Large bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a cloudy dark copper colour. Aroma of yeast, hay and banana. Yeast and banana notes, a little spicy. Moderate carbonation. Flavoursome. A good German wheat beer.
Pours hazy light orange with a big foamy white head.  Aroma is orange and light tropical fruits. Flavour is malt, cereal, mango and citrus. A smooth full bodied beer. Very enjoyable.
Une blanche classique fruitée, élégante, équilibrée avec une belle finale acidulée. Bière de soif

Barwa jasna, słomkowa, piana niska, trwała. W aromacie czuć to co powinno być czuć - wyraźny goździk, lekki banan, słód. W smaku podobnie, wszystko jest na miejscu. Bardzo dobre piwo. Dobry reprezentant stylu.

Can: orange cloudy beer under a pillowy cream coloured head that lasts and turns into a thin fizz covering. Nice lace. Classic notes of banana, clove, yeast, and bright tropical fruits in the aroma. Taste follows above mentioned, but is certainly subdued. Some malt rounds it up. It’s watery because of the low abbreviation, but still has its own legs to stand on. Soft mouthfeel and Highly quaffable indeed.
Tap@ restaurant in Braunfeld. Geeloranje kleur, troebel, kraag blijft lang. Ruikt naar gekookte bloemkool. Smaak is melig en flauw, weinig pit.
High carbonation, fast disapearing head. Bannanas, sweet fruits aroma. Taste bannanas, malt. Good beer through hot summer.

Barwa ciemno s?omkowa, m?tne, wysoka, ?adna piana. W aromacie wyczuwalny banan, w smaku równie? banan, s?odowosc oraz przyjemna, niska goryczka. Jeden z lepszych weizenów, w swojej klasie cenowej absolutny krol.
Great aroma with orange and chontaduro (colombian fruit) nuances. Maybe too much body. Malty, cereal, citric, caramel notes. Refreshing and efervescent beer.

Tap at Le Senk. Nice golden color, hazy, big white head. Typical aroma, sweet, a bit of kiwi/mango. Nice typical taste, banana and clover. Medium body, high carbonation, good mouthfeel. Very nice balanced weizen.
Very drinkable, flavorful, easy going beer. Would go great with a meal. Really good Weissbier.
Tap. Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat and citrus. Slightly spicy with some low sour and bitterness. Good solid beer.
Bue en bouteille de 50cl. Blond clair. Grosse mousse blanche consistante. Nez céréale. Palais rond et doux à l'allemande. Note de fruits, de pain. Bel équilibre général.
Tap at 12 apoštolov. Hazy yellow colour with small head off (bad tap skills). Aroma of banana, spicies. Taste of wheat malts, banana, like vanilla notes.
Buonissima Weizen, saporita e rinfrescante. Aromi un po’ speziati, un po’ di banana e un po’ citrici, e lo stesso si avverte in bocca. Carbonizzazione giusta.

Poured from the can, hazy orange coloured beer with loads of carbonation. Aroma is dominantly malt with some yeast. Tastes are malt and bananas, cookies. This is beer I love to drink on a hot summer day.
500ml can. Hazy golden color with one finger head. Wheat, cloves, slight banana aroma. Taste is a little more mild than I like for the style, but it is a very good version nonetheless.

0,5l, wazig oranje met volle geel-witte kraag. aroma van mout, citrus, gist, lichte banaan. smaken moutig, graan, citrus, matig zoet, licht bitter, stevig, zachte banaan, lichte citrus, deeg, matige body, matige co2, degelijk, niet bijzonder verder.

Amber, cloudy and medium-bodied. Mild aroma and flavour, with the style’ usual fruity and slightly spicy characteristics. Somewhat dry taste with a dry and lightly bitter finish. A few unfortunate metallic notes, too. Overall, very much an average beer for me, as hefeweizens usually are. Not bad per se, but dull.
Bottle: 500ml Price: 1,29€. Standi didelė, balta puta. Malonus kvapas, labai geras skonis.

Pretty decent Weissbier. Without a doubt, one of the best representatives of the genre... taste is strong malts, specially wheat. No hop presence overall... just smooth, simple beer where wheat dominates the flavour.
Очень вкусное пшеничное пиво, отличная пенная шапка, приятный аромат, хороший вкус и послевкусие!
Ananas in het aroma en in de dronk licht zurig maar al gauw neemt het ananas zoet de boventoon best aardig
To me this is the one of the best hefeweizen beers. It has everything that one hefeweizen should have: aroma, taste, apperance, tradition...

Bue 10 mois avant DLC chez Ludo. Bière blonde/blanche avec gros col de mousse qui tient. Arôme agréable doux, fruité mais non identifié. En bouche, légèrement crémeuse grâce à la mousse. Final superbe sur la banane, les fruits exotiques et une pointe de levure. Superbe découverte pour une des mes premières allemandes.

0.3 l on tap at ’Ter Marsch & Co’ (Amsterdam). Hazy, golden amber with a medium large, foamy, beige head. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy aroma of banana and cloves. Sweetish, yeasty-spicy, minimally fruity taste of banana, cloves, some vanilla and hints of honey, followed by a short, slightly bitter, yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Nice and refreshing!

On tap at ’Salvator’. Hazy, golden amber with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, rather yeasty-spicy aroma of banana and cloves. Sweetish, rather yeasty-spicy and a little sourish taste of banana, cloves hints of honey, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, slightly sourish, quite yeasty-spicy finish. Medium to full body, creamy and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Nice! (7/4/7/4/14/3.6)
Pours hazy golden with big long lasting white head. Aroma is fruits, fresh flowers, some yeast, some soap. Taste is soft, some banana, soap, floral notes, some bitterness. Light and easy drinkable.
Good hefeweizen, but for too boring in taste, i would like more bananas in aroma in taste, so quite fits the style, but nothing special.

500 ml bottle. Pours cloudy intense orange colour. 2 finger frothy a bit yellow head. Stays. Truly a perfect lacing. Active carbonation. Aroma: wheat, soapy, fruity, pickled sour apples, sweet esters, bready, flour. Taste: mild wheat turns into a delicate sour citric / apple after every swallow. Just a perfect thirst-killer. Of course not a delicious but a very decent brew. Ja-ja.

Aroma : ?
Appearance : Bright Not much Foam
Taste : Cool Crisp, average hop
palate : A little light 
Very Cool Nice Impression
Hazy orange color, medium head. Aroma: mostly banana. Taste reminds of bananas, low bitterness.
Pale orange color and cloudy. Slightly sweet smell. Taste is a bit of banana with a lot of spiciness. Mildly sweet aftertaste. A solid hefeweizen, but not my favorite.

Barwa jasny bursztyn, mętne. Piana gęsta, powoli opada, ładnie oblepia szkło. Bardzo przyjemny pszeniczny aromat, do tego dojrzałe banany. W smaku dominują goździki, poza nimi są również banany. Bardzo dobre piwo, bardzo pijalne.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Ładna piana, biała, wysoka. Aromat mocno goździkowy, bananów mniej. W smaku również goździki i mało bananów. Bardzo dobry balans, wysokie w stronę niskiego wysycenie, lekka wodnistość. Poziom kwaśności jest relatywnie niski. Bardzo fajne.

Draft. Pours orange gold with a creamy white head. Aroma is lots of banana on a wheat background. Hints of tropical fruits. Taste is bubble gum and banana, a bit yeasty, but overall remains quite dry and does not quite fully live up to the excellent aroma. Only during the relatively subdued finish do the sweet notes take over. Smooth. Palate is medium bodied with average carbonation. Nothing outstanding, and no pretensions; this is more your reliable Weizen to accompany your grilled steak on a warm afternoon.
Banana, yeast, turbid golden with a huge rocky white head, light body, medium carbonation, quite sweet, fruity, banana, spices...easy to drink, easy to find, a great classic.

unclear golden with orange hue, huge white head, big banaba hefeweizen aroma, slightly spicy aroma, sweet with medium banana and spicy finish, quite simple but very nice, creamy mouth, slightly tart, ripe fruit, some alkohol,

500ml brown bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy straw colored with a medium sized frothy beige head, that settled quickly. Aroma of lemon zest, mineral notes and banana. Flavours of lemon zest, banana and a hint of toast. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Overall a solid style typical Hefeweizen.

In bottles from my local Publix supermarket, usually poured into a beer glass at home, accompanied by some cheese (sharp cheddar or Babybel swiss) dipped in sriracha while watching DVD of films such as Captain America: Winter Soldier, The Devil’s Rain, Black Sunday, Near Dark, Interstellar, The Social Network, etc. This is quite possibly my favorite beer - from the delightful yeasty overtones, which offer a spicy-like aftertaste, to the wonderful lacing on the newly-emptied glass ("Dat lacing, tho!"), I never grow tired of this wonderful stuff! After polishing off a sixer, I’ll usually grill a steak along with some sliced onions, all the while watching more movies in a dark room; in the winter the home I rent is pretty frosty due to no central heat, so I’m bundled up pretty well, with some nice frost coming out of my mouth, and steam rising from the ribeye - but the temperature keeps the Hefeweizen nice and cold! In the warmer months, I rely on a window unit A/C, plus a box fan to keep a nice, cool breeze on my as I take these bottles out of the ice....it makes for a pleasant experience!

500 ml bottle from the wine monopoly.

Large white head, hazy orange color. Slightly taste of wheat, yeast and citrus.
Hazy orange color with beatiful big foam. Aroma of wheat and bananas. Taste has wheat, hops, hint of bananas. Medium body, high carbonation. Solid hefe.
Klasyka gatunku, jedno z lepszych piw jakie piłem. Warto podkreślić, butelka 500 ml. Bardzo mętne, z osadem. W aromatach cytrusy, goździki, banan. Piana wysoka, gęsta i drobna. Pijalne. Polecam.

Bottle at home. Hazy yellow colour, with a big microfoam. Nose of banana slight DMS. Taste is very slight sourness with some usual weizen notes (sweetness, esters etc.) slight dms in the taste as well. Nice brew overall.

Bottle 0.5
Классический немецкий вайцен, чувствуются цитрусы.

Dark amber color. Foam is quite big and soft and lasts for a long time (about 5 minutes). Flavour mostly citrus and grainy. Taste without bitterness with big carbonation, very dry, mild, grainy. Aftertaste is wavelike, shakes back of the tongue. Very pleasant beer, very drinkable.

Robe orangée e trouble? La mousse ne tient pas.Arômes de fruits jaunes et levure. Goût pain, fruits jaunes, agrumes, on sent des notes de houblon. On reste sur les agrumes. Texture épaisse et carbonatation fine.
Une bonne bière de blé.
Pours hazy, cloudy orange. Surprisingly dry, which makes it exceedingly drinkable. Pretty subtle fruit flavors. Not bold or fruit forward, just clean dry and crushable. Patio beer.

Aroma: cloves and weak banana.
Appearance: hazy golden-orange color and white head.
Taste: cloves, banana, zesty, quite dry.
Palate: medium body and high carbonation, zesty.
Overall: Really good weizen.
Gezapft. Farbe trübe Orange, leicht sprudelig. In der Nase deutlich Banane, sonst würzig. Antrunk voll, Geschmack Banane, Orange, Hefe, leichte Bitterkeit

Cloudy orange, some carbonation is visible, obviously big head, quite persistent. Aroma is freshly herbal, estery fruitiness, lemon, slight banana. Taste is mainly sweet with a light acidic touch: grainy base, light fruity, lemon, hint of tartness, a bit of spiciness. Light body, carbonation is obviously vivid but still soft and easy. Very high drinkabilty. Not impressive but not as boring as some other hefes

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours hazy amber with a big frothy head. The aroma features a proper mix for a hefeweizen; plenty of wheaty maltiness with a noticeable component of estery fruitiness and yeasty spiciness. Taste is light sweet, offering grainy maltiness, fruitiness with light banana and some spiciness. The palate is medium-bodied, average in carbonation and fairly smooth. Standard, good wheat beer. Perhaps not quite as assertive in taste as Weihenstephaner or Franziskaner, for example.

Si presenta dorata, velata, discreto perlage, schiuma bianca compatta e pannosa come da stile. Al naso risalta la banana, lievito, malto, frutta. Bevuta molto dolce, banana in gran evidenza. Carbonazione media e corpo leggero, davvero beverina. Ottima sui pasti e d’estate.
0.5 l bottle. Hazy golden/ peach with foamy white head. Citrus, grapefruit and some other fruits in aroma. Sour lemon-grapefruit taste with medium finishing. Nice.
Color naranja oscuro turbio. Aroma a banana, clavo y flores, con un fondo acido alimonado. Sabor a pan tostado, banana, astringente. Final seco y levemente amargo.

Really tasty and a joy to look at in my glass. Drinking one right now. One of my favorite ’normal’ German beers. Full of flavour and body, nice fruity and full taste. Luckily available at my local supermarket (Albert Heijn).
Så sinnsykt digg øl! Perfekt fruktighet og friskhet. servert kald i et høyt glass på en varm dag er denne nærmest uslåelig!

Cerveja de trigo muito boa. Extremamente saborosa com um aroma espetacular.
Uma das melhores cervejas de trigo.
Bardzo dobra pszenica. Biszkopty, banany, goździki. Mętna, zapychająca. Lubię wracać
Having at nyc during one of the first warm days of the year. Great ester flavors, tons of flavor. Standard for the style.

Veiled golden amber color with moderate activity. Thick foamy beige 3 finger head lasting around 10 minutes with good legs.

Aromas and flavors of citrus, fruits, grains, floral and herbal spices. Pleasant floral nose. Delicious sweet fresh grainy taste with fruits like lemon, orange and pineapple. Hints of banana, coriander and clove. Well balanced between sweetness and sharpness.

Slick medium body with perfect carbonation. Balanced finish ending with a slightly bitter clove like feel and pilsner spices lingering on the tongue.

Overall an excellent craft with a great look and smell with crispy delicious and complex flavors. Slightly pale and soft but well balanced and super fresh.
Most popular German Weizen beer, Well balanced weizen with ripe of banana taste, Color amber, head creamy. Not the best Weizen but really good!

W zapachu z butelki banany i lekkie goździki, lekkie ciasteczka, pszeniczna słodowość, drożdże. Piwo w barwie pomarańczowe, wyraźnie zmętnione, z prawie białą, bardzo wysoką średniopęcherzykową i dosyć trwałą pianą. W aromacie ze szkła naprawdę przepotężny goździk. W smaku słodkie, nieco morelowe, z dosyć wyraźną goryczką w finiszu i kwaskowością. Przyjemnie korzenne. Nie tak gładkie jak niektóre weizeny. Bardzo pijalne.

Barwa jasnozłota, zmętnione, biała piana, obfita, drobna, niezła nawet koronka. W aromacie głównie banan, lekki goździk. W smaku minimalna kwaskowość, banan, trochę goździka, pszeniczność, pszenność, generalnie niezbyt pełne, raczej wytrawne, wyczuwalna delikatna goryczka. Wysycenie średniowysokie, dobra pijalność. Poprawny Weizen, przyjemny, klasyczny.

Butelka 0,5l Kolor mętny złoty, piana piękna, mocna zostawia ślady na szkle. Aromat klasyczny, mocne banany i goździki. Smak lekki owocowy , orzeźwiający. Bardzo dobre piwo jak prawie każda pszenica z Niemiec.
Piana ładna, gęsta, ale krótko się utrzymująca. Mętne, bez widocznych drobinek. W aromacie banan i guma balonowa. Wytrawne w smaku, dosyć mocno nagazowane.
Optisch ein normales Hefe, kann jetzt nicht erkennen, dass es trüber ist, als andere. In der Nase Nelken, setzt sich im Trunk fort, aber mit seltsamer schräger Bitternote im Antrunk. Geht so.

Originally rated on 5/30/08. In my opinion one of the better hefe’s avalible. The aroma is complex with hints of wheat, citrus, cloves and banana in the mix. A golden, cloudy body with a decent head. It goes down very well with a plesant aftertaste of cloves and banana. Good in bottle, great out of the tap, one of my favorites at the local pub.
Para ser trigo está bien hecha y los años de experiencia se hacen notar. En cambio al ser un gran clásico no te descubre nada nuevo y no te aporta ninguna novedad

Poured a cloudy pale golden colour with a three-finger off-white dense foamy head that retained very well and laced well. Carbonation high and fine. Aroma subtly of banana with a hint of cloves and a trace of yeast. Taste dominantly of banana with hints of cloves, citrus fruit and sweet malt. Light body. Smooth and creamy with cloves on the short lived finish.
Well balanced weizen with ripe banana, oranges and medium long sweet finish.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours cloudy amber. Nose: orange zest, yeast, banana. Full-bodied on the palate.

De la macro cervecera Paulaner Grouppe(GER) esta "Paulaner Naturtrüb" una wissbier de 5.5% de alcohol, un estilo muy popular de las cervezas tradicionales alemanas en la cual se emplea mínimo un 50% de malta de trigo y la famosa levadura fenolica wissen que da el sabor característico de este estilo originario de las regiones bávaras.
En apariencia esta cerveza cuenta con un color dorado con turbiedad característica de las wissen bávaras creado por los almidones de la malta de trigo y la cuantiosa levadura que se emplea, una muy amplia corona de espuma que impide la oxidación de la cerveza, clara y cristalina con burbujas amplias, un cuerpo liviano que aunque deja marca en el vaso se percibe muy ligero. En aroma resalta el aroma a platano, bizcocho, especiado a clavo, dulzor fresco, hay una ausencia total del lúpulo y algo de cítrico. Ya en paladar es una cerveza muy ligera para dar tragos largos, el principal sabor es el de especias de la levadura que aparentan clavo y coriandro, haciéndola compleja, seguido por un fuerte sabor a trigo que es complementado con un muy agradable dulzor moderado, sabores a pan y plátano tambien muy identificables, sesionable y adecuada para épocas de calor y para el desayuno.

Cóż... Paulaner nie jest złym piwem. Jakimś specjalnie wybitnym także. I choć świadom jestem faktu, że po wypiciu nie będę bardzo zadowolony, to gdy najdzie mnie ochota na hefeweizena, a żadnego fajnego kraftu w pobliżu nie ma, wybieram Paulanera... Kolor jasnożółty, wielka, biała, puszysta piana. W aromacie banan, nieco goździków i kolendry. W smaku również dominują wspomniane nuty. Czasem pojawi się trochę metalu. Wysycenie średnie. I tak naprawdę nic szczególnego się tutaj nie dzieje, a mimo to piwo jest bardzo pijalne.

Unfiltered bottles and cans.
"Naturtrüb".
Ingredients: Water; Malted wheat; Malted barley; Yeast; Hops.
Color amarillo turbio. Espuma abundante. Olor a fruta, especias. Sabor equilibrado, afrutado, fácil de beber, cremosa.

0,5l Flasche. Trübes hellbraunes Bier mit hellem Schaum der recht schnell zerfällt. Es riecht nach Brotteig und Weizen mit fruchtiger Note. Im Geschmack unreife Banane, Hefe und Getreide. Leichte Säure. Im Abgang etwas trocken. Süffig.
God øl, med flott farge. Litt for mye sødme, men rund og fin i smaken og passe bitter.
Cloudy yellow, big stable white head. Aroma of fruits and spices, complex sweet fruity taste with lasting after taste. Classic!

Gold with snowwhite foam. Nice banana like taste and aroma.the taste of banana and weissbeir mix perfectly in your mouth and stay ther for quite some time. One of the best if not the best weissbeir worldwide
Molt bona cervesa. Clàssic alemany. Possiblement la millor cervesa a nivell comercial del mon. Bon color, molt bon sabor i un cos turbi.

Picked up this classic again. This is the classic most widely available hefe-wiezen and while it pales in comparison to the local Brauhaus stuff it is still pretty decent. Its on the sharp side and the taste a little thin. If you look there are better offerings around. Take hacker-pschorr effort. Look its okay but a dull Hefe-Wiezen. Disappointed on my return. Always makes me wish I was in southern germany drinking the real thing!

Looks hazy light golden with a creamy white head. What a great fruity and spicy aroma. Tasting brings out banana, citrus and spiciness from the wheat. Distinctive and true esters. All flavors combined with a super creamy mouth feel. Excellent Hefeweizen.

In bottiglia. Colore arancio chiaro/oro, riflessi giallo pallido. Bella testa abbondante, di colore bianco torbido, di persistenza da bassa a media, di trama granulosa. Olfatto di spezie, limone, banana, uva, malto di frumento e lievito. Carbonazione vivace, corpo molto leggero. Aroma un po’ blando, dolce e mediamente citrico, di limone, banana, malto di frumento, spezie, note di lievito e vaniglia. Luppolatura mite e poco percettibile, nello stile. Astringenza secca, controllata. Gusto fresco e dissentante, ma relativamente povero, che sprigiona poche emozioni, con trama concretamente watery. Mouthfeel di frutta matura, innocuamente amaro. Beva veloce e poco significativa, per un prodotto convenzionale che rappresenta comunque un buon compromesso nel panorama delle birre commerciali, cui appartiene. Una weizen quindi molto ordinaria, essenzialmente obliabile, di facile reperibilità sul mercato, che quantomeno non tradisce i dettami della sua categoria.

Pours a clouded golden color, with a huge, froth head.

Smells of clove, lemon peel and unripe banana among a pleasantly sour yeast pillow. 

Drinks perfectly easy, utmost creamy on the tongue with a refreshing finish.

Tastes of peppery spices among a banana and citrus fruitiness, tied together by an awesome softness, resulting from the prominent, tart yeast. Has a white bread maltiness during the finish, together with ripened banana and a bubbly carbonation. 

Very smooth, perfectly put together with a lemony, enjoyable twist to it, creating a satisfying refreshment.
Quizás la mejor Paulaner (de las que he probado) de sabor agradable. Es la típica cerveza alemana de raza. Recomendable y sabrosa, se deja querer.

Pours a hazy looking golden colour with big and creamy long lasting white head. Refreshing smell of wheat and grass.

Typical taste of wheat beer - yeast, grass, spices. It tends to fall on the fruity, sweet side. Excellent balance. Medium body, medium carbonation, creamy texture. Very pleasant aftertaste.

Overall, excellent wheat beer. Recommended!
Oranje, nevelig, met kleine witte kraag. Sinaasappel, zure appel, tarwe. Bitterzoet en licht zuur. Beetje melig in de mond.
Hazy golden-orange color with fluffy white head. Sweet, wheaty aroma with notes of citrus and banana. Taste is medium sweetness with light and crispy mouthfeel.

330mL bottle BBE: 10/16. Medium chill (approx. 10 degrees). Pours a cloudy amber-copper body with medium, lasting, tight, creamy, off-white head. Medium intensity nose that’s metallic, with banana milk and bread. A light-medium pancakey sweetness predominates, with a light bitterness providing balance. On the palate, a medium body has a velvety texture, medium carbonation and a short, clove-infused finish. Clearly an accomplished Hefe that’s made to appeal to the masses, but there’s nothing special going on here.
sweet aroma. sweet and little sour taste bronze appearance long palate agdhda

A hint of banana smell. Abit hazy, amber yellow with a thick white head. Mild taste, abit watery, no bitter, abit sweet and slightly sour. Great carbonation. Refreshing beer for our hot weather. Would prefer it less sour thou. Lager-style ale wheatbeer?

ヘフェバイツェン  
香りが深いような、無駄な香りのような

Hazy golden liquid with thick frothy head. Aroma of coriander, tavott. Taste of banana, barbariss caramel candy, coriander, yeast, medium sweet, light bitter, light sour. Light body, creamy feel, average carb.
Nice golden colour,, fruty taste,, very drinkable, aftertaste is very good, no bitterness but ver very nice beer, smells like banana

Farbe: dunkelgold richting braun
Schaum: top
Nase: mild, nach Banane
Geschmack:sehr angenehm und balanciert, feine säure, recht hefe-breit und vollmundig. Im Abgang wieder Banane, Hefe und Weizen. Für mich ein absoluter Klassiker, mein meistgetrunkenes Weizen, der Geschmack ist nicht super-sophisicated aber super ausbalanciert.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours hazy golden with medium sticky head.Aroma: sweet, malty, wheaty, cardemom, yeast, banana, orange. Taste is sweet, yeasty, slight cardemom, malty. Thin + body. A bit watery.

Smells of banana with some floral scents too. Some freshness underneath it, kinda reminds me of eucalyptus for some reason. Not too strong aroma anyway. Looks hazy, amber yellow with a thick white head. The taste though is super mild. I’d describe it as watery, not sweet, not bitter... maybe slightly sour but that’s it. Ideal carbonation and texture but again, no finish whatsoever. Decent value for the format it comes in (50 cl) and relatively easy to find. I’d say it’s a good, refreshing beer for the summer but definitely not to enjoy the taste of it.
Bonne weiz, un peu de banane et d’acidé, trouble comme une non filtré...Mais pas encore parfaite pour moi
Aroma of mostly banana, but also with fruits. Taste of yeast, wheat and fruit. Mild sweetness and not much bitterness.

0,5l bottle. Hazy yellow colour with creamy white head. Aroma: Sweet honey, yeast, citrus. Taste: Buttery/honey sweetness, light bitterness, well balanced. Medium body, medium carbonation. Creamy thick texture, a pleaser to drink. Sweet/bitter finish. My favourite hefeweizen so far.

Bright orange pour, hazy, with a fluffy white head. Smells like caramel, bananas, lemon zest and bread dough. The taste is bitter-sweet and refreshing, with a bit of a metallic feel and notes of white bread, yeast, bananas, sweet spices and a bit of lemon zest. Very refreshing and well balanced.
Muito boa weissbier, identica a Erdinger, acidez mais evidente, bem refrescante, encorpada. Boa weiss

Looks divine, with a cloudy gold pour and that huge pillowy white head that sticks around. Smells very wheaty, banana, bready malt, spice, and the taste follows through. Classic Hefeweizen flavour down pat. It fills the mouth and feels creamy, then ending with a dryness that begs another sip. Spot on.
Nice aroma and taste of a wheat beer. A good representative of wheat beer from Germany.
Hofgut Hopfenburg, camping in Schwäbische Alb. 0,5 L blik. Prima romig bananen/graan bier. Met licht fris zuurtje. Backlog from 2015/07/20.
0.5L bottle. banana and wheat. looks beautiful. very high carbonation in my bottle. quite decent hefe weizen.
0.5 bottle. Hazy golden color with thick white head. Banana, clove, wheat and yeast aroma with fruity finish. Refreshing

Bottle on the Newcastle - Amsterdam ferry. Hazy amber with a big frothy off white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus and banana. Full flavoured with light spice, caramel, citrus and lots of banana, especially in the finish. Very good wheatbeer.

Paulaner Hefe-Weisbier has a very thick, bone-colored head, a hazy, gold-orange appearance, fierce, tight bubble streams, and heavy lacing globs left behind. The aroma is of mildly-spiced white wheat bread, with a bit of banana and coriander, but not a lot of that. Taste is of those elements, with a tap water component. Bitterness is low. Mouthfeel is soft and moderate, and Paulaner Hefe-Weisbier finishes mild and drinkable. RJT

Flasche 0,5l: Helles Braun, leicht orange, kräftige Trübung, fester feinporiger Schaum; Angenehm frische Nase, malzige Süße, Vanille, Bananenpudding, Getreide; im Körper cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, würzig, würzige Süße, Getreide, Malz, leichte Hopfennoten

Piwo mętne o drobnopęcherzykowej pianie, która utrzymuje się długo.aromat typowo przeniczny oraz bananowy.w smaku trochę przeniczne z nutką cytryny, choć całość wydaje się być lekko rozwodnione. Piwo orzeźwiające. Bardzo dobre piwo przeniczne, biorąc pod uwagę fakt że jest z koncernu oraz cenę.
Trübes Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Weizenmalz, Hefe, etwas Banane, spritzig.

33cl bottle at the KLM lounge, Frankfurt Airport on 01-Dec-2015. Hazy pale colour with a thick white head which quickly dissipated. Medium body and carbonation. Aroma of cereal, grain and fruit. Flavour of wheat, banana, yeast and light spices. Fruity finish.
500ml bottle. Fairly good Hefe. Slightly flat in terms of flavour profile. Typical banana, clove aroma. Refreshing.

Bottle from Co-op. First real weizen in a long while. Pours out beautifully into a Paulaner weizen glass, thick fluffy head, the swirl of the bottle stirs up the sediment enough to cloud up the orange golden body. Aroma right on for the style, banana, bubblegum and clove. Taste also spot on, mildly sweet with some citrusy zing. Oh how I miss my German weizens. This brings back a lot of fond memories.
Didn’t take tasting notes. Just wrote down the score so I’m typing just enough words.
Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma of banana, wheat and spicies. Taste is sweet with bitter finish. Nice fizzy carbonation, which gives some extra bite for this beer. Well balanced weissbeer.
I have easily had this over 300 times!(that is also my review).
Klasyczna przenica piwo calkiem dobre jak na koncern. Degustoane przed zalozeniem konta ocena z notatek
Nice 0.5l bottle. Usual aroma for weissbeers, with alcohol notes. Strong flavour of some wheat and sereals. Unusual for weissbeers, but I don’t like it at all. Very weak for paulaner brewery.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pours cloudy with thick white head. Aroma was wheat, banana and spices. Taste was sweet and refreshing.

Laranja escura, turva. Espuma muito abundante e muito persistente. No aroma, banana e um pouco de maracujá. Sabor de banana, cravo, manga verde e um pouco de noz moscada. Retrogosto levemente cítrico. Refrescante e saborosa.

50 cl bottle from Roto dinamic, served in a tulip. Dark amber, unfiltered, with medium off-white head that dissipates over several minutes. Aroma is medium banana, grainy, quite fruity, light yeasty. Medium body, low carbonation. Taste is low to medium sweet, medium bitter, with oily texture.

A cloudy yellow-orange beer with a frothy white head. A potent banana led wheat beer aroma, mango and passion fruit as well as the spice of clove, nutmeg and cinnamon. There is also a hint of dusty wheat in the background. Dry mouthfeel. The taste is what you’d expect, but turned up a notch! The tropical fruit flavours seem a tad stronger, banana, mango, grapefruit, the spices are heightened, clove especially, plus nutmeg and cinnamon, and even a touch of black pepper. This is all underpinned by a dry, dusty cereal flavour that lingers in the background in a long and flavour filled finish. Bottle @ A&O hotel Hamburg Süd, Hamburg.

0,5L bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a cloudy dark orange colour, with a nice thick creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, some light spicing, not as much as other weizen. Taste of bread, yeast, some banana. Not quite as strong as some in the style but very nice nevertheless.

My fave hefeweizen, despite the fact that is mass-produced. Pours light yellow with rich white head. Notes of bananas, spiciness on the tongue, rich malty character, bread+cereals. Well paired with fish and light meals.
Don’t really like this kind of beer. Not comprehensive, a bit flat and slightly unpleasant aftertaste. Freshness doesn’t compensate for the mediocre taste.

Hazy deep golden pour with thin, yet dense white top. Aromas of tangy fruit and yeast. Semi-sweet, malt and banana come through in the flavor. Over-carbonated, as is common for the style. This is not bad, but there are better.

Bue à la pression en 50cl au bistrot des moines à Belfort. 
Couleur blonde trouble mousse bien présente et effervescence moyenne. 
Nez banane.
Bouche banane et levure basique mais bonne.
From can and on tap. Pours with a rich frothy head and nice almost orange colour. Some yeast of course but also a bread taste. Freshness and a lasting taste. Very typical wheat beer type.
Color arancio con densa schiuma bianca. Molto dolce con evidente predominanza dei lieviti che danno caratteristici sentori di banana

Orange color, huge head. Smells of the usual hefe-suspects. Banana and clove, touch of bread. Nice yeast fruitiness. Decent sweetness, balanced with that tangy, sour, wheatiness. Little to no hops bitterness, but a good amount of phenols. Spicy, green bananas, tiny hit of clove. An above average hefe, but not mind-blowing.

0,33 bottle. Pours medium to dark amber color with huge frothy white head. Excellent head lacing, fully lasting, Body is cloudy, hazy. Aroma of flowers, banana, bubble gum. Flavor is light to moderate sweet. Medium body, lively carbonation.
Piwo złociste, zmętnione, pina buna, średnio pęcherzykowa. Słodki aromat, banan i goździk wyczuwalne. W smaku trochę drożdżowe, mało kwaskowe z nutką goździka.

330ml bottle. Poured two into a full Weizen glass. Appearance is perfect - glowing orange yellow with a billowy foam head that leaves the best lacing all the way down the glass I’ve ever experienced. Aroma - OK, but smothered by the head so only a light hint of banana. Taste was sweet (for beer) and light / crisp with nice mouthfeel. Soft palate of a medium length. Overall a nice beer of this style - however I’d choose Weihenstephaner over this any day of the week.
Zavaros aranyló megjelenés fehér habbal. Illata citromos narancsos. Íze narancsos banános élesztős és buzás. Közepesen testes finom darab.

Typical Deutsch wheat beer, very hoppy and filling. Mass produce, better to taste the local Hefeweizen beers if you’re ever near Munich. Of course 1000x better than the so called Hefeweizen made in America, never understood why they put an orange in it.
This has always been one of my go to beers. It is great in warm weather, estery, clovey, bannana all kinds of character to love.

Bottle shared at a tasting (Thanks Micah!). Pours a hazy, glowing orange with a huge soapy white head. Lots of banana with some peach, orange, clove and lemon zest as well. Average carbonation with a some light fruity tartness on the finish. Super refreshing under the sun.

Bottle at AC. Murky orange golden with big cream colored head. Some banana, fresh fruits, dried apple, dough, lots of spicy yeast. Lots of standard hefe weizen notes but with a very nice complex fruity touch. Light sweet and very light bitter finish. Medium bodied with velvety feel. Lovely beer.
Fľaša 500 ml z Pivotéky v Nitre. Vysoká biela pena, zlatomedová farba, ovocná aróma. Stredná rezkosť, nasládla chuť, ovocie, pšenica.
On tap at Bavarian Bier Cafe, Gold Coast. Cloudy and golden with a solid head. Aroma of bananas and cloves that builds on the palate. Refreshing.
Recuerdo la primera vez que la probé, hace ya bastantes años. Me enamoró desde el primer día. Magnífica cerveza de trigo.
Aromat godziki i banany. Kolor pomarancz, zmetnione zloto. W smaku przyjemnie bananowe.
Cloudy orange in appearance. Aromas of wheat, yeast, orange and a hint of lemon. Tastes of yeast, wheat, orange, spices and lemon.

Aromat: g?ównie banan i lekkie go?dziki. Wyglad:kolor metny bursztyn, piana bujna, oblepia szk?o, ale opada do?? szybko. Smak: lekko kwaskowe smak odzwierciedla aromat, goryczka symboliczn?.Odczucie w ustach: lekkie, wysoko nasycone. Ogolnie: Dobre, klasyczne piwo nie wyró?nia si? niczym.

Large, white and creamy foam. Distinct scent of wheat malt. Sweet flavor that exudes freshness with notes of banana and freshly cut grain. Whether it is worse or better than Erdinger, Oettinger or other of the big German hefeweissbier I dare not to decide. It can be concluded that it is really tasty and thirst-quenching.

De aspecto amarillo oscuro y turbio, una burna presencia con espuma blanca limpia y de persistencia media.
El aroma que más destaca sin duda es el pan horneado y algún toque silvestre. 
Sabor a pan horneado igualmente con algún toque frutal, silvestre e incluso alguna especia con un final ligeramente dulzón

Aroma: wheat, yeast, some banana, a little bit of clove.
Appearance: yellow, cloudy, a huge, fine and pretty stable head.
Taste: mildly bitter, mildly sour.
Palate: body light; carbonation average; finish faint, just a bit of sourness; a little spice throughout.
Overall: a nice, light beer; enjoyable and easy drinking, but also not particularly memorable.

Nice, good looking beer in the glass. Chilled and hazy. Nice two-finger head descending fast. Low carbonation. Aroma is fruity, with citrus and spice notes. Flavour is more of the same thing, dry and carbonated, bittering coming through along with pleasant notes from the yeast. Absolutely an A-class beer.
Transferring old data - a pretty decent wheat beer. nice, fruity aroma, thick head, copper color.

Pours in hazy deep yellow colour with huge white head. Aroma of
dough, citrus, herbs. Medium sweet, almost no bitter taste. Light body, medium carbonization, watery texture.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złocistopomarańczowa, mętne. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości, dość trwała. Nieśmiało oblepia szkło. 

AROMAT: Dość intensywne. Czuć robotę niemieckich drożdży! Sporo bananów, wyraźnie goździki, . W tle guma balonowa i chlebowość.

SMAK: Zboża i goździki. Posmak przyjemnie bananowy. Wysokie nasycenie. Goryczka niska, krótka.

OGÓLNIE: Klasyka wśród Weizenów. Mimo, że produkowany na masową skalę zawsze trzyma poziom.

W kolorze zmętnione pomiędzy złotem a pomarańczą. Piana obfita jasna z drobnych pęcherzy opadła z czasem do małej warstwy. W aromacie wyraźnie wyczuwalne są goździki i banany. W tle zaś mamy zbożowość (od słodu pszenicznego). W aromacie podobnie, z tymże jak dla mnie piwo sprawia wrażenie lekko mdlącego. Goryczka minimalna podbita jest wysokim wysyceniem. W ustach pozostaje wyraźny, kwaskowy posmak. 
To dobre, orzeźwiające piwo do sesyjnego picia. Ale nic ponadto
Aroma frutado e sabor encorpado, faz jus à nota que possui (94). Excelente drinkability, dá pra tomar várias sem enjoar. No geral excelente.

A very cloudy gold body, one would expect from the style. The head is as white as it is active on the pour, but it disappears rapidly to a foamy film. Any glass movement will produce lacing however.
Lemongrass and wheat on the nose. It possesses a nice light, zingy mouthfeel. On the tongue, there is melon sweet fruitiness, and of course the obligatory wheat tastes. 
I think on style, I’d say they were pretty successful, but on my overall beer scale, I file it under no need to buy again.

When I first started reviewing beer way back in 2008, hefeweizen was one of the uniquely foreign styles I found myself attracted to. Seven years later, my love for authentic German brews of the style has not dissipated, and I’m able to savor their flavor even more. Paulaner Hefe-Weizen was a good beer when I first had it, but drinking it today I realize how great it really is. Big on flavor and aroma and remarkably easy and fun to drink - that’s a winning combination for sure.



I poured a 500ml bottle into a weizen glass. It had a best before date of 1/2016 and cost $2.79 ($0.17 per ounce).



Appearance: A deep shade of orange/light brown. Extremely hazy, but fine carbonation can always been seen rushing up to the top. Pours to a large, white, foamy head which retains and laces excellently.



Smell: Sweet banana bread scent with a touch of orange and a light clove-like spice character. 



Taste: There are those who scoff at the hefeweizen style and say they all taste essentially the same because the yeast does most of the work. While I would agree with the latter, I disagree with the former as I have had plenty that are mild and boring (and some that are just plain bad). When I think of a great-tasting hefe, this is what I think of. Up front there’s strong wheat presence that imparts a bit of a tart, cracker-like character. Banana bread is also quite prominent, though it emerges much more on the finish than the beginning. Through the middle I detect a light spicy sensation; a mixture of orangepeel, clove, cinnamon and just the faintest hint of peppercorn. The aftertaste is all banana bread, though it fades rather quickly. All in all, this is how a hefeweizen should taste.



Drinkability: I can drink beers of this style year-round, though I prefer them in warmer weather. I had absolutely no trouble downing a tall glass of Paulaner Hefe-Weizen on a hot summer’s day. The beer is highly-carbonated for sure, but it’s a fine/micro carbonation. It literally vibrates across the tongue, but at the same time scrubs the palate clean. Refreshing while in the mouth, and highly quaffable even though it’s a perfectly medium-bodied brew at 5.5% ABV. It would be awfully tempting to session this, but the 11.2oz cans are hard to find. A single half liter is definitely sufficient. I wish Paulaner would offer this in 500ml cans or even 1-liter cans!



RATING: 9/10

Wonderful orange unfiltered color. Sweet hoppy aroma. Light fruits. Nice head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ein tolles Weizen. Sehr fruchtig, sehr bananig. Die Nelke fehlt leider fast total, aber es ist trotzdem ein super Weissbier.
500ml bottle. Hazy golden orange color with off white head. Yeasty fruity aroma, citrusy, banana, spicy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

Bottle 50cl from Systembolaget. Very nice looking cloudy orange with a great white head. Banana, spices, yeast, citrus, coriander, oranges, marzipan. Medium body, lively carbonation, yeasty fruity finish. Very nice Weissbier.
Spicy herbal aroma, maybe some coriander and banana. Doughy taste with orange. Refreshing weizen, a big plus is that the banana doens’t take over the aroma which is the case in many beers.
11.2 oz bottle pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of yeast, grass and malts. Taste is banana, grass and malts.

Pours a hazy golden color, topped with a fairly big frothy white head, some medium retention. Wheaty aroma with presence of bananas and some mild yeasty feel. Taste is slightly sweet and wheaty, a bit bready in the body with some soury feel. Pretty nice, a milder version of a hefeweizen, that’s why I like it.
Beautiful golden color a light clean slightly bitter flavor with a hint of banana flavor. I enjoyed this beer on a hot day went down smooth and was very refreshing.
----- I’ve tried it before joining to the RateBeer. -----

Ok, talán egyszerűbb mint egy Weihenstepaner vagy egy Schneider, de ezért már ez is tökéletes búza, ráadásul még megfizethető is !

A dús, tömör habjában partikat is lehetne rendezni ! Egy szüretlen sörnek pont így kell kinéznie. Illatba, ízbe sem lehet belekötni, még a dobozos változatnál sem. 

Very Nice !

500ml bottle on DFDS Newcastle to Amsterdam ferry. Hazy gold amber colour, white foamy head and yeasty banana aroma. Taste is wheaty, grain with fruity banana and milky, yeasty notes. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, tangy banana fruity finish. Quite drinkable.

Muy buena presencia, pero el caso es que me supo aguada. Esperaba más. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

This, to me, is a Weiss beer as Weiss beers are most. It doesn't impress much, but it is a pleasant accompaniment with sunshine.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ojciec wrócił właśnie z Niemiec i przywiózł kilka piwek.
Bananów ci tutaj dostatek, zarówno w smaku jak i w aromacie a i posmak waniliowy poczuć można. Nie mój styl ale piję z przyjemnością.

Bottiglia da 0,50. Colore oro ambrato e schiuma molto abbondante e persistente. Cabonatura moderata. Gusto con sfondi erbacei leggermente agro. Aroma fresco e floreale con finale di agrumi. Consiglio 7/10
Отличное спокойное пиво на каждый день, на неразборчивых друзей!

Bottle. Aroma of bananas and citrus, yeast. In taste mainly bananas, no clove at all. The beer is low bodiee, strongly carbonated. All is great except the lack of clove. Now beer is really dull and heavy. Decent big brand hefe though.

Fles gekocht bij AH, uitgeschonken in Weihenstephan glas. Donkergeel/oranjeachtig troebel bier, met volle witte schuimkraag die stabiel is. Klassieke weissbier aroma's van Duitse gist, banaan, citrus en specerijen vooral kruidnagel en licht peperige noten. Het smaakpallet volgt de geur. Kruidig, verfrissend en zacht hopbitter. Smaaktonen van banaan, citrus, vanille, kruidnagel, nootmuskaat en een finish van witte peper. Romig mondgevoel met zachte carbonatie. De bekende kauwgom tonen zijn bij de Paulaner minder sterk aanwezig dan gebruikelijk. Paulaner behoort met Erdinger tot de betere bekende Weissenbieren van Duitsland. Alleen de Weihenstephaner is nog iets beter naar mijn mening.
Bottle bier guys ossett. Golden good head. Banana clove aroma taste some pepper light bitter. Nice body. Good stuff.
one of the best weissbeers in the world. silky, well balanced and delicious.

Turva,amarelada,espuma abundante com boa duração,alta carbonatação;aroma típico do estilo,frutado(banana) e condimentado(cravo);sabor adocicado na medida segue o aroma,com o frutado mais destacado,refrescante,"drinkability" alta,corpo baixo/médio. Weizen correta e bem feita,serve de parâmetro para o estilo,vale a pena,recomendo.

Flasche (50 cl). - Für ein Weizenbier recht schlank, sehr mild, mit mild säuerlich-fruchtigen Anklängen und ganz schwach grasiger Herbe. - Immerhin ein guter Durstlöscher, ansonsten bestenfalls durchschnittlich. Ein wirklich gutes Weizenbier muß aromatisch mehr zu bieten haben.

Cloudy orange/gold with thick tight white head. 
Banana/lemon/touch of bubblegum. Refreshing, Finish has lemon and banana Quite a nice dry feel Huge creamy head with excellent duration.

13 July 2019:. 32 oz draft at Ol Heidelberg Cafein Huntsville, Alabama.  Hazy orange gold poured with a thin white head that left minimal lacing. The aroma is clove and banana. The taste is smooth and slightly sweet. Very enjoyable. 


23 July 2015:  Draft. Hazy orange with a nice white head. It had a wheat, banana and fruit flavor.
Pretty good Wizen. Aroma of banana and citrus, cloudy amber with long lasting white head, taste is fairly sour, certainly not as sweet as Erdinger which I prefer.
There is nothing about this beer that I do not like. I am a very picky beer drinker, and this has become my favorite.

Very clear ambery color with fast decaying foam. The smell is full and malty. The taste is wheaty and bread like. The aftertaste is also bread like and all in all, this beer doesn’t so a lot wrong, but is a little boring nevertheless.

Pours dark orange with medium head. Aroma suggests wheat, banana, some dark fruit and malt. Taste reveals very much the same. Good mouth feel, a little watery though. Still easily drinkable. A good hefeweizen.

Third times the charm.Good Hefeweizen

Huge, fine yellowish head, very stable over hazy warm-orange beer. Bit of clove, lots of banana. Later citrus and orangepeel. Citrus, banana, lemon in the flavour. Wheat gives also some acidity. Faint bitterness in the palate. Quite refreshing, despite the wheatslickness & -filling. Very classical, but quite decent Hefe.
0,5 l Flasche. Oranges, trübes Bier, dichter, langlebiger Schaum. Hefiges, brotiges Aroma, heftiger, brotiger, leicht süßer Geschmack.

Je préfère quand même la Weihenstephan. Elle reste très agréable et réussie : le blé est bien présent, le léger houblonnage qui soutient et rééquilibre vers un breuvage desalterant.
On note tout de même une jolie longueur en bouche où on trouve une certaine richesse, un goût de reviens-y.
Oranjebruin bier met schuim. Eén van de betere Weissbieren. Smaak is krachtig fris fruitig, ietwat zuur, citrus. Erg goed.

Great beer. True to the Hefe Weissbier style.

Although not as sweet as the Erdinger Hefe Weiss, this one does have a bit of a harsh aftertaste (which the former doesn’t).

For me, Erdinger is still the king of Wheat.

MB
Lekker bier voor op een zonnig terras. Mooi troebel, ruikt wat naar banaan en smaakt een beetje naar meloen.
Piwo złote, mętne. Piana bardzo obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała- super. W aromacie lekkie banany. W smaku słodowość, banany, chleb. Wysokowysycone. Ma trochę ciała.
A very pleasant German Weissbier. It is cloudy with a medium head that lasts through the drink. A sweet taste with a hint of honey.
Buona weiss dissetante, dal colore ambrato torbido tipico, odore di cereali e vaniglia, sapore asprigno di cereali, banana, lievito.
Een goede hefeweizener. De klassieke elementen: graan en kruiden. Paulaner heeft echter ook een wat weeïge ondertoon. Heerlijk bij warm weer.

Can 0.5l. Cloudy dirty pale orange liquid with gigantic off white head. Medium body, medium to light carbonation. Aroma of yeast and grains. A bit sour taste, could handle a bit more sweetness. Taste of banana in the end. Semi long finish. Nice hefe.

Bottle. Huge Head, lot of CO2. Very cloudy amber colour even without yeast deposit. Light banana notes in the nose. Malty mouthfeel with creamy banana, but not very intense. No hops, no bitterness. Classic average german wheat made for mass consuption.
From bottle 04.07.15. 4,6 % ABV. Slightly hazy golden. Foamy white head. Aroma of coriander, clove, bananas and a hint of lemon. Similar taste. Slighty sour.

Pours cloudy orange with creamy and persistent white head. Aroma of cloves, bread, some banana. Taste is light sweet and sour. Smooth palate, medium body, lively carbonation. Well balanced, easy drinking, great Weissbier.
From tulip pint glass. Hazy golden color with medium head. Aroma: a bit disappoint, mostly yogurt-like yeast and banana Taste: mostly sweet and a bit sour. Medium body. Quite nice choise for summer

500 mL bottle capped at the pool. This is officially the most flavorful beer I’ve found on this island, and a refreshing change to its usual style offerings. Nice banana grain aroma. Flavor is lemon, grqins, and mild banana. Drinks nice. Good flavor. Good beer.

(bottle 500 ml)
Aroma: banana, grainy, bready smell
Apperarance: very hazy, gold color, perfect big white head with perfect lacing.
Taste: medium to high sweetness, quite sour ,banana/bready notes in flavour, great bready aftertaste.
Palate: oily, medium body, high carbonation
Overall: Very refeshing ,very drinkable , great beer.

Nez: Froment, banane
Bouche: Froment, banane, orange, épicée
En cette période caniculaire, je la trouve excellente.
Cloudy orange with an above average head. Good banana and vanilla nose. Flavours start sweet and fruity, gradually developing spicier and drier. Quite sparkling with a slightly bitter finish.

0.5l pour from refrigerated can into plastic solo cup at Frankfurt airport. The fluffiest a beer’s head can be. Huge fluffy white head. Lots of carbonation, mostly clear, and brilliantly orange. Medium body, mostly creamy with a bit of a crisp finish. Nose of clove and banana. Spot on for a hefe. Taste is pretty well balanced, leaning on the sweet side. Banana notes dominate with maybe a little citrus in the background. Pretty good all around, though not incredible.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours with a hazy, unclear appearance and a somewhat thick head. The aromas are very particular, with certain notes of banana but definitely not hoppy. As for the taste, I consider it rather sweet, with a slight sourness afterwards, very decent and very balanced. Initially, I was surprised by the heavy carbonation, and the somewhat creamy texture that was absolutely delightful. The beer was enjoyable, and its many different flavour complexities came unexpected! Refreshing and delicious, if, of course, different from the standard barley beers.
"Would drink again".

500ml bottle at home bought at random Merkur in Vienna. BB 02/2016. orange cloudy color. rather big white head. smells of spices, cloves, light banana, peach, a bit yeasty. medium body, soft bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of spices, glue, some ash-like notes, herbs, peach, lightly yeasty. finishes with spices and light fruits. expected a bit more.
nice weizen aroma faint banana looks nice clouded touching orange sturdy foam taste faint banana some clove full bodied good weizen

Bottle:
Pours dark gold with a huge, frothy head.
Strong clove and banana aroma.
Sweet, creamy wheat malt, banana, spice flavor.....
Solid.....very tasty.

Piwo pszeniczne, naturalnie mętne. Barwa jasno złota, niewielkie słomkowe refelksy. Piana bardzo obfita, drobnopęcheżykowa, trwała, mocne koronkowanie. Aromat lekko chmielowy, pszeniczny, świeży, cytrusowo-bananowy. Wysycenie średnio niskie, piwo orzeźwiające, lekko wodniste, niewielki posmak alkoholowy, wyraźny ale krótki. Goryczka niska, krótkotrwała. Piwo dobrze pijalne, orzeźwiające, lekko kwaskowe, z nutami owocowymi, dobre na ciepłe dni, lekkie.
Strong banana aroma throughout. Hazy yellow with thick white head. Heavy initial carbonation. Good mouthfeel - sweet banana and lemony taste. Refreshing but maybe a bit sweet.

Creamy and wheaty banana aroma. Appearance is foggy and hazy, minimal head. The first time I tried it from bottle, the aftertaste kicked in a really sour and wheaty feeling which was kinda strange to me. Now that I have tried this again multiple times on tap, I can confirm that it is one of the best weizens I have drunk and it isn’t that sour at all. You can feel the wheat very well, it is just like liquid bread. So nice. Rerated.

Dorada turbia de abundante espuma blanca. Aroma bastante típico, cereal, de notas espaciadas y plátano. En boca cremosa con buen punto de gas y sabor dulce y refrescante con las características que anunciaba en el aroma.
Draft at chaps. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. The aroma is loaded with banana bread and clove..typical. Full taste and thick mouthfeel.

Z?ote, m?tne piwo o bardzo obfitej pianie, która pozostaje do ko?ca i zdobi szk?o. Aromat bananowy z nut? go?dzików. W smaku podobnie tylko go?dziki s? troch? bardziej wyczuwalne. Goryczka niska. Ogólnie przyjemne i pijalne piwo, ale s? lepsi reprezentanci stylu i jednak czu? troch?, ?e to koncerniak.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden full white head. Aroma of citrus, banana, clove, dough. Medium-high sweetness. Light body, active carbonation, somewhat sticky texture, light sweet finish. Excellent hefe.
Golden, cloudy with a thick white head. Lemon and wheat on the nose. Has a lovely wheaty kick at the end.
Buonissima versione di birra weisse, ottima la schiuma. Perfetta da bere per l’estate.
Tap @ Retro Sports Bar. Hazy dark golden, white head. Aroma :, spices, banana, wheat, clove. Creamy mouthfeel, medium dry. Flavour; Sweet banana, grass, wheat. Finish fresh sweet/sour lemon lemonade.

Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier is right up there with better known German Hefeweizens. Darker orange pour with a white frothy head. Aroma is light notes of banana and cloves. Taste is the same with a clean finish. Paulaner is definitely a worthy Hefe true to style.
Als je het uitschenkt denk je dat je het zoveelste weissbier hebt. En alhoewel de smaak niet overdonderend is, is het toch beter dan de gemiddelde weissbier. Valt goed mee

11.2 oz bottle into weizen glass, exp date 11/15
Aroma: German hops, some citrus, mostly immediate esters, mostly clove-y, less of the fruits in other weizens.
Appearance: pretty, cloudy burnt orange. good head retention throughout drinking.
Taste: light-bodied, hint of tartness? very little of the esters I remembered in this beer.
Palate: medium bodied, thick carbonation.
Overall: something isn’t right here. I’ve had this beer more than a dozen times, and at no point was I ever as disappointed as I was here. Feels like the bottle was old?

>a really unremarkable episode of an ongoing tv series/podcast
From bottle. Pours cloudy with big white head. Aroma banana, wheat. Taste fresh, wheat, bubblegum, citrus. Medium to high carbonation. Good classic beer especially for summer.
A classic Hefeweizen. Still excellent before Heineken will ruin it. Yeasty delight. Perfect summer beer.

Aroma:


Slight/medium aroma of malts, wheat, banana, bread and hops.




Appearance:


Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white head.




Taste/Palate:


Starts medium sweet with malts, wheat and banana; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread and hops.




Overall:


This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. So amazingly refreshing with loads of wheat and banana. Could have been slightly more sweet to be honest, but it is still a great beer with a wonderful appearance.

Wygląda bardzo ładnie, jak typowa pszenica - wysoka trwała piana, lekko zmętnione. W aromacie nieco słodyczy i duże ilości mącznych bananów naraz. W smaku banany są nieco przytępione i uzupełnia je lekko witowa pomarańczka. Jeden z najlepszych koncerniaków na świecie, bez dwóch zdań.

After a hard Summer’s day of rigorous outdoor activity, this is a solid quaff to slake a hard earned thirst. Cloudy golden yellow with a long lasting white streaker, sweet notes of wheat, banana, coriander, light clove and balanced bubblegum. The banana flavour is awesome, subdued and tasteful. I usually am not one to champion this style but I have found a new regular Summer swigglette in this Hefe. The mouthfeel is lightly chewy but has enough carbonation not to make this sweeter tasting beer go over the handlebars.
Blanche fruitée, sans aucune note désagréable en bouche. Bouteille 33cl ramenée d’Allemagne par un ami, bue le 02/05/2015.

Bottle from Auchan, Luxembourg. Hazy copper yellow with picture book white head. Nose is banana, white bread, cloves. Taste is similar, very bready, smooth and silky mouthfeel, well carbonated. Not quite as good as e.g. Franziskaner, but still a great weizen.

On tap at Madrid Beer Museum. Big white head with good retention. Cloudy pale golden colour. Acid aroma. Acid taste, tropical fruit, very slight bitterness, green banana with some clove finish.
It is the second place it taste like that. I will not no try it anymore because I think this is its real flavour.
0.5 bottle. Pale yellow color with thick, cloudy white head. Banana aroma that dominates and also some wheat aroma too. Taste follows aroma of a banana and wheat. Medium sweet taste.

Good quality heffeweisse. Not my favorite in the style though. Nice pale yellow with a big head and pleasant carbonation. Flavor is malty with a bit of banana and some funky yeast notes. Not too sweet. Good stuff but lacks a bit of caracter.

500 ml bottle. Cloudy dark yellow, with a thick white head. Wheaty-malty aroma with banana, yeast and lemony notes. The flavour is wheaty, with banana and yeasty notes, and a mildly spicy finish. Tasty.
Bottle 500ml from supermarket in Austria,soft taste of yeast and banana,malt taste,golden orange,good weissbier.
A non filter beer in all the characteristics, strong body, dark-gold color, good taste, a lot of foam, served in 50cl glass from tap.

Can from Beermerchants.

Pours orange, cloudy, two finger white head. Aroma of wheat, bananas, floral...Taste of bananas, loads, then floral, flowery flavours, then some wheat, orange, a touch of spice, very good.

Classic Oktoberfest favorite!
Pours pale orange (rather than amber), cloudy and hazy. Head is abundant, persistent and rich.
Intense aromas of banana, smoke and lemon.
Creamy full body. Not very long finish.
Se puede beber pero no es tampoco una cosa del otro mundo. Desde luego hay muchas de trigo peores
This has a nice German taste with a light look and smooth finish. You can taste the complex mix of malts that give it its flavor.

Orange cloudy beer, white big head, nice lasing on glass. Bananas and other esters, cloves. Taste: light to medium sour, refreshing. light to medium body, medium carbonation. Overall: good example of this style, I like it.
Butelka. Barwa bursztynowa, mętne. Piana drobna, obfita. Aromat słlodowy, bananowy. W smaku kwaskowate, bananowe, goryczka na poziomie niskim. Piwo nisko nasycone.
Smell of yeast, banana and orange. Nice firm foam. Cloudy golden colour. Soft taste of yeast and banana, backed up with a nice wheaty malt taste. Good mouthfeel. One of my favourite weissbiers!

Pours cloudy orange with a nice foamy head. Aroma of candy bananas, hint of cloves and honey. Very strong hit bananas on the front taste, some orange but gives way to a watery palate and perhaps too much carbonation.
0,5l Flasche Orangenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Schmeckt typisch nach Banane und Hefe.

Une weissbier classique, à servir sans un verre adéquat qui offre un beau col de mousse onctueux qui tient la durée. Toujours cette petite saveur légére de banane typique. A tester avec d’autres weissbier pour comparer

Nice honey yellow colour,  cloudy, with some sediment sometimes. Interesting silky structure, soft and with good white top. Good carbonation. Clean taste of typical german hefe-weissbier. Discreet aroma,

I think this was my first Weizenbier many years ago. I still think it is one of the best in the world. Unfortunately more often you get an older one. There is nothing like a fresh Paulaner from draft at the Paulaner am Nockerberg Brewhouse.
On tap. Pours hazy pale yellow with a foamy white head. Aroma is wheat, banana, yeast. Taste is similar, very well balanced, medium body, watery texture, great drinkability.

En svært positiv overraskelse. Har sett denne mange ganger i hyllene, og skjønner ikke helt hvorfor jeg ikke har kjøpt denne før. God. Frisk. Deilig. Både alene og til mat. En god øl!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0,5. Shared with friends.
Fruity aroma. Very refreshing.Medium sweetness and sourness. Pleasant aftertaste. Good weizen.

A typically good Weissbier. It has a slightly higher ABV than my other favorite Franziskaner which makes the flavors stand out just a little more. I will have to see what the availability and price difference is and possibly switch to this if I can get it. My wife likes this type of beer and tried this brand while on vacation in Panama and liked it better.
Bottle. Classic hefeweissbier from Paulaner: banana, cloves in aroma. Taste of wheat, cloves, lightly acidic. Very refreshing and sessionable.
perfect beer for me,i love that teast very much,quite traditional,but its easy to drunk when i had the sixth bottle
That is what you get on most situations in Germany. Not very tasty and not a memorable experience but high drinkability.

Amargor: 3/5
Dulçor: 3/5
Corpo: 3/5
Muito boa cerveja, aromatica e refrescante, com boa persistência.

Piwo o ladnej barwie i pianie, lekko zmetnione, spore nasycenie. Aromat intensywny, zdecydowanie czuc jest banany, po zamieszaniu ten aromat bananowy jest bardzo intensywny i nawet troszke taki rozpuszczalnikowy. Pomimo tego bardzo przyjemnie sie pije. Piwo bardzo gladkie. Gasi pragnienie.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Vista: Color dorado - naranja, con bastante turbiedad. Espuma abundante y duradera. 
- Nariz: Aroma intenso a pan recién hecho y a frutas, especialmente plátano
- Boca: Notas de plátano característico de este estilo, con tonos de naranja, especies y trigo. Postgusto afrutado.
Golden colour with creamy head. Aroma and flavours of yeasts, hop and bananas, with little bitter, malty finish and sweet aftertaste.
Olor a platano tipico de las cervezas de trigo. Sabores a maltas muy destacados. De trago largo. Espuma persistente.

Een af de klassiske tyske Weiss-Beer. Altid en dejlig nydelse på det rette sted, det rigtige tidspunkt og i det rette selskab. Lidt spids bittersmag og lidt for meget kulsyre - ellers ville de få 4 stjerner.
Cloudy orange color, big white head. Aroma is banana, yeast, little acidic note. Taste is little sweet and sour, dry finish. Banana and bread flavor. Light to medium body, medium carbonation.
banana flavour, creamy off white head, yeast taste, bready, middle carbonation for a Weissbier

Aroma of wheat, hay, malt and banana. Pours cloudy amber liquid with a large frothy head. Taste is both slightly bitter and sweet and very dense with flavour. The flavour is mainly wheat with some malt and yeast and a hint of banana and hay. The flavours mix very well and nothing is really overwhelming. The body is rather full with a slick, almost water-like texture. This is a very well-done Hefeweizen. All the ingredients that are typical for a Hefeweizen and yet I would rate this way above average because of how diverse the taste and smell is.

Butelka 0,4l. Barwa jasnego zlota, oczywiscie pieknie metne. Piana biala po nalaniu wysoka, gesta i drobna, ale szybko opada. Aromat bananowy i jakby lekka nuta drozdzy. W smaku klasycznie jak na weizena przystalo. Alkoholu nie czuc. Orzezwiajace.

Bottle 0.5l (12.2015). Golden, orange, banana colour typical for weizen. Long, frothy, white head with good lacing. Banana and clove in aroma, medium intensive and very nice as I could expect. Taste it is classic of german wheat beer. Medium body, light bitterness and a bit sweet-sour at the end. Beer is light, soft fizzy, good drinkable - very good sample of this style.

Butelka 0,4l do 08.10.2015r. Barwa ciemnego złota, zmętniona solidnie. Piana jasno beżowa, obfita i drobna, jednak szybko opada. W aromacie banany, goździki i taka nuta dosyć nieprzyjemna drożdżowa. W smaku banany, pszenica i delikatna gorycz. Bardzo takie smukłe i gładkie w budowie. Super odczucia w ustach. Nasycenie średnie, w sam raz. Alkoholu nie czuć. Przyzwoite piwo, a jak na masówkę, którą musiał wykonać Paulaner dla Lidla, to jest to spory sukces. Polecam jak najbardziej.
Bottle @ Patio Restaurant, Katowice. Hazy golden colour, nose of citrus and grapefruit. Also aroma of bananas. Bitter finish. Good weissbier.

0,5 l bottle. Very pleasant aroma - fruits and flowers. 
Very drinkable, but taste quickly disappears.
Very low bitterness and very short aftertaste.

Z kranu, w jednym z pawilonow (Lenistwo) - klasyka - piana obfita, kolor jasny, zolty, bardzo metne. aromaty bananow i gozdzikow sa obecne choc niezbyt intensywne. do tego troche drozdzowo-ciastowych nut, nieco zbozowosci, nieco jakichs landrynkowych nutek. Smak analogiczny do aromatow - wyczuwalna kwaskowosc i slodkosc lekka. srednie wysycenie, dosc pelne. Niezly, bezpieczny wybor w miejscach, gdzie nie ma wyboru ;) Ale zarazem sporo lepszych pszeniczniakow na rynku.

 z tym sporo lepszych to nie wiem, czy sie nie pospieszylem :) ocena w gore ;)

Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

22-12-2017; bottle; at home (bought at beerwulf.com, #19 of their Christmas advent calendar).
Nice looks. Dark golden-orange color. The beer is, like a Weizen should, cloudy. The thick layer of touch harsh foam leaves for a thin layer of silklike softness. 
The smell is sweet and fruity. It is a typical Weizen smell. Sweet malts, with a touch of gum and some bread, with just a touch of floral hops. Yeast contributes for most of the aroma, giving delicious aromas of banana, some zest and a hint of spice. 
The taste is also fine. Sweet malts, a hoppy bitterness and sweet, spicy and creamy yeast flavours. It has to be said, that this isn't worlds best German Hefeweizen...it is very nice, but a bit simple. It already has part of the factory brew character...a bit mild and plain. I don't know if it 100% deserves it's place in the top 100, or that this is because of the fame it has. But, it still is way above factory pilsener and lager, so it is quite nice.
The palate of the beer is fine. Medium body, smooth and a bit creamy texture and medium low carbonanion. The finish has some alcohol, quite some bready malts and a bitter hop touch. All in all, an above average beer, but an average German Hefeweizen.

Poured from tap ,Cloudy orange beer. Some banana, citrus, orange aromas are felt. Medium body, with a balanced malt and citrus hops with a pretty cool alcoholic level. Great when u just want to chill and drink good wheat bear.

Poured from 500 ML bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a very nice wheat, malt and floral smell.
Appearance- Pours a dark yellow color with some sediment and a large white head.
Taste- The wheat is blended nicely with the malt and is a smooth and flavorful blend.
Palate- A medium bodied beer with light carbonation, has a slightly oily texture that goes well with the flavor.
Overall- A very nice example of a hefeweizen, try it if you haven’t had it before.
Flaska från SB. Skummar mycket och bildar fin krämig skumpuck. En ljus, lätt stiltypsik hefe, lite lättare och torrare men krämig och mjuk munkänsla. Lättkryddad. Gott
Nie znam się na piwach, ale lubię bardzo tę bananową łatwopijalność Paulanera.
Old rating. When you need a hefeweissen, this does the trick. Crisp, clove, banana, wheat, orange peel. Slightly thin, but refreshing.
El clásico primer paso en las cervezas de trigo. Un gusto que sea ya tan fácil de encontrar.
Decent Hefe-Weizen. It has all the characteristics of a Hefe-Weizen but it could all be done better. It’s very flat in taste and aroma.

Pours a quite dark orange with a nice white head. Aroma has tons of clove and banana. Some sweet malt is also quite prominent here. Flavor has nice banana, clove, but with a good malty backbone to it. My personal go-to weisse for sure. Really good, balanced and easy-drinking!

Bottle and Draft 0.5l at Paulaner pub Belgrade Serbia.Pour it hazy orange color with big white head.On the nose orange and banana.Taste and aroma very good complexed classic great taste for me, every time I tried Paulner hefe weizen is really calssic.Banana, wheat, bread and yeast.Very good,

Espuma blanquecina muy compacta y permanente, color amarillo anaranjado, turbia sin filtrar, buen aroma en nariz, sabor donde se aprecian el dulzor de las maltas con un final con ligero amargor, regusto sabroso

0,5 L Beer Can(!) ( Although I loathe beer cans the supermarket made me an offer I couldn’t refuse). 1.Beautiful cloudy orange color. 2. Good head that remains for a couple of minutes 3. Well carbonated 4.Orange peel and other citrus notes. Really good beer.
Słaba piana jak na hefeweizena, zniknęła szybko, w aromacie brak goździka pozatym bardzo stylowo, wysokie wysycenie i bardzo orzeźwiający owocowy smak. Taki klasyk.

1 -Cor: Dourado, ligeiramente turvo.
2-Sabor: De corpo médio, refrescante, conjugado com toque frutado. Espuma ampla, densa e de longa duração.

Keg at Paulaner Stuttgart, 08/02/15.
Hazed orange amber with a decent off white top.
Nose is yeast esters, clove, straw, orange, vanilla, light banana.
Taste comprises banana, spice, caramel, yeast.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent enough hefe, perhaps expected a little more from one of the big boys having had this in the dim and distant past but not rated it!

On tap at Rolf’s in Warren in early February 2015. Served in a 1 liter dimpled mug. Light crisp clean and refreshing. Subtle flavors complimented the rich German food (had Kassler). Very easy drinking and pairs nicely with rich foods. Not something I would drink by itself though due to its mild nature. Update: Had this today from a bottle in a glass with a lemon wedge rimmed around the lip and dropped inside. Fantastically refreshing!
30.4.2014. Aroma of banana, citrus, yeast. Quite carbonated and light. Taste of banana and yeast. A bit too light for my taste.
0,3 hana @ Gallow’s Pub. Samea kullankeltainen. Tuoksussa pehmeää mallasta, hiivaa, banaania, hieman toffeeta. Maussa vehnämallasta, banaania, hiivaa. Helppoa, pehmeän täyteläistä.

The no. 1 Hefe-Weißbier in Germany and one of the world’s favourites. Naturally cloudy and shining silky gold in the glass under a really strong head of foam. At the first mouthful this Weißbier classic has a mild aroma of banana. Finer palates detect a trace of mango and pineapple and the balance between sweet and bitter. Beer connoisseurs appreciate the fine note of yeast and the mild but sparkling mix of aromas. It is a typical beergarden beer, which brings people together all over the world.
The bottle isn’t too beautiful, but the beer tastes great even though aroma and palate need something.

Grumlig guldfärgad öl med stor vit krona. Lite väl enkel i min smak. Lite blaskig men man känner ändå bla: jäst, vete, banan, malt. Doften är bättre än smaken! God öl men finns bättre i kategorin.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Copenhagen 16/8 2014. Poured from keg in plastic glass at a birthday party. Hazy dark yellow with white head which quickly subsides. Very fruity and herbal aroma - Classic Weiss beer. Tingly creamy mouthfeel. Distinct taste of Weiss beer which lasts for a suprisingly short time.
Cloudy yellow color looks like honey, big white long lasting head. Wheat aroma, light sweet taste.

Bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy golden color, with pillowy white head. Head lasts for a while and finally dissipates into a thin film. Aroma is citrus, spices, cloves, a bit of bread and bananas. Smells great. Taste is clean, a nice mixture of mellow spices, wheat, a bit of bread and dough. Hops keep this crisp, bringing a faint citrus into this. Crisp, clean mouthfeel, light body highly carbonated. Very good.
W aromacie nuty malinowe, brak charakterystycznych dla piw pszenicznych nut bananów i goździków. W smaku przyjemne, tutaj pojawia się trochę banana.

0,4 l bottle. 
Pite/Drunk: 2015.02.18 
Partia/BBD: 05.11.15 L30946C

This is my all-time favourite. If you like wheat beers you will not be disappointed. It has a very nice aroma, foam, and it has that nice caramely taste. Simply the best!

Visual âmbar alaranjado, convidativo. Espuma espessa, duradoura e uniforme. Aroma adocicado, canela, baunilha. Paladar muito bem balanceado, maltado. Aftertaste médio mas muito saboroso. Um caso de amor com essa cerveja!

500ml bottle at home, from AleselA, Glasgow - clear orange amber, many mico bubbles, thick creamy off-white head, strong aroma of yeast, wheaty, some lacing, more yeasty, wheat flavour, good carbonation, dryish finish
Bouteille 50 Cl, une belle mousse blanche épaisse, légèrement ambrée, pas de fumé,pas d’amertume.

11.2 oz bottle. Pours hazy golden with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head, nice lacing and lovely carbonation. Aroma is of spicy yeast, wheat malt and ripe apples. Body is medium and crisp. Wheat malt, yeast, ripe pears and spices fill the mouth. Finish is light and fruity. Good brew but I’m not a fan of the style.
Bottle from SB. Cloudy golden with a medium white head. Fruity and spicy tones. Fruit, spices, malt and hops. Medium body with a balanced finish.
Very good, kinda sweet, with nice color, and rich palete. It has no bitternes in aftertaste. It is very light drink, it will be suitable for everyone. Delicate smell, adds even more.
Couleur jaune doré; mousse blanche assez fine; odeur fruitée; goût malté et fruité; bière très agréable

Dobre.
Klasyczne, byle świeże, byle latem. I żeby schować przed żoną bo też lubi.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A gorgeous brown orange opaque beer ; many small bubbles ; big white head with a good retention. Fruity aroma (intense banana, pear), spices, herbs. Light sweet, medium dry bitter ; refreshing. Light to medium body, silky texture, good carbonation, short dry fruity finish. Overall, delicious, fruity, refreshing hefe-weissbier !
This is definitely what you would expect. Is this Oktoberfest. Yumm. Can I have another.
Legjobb sörök közé sorolom . Izletes, gyönyörű színe van, látszik nem vizes, és érzik is rajta. Illata is nagyon aromás. Bár nem olcsó de mindenképp kostolandó darab !
Good wheat beer. Pleasant aroma, light bitterness. Wheat flavor and long aftertaste.

Bottle. Hazy golden w thick white head. Strong malt and yeast aroma. Smooth well rounded beer. Mild banana and caramel notes.
