Bottle from El Corte Inglés (Barcelona, Spain). Appearance: Golden color. Hazy body. High carbonation. Large, rocky, light, intense white and lingering head. Aroma: Wheat malts. Bread, cereals, spices and fruits. Taste: Medium sweetness. Palate: Light and thin body. Wheaty, sweet and refreshing aftertaste.

Butelka 0,5 l.
Kolor pamarańczowo-złoty.
Piana wysoka, obfita, utrzymuje się długo.
W zapachu głównie pszenica, goździki, owoce.
W smaku pszenica, chleb, banan.

Had this many, many times socially and now finally rating it. It pours a nice orange, gold color with a shrinking fluffy white head. The aroma is softly malty with equal parts banana and clove spice, minor floral notes. The flavor is strong with wheat, mild acidity and starch, banana, clove and light lemon, herbals in the finish. For me, this is pretty much the gold standard for hefeweizen, especially if you can get it fresh and/or on draft. Really nice on a warm spring day.
Meh Meh Meh Meh Meh Meh Meh a little bitter Meh Meh Meh Meh watery Meh Meh Meh Meh Meh

05.15 best by.
Poured from a pint bottle into a weizen glass on 11.24.14.

A: Maybe Noble or Hallertau hop smell. Typical Old World beer smell. Wheat, orange, and clove then take over.

A: 2 finger head. Opaque orange yeast cloud at the top of the body. The body is see through orange and yellow at the bottom in spots. The yeast cloud is massive.

T: Orange, wheat, and lingering sweet clove are dominant. Spicy clove is subtle.

P: Watery and smooth as a hef should be.

O: This is as good as I remember the first time that I had it. Beer was supposed to taste like adjunct lagers before this one. It was the first beer that opened my eyes to what good beer tasted like. It led me down a path of exploration into other hefs, wits, APAs, porters, stouts, IPAs, and beyond. So, personally, it means a lot. Generally, I think that it’s one of the best hefs in the world. It has a bit more orange flavor than other hefs and is more assertive all around than some.

Translucent yellow haze. Large head with good retention. Malt, wheat, lemon, and alcohol aroma. Full bodied and creamy. Initial taste is robust combination of malt/wheat, but finish presents a wonderfully smooth mixture of lemon, banana and a wee bit of hop. Quite good indeed.

Had this many, many times socially and now finally rating it. It pours a nice orange, gold color with a shrinking fluffy white head. The aroma is softly malty with equal parts banana and clove spice, minor floral notes. The flavor is strong with wheat, mild acidity and starch, banana, clove and light lemon, herbals in the finish. For me, this is pretty much the gold standard for hefeweizen, especially if you can get it fresh and/or on draft. Really nice on a warm spring day.

Bottle, 40cl. Pours hazy gold nice white, small-bubbled head, nicely lasting. Scents of typical Hefeweizen, predominantly wheat, some coriander and cloves. Taste is very light mixture of sweetness and soft bitterness. Its gentleless is disturbed by overcarbonation and watery feel. Too flat.

Tried in several times! Last one on the 18/01/2015. One of my favourite Hefeweizen!!!! Quite good. Hazy golden colour with a nice smooth medium white head. Aroma of citrus, banana and malts. Taste is sweet and smooth with presence of banana. Next one please!

Aromat przyjemnie słodowy, pszeniczny, lekko chlebowy. Barwa jasnobursztynowa, mętne, spore wysycenie. Piana wysoka, średnio i drobno pęcherzykowa. W smaku bez fajerwerków, ale bardzo klasycznie, pszeniczne, chlebowo i smacznie. Bardzo pijalne. Średnia goryczka.

As much as I do not like Hefeweisen- this is my favorite. Enjoyed it in Germany on tap recently, and found out that it is not ticked. Pleasantly sharp citrus and wheat mix. Always good choice, no matter the temperature.

from paradise market. looking forward to it as i love the style but it tasted pretty fucked. watery, tinny, with little distinctive flavour. no clove, banana. a bit of hay and yeast but that was about it. judging by the other rates, maybe i got a bad bottle
Amarelo dourada, Turva, ótima formação e estabilidade de espuma. Aromas de banana e cravo bem evidentes. Aftertaste doce e bastante refrescante. Uma referência do estilo. ótimo Custo-benefício.
Gutes Hefeweizen. Gelbe Farbe, naturtrüb. Große, weiße Schaumkrone. Leicht süsser Weizengeschmack.

Poured from a chilled brown 11.2 oz bottle into a just cleaned wiezen glass (with a thin layer of cold water to slow down the head) and not completely draining the bottles as there is yet a flavorful residue there, @ the bottle’s bottom. let the bottle rest; take a nice, long, refreshing swig of what’s in your glass; swirl the bottle’s remaining contents; pour into the wheat glass in drips of froathen gold. 
this can be done again or until the bottle is squeezed dry.

Aromat bananowy z domieszką wanili i delikatnymi goździkami. W smaku lekka bananowość i pszeniczność ale przeważa owocowaość (może trochę mango albo brzoskwini. Bardzo dobre piwo, nie jest zbyt treściwe, ale jego lekkość świetnie wpływa na pijalność.
Aroma: banana, cloves, yeast, malts. Taste: Very smooth and light, banana, cloves and fruit sweetness. Medium head, average lacing and medium carbonation. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 5PLN (0,4 bottle)
Its a fresh white bear which make you enjoy it whitout doubt. Good taste and colour.
On tap at Erwin’s Gastrobar. Pours cloudy pale orange with a thick creamy head, big malt flavour up front, very well balanced, with a fruit hop finish. Great stuff.

This beer is close to perfection. Very fresh and full taste (also complex enough, not a boring beer), exactly the right amount of carbonation for this type, and a very tasty appearance in the official glass. Tried this beer often from bottle (in official glass), also at Oktoberfest München. Never disappoints. 


Contains subtle hints of banana, however not as much as for example Edelweiss.

Very close to Weihenstephaner hefe weißbier. I have compared the two several times, and it is hard to decide which one is best. Swirled and poured the yeist out in the glass (for both beers). I do know know if you are supposed to, but I think it makes the taste more full.

This is a classic, textbook hefe by all regards. It looks almost as good as it tastes - murky orange body with a big head, served in a weizen glass. Banana yeast mixed with citrus in both the aroma and the taste. Sweet, but not overly so. And thanks to my local Billa, even affordable.
Classics: excellent wheat beer is drinking at any time of the year and after any sporting activities.

Served in a tulip. Orange with a medium white head. Delicious sweet and fruity aroma (bananas, vanilla, lemons, gum, clove). Taste is bananas, caramel and red fruits with good sourness and bitterness. Finish is light sour and light bitter. A delicious, creamy and refreshing German Weizen. Great beer!
330ml bottle into glass. Mild aroma. Cloudy orange with soapy head. Tastes like fizzy creamy Banana. Touch of bubblegum, slight hoppiness. A bit vegetal in the finish. OK but not great.
Typical german hefe weissbier, simple but it doesn't spoil it.  however, you can become bored after drinking just two bottles

Gout fade, effervescence moyenne , plutôt aqueuse, finale légère et courte, mais agréable.
Bière douce au palais.
Bière d’été.

Golden brown opaque pour with a slightly off white head of fine foam. The aroma is grainy bread with a lot of yeast byproducts. Banana and candy mainly. Flavor is fairly similar, with a welcome sweetness to balance out the bread. Slick and refreshing mouth feel, but with maybe a tiny bit too much fizz. No real hop presence. Classic and widespread hefe.

A classic german "Hefeweizen". This means that the yeast, which provides the second bottle fermentation, stays in the bottle. But other than similar belgium beers, the yeast has to go into the glass in order to be drunk with the beer. So these beers are always troubled and the yeast gives a huge part of the taste. The Paulaner surprises with a dryer hop note than most of it’s brothers. Tghis makes it quite unique and is very pleasant. On the other hand, the typical banana hint is much less detectable. Still, it’s a wonderful thirst killer.
What makes this Hefeweizen so good, is the fact that it is not the truely typical Hefeweizen. It has it’s own character as it slightly dryer that other Hefeweizens. Sure, if you’re searching for the wonderful banana hints a Erdinger provides e.g., you might be dissapointed. But don’t - relax and enjoy it’s unique combination of flavors.
light banana aroma, appear pale with a superfine white head. taste light bitter and sour, lively carbonation light bodied, and a short finish

Nez épicé, douceur, banane mûre, petite acidité, levures, blé.Robe blonde trouble, bière blanche.Belle bonne blonde/blanche de blé offrant ses notes épicées et douces de levures, épices, bananes.Classique et bon.Beau corps onctueux.
Very clean and well-balanced taste. Aromas of banana. Cloudy. Golden color with a big nice white head.

Hazy orange looks with fluffy and big head on top. Fresh fruits and wheat malts in the aroma. Citrus pops up too but the aroma is on the sweet side rather than bitter. Taste has lots of wheat, fruits and yeast. Medium Body and high carbonation. Well you cannot go much wrong with a Hefeweizen, but I’ve tasted better ones.

caramel, hay, spruce, leaves, earthy, soy sauce, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation. Not a big fan of wheat beer, but this was slightly more interesting than others I’ve tried, due to it’s sour taste. Still not a very interesting beer, but decent.
Poured from can, hazy gold with low creamy head. Aroma strong with notes of banana, hay and herbs. Taste a little sour, some bitterness and some sweetness.
Decent classic weizen. Lemon, orange, banana, yeasts in aroma, a bit sour taste, very refreshing with lemon finish.
well-balanced aroma of banana with hints of yeast and spices... the taste is malty and fruity with shades of candy and yeast and light hopping... spicy, sweet and dry aftertaste... nice hefeweizen...

Hazy yellow to light orange beer with a nice, white, frothy and stable head. Aroma of sweet bananas and some cloves in the backgroud, intense. Taste is again sweet banana, a bit of sourness and an acrid touch of carbon dioxide on the palate. Sweet banana lingers for a while in the aftertaste. Strong carbonation. Refreshing, appears to be full-bodied due to the sweet banana notes in aroma and mostly in taste. Really good beer.

Pours a hazy yellow to orange body with a nice white head. Aroma is yeast, fruit, some spice. Taste is sweet with some sourness, but not too sweet. Nicely balanced. 
A great German beer with a satisfying taste!

- Alcoholpercentage van 5,5%

500ml can. Hazy yellow color with plenty of creamy white head. Citrus and wheat aroma. Taste is wheat, citrus and banana with some ending bitterness.
White frothy head.Golden orange. Cloudy. Persistent. Banana, citrus, yellow fruit, grassy, honey. Medium-light body. A bit astrigent. Good weisse.
Bottle from Yamaya. Opaque gold, big frothy white head. Fruity banana aroma, some spice. Quite dry, good carbonation.

50cl bottle from Waitrose. Poured a cloudy dark golden/ ochre colour, with a big, dense white head, which dissipated to a halo. Aroma of oranges, yeast esters, cloves and bananas. Soft fruit and bready malt flavours, with plenty of wheat. Finish is quite light, but pleasant enough; some more tinned fruit, dough and straw.

Bottle. Hazy honey-like color with beautiful huge long-lasting head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, light banana (specific for weizen). Sweet taste. Aftertaste light bitter. In general, that's weizen how it should be.

0,5l bottle. Classic german hefeweizen. Fruity, tasty, refreshing, delicious. Thats how a beer should be.

Jeden z najlepszych przeniczniaków na rynku mimo, że z koncernu. Niemiecka solidność

This is an impressive german hef. It’s less sweet and creamy than Widmer Brothers and has more ’beer taste.’ The head is one of the most impressive sights to behold - thick like foam on top and glistening on the bottom.

Bottle 50 cl.

500ml can served in an Weizen glass.

Can. Light golden, cloudy, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty – some wheat and sweetish aroma, some fruitiness and light banana. Body is light to medium, malty – lightly wheaty and lightly sweet flavor, fruitiness and light banana. Finish is short to average, malty – lightly wheaty and dryish - lightly sweetish, light banana. Watery hefeweizen from big brewery for the masses. Lacks character (and taste).

Review: Can of Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier Naturtrüb 5.5%ABV

Paulaner’s have made good beer for close to 400 years, so it was with great excitement that I had a chance to sample a Oktoberfest special and the brewery’s biggest selling product. German beer is always a winner so lets see how I got on…………

The smell was of a very very strong sweet aroma, but lovely on the nose. The aroma is mostly wheat and earthy with some light citrus notes. Going by the smell, its already off to a great start, lovely stuff. This is a beer that means business.

On pour I got a very large frothy white head that took a little while to settle, with a dark cloudy golden colour of a beer appearing. There was very good lacing with some carbonation.


When the head finally settled down, I started on the important business of the tasting. The taste was not as overly strong as I had expected, it was extremely smooth and clean to drink, subtle flavours, with a lovely feel to it. To be honest I didnt find too much going on with the taste, as the flavours were particularly soft on the palate, with a mild wheat and yeast taste. There was a very faint but nice citrus hop aftertaste, This has to be one of the most drinkable beers I have had in a long time, was very easy to drink and enjoyable in the process. Such a shame I only bought a few cans! Can see why this beer is so popular in the beer halls of Munich, as I’d imagine you could down these all day long. This is really a top beer. Strongly recommended. Prost!
Hazy golden with off white head - Wheat aroma - Nice malt and wheat body with some yesty notes in the back , with hardly any bitterness - Wheaty sweet finish - This was nice

Can. Pours in cloudy yellow body with high frosty head. Aroma has a lot of banana and spiciness at first, with some malt in the background. Taste has medium to none bitterness with light wheat sweetness, light yeasty background. Body is medium, high carbonation.

Barwa porannego moczu z białkiem, czyli jasnego złota. Zmętnione konkretnie, ładnie pracujące.
Piana obfita, ale bąbelki od średnich do dużych, po jakiemś czasie znika całkowicie.
Aromat fenolowy estrowy, czyli goździkowo bananowy, słodowy, lekkie owocowe. 
Rześkie, pijalne i owocowe, dobry balans między estrami i fenolami.
Wysycenie średnie w stronę wysokiego, goryczka jak na weizena wysoka, ale ogólne bardzo niska.

Strong body with personality. Smooth, slightly bitter, a little citric and spicy. Impressive head. One of my all time favourites for its drinkability.. Gets drier in the end. A lot of yeast throughout it. A great session beer, very balanced.

Citrus and wheat in the aroma. The taste is watery, metallic and citrus. Okay bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a little while. OK, but still easy to drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Klasyka gatunku. Pomimo, że szukając po niemieckim rynku można znaleźć lepsze piwa pszeniczne to Paulaner trzyma poziom i w segmencie popularnych pszenic przedstawiciel bardzo dobry. Wszytsko na wysokim poziomie.
I was expecting a better beer, anyway, it is a good one. Wheat profile, spicy, clove, medium low bubblegum and very low banana, aroma and flavor.

Also known as "Hefe-Weizen Natural Wheat" in the states.

Lovely golden yellow color with a matte finish. Lots of carbonation. Enormous, long-lasting head. Thick crown of lace. Incredibly cloudy. Textbook appearance.

Aroma is a dry, leafy aroma, where the cloves smell dried up and ashen. There is a banana, but more like a banana cream pie: muted and blunted. Doesn’t have the fresh aromas of ripe bananas.

Flavor is clothes and black pepper. Banana cream pie. A potpourri of dried leaves. Tastes just like autumn. A little salty; definitely triggers some nerves on the back end of the tongue.

The feel is smooth on the exterior, dry on the inside. It has an almost chalky dryness. This is a very solid hefeweizen: it’s got all the elements you want, and none of the bullshit. Very good.

Bottle: cloudy orange, huge off-white head. Balanced wheaty aroma with limited banana esters--just enough. Some citrus. Flavour is smooth wheat, banana, lemon, very slight bitterness. Light sourness. High drinkability.

Cloudy, yellow pour with a large, frothy white head. The aroma is mostly wheat with some light fruity notes. It has a light oily texture with average carbonation. The taste is sweet and refreshing with a clean finish.
16.9 FL OZ ($2.49) HOLY COW! wow this is really good beer. I think this is a new fav.

330 ml bottle. Hazy deep gold color. Thick mousse-like beige head. Wonderful banana and clove wheat malt aroma. Tart sweet citrus malt flavor. Notes of tangerine and earthy yeast with a touch of honey. Some citrus hops in finish. Delicious. A world class Bavarian weizen.

Pours a nice hazy, golden wheat with lasting head and great lacing. Aroma is wheat, orange, earthy. Taste is great with a nice mild wheat, slight bit of yeast, orange, and mild bitterness. Paulaner’s been at this for nearly 400 years, and it appears they know what they are doing. Nothing earth-shattering, but for this style, this is a reference beer.
Mixture of flavors. Tastes earthy & hint of citrus. Bit too much carbonation.
Scent of raisin and orange. Cloudy amber colour. Flavours of orange, bread, and slight coffee. Light body and lively carbonation. Quite a lovely beer.
Kjøpt på tax-free på gardemoen. Lyst uklart med duft av sitrus og banan. Bløt og fin smak hvor de samme tonene går igken.
Color cobrizo turbio. Aromas dulces de platano. Cuerpo medioz inicio muy dulce, afrutado. Bien.
Bardzo dobre piwo jak na "koncerniaka". Przyjemny aromat, śwetna prezencja. Smak złożony - czuć banany, goździki i słodowość. Cena poniżej 3 zł - Czego chcieć więcej:D
Clouded orange in colour with a solid head. Nice aroma of malts, a bit of bananas, resulting in very sweet taste as well. Highly carbonated. Pretty good

Barwa jasno złota, wyraźnie zmętniona, piana biała zbita, zostawia ładną obrączkę. W aromacie słód pszeniczny, drożdże i lekka kolendra. W smaku dominuje słód pszeniczny, ale daje się wyczuć lekkie goździki, nuty ziołowe i żywiczne. Troszkę cytrusów. Bardzo wysycone, wyraźna ale krótka cytrusowo-ziołowa goryczka i kwaskowo cierpki finisz.
I think everybody knows how the Paulaner tastes. I like to buy a bottle from time to time. It’s one of a kind among beers you can buy in Poland.
Bottle, 0.5l. Hazy golden colour, medium white frothy head. Wheat, yeast aroma. Taste is sweet with some citrus note. Medium carbonation. Overall good and refreshing hefe.
In 500 mL can. Plastic, yeast and nothing else. Oh well, when you want to get drunk and you’re thirsty...

Blanche tourbe orangée. mousse blanche persistante.
Arôme fruité acide, avec une douceur de banane.
En bouche similaire, avec un léger houblonnage apportant de la rondeur à l’acidité citron-orange et douceur bananée. Bière blanche de qualité.

Aroma: wheaty, malty, caramel. Appearance: hazy gold, massive, frothy white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: light bitters coming up, very wheaty, grain malts. Overall: nice Hefeweizen, quite well balanced aroma and palate. Bottle at The Victoria, Bayswater.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Surprised I hadn’t rated this yet. I’ve had it so many times I’ve lost count. Foam banana and the typical wheat yeast aromas on the nose. Similar taste. Thirst quencher.

Nose: Slightly sweet wheat and crushed coriander seeds, yeast and yellow berries and lemon fruitiness.
Taste & palate: Smooth, creamy taste with nice fruitiness, some hops (not much though) and a short to medium aftertaste.
Nothing very complicated or complex but an honest, classic and refreshing weissbier.
Paulaner is one of the more conservative weissbiers out there, but why mess with history? A bit of banana on the nose and a good bit yeasty on the mouth.
herbals and sweet banana on nose. sweet in taste, yeasty. high carbonation a bit flat aftertaste. classic weissbier without a history.
Mild brew with wheat bananas taking the center stage. Some acidity and astringency on the finish. Decent but nothing out of the ordinary.
500ml bottle. Pours cloudy golden with yeast, banana, citrus and wheat aromas. Taste is wheat, orange and other fresh citric aromas.

poured into a tall schooner from a 500ml can. Scents of light citrus and classic wheat beer notes. Cloudy tan/orange with a rocky off-white head. good carmel and lightly sour, light sweetness, with a lingering wheat finish. Nice character and drinkability.
Klassisches Weizenbier. Vielleicht DAS Weizenbier. Man schmeckt die Hefe, ein bisschen Bananengeschmack ist auch mit dabei, zudem eine gewisse Malzigkeit. Kein Hopfen.

Barna színű testvéréhez hasonlóan kiváló tulajdonságokkal bíró, narancslekvár színű főzet, mely a búzasörök malátás teltségét és üde gyümölcsösségét egyaránt megcsillogtatja. Fantasztikusan harmonikus alkotás.

German Wheat Beers dominate.
They have perfected them.
Paulaner might be the best.
It’s a conservative wheat beer, that tastes perfect.
Others have a slightly wilder wheat taste.
So start with Paulaner.
Can only get it in the bottle around NE Ohio.
But it’s widely available, which is nice.
Far better than any Belgian or American wannabe.
They have been doing it a long time.
For example, the equally great German Wheat Beer by Wenstaphaner has been brewing beer since the year 1080.
It’s has a nice wilder wheat taste, and is available on tap at the Winking Lizard restaurant in Peninsila, Ohio.
Other German Hefe-Weizen wheat beers like Schnieder, Franzanhaner, Ayinger are very good too.
Franzenhaner is on tap at the Firehouse Grill in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio.
The only Amercan wheat beer that comes close is Victory’s wheat beer.
Got it on tap at the Gastropub in Hudson, Ohio 7/2014.
On Rt 303 just east of the low railroad bridge.
Enjoy !
Poured from the tap at Paulaner am Dom. Cloudy orange with white head. Wheaty, yeast aroma and taste. Decently fills mouth. No banana flavour.
Pours hazy dark golden color with white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, lemon, banana and spices. Similar flavors. Medium body with average carbonation.

De lo más decente de un supermercado normal o de lo más bebible de un bar/discoteca corriente. Co casi todas las alemanas "normales", la ley de la pureza, garantiza aburrimiento. Aroma y sabor a plátano, lúpulo muy poco presente, cereal pesado en boca.
Hazy yellow to orange body with a nice white head. Aroma is yeast, fruit, some spice. Taste is sweet with some sourness, but not too sweet. Nicely balanced. Pretty decent.
Another great beer from Germany. I could drink this all day, everyday! Typical cloudy appearance with a satisfying taste!

Classic Hefeweizen with yellowish, thick and moussy, creamy head and ochre blonde colour with orange glow and lively sparkling. Appetizing fruity aroma, bready malts, wheat, honey, almond, banana, apple peel, cloves, white pepper, perhaps a hint of orange and a bit sweaty. Light and subtle fruit sweetness in the onset, banana and apple accents, rather sharpish carbonation, fluffy, bready and cake-like malt base, intertwined with mild spicy notes (cloves, bayleaf), evolving into a softly sourish, very mild but well-incorporated hoppy finish. A reference for its style.
Opaque gold, strong white head. Yeasty fruit aroma, sweet yet... thick? taste. Sweet finish, but not too enduring. Liked it.

Ottima weiss molto particolare. Buon aroma fruttato bananoso come al solito mentre al gusto un equilibrio perfetto e un gusto davvero unico ne risalta la sua bontà. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85
Hazy golden-orange colour with a thick, white head. Aroma consists of yeast, fruits and honey. The taste is similarly fruity with a hint of spices, and slight bitterness in the finish.

Une bière qui me vient d’un échange avec Todd, mon voisin au camping, qui vient de Columbus. Elle est, du moins, elle semble ambrée et quelque peu voilée en cette fin de journée où la luminosité a déjà diminuée. Une grosse mousse dense se forme au versage. Elle persiste et une mousse baveuse reste accrochée au verre. Des arômes de banane, ou de pelure de banane en émanent aussitôt. De façon plus discrète, le blé se fait sentir avec quelques effluves champêtres. Le goût est d’abord minéral et ensuite fruité. Elle n’est pas très expressive, mais bien satisfaisante. (M.A. 04-15) (1162-010814)
See it everywhere, finally tried it. Hazy deep gold. Nose is tart wheat, lemon, a bit of sulphur. Flavour is pretty standard b/c with some sulphur, not particularly fresh. Pretty good.

On tap, poured a milky orange hue w/ a medium frothy head w/ a lasting cap. Light sweet fruity aroma. Initial flavor is moderate sweet w/ a faint bitter finish. Tastes are banana, orange, and a light grapefruit. Light bodied and a light creamy mouthfeel.

Cloudy orange like colour. Huge yeasty aroma with banana and kitchen spice and some wheat as well. On the palate it is quite carbonated and kind of pops on the tongue. Medium bodied and fast flavour profile with an equally fast finish. Yeasty and hints of spice. Classically styled.

Transfer from BA review on 11-3-12-
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance – The beer pours a very lightly hazed orange amber color with a thick and billowy white head. The head has fantastic retention fading to leave a decent amount of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell – The aroma is heavy of a yeasty and wheaty aroma. It is mixed with a decent black pepper and banana smell. Quite a classic Hefe aroma and quite nice.

 Taste – The taste begins with flavors of wheat bread and a biscuit maltiness meeting the tongue. A light orange flavor is upfront which seems to grow stronger as the taste advances. While the orange grows stronger, other flavors of a yeasty nature come to the tongue. The biscuit begins to fade with the wheaty tastes and the orange citrus grows even stronger. In the end a light yeast and nice citrus wheat flavor are left on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is quite creamy for an only 5.5 abv brew. It has a moderate to average level of carbonation. The beer sooths the tastebuds as it passes through the mouth. It is great for the tastes of the beer and quite drinkable.

 Overall – A nice easy drinking Hefe with a fantastic transitions and tastes in the flavor. A very nice drinking brew.

Yeasty aroma. Pours a hazy golden yellow with small white head. Taste is yeasty with muted clove and banana. Body seems a little heavier than other hefes. Good solid hefeweisse. Inspired by another poster, I rate this behind Weihenstephaner but ahead of Franziskaner.
Strong fruity peach aroma. Cloudy golden colour with great head. Beautiful light honey flavour with some fruit hints. Light body with medium carbonation.
50cl fles. Goudgele kleur. Witte volle schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : zoetig, citrus, licht banaan smaak, geen overheersende koolzuur. Lekker blond biertje.
A german, amber, cloudy hefe weizen with white head. Aroma is fruit, banana, malt, yeast, (dust?). Taste is bitter sweet. Pearly.
@ Sandy Bay, Cyprus. Bottle (500 ml) from local supermarket (€ 1.99). Wheaty and yeasty with spicy and fruity notes, sweet, banana, medium body. The finish is dry and light bitter.

Drink cold (8-10°C)
Eye: golden to copper colour with medium thick white head.
Nose: floral notes, honey, spices, citrus fruits
Mouth: wheat, honey, bread, citrus fruits and spices
Palate: long finish with tipical wheat beer taste and citrus again
Overall: nice wheat beer to drink in the summer in a beer garden
Une weizenbier pas désagréable. Douce. Mais manque un peu de caractère ne permettant de la distinguer au sein de sa catégorie.

Czuć słód pszeniczny, troszkę kolendrę, nuty cytrusowe i żywiczne. Solidna gęsta piana, pięknie zdobi szkło, mętne koloru ciemnego złota. W smaku dominują tropikalne owoce, ananas, mango, goryczka delikatna, wyczuwalny alkohol, cytrusy. Piwo bardzo pijalne, lekko przesycone, lekka kwaskowatość w ustach.
One of most refreshing munic style wheat beers. Well balanced with no extra banana taste.

(Bottle, 0.5 l - BBE 03/15, 20140805) The beer poured orange and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had clove, fruitiness, banana and grass. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, clove, mildly tartness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity, spicy, grassy and bitter. A solid and good hefeweizen.

Draught at Paulaner Beer Garden at Sarona market. Hazy golden-yellow with low off-white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, bready, sweet. Flavor of wheat, floral, notes of honey, banana, smooth, light sweetness, light hoppy bitterness. Lively carbonation. Light to medium body. Smooth and buttery texture.

Pours a very cloudy amber with nearly white head. Really spicy on the nose with tons of clove and pepper. There’s also some wheat, bread and citrus notes. Quite bready on the palate with a little spice but nowhere near the amount the nose has. There’s also some light citrus notes. Really pillowy on the palate with a decently long, easy finish.

Blonde dorée légèrement trouble. Haut col beige légèrement doré, de fine mousse bulleuse à cratères. Nez lévuré, banane, pêche, blé. Goût légèrement acide, froment, banane, pain frais. Bière très rafraichissante.

Pours a hazy copper colour with tons of dense white head. There are aromas of yeast, malt and a bit of lemon. The flavors I get are malt, grain, banana, bubble gum and some grapefruit. A good Weissbier overall although I tend to prefer those with a stronger fruit component.

Can from the LCBO. Hazy gold with a two finger off white head. Nose is wheat, banana, cloves and caramel. Excellent balance of sweetness and spice all the way through. Medium smooth mouth with average carbonation and a long lightly spicy finish. Well balanced Hefe.

Gold, hazy color, tall and very persistent head. Pleasant nose. Medium body, light flavor, avg texture, rich, balanced and bright mouthfeel, avg length. Delicate combination of bitter, sharp and slightly sweet tastes, great balance. Yeasty, hint of lemon peel or coriander, wheaty. One of the best in the style. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours hazy rusty orange color with white head. Classic hefeweizen aroma and flavors.

Das Paulaner Weizen ist für mich ein plus minus nul Weizen. Farbe ist typisch für ein Weißbier, Schaumkrone ist stimmig. Einstieg ist frisch und Hefig. Geschmack im Körper kommt stärker raus und Abgang ist noch hefiger. Fazit: Gutes Weizen bei dem man nix falsch macht.

Can. Colour...lightly hazy, light amber with a massively frothy, pillowy white head. Nose...light spice especially clove and allspice, butyl esters, and dusty banana. Palate...I imagine it’d be all too redundant to day that this is a "classic" for its style! Light CO2, which is surprising given the immensely frothy head! There’s plenty of yeasty goodness here as well as the quintessential banana, spice and bubble gum trio. The finish is rather long and leans towards banana Laffy Taffy, which ain’t a bad thang! Zehr gut!!
Classic taste - recognizable from the first gulp. Tried it from tap, in the bottle, in the 5L keg.

@ The beach in Snekkersten 25/7-14. Can from some local supermarket in Snekkersten. Aroma: Yeast, fruity, banana. Taste: Dito + light acidic. Body is light to medium, the finish is dry and a bit watery with notes of bananas.

Notes from Family Hefe Tasting. Pours an unclear orange with a white head. Little lace. Aroma has bananas and spices. A bit of fruit. Taste is fruity with bananas and spices. 13.6. Shrug. This was the winner of the tasting, and almost unanimously, beating Weihenstephaner and Franziskaner.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy yellow/golden with a white head. Aroma is fruity sweet wheat, yeast, bit of banana. Sweet taste, bit bitter, yeast, fruity.

Can from local supermarket. Pours hazy light amber with medium, off-white creamy head. Aroma is banana, apple, ripe tropical fruits, bit of vanilla. A bit of sourness first, quickly replaced with a nice full-bodied sweetness. Sweet finish, virtually no bitterness.
Drank from a bottle at a friend’s balcony. Fruity and fresh, a good but basic weißbier.

Pours a hazy amber body with a thick head. Funky aroma and a nice and yeasty taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy, light brown color with nice head. Aroma has yeast, wheat malt and a bit banana. Medium body. Taste has sweetness and sourness balanced. Wheat taste with a hits of banana, citrus, toffee. Excellent straightforward summer hefeweizen.
Una de las mejores que e tomado en mi vida.muy buen sabor y espumosa.magnifica cerveza
Drought at pub 0.5l. Golden misty color with white thin head. Medium body and aroma of lemon, clove and banana. Taste is sweet and little sour.

50 cl bottle from Kristiine Prisma in Tallinn (€ 1,85), July 2014. Pours a hazy orange with a massive, light tan / off-white head that retains very well. Nose is terrific. It’s got a malty backbone, both wheat and barley there with a strong presence; additionally some very refreshing fruity, sweet biscuity and sour yeasty aspects; more and more spicy clove as it warms. Taste is equally good: sweet (banana), sour and rich (pickled apple); wheaty, rounded. An enjoyable spicy (clove) finish. Light to medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel. I just took it from the fridge but it still has a certain warmth to it; it’s texture is smooth and soothing, soft and delicate. Surprisingly low in carbonation. Verrry good.

In short: aromatic sour weissbier.
Kind of sour and strong for a weissbier, pours brown to orange, more malty flavour and less banana than an average weissbier, great fruity aroma.

Pours what you would expect for a weiss, cloudy golden that pours a couple of fingers white head that reduces to one. Fresh wheat malt to the nose and taste. Taste mild banana and a little fruit. Meh not the best example of a wheat.

500 ml. Hazy, amber color, long-life big sized off-white creamy head, medium body, sour quince and slight sweet malty taste, dry and sour wheaty palate without hoppy notes. Smooth and well-balanced brew.

Poured from a 500ml bottle, bought in Chicago. Best buy date: 11/14. Pours a hazy, light gold/orange color with a thick, finely foamy, almost creamy head that lingers. Aroma is of light malt sweetness, wheat, and dominant banana. Very light and delicate smell. Flavor is lightly sweet up front with a pronounced wheat character. A faint note of apple is present and moderate notes of orange peel throughout. Lingering malt sweetness and wheat character on the back end. No hop presence. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied. Overall a very tasty, well-rounded, and refreshing beer and a great example of the style.

Can from lcbo. Pours orange with thick white head. Mild aroma of bananas with a bit of spice. Tastes strongly of bananas with some sweetness and some clove/cinnamon. Very refreshing. Lingering banana aftertaste.
Piękny, mętny wygląd. Niestety niezbyt gorzkie, lekko kwaśne, słodki smak pojawia się w ustach po pewnym czasie.
Medium gold pour, creamy thick white head. Nose is banana, light clove, and yeast. Bittersweet. Middle is soft fruit and creamy wheat malt. Finish is yeasty and slightly dry.

I've been enjoying a lot of weheinstephaner Hefe recently, figured I'd give Paulaner a try too. This is a close second, a very flavorful if less complex example of the style. To begin, this pours a flawless appearance, a nice hazy orange color with good lacing, also a full long-lasting natural head, impressive, aroma is pleasant too, more wheat/malt than orange/banana notes, I prefer that. Taste is good, more malty wheaty base, less fruity freshness. Something that appetizingly tastes like apples. Finish is ok but something is off, kind of sour I think. Still very good overall, I would purchase again. Wehein.. wins in this style category, while I prefer Paulaner in the dopplebock category.

500ml bottle [eins geht noch rein]. Hazy amber colour with huge, frothy to creamy, off-white head. Wheaty and yeasty aroma, herbal hoppy overtones, slightly bready, a touch of apple. Taste is minimally sweat malty, slightly bready, some roast apple, herbal hoppy overtones. For a long time not much yeast action, slightly dull and muffled; later a bit more peppery spicy in well balance with the bready touch. Lacks a bit of the refreshing character typical for a Weizen.
Bottle bought in Germany. Hazy with big head. Less banana than other weissbeer. Okay..
500ml can from Carrefour, Xintiandi, Changchun. Pours golden orange with a generous head. Some banana and clove aroma. Bitter, slightly oily finish. Pretty good.
Ovanligt lite "vete" för att vara en veteöl. Ganska fruktig och begränsad beska. Trivsam trädgårds- och grillöl.
Weiss sufficiente che ha dal suo un prezzo molto contenuto e una facile reperibilità. Birra da pasti.

Featured as seasonal draft at Cafe Navona in Rockaway. Nice golden hazy complexion. Traditional flavor includes banana and fresh yeast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I love this style. And I love that a beer of 5.5% can kick out the flavours of some of its stronger cousins. Lovely hazy orange with small white head and decent lacing. On the watery side of medium bodied, but enough carbonation and creaminess to make it a pleasure on the palate. Banana and clove, of course. A bit too sweet at the end perhaps, otherwise great.

Bottle 50 CL. Pours orange with white lacing head. Notes of banana, wheat, citrus.

- beerbasher
Bottle 33cl. Globus. Cloudy orange with large foamy, long lasting off-white head. Aroma is wheat, banana, citrus. My favorite hefe.

Pours a thin head on a hazy darker straw colored body.
The aroma is banana and dry grains. Nice and pleasant.
The taste has a balance with mild lemon bitterness and some sweetness in the background.
The texture is smooth with low carbonation.
An excellent hefe.

Bottle from SuperValu, Longford [260614]

Orange, very hazy, big frothy white head, some lacing

Aroma of soft wheat, tangy, bit tart, soft peppery spicy, no ’clove & banana’, soft fruit

Taste of soft wheat, now getting soft banana, touch of clove, mellow spicy, soft fruits, bit yeast, nice gentle flavour, maybe flattens out a bit in the middle

Palate - soft carb, medium body, smooth and creamy, fairly sweet, bit sticky. Finish as main flavour, some powdery wheat in the finish

Overall - Easy drinking, pleasant, quite sweet - I prefer this hefeweizens to the overly clove and banana ones
Despite it’s so popular, so easy to buy, so common beer, it’s still so good. It’s a weizen from which you can start drinking wheat beers. Has a sweet banana aroma.

Box at hotel. Enjoyable summer beer with cloudy golden appearance and a eager enduring head. Smells of the wheat used and tastes slightly banana sweet, light on the bitterness. For a boxed beer, this was a very positive surprise.

Bottle 50cl. Hazy to cloudy orange color, good creamy off-white head that disappears slowly, good lacing; aroma wheat, bread, yeast, orange citrus, banana, coriander; moderate sweet and sour taste, yeasty; medium body, creamy texture; aftertaste as in taste with some light bitterness, light spicy tones.
Dorodna, drobno pęcherzykowa piana. Barwa zmętnionego, ciemnego złota. W aromacie owoce, słód, W smaku słód pszeniczny, owocowe nuty chmielu, delikatny banan i skórka chleba. Goryczka słaba.
Pours a cloudy orange with a two finger fluffy head. Aroma is malt, fruit, and spice. Taste is the same as the aroma. This is an excellent beer. One of the best I’ve tasted.

500ml bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours hazy orange, little head, but high carbonation. Aromas of cinnamon buns, clove, bread, light citrus. Taste is kinda sweet, more spice. Sticky texture. Finishes quite long, but not in an entirely pleasant way. Also very gassy. Preferred the Krombacher.

Weiss ottima... Molto Beverina densa e burrosa con quella nota acidula che non guasta mai... Provata in bottiglia in varie occasioni non delude mai. Poi io sono un appassionato delle birre di frumento

It has a cloudy appearance, lots of visible carbonation and a deep golden yellow color with a thick foamy white head. The head which builds up big and pillowy has very good retention and leaves lots of cool lacing on the glass. The aroma has a deep malty wheat scent with hints of banana and a touch of spicy clove. The flavor has a refined and well balanced mix of tangy wheat and sweet malty grain with fruity/earthy yeast that has hints of banana and clove. Hop flavor is very mild, clean, somewhat lemony and most noticeable in the finish which is fairly dry. Its mouth feel is smooth and creamy with a medium body that is very drinkable. Overall it’s extremely refreshing and flavorful. Very well done.
Crisp, lightly malty, with hints of citrus, yeast, banana, and a touch of spice. Smooth through the finish. A very fine example of the style.

Bottle. Pours deep hazy amber-orange liquid, with an amazing frothy white head. . Aroma is yeast, banana, bubblegum, and some floral notes. Light to medium body with a average carbonation. A vary solid Hefeweizen

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours a cloudy light orange color with a great thick white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, some clove and malt. Medium-light body, great wheat taste all the way through. Finish is yeast and malt. This is my standard to judge all other hefe-weizens. Love this one...would recommend it to all. Plus, the label is just cool!

Pours a dark hazy orange with a medium white creamy head which lasted ok. Aroma sweet citrus, wheat, and yeast with a hint of spice. Taste a good cloudy wheat, followed by light sourness, then moving to a long rolling wave of yeast with a touch of vanilla and spice. Moderate body only (mainly due to good carbonation), with a nice long finish that coats the mouth fully. Certainly surprised me. While all the components were there and good, overall... it just felt something was... missing.

Bottle from Yamaya. Poured a darkish cloudy bronze, with a snow-white foamy head. Nose of malt, peaches, wheat, hint of spice. Lovely relaxed mouthfeel- creamy and full. Natural flavours of grains and yeast are featured brilliantly. Not super complex, but supple and fulfilling. Will have to get again, methinks.

Barwa jasnozlota, piwo delikatnie zmetione. Piana malo obifta, utrzymujaca sie do konca. Przyzwoity lacing. W aromacie duzo sie nie dzieje. Glownie banan, odrobina kolendry, trawiastosci. Jest ok. W smaku lekko slodkie. Dominuja owoce, zboze. Mimo to orzezwiajace. Wysycenie srednie. Bardzo pijalne. Idealne na upalne dni. Klasyczny hefe, ale warty polecenia. Jakosc/dostepnosc 10/10.
Pours cloudy amber with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, wheat, light pepper, coriander, honey. Taste is citrusy, wheat sweet, mellow sweet finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.

Robe dorée, claire. Mousse peu présente. Goût assez standard pour une weissbier : céréales, pain, léger nez de banane. Un ensemble assez sympa pour se désaltérer avec une bonne petite allemande quand il faut chaud. Une assez bonne surprise pour moi qui ne suis pas fan de ce genre de bière.

Bottle at home from backlog notes. Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have wheat malts, banana, yeast, mild citrus, cloves, lightly toasted, solid classic Hefe. Though good, this is not something I would revisit.
12oz bottle. Great German hefe, classic brew, definitely worth the try. Great brew for summer.

Classic banana and clove and sweet wheaties aroma. Magnificent pour, huge head that towers out of the glass. Silky, a lighter weissebier, with no crispness or over carbonation like some others. Really smooth and delicious. As commercial as it is (Im drinking it from a Bayern Munich Thomas Muller can this occasion) it’s still so bomb. Never gets old this one.

Bottle pours a light copper straw colour with a little head. Aroma is of spice, fruit, and mild floral hops. Tastes of citrus, spices, and banana and is kind of the sweet side. Has a light thin body with average amount of carbonation. Finishes with a refreshing sweet taste. A good Summer brew.

50cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Honey-colored, hazzy. Little initial head, medium carbonation. Good body. Aroma of cloves, slightly citrus, bit of banana, yeast and bread. Slightly sweet, not very. The aftertaste is dry, short and slightly sweet.

Awesome example of Bayern Hefe...

Typical nose for Hefe...slight hay & sour notes

Pours typical mit hefe haze, straw coloured 

Taste has slight sour and what most people call the banana/clove taste. A little thinner mouthfeel than I would normally lie, but not overly distracting

Nice wheat/sour finish



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

An aroma of decaying grass and banana. Appears clearish but hazy gold with thin white foam but nice lace. Taste is bitter hay up front, a hint of vanilla, then a sweeter citrus-sweetie flavor. Palate is ordinary. Overall, decent.
Tap. Opaque-ish dark honey color. Thick head dissipates into lace. Thick mouthfeel. Oddly citrus, yeasty nose. Strong banana, slight pineapple.

From a bottle. Pours cloudy orange-gold with a nice creamy white head and lacing. Aroma of banana, citrus, clove, and wheat. Classic balanced flavor, medium sweet and slight sour, minimal bitterness, nice clean finish. Just a masterfully done work of art in it’s simplicity. Very quaffable in large quantities if desired.

Bottle. Banana, clove, vanilla, wheat on the nose. Thick long lasting white head, hazy, orange golden. Medium body, sweet, bready,, spicy, soft lively carbonation. In the end some bitterness from hops.

Bottle from Irma, CPH - fuzzy dark golden pour with puffy white head. Grassy and sweet wheaty aroma and taste, with some light citrus (lemon) notes, some banana, and subtle herbal nuance in the finish. Refreshing. Nice.

aroma: sweet, banana, fruity, apple, typical german fruits
appearance: hazy amber colour, nice foam
taste: strong banana, sweet, refreshing, typical german wheat beer, very decent one
Draught - pours cloudy, golden with white head. Aroma of yeast, with orange and cloves. Taste is sweetish with notes of coriander and orange.
Re-rate with can version. Distinctive orange sparkly appearance with a big white head which retained pretty well. I like that you can get it in a can in Europe.

Bottle pour. Perfect opaque orange with white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, cloves and some dough. Taste follows, layering in some bubblegum sugar. Rich, yet light mouthfeel. Nothing unexpected here, just flawless execution.
Dark orange color, with hick and voluminous white foam. Canana and clove aroma. On the palate, creamy, sweet. Maybe too sweet. Is good, but it makes it heavy.

Damn. Should have bought a six pack of this. I think it was da Vinci that said, "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication." That rings true in this case. This Hefeweizen is so straightforward but the execution is masterful. Beautiful appearance, lively carbonation, and a crisp finish. Best of all are the sweet banana and citrus tones with the earthy, spicy yeast note. Paulaner’s Hefeweizen is built on quality and tradition. Most importantly, it tastes amazing.

Hefeweizen de 5,5 % abv pour 12,5° plato, en format 50 cl, avec malts d'orge et de blé.
Mon exemplaire était à 6 mois avant sa date.
Couleur de melon mûr, avec un léger trouble (naturtrüb).
Bulles fines, partout, vives.
Mousse blanc cassé, crémeuse, stable à 3 mm.
Arômes de zeste d'orange, melon, pointe de citronnelle et d'aspérule.
1ère bouche souple, à la belle entame melon/malt, avec une  pointe de tabac.
Arrière-bouche douce, fine.
2ème avec orange et écorce de tilleul.
Arrière-bouche fine, fruitée.
3ème à l’ensemble zeste/fruit/levure/tabac.
Arrière-bouche mêlant herbes et fruits.
Longueur au très bel équilibre, légèreté et harmonie.
Jambes huileuses, longues.
Levure souple, fine, belle ligne.
Alcool bien pour le style, il préserve toute la délicatesse.
Finale avec une note de tabac et une douce fumée. Superbe.
CONCLUSION : très grande hefe en naturtrüb, qui confirme la belle prédominance de Munich
dans le genre.

Pours an evenly hazy orange body with a fluffy white head that laces nixely. Nose has yeast, grass, banana and some cloves. Taste is fairly dry with a medium bitter finish. Carbonation is rich but feels soft and the palate is rich. This is a nice well balanced wheat, albeit a little dry.

From 0,5l bottle. BBD: 07/14. Pours deep hazy amber-honey liquid, nice big frothy white head. Aroma: banana, wheat malt, some hop notes, citrus. Taste: light to medium sweet, light bitter, light sour, banana, citrus, hops, clove, Palate: medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, long bitter sweet aftertaste. Overall: quite good German Hefe-weizen, full bodied, intensive banana and citrus. medium to high drinkability.
Dorada, turbia, con buena cabeza. Aroma frutal tropical, plátano. Cuerpo medio, saborea lijeros, equilibrados y retrogusto corto.

This beer starts of being dark gold color and changes to light gold. It has whitish average head. Its light to medium body gives it a refreshing taste, while still giving enough texture. It feels a bit creamy. It has flavors of banana, wheat, bread, dough and cloves with citrusy and floral notes
500ml can. Cloudy dark gold with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are banana, wheat, bread, dough and cloves with citrusy and floral notes. Light to medium body, high carbonation, creamy texture.

Pours light gold, cloudy with pretty good head, medium retention and lacing. Fluffy one.

Nose - mostly well-balanced fruity banana esters, some bready notes and crispiness. Balanced 4vg clove. Pleasant aroma, although not very strong.

Taste is crisp and fruity, with some sourness and sweetness finished by dry cloveness and pleasant aftertaste.

Pours deep hazy yellow with a fluffy two finger cap. A classic German Hefeweizen. Balanced, smooth, refreshing. Taste is a fragile dance of yeast, slices of lemon & juicy banana. Goes well on a Friday night with pizza piled with cheese & olives.

50 cl bottle & Tap. Classic german hefe, hazy orange slightly golden colour, pours typical weisse head which dissolves quite rapidly leaving the usual layer. Bread-floreal-wheaty-banana aroma and taste.  Maybe bit over carbonated, in my opinion. Actually one of the cheapest hefes I can find in markets/beer shops. ++ Tried it serveral times on tap, both in Germany and Italy, and it’s actually very much better, smoother and more balanced in the taste
One of the German classics and rightfully so. Tasty soft wheat beer with some mild hops and fruity yeast. Nice.
Bottle. Cloudy orange with large foamy, long lasting off-white head. Aromas of fruit, yeast and wheat. Banana, yeast, wheat and some mild citrus flavors. Very tasty.
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a hazy light gold with a layer of cream colored head. Aroma and taste similar. Bready and okay.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance was a cloudy/hazy golden orange body, two finger white foamy lumpy head that lasts for a good three minutes and then ends up leaving a spectacular clingy yet somewhat foamy lacing.
The smell was a "banana"/estery aroma and cloves, light citrus.
The taste was the previously mentioned flavors with a nice big wheat bite, all combined in the aftertaste, dry clove-like finish.
On the palate, it sat about a light to medium, sessionable, carbonation is spot on for the style and for me, also becomes a bit creamy.
Overall, well, hefeweizens are originally from Germany, so its hard to bust on this one period as the Germans know how to make ’em - very good for its style and very good to me (and that says a lot since I’m not a true hefeweizen fan).
Tap. Pours cloudy straw color with creamy white head. Spotty lacing after that. Nose and taste is all clove and banana. One of the best Hefe’s.
A very good wheat beer! I highly recommend this beer for everybody who likes this type.

Simply the Best!.

Einfach das Beste!.

Simplemente lo Mejor!.

0,5 liter can from LCBO. Don Mills, ON. 5.5 % alc./vol. Pours a hazy deep golden colour with two finger of lasting white head. Wheat aroma. Pure wheat beer taste. Light body, slight creaminess with moderate carbonation.

Cloudy golden orange, cream head
Banana, wheat, cereals, orange, 
Full body, cereals, a hint of coriander, spices,
A good wheat beer, better than most, but still lacking the barley malt flavor. Light in color and moderately hopped, this beer is a nice refresher on a warm day.

Banana, yeast, some spice and grass in the aroma. Hazy golden with a white head. Medium sweet and light bitterness. Light to medium body with a average carbonation. Overall a refreshing and fruity beer.
Bottle from Rehills Newcastle at home. Lovely cloudy orangey colour. Flavours are subtle rather than overwhelming but this makes it particularly drinkable. A nice beer rather than a great one:
Élesztős, ébresztős, tökélentes, alapbúza, van egy bajor zamata, eltelít, tápanyagdús.
First drank on 3 June 2011 -- From a 500 mL bottle, one of my favorite German Hef’s. Holds up against any American version I’ve ever tried. Great beer.
bananig, angenehm hefig-mild leichte bitternoten. süffig, kurz anhaltender abgang. gutes weizen

500 ml bottle out in the sun @ "Le Benjamin Bar & Bistro",Oslo.
April 18, 2014
Beer enjoyed from a Weissbier glass.
Cloudy golden color with a thick creamy head and medium carbonation.
Aroma is yeast,banana,floral and some grass.
A bit sweet,fruity,yeasty and has a crisp and wheat taste.
Very refreshing on a sunny easter afternoon.
0.5L bottle. Pours orangish with a medium creamy white head. Aroma is banana, spices and wheat. Taste is fruit, wheat and hops. Soft carbonation. Very good beer.

Orangish colored beer with a medium head. This is a really good German wheat beer with just the slightest hint of citrus. I’d drink this in a heartbeat. I think it would be especially good once it warms up, weather wise, around here.
Orange beer with medium white head. Aroma is banana, citrus and orange. Taste is malt and some citrus.
Bottle, pours golden with a white head, tastes of wheat, bananas, and some citrus, slight bitterness, very nice Hefeweizen
Classic german Hefe-Weizen. Just finished mowing the lawns on a warm autumn afternoon, sat down to drink one of these. Magical for a relaxing Sunday afternoon.

Really good wheat beer. Looks gorgeous in the glass. Good head retention. Refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer has a troubled dress by yeast in suspension. Foam isabundant creamy and persistent. You can find fruity aromas and smoked grain. On the palate, it is round and slightly tart fruit flavors and develops
I admit to have been a little bit disappointed compared to the rating this beer gets on the site.
Pours a hazy amber color. Aroma is bready and yeasty. Taste is sweet bready malts with some fruit yeast.

Base by BJCP Hefe guidelines. Appearance was cloudy straw gold with lasting creamy white huge 3 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are fruity esters yeasts, clove, banana, hints of orange and lemon with grainy nose. Taste are wheat, banana, lemon, berry-like yeasts and pale sweet malt. Palate was soft smooth creamy CO2 with light crisp body, a balanced fruity and grainy glorious finish. A prime example of a Hefe, refreshing brew.

Several pints on tap. Cloudy orange-golden with a lasting disc of cream. Nose is the requisite clove and spicy banana with some caramel, toast and a touch of lemon juice. Taste is the same goodness, but overall the nose and flavor seems to be a bit less bold with the Bavarian yeast character as some other great German hefes. Light-medium body has a great balance with medium-high carbonation and is an easy spring sessioner.

Its a good classic Hefeweizen. For such a big beer company they still make good beers. Those that like wheat beer you would want to taste this one. Taste best drinking outside in the summer under the sun!

11.2 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a very hazy orange color. The eggshell-shaded head looks quite dense and sturdy at two fingers tall, but retention is just pretty good. It leaves behind sparse but thick looking lacing behind.

S: There actually isn’t much of a focus on esters here, and if there is, it’s definitely what I would consider more clove-forward. Not much banana or bubblegum. There’s also an earthy, bready tone provided by the combination of malts and yeast - and look! There are some hoppy touches, too! The quality of the aroma subtly sneaks up on me: I’m not too impressed at first, but the more I inhale it, the more enticing it becomes.

T: Definitely clove-oriented, balanced out by its mildly fruity midtaste. The latter reminds me somewhat of oranges with a dash of apricot. Some lactose cream pops up right before the swallow and on the finish. Not too complex, just really damn satisfying.

M: This is very crisp and refreshing. Definitely not a dry beer, though, and I’m perfectly okay with that. Given how drinkable it already is, a dry finish would ruin it. Low carbonation doesn’t impede, either.

O: Well, what else can I say apart from ’just another great German-brewed hefeweizen’?
Hazy golden colour with long lasting white head. Aroma od wheat, bananas and yeast. Bit oily and bit sour with medium carbonation.

Appearance: Cloudy yellow/orange. Decent foam that disipates somewhat quickly but keeps its presence throughout the glass.

Smell: Banana/citrus bits. Inviting.

Taste: Banana/citrus with a hit of wheat. 

Mouthfeel: No worries on the carbonation, almost spot on. A very sessionable beer that tickles the tongue. 

Overall: Definitely a very good beer. Not my overall favorite Hefeweizen, but it is definitely up there. A solid Hefe for people who want to expand their horizons.

Serving type: Bottle poured into a Weizen glass.

T: Very nice! Banana and cloves are subdued and sweetened on the palate. Very nice and easy to drink. The thought that someone would want a citrus wedge on this is troubling. The beer is near perfect for the style. Grain, cream, banana bread, pecans, cloves. 

M: medium to thin body and finely carbonated. Slicks the palate and resonates. nice.

O: This is an outstanding beer. Althought hefeweisen is not my favorite style by any means, this example is obvious in it’s superiority to many examples.

500 ml bottle into weizen glass, best before 2/2014. Pours very hazy golden orange color with a 2 finger dense and rocky white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with some moderate streaming carbonation. Aromas of lemon, banana, pear, apple, clove, wheat, bread, bubblegum, light honey, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with very well balance malt and fruity/spicy yeast notes; with good strength. Taste of banana, pear, lemon, apple, wheat, bread, clove, bubblegum, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Light wheat tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of banana, pear, apple, wheat, bread, clove, bubblegum, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice balance and complexity of malt and yeast ester flavors; with good robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy, smooth, and crisp mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish. Overall this is a really excellent hefeweizen! All around great balance, robustness, and complexity of malt and yeast ester flavors; and extremely smooth to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle of 500 ml, bought in Germany. Poured into a weizen glass. ABV is 5.5%.
Colour is deep orange golden, only the slightest hazy, with a big, three fingers tall, white and fluffy head. Good retention. No lacing left on the glass. Activity in it is average.
Aroma of wheat, bubblegum, apricots.
Taste  is of wheat, yeast, bananas. Mildly sweet. Very refreshing.
Medium to full body, perfect amount of carbonation. fairly long, dry finish.
Overall, so much better than all the other weizen beers I had till now.
Schiuma bianca e persistente. Birra beverina e fresca ottima a tutto pasto. Discreta per tutte le ore e per tutte le occasioni.

(From Notes 2009) Color is a pale light copper. Rapid carbonation. Slightly off color head, thick at first and lingers with numerous craters forming. Lacing so thick I thought I was drinking whipped cream. Sharp banana, citrus and clove smell, not overpowering though.

A delicate, smooth taste. A touch of wheat and a bit of citrus but not as strong as other beers I have had in this class. Smooth finish, no aftertaste. immediately want to take another sip.

Serving type: bottle
Mooie gele\rode kleur. Deze hefe-Weissbier heeft een zachte zeer lekkere smaak. Topper

Can 0,50L. Murky, cooper colour with huge white, fully lasting head.  Medium aroma of banana, bread, wheat, corn and some honey. Slightly acidic taste and aftertaste. Medium to full bodied and oily texture. Very good hefe...

Pours a cloudy light orange colour. An inch thick white head that fades fast, but leaves a little lacing. Aroma is yeast and citrus. Medium mouthfeel. Has a dry flavour of wheat, with hints of banana and spices. It’s pleasant and pretty much what you expect of a good hefeweizen.  One of the better ones I’ve tasted of the kind.

Cloudy pale orange color, big white head. Nice aroma of wheat, yeast and banana. Dry sweet taste of wheat, spices, citrus and yeast. Medium body and lively carbonation. Nice one, smooth and refreshing wheat beer.
A weissenbier is a weissenbier even if it comes from a can and do not have a deep flavour. But has colour, head and looks.

Schiuma bianca abbondante e persistente, colore giallo dorato opalescente, aroma di frutta gialla, banana, corpo medio, discreta carbonazione, dolce , si percepisce banana, albicocca, spezie, il finale e’ sgrassante e secco. Sicuramente beverina ma piÃ¹ birra estiva che invernale. Non male essendo una Weiss industriale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A nice hefeweizen, cloudy orange with a thin white head. Taste is wheat, citrus, and banana.

Poured into a Adam Adams glass. Cloudy dark yellow with a nice cream colored head that slowly dissipates to a film and ring. Scent is nice but not strong. Some banana but not much. Taste is very well balanced. Banana and citrus with a nice clove finish. Light to medium/light mouthfeel. Excellent easy drinking beer. No problem to down several.

Cloudy golden with medium white head, Lacing nicely.
Aroma.. wheat, loads of yeast, decent hops for hefe , fruity (banana to apricot).
Quite sweet with smooth bit spicy and sour finish. Quite dry.
Very nice standard beer. Not very deep in complexity, but easy drinkable and you get satisfaction of decent beer

Have had this on draught in Munich but even out of the bottle this is a good drink. Relatively light for a weissbier, but with plenty of flavour; lots of citrus notes, but not overpowering, with spicy notes and a hint of vanilla.

Una de mis preferidas de trigo. Muy buen sabor, bastante cereal, bastante cuerpo. Es muy poco amarga, especial para personas a las que no le guste el sabor característico del lúpulo. Recomendación: Acompañar con unas palomitas de maíz.
Imported bottle. Too sweet taste, but nicely looking. Smells ok, but the bitterness disappears in all the sweetness.

6-pack from beer store.  Pours cloudy gold, with a great big frothy head.  Wonderful aroma of spice, wheat, yeast, and a hint of lemon.  Taste is banana, citrus fruits, vanilla, slight spice.  Starts sweet and ends with a dry finish.  Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel.  Very good stuff.
The best of Paulaner. Hazy orange colour with a creamy white head. Fruity aroma of bananas, spices and yeast. Fruity flavour. Not the best weiss, but enjoyable, a good one.

Bottle - Golden cloudy haze colour. Wonderfull aroma and flavour of banana, citrus peach and wheat. Very tasty and lives up to its reputation. Have not been dissapointed with the Paulaner Hefe-Weiss yet.

Wife got this draft at Frisco Grille in Columbia, MD.  Served in a pint glass, cloudy gold color with white head.  Aroma of bananas, apple sauce and some orange.  Taste is fruity, some spices and wheat.  Light body, yeasty and medium sweetness.  Very good Hefe.
Golden. Fluffy white head diminishing to lingering soapy. Aroma banana and Wheat.  Flavor of banana, wheat, yeast. Creamy medium body. Clean finish- welcoming another sip.

Poured a nice very cloudy golden color; nice white heat. Aroma is of fruits banana, apple and oranges. Taste is also of fruit combined with wheat. Very pleased with this one; nice sparkly a bit sweet, overall very good beer.

355 mL bottle from the LCBO (Bank & Walkley, Ottawa). This beer pours a very cloudy golden colour, with a minimal head and slight lacing. The aroma was very pleasant with notes of apple, pear, apricot and yeast. The taste was quite light, and not as funky as other Weissbier’s. With notes of apple, pear, crackers, yeast, and a nice carbonated bite. The finish is lightly fruity, almost like grapes. This is an excellent Wheat, very light, crisp and drinkable!

Bottle from Majestic Wines, who sell this in boxes of 12. Light orange brown in colour, thick white head. I’d say a classic middle of the road weizen, reasonably firm tasting, some apple fruit, some spice, bit of yeasty wheat. But not massively funky or weird with this. Pleasant and easy to drink.
My introduction to proper Hefe-weissbier in Germany all those years ago. Still a classic, still a favorite. Lovely unfiltered beer.
Huele y sabe a pan, a plátano, a clavo y crema. El apego a la Reinheitsgebot es, por tanto, sospechoso. Qué mas da, está buenísima!!
Bouteille de 500ml, robe blonde orangées, arôme de banane, goût de levure allemande et de levure.
500ml bottle. Aroma: banana, vanilla, cereal. Appearance: hazy, sparkling, frothy. Taste: medium sweetness. Palate: long finish, medium body.

#9
Tolles Bier! Schon oft getrunken und doch ist da immer wieder die Bestätigung guten Geschmacks. Hier stimmt für mich und viele andere Weißbierliebhaber einfach alles: Der fruchtig-würzige Antrunk, der Anzug der Hefe und der süffige Abgang, LECKER!! Es gibt Weicheier die über die deutlichen Hefenoten mosern und daher lieber Erdinger Weißbier trinken, ABER wen kümmert sowas wirklich.. Es mag ebenbürtige Weißbiere geben, aber keines ist besser!
	
Test vom 14.9.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 15,15,15,15,15,15 - 15,00

Poured from a 12 oz. can......huge head on this one!......smells of resin and banana hit your nose.....tastes like a belgian wheat, kinda yeasty and bananaish.....palate is light....not a bad beer, glad I got to try it.

50 cl bottle. Very good beer, although a little watery in my opinion. Hazy liquid, golden colour. The head is minimal, although I am tasting it in a trappist glass, so maybe that’s the reason. Aroma of banana, lemon, yeast, cereal, bread and especially clove and wheat. The taste is quite balanced, with salty notes. A little on the sweet side, but in no event overpowering, thankfully. Medium to full body, thick texture and fizzy carbonation. The finish is powerful and short, leaving a sweet, fruity taste. Very nutritious and refreshing beer. Great drinkability. To enjoy especially in a hot day.
Bottle. Pours a hazy amber color with a frothy white head. Nose is very yeasty with some citrus in there. Taste is much the same, though it feels rather heavy.

On tap at Old Chicago. Pour is hazy orange with a frothy white head and good lacing. Sweet, citrusy, bready aroma with notes of banana, clove, and grass. Taste is biscuit, somewhat sweet, bubblegum, clove, mint, and bread with a lightly spicy finish. Medium mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Not my favorite Hefe, but definitely a solid offering.

Nice fresh, sweet fruity taste. Full of aroma from a real "Weizen". Can’t find any bitterness and a slight dry aftertaste.

Lekkere frisse, zoete fruitige smaak. Vol aroma van een echte weizen. Geen bitterheid en een beetje droge afdronk.

Appearance: thick creamy head, golden cloudy appearance Aroma: banana, refreshing, lemon, not especially strong Taste: medium feel on the tongue, hints of banana, very smooth, slightest hint of lemon at the end, creamy Palate: no c02 burn at all, not much of an aftertaste except maybe some lemon Overall: very drinkable, creamy but not as frothy as some hefeweizens, very good beer none the less ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great head. Malty smell with milky look. Citrusy taste with bittery ending. Overall pretty good weissbeer.
Over than average, nice aroma but some alluminum taste. More than averge.. But i expected more from it
Good, could be a bit crisper.  Wheat is tasty without dominating the flavor. Mild esthers...good beer overall.
Draught at Never Grow Old, Oulu. Colour is hazy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours are banana, yeast, some spices and wheat. Quite typical German weissbier.

330 ml bottle. Pours an opaque pale orange with a thick, resilient white head. Smell is banana and cloves. Taste is pretty much the same, with characteristic wheat, barley and yeast hefeweizen flavors. Some herbal hops in the finish. Thick body, soft, silky mouthfeel. So simple, so well-balanced, I can’t help but think this probably is the best hefeweizen I’ve had the pleasure of drinking.

Has lighter wheat beer taste that finishes pretty cleanly. Like a premium bud. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy golden yellow with white foam head. Lacing and leaving drinking rings. Aroma is weak but a typical German Weißen. Taste is not outstanding, nothing special a weißen again. Nice long citrus aftertaste. (Velp 201212)

Colour is cloudy hazy golden brown; Full body, with big head and frothy (one finger); it has fragment smell of banana, vanilla, and fresh tomato; good lacing; Easy to mouth, has good taste of mash banana and cloves, with distinct but pleasant tartness aftertaste. Hop bitterness is minimal, almost undetectable; No earthy / muddy taste associated with Franziskaner’s hefe weiss.



Comments: While Erdinger’s is solid and Franziskaner’s is mellow and down to earth, Paulaner’s hefe weiss has more character and is exciting to drink. Recommended.
Smells of wheat, good golden colour, hazy. Sour wheat typical of the style. Not bad.

11.2oz bottle, from my local Kroger. Best by: 4/2013. Nice estery spicy hefe nose. Totally hazy yellow orange color. Good thick one-finger white head. Good lace. Nice banana, coriander spice aroma. Tart sweet taste, light sour note. Smooth, but pronounced carbonation. Medium body. Dry texture. Solid hefe.

0.5 l bottle, from a supermarket, in Bucharest.

Golden to orange coloured, cloudy liquid, long white head.

Aroma has notes of banana, cinnamon, pepper, yeast, orange, fresh bread.

Medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation, bitter taste, bittersweet aftertaste.
Large foamy white head which stays, light orange/yellow colour, sour fresh banana smell, medium carbonation, soft bitter, fruity bit banana/lemon taste
Bela cerveja com toques citricos, e cor amarela escura, mas com final muito lupulizado, que nao chega a comprometer.
excellent weizen beer appearance with amazing head; both the aroma and taste are dominated by citrus with bread and moderate banana notes; great weizen
Poured a murky brown with a thick frothy off-white head. Aroma of spices and fruit. Medium body, flavour of banana with a hint of citrus.

Nice hazy pale colour with a right amount of foam. 
Some banana-esters, but not as much as I’d like. 
Nicely balanced, all round well done hefe-weizen.
bottle from lidle milford. decent hefe. . more bittering in the paulner gives it the edge in the hefe I believe
Pours a cloudy dark straw color. Aroma is nice banana, spice. Taste is same if banana, orange and spice.
For being such a common beer, this is a suprisingly good Hefeweizen and beats many of the more rare German imports.  If it had a tad more body and complexity, this would rank as one of my favorites.
Orangish colour with a medium white head. Sweet with banana notes, a typical Hefeweizen. Cheap and easy to find, a good option for an enjoyable and refreshing time. Much better on tap!
Una muy buena cerveza de trigo con gran apariencia pero muy industrial. Perfecta para unas cañas en verano. Las hay mejores.
De color amarillo oscuro, espuma blanca y persistente, sabor suave con respecto a otras, el final es algo mas lupulizado que otras, aun asi bastante buena dentro de su campo
Aroma of malts, mostly hay and some caramel, herbs and hops. Flavour also adds wheat and maybe some orangepeels. Slick mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Overall a good hefe-weissbier.
Tap. Pours clear golden, with some white head. Aroma has wheat and fruits. Taste is light and somwhat sweet.
Bottle. Pours clear pale yellow with thick white head. Clear aroma of hop and wheat. A little watery but ok.
5.6% hazy gold colour with a nice head, it is all that a good wheat beer should be.  I think I have only had one wheat beer I didn’t like.

0.5L can @maxima
It was 2nd from 4 in a row hefewizen: color pale cloudy yellow to orange with dark brown tiny pieces of something, taste is sweet, not sour. Finish was quite spicy, herbal - liked it. Mid body with good white lasting head. Overall - could be better.
Must re-rate.
Es una de las cervezas de trigo más famosas. Con bastante cuerpo y mucha espuma. Fácil de beber y refrescante pero llena mucho.

From a can in a tulip. Cloudy bright golden orange. 4 finger fluffy head that fades so slowly with really beautiful lacing. Sweet lemony scent with wheat. Taste is gorgeous. Sweet, lots of honey and wheat chewiness. Bitter balanced finish. Hint of cloves. Wow. Perhaps the best Hefeweizen I’ve ever had.
Jag brukar inte gilla den uttalade brödsmaken av den här typen weiz, men den här var riktigt fräsch och god

Pours a cloudy golden orange with a white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of wheat and bananas. Very light almost to the point where it is watered down. Sweet fruit and wheat dominate flavor. Sour dry finish.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden to orange color with decent white head. Aroma is orange, banana, wheat. Flavor is wheat, banana and a hint of some spices and alcohol.
Yeasty aroma. Pours cloudy light gold with quick white head that leaves moderate lacing. Slight citrus sweetness. Very smooth. No bitterness. Well balanced good beer.
From bottle. Mild wheat beer, a solid example of the style without being outrageous. Bananas!
Golden cloudy color with white persistent foam. Yeast and malt aroma, heavy sweet with high carbonation.
Colore arancio scarico, opaca,  schiuma persistente. Al naso banana e lievito, aroma di luppolo assente. Poco amara, in ingresso spiccata carbonazione,  acida nel finale. Decisamente una buona weizen

50 cl bottle.

Originally rated on 20090314.

Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, some fruits and banana. Flavor of yeast, fruits, wheat and some faint spice notes.

Pours a great coudy orange, nice, long-lasting head. Smell is banana flambee - spicy sweet fruit. Taste is nicely sweet, more banana than citrus, with good spice and a mildly bitter finish. My favorite "find-it-anywhere" hefeweizen.

Bottled. Sparkling, hazy orange beer with yeast-clouds drifting in it. Nice, medium, off-white head. Lots of banana-esters when poured, but they calm down after a while, and yeast and cloves finds their places. A bit thin mouthfeel with flavors of banana, lemon, cloves and some yeast. The finish has some metallic notes, as well as spices.

50cl. Bottle. 
Poors cloudy orange with good white head. 
Aroma banana, malt, bread. 
Taste sweet, small biter in the finish. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
Good weissen.

Classic Weizen which you can get just like everywhere. Aroma of yeast and sweet fruits. Taste of rich yeast with intensive hints of green apples and earthy flavours. Really delicious and easy to drink.

Sometimes a classic turns out as still something special. After drinking this one for years I must confess it still hits the points. A bit of yeast and malt, a bit honey and some sourness - that’s it. Great and well valanced beer. A classic.

Tried this beer on tap at the Flying Saucer in Addison, TX. Aroma and flavor notes of yeast, fruit, bananas and malty hops. Overall tasty beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes, 5/15/11:
Poured a 12oz bottle into a weizen glass - best by date was Sept 2011.

A: Hazy copperish pour with a fluffy white head that dissipated at first, then settled to a nice little cap that laced the edges of the glass all the way down.

S: Bananas, clove, tart yeast.

T: Wheat malt, bananas, slight hop bitterness in the finish. Yeast is there as well.

M: Nice & on the thin side of medium. Carbonation moderately high and goes down easy.

O: Great summer beer and great example of a German hefe. Had this after coming in from mowing the lawn and it suited its purpose perfectly.

Malty and banana aroma. Pours hazy golden-orange with medium white head that leaves a small lace. Tastes medium sour, light sweet and light bitter at finish. Carbonation is average. Body is medium and texture is oily. Overall, a great hefe-weiss that matched my lunch perfectly.

Can 01.10.2012
Visual: Pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a huge creamy head with excellent duration.
Aroma: Lovely yeast with fruits, (bananas), wheat malt.
Taste: As aroma and slight taste of hops.

---Rated by Sumonation
500ml bottle - a great big hit of malt on the nose, banana sweetness and breakfast cereal, a cloudy amber body lasting white head. A fresh herby flavour, a balanced palate. Very good.

Looks like a advertising photo after having poured it into the glass. Just perfect. Amber colour, high white head that stays for a while. Fruity full taste and long finish with woody undertones. The best wheat beer I know on par with Erdinger Weissbier.
Can. Huge creamy head with excellent duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, bananas, wheat malt and hops.

Beautiful color a little bit darker then normal weisbier with nice white head. The aroma has a lot of fruit to it like banana and citrus peel. The taste is refreshing and nicely balanced I really enjoyed it a lot also the palate is great (may be the best part) it’s refreshing as lemon and it tastes like lemon peel. Amazing beer I can drink it throw the whole summer.
50cl. Hazy orange with nice white head. Sweet and fruity flavors mainly bananas. A good and refreshing wheat beer

30cl from tap at Gran Cafe de Madrid. Pours hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma of banana, wheat, some malt and a hint of citrus and spices. Fresh and lightly sour with a pleasant banana flavour. Nice and refreshing. (2012-08-17)
