Excellent peppery banana wheat aroma. Glowing opaque yellow-orange. Stinging bitter and estery sweet flavors meet for an ideal hefeweizen. Refreshing, but too much bite for the session range. A mass produced wheat beer that’s on par with the weizen specialists.
Great true hefe. The best out there. Consistent taste and quality. only flaw is 11oz bottles.
Pours a cloudy dark straw color. Aroma is nice banana, spice. Taste is same if banana, orange and spice. Nice beer.

Talk about your true to form Hefeweizen. One can’t do much better in thIs style. Nice lemony floral and spice aroma. A tan golden color with a creamy head that made we wait. It had a citrus herbal flavor that eventually mellowed out. If you’re looking for a good beer for warm weather, this hits the spot. Average palate with moderate carbonation.

Tra le birre "da supermercato" è la mia preferita, la si trova anche a un euro. Profumo intenso dalla bottiglia, delicato dal calice. In bottiglia abbastanza frizzante, ma messo in un calice e lasciato per un minuto assume un’altra consistenza. Profumo di grano piacevole e non invadente. Gli ultimi sorsi si fanno bere decisamente meglio della sua concorrente da supermercato per quanto mi riguarda, la franziskaner.

Aroma has wheat, citrus, banana, bit sourness, malting underneath, nice fresh aroma. Hazy golden, frothy creamy head is long. Taste has same elements as aroma, finish is sour and bitter, medium body. Overall this works, has basic elements is right places and also some nice sourness balancing all.
0.5l can. Hazy orange body, white head. Spicy aroma with some citruses and a little banana. Banana-like flavor with some spicyness.Nice weizen.

Obtained in a trade // 50 cl. bottle sampled @ Man-ki’s BBQ // hazy bright orange with a crisp white head // fruits, orange peel in the nose, full wheat quite bitter with herbal overtones, touch citrus // sweetish mellow wheat taste blended with a touch of melon, some summer fruits, touch apricot, bitter herbal, plenty of clovers, round mellow, touch flowers, touch citrus in the back // reasonable wheat body // lovely hefe // this comes in can awesome

Bottle at home. Has a dull orange colour with a medium frothy and off-white head. Classic fruity aroma with banana but also some caramel and camphor. The flavour is also sweet and fruity with a touch of spices. Wonderful soft mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. A great hefeweizen!
Smell of hay, grass, pale - golden in color, cloudy, minimal head, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation,  I personally like Circus Boy’s Hefe better.
Cloudy head, sweet-citric aroma, first impression is neutral but aftertaste is very sweet (a bit of banana-lemonish) and positive.
As a wheat beer lover, I quite enjoyed Paulaner and found it refreshing. I would definitely order it again!

This is a cloudy golden liquid with large bubbles and a frothy persistent head. The aroma is strongly of wheat with some caramel. The taste is slightly sour. This is a medium to full bodied beer with a thick texture and strong, sharp carbonation. Overall I would say that this is a pretty run of the mill wheat beer. It had everything I was expecting it to have and not much else.

De lo mejorcito de las cervezas de trigo. Desconozco por qué, pero se nota que está más cuidada su elaboración que el resto, puede que en su magnífica apariencia, o en un redondo sabor y final de tránsito. Gran cerveza

I tried this on tap at Old Chicago in Madison, WI in summer 2012. 

Pours a cloudy copper orange color with a slight off-white head served with lemon. Scent is mild with wheat and citrus. Taste is sweet, full of wheat, and hints of citrus. Finishes very smooth and delicious. A good overall beer especially in the hefe-weizen style.
Wunderbares Hefeweizen. Klasse Aroma und eindeutig mein Favorit unter den Hefeweizen. :)
Poured a hazy golden color with a smaller sized head. citrus, some wheat, cloves, and bananas.

Very tasty hefeweizen.   Great aroma of nutty banana bread and cloves.  Really comes to the forefront as you start to sip.  Beautiful cloudy orangish color with a frothy, fluffy thick white head that takes it’s time to come down with some medium lacing.  The taste is typical of a German/Bavarian hefe with lots of sweet banana and clove and some caramel.  Smooth and velvety feel on the mouth.   Overall very solid and delicious wheat beer.  Got a 24-pack for a great price at Costco.  Will drink lots of this.

Bottle. The main advantages of this beer are its taste coupled with its reliability. It may be standardised but it never disappoints. Hazy golden with a frothy head. Aroma is banana, cloves, bubblegum, vanilla, malt and yeast. Taste is light tart, less sweetish with a subtle bitterness. Light to medium body, flavourful beer. Flavour is fruity and soft, coupled with a subtle spiciness. Very good.

Aroma is honing, bloemen en rozijnen. Smaak blijft wat achter, maar heeft een aangename zachte afdronk van gedroogd fruit en heel licht bittertje. Troebel oranje met klein stevig kraagje. Van de tap @ sportsbar airport CPH.

.33L bottle, poured into tall hefe glass. Pours very effervescently with much white foam which leaves a clingly lacing on the glass later. Color is a hazy sunset yellow. Smells of faint banana and stronger clove, with something more grainy as well. Taste is smooth, malty, almost no hop bitterness, some yeasty cracker-like flavors present. Not my favorite hefe, but it’s a solid standard. Very enjoyable.
From the bottle poured a light golden brew with a nice white head. aromas and flavors of bubble gum and malt. Light bodied and delicious. One of my favorites.
Průměrná pšenka, která u mě v hodnocení doplácí na to, že holt weizeny nemám moc rád. Lahváč.
Cloudy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, clove, & bananas; Flavor of wheat, some yeast, bananas, light clove, and citrus; Nicely balanced; Solid hefeweizen.
Pours a golden orange with a quickly dissipating off-white head and little to no lacing. Aroma of german yeast, citrus, and wheat. Taste follows suit, with the typical hefeweiss flavor. It’s average.

From bottle to glass.  Aroma is spicy, herbal, and banana with head still attached.  When it finally fades away, the banana aroma explodes at you.  Very nice.  Looks dark brown with massive head.  Taste is sweet.  Very creamy texture like most German wheats and very drinkable.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Fruity aroma. Sweet malty flavour.

Poured yellow-copper with a large, long lasting head.  The aroma is of banana and clove.  The mouthfeel is smooth and velvety.  The flavor is malty, bready, with banana and clove in nearly perfect balance.  Best hefe I’ve ever had.
Para mi es la mejor cerveza de trigo que he probado. Entra suave y dulce, tiene mucho cuerpo y bien servida, una espuma cremosa.

Ar: Banana, yeast -bread
Ap: Gold-amber, hazzy - great frothy head 
T: Aroma follows through - banana fruit and bready yeast - very well balanced
P: Lively carbonation, medium bodied
O: Great hefe - the appearance is just beautiful
yellow/orange color, aroma of wheat, bitter orange, coriander, clove, yeast, flavors are the same, crisp and clean
On tap in Germany, hazy golden yellow pour with a nice head. First brewery that respects flavor and not a watery taste. Spicey and bready, nice finish. By far the best tap thus far. More to follow.

On draft in Berlin. Pours a nice hazy golden orange with a big white head and aroma of malt and wheat. Taste is of wheat, malt, and fruit with a medium finish, definetly one of the better big names beer in Germany

On bottle
Golden color, good foam.
good fruit intensity, banana
Medium body & complexity 
Good carbonation & well balanced.
Enjoyable
Bottle - Banana, yeasty, wheat, clove aroma. Hazy golden with a moderate white head. Banana, wheat malt, clove, citric flavor. Light crisp carbonated body.
Basement aromas, earthy, alcohol, dough, bread, spruce, barnyard, raisin, cereal, spruce
Just another Weissbier if you ask me. Banana, caramel malts, dough. Very well drinkable on a hot day like this.
500Ml bottle and on tap in Dublin. Really Nice weissbier, really fruity. I recommend it.

Poured cloudy orange, with a small head that eventually vanished, leaving a tiny ring.  Smelled mostly of citrus and some spice.  Tasted somewhat sweet, with the citrus and fruitness even stronger. Full bodied and a thick/syrupy texture and good carbonation.

Draft: Buffalo Wild Wings of all places. Instantly reminded me of Germany.  Good banana and vanilla nose. A little sweet, with nice undertone of spice. Very refreshing to start, finishes a little dry and bitter.

Birra molto corposa dal colore ambrato torbido dato dal fatto di essere una weise sapore forte consiglio di berla il piu ghiacciata possibile per poterne assaporare a pieno il gusto.bottiglia da 500 ml
floral, leaves, cloudy, white foam, golden, lightly bitter, average carbonation, creamy, medium body, bitter,
Bottle@poggio. Small head. Haze golden brown. Yeasts basement aromas blended with wheat malty notes. Apricote and orange peel. Some sweetness. Fine classic hefe.

330 ml bottle. Pours an orange/amber with light persistent head. Aromas of grain, yeast, and lemon, with floral notes. Full mouthfeel. Lots of carbonation on the tongue. Light flavors of dough, citrus, and cloves.
2001th rating of this beer.  tap at redbones.   creamy banana bread dough, walnuts,  light spice.   fruity.  bubblegum.  pretty good.  prefer ayiger and weiengighester hefeweizens.
Strong banana aroma and taste heavy on the palate but a smooth cracking pint, glorious.

Bottle. Pours a expectantly orange hazy gold. Nice chunky off-white head. Initial malted nose with a few fruity citrus notes. A touch of banana. In the mouth, a nice complex, but steady taste. Banana, oranges, sweet malts, there’s a tang, but it’s not an icky metallic but more of a fresh zest. Quite creamy and thick in the mouth and the carbonation carries everything along nice and smoothly. Finish is dry and appealing.  A solid and cracking drink.
0,5l bottle. A cloudy pale weizen with a nice rich white head. The aroma has notes of banana, wheat and malts. The taste is sweet and very fruity.

0,5 bottle. pours hazy golden with big bubbles head, quickly disappearing.
sweet aroma, banana, vanilla and orange, with metallic hops.
banana and vanilla also in the taste, but with a good malty presence.sweet and pasty final. smooth and milky mouthfeel. good carbonation.

fles 50cl
kleur: niet helder oranje, flinke witte schuimkraag, redelijk carbo
geur: fris, peer, licht zoet, graan
smaak: fris, licht zoet, lekkere bitter finish.

Appearance: Clowdy orange to brown color with an small short lasting tan head (i did pour carefully ) 
Aroma: yeast, dough, hints of cloves, banana, flowery
Taste: light sweet with a light bitter and astringent finish
Pours hazy golden with a nice high head. Aroma wheat, banana, yeast. Medium sweet taste. Very nice all round hefe. Not Bad.
what a hefeweizen should be.  pours a hazy darker yellow with a robust head. smell of banana and cloves.  goes down smooth.

Pours a hazy amber color with a foamy white head. The nose is sweet - banana and yeast. The taste is similar - banana. It has very smooth mouthfeel - no carbonation. Very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Hazy yellow with an enormous white, fluffy head. Tons of bubbles, awesome head retention and plenty of lacing left behind.

S: Banana, clove, wheat. Smells terrific!

T: A very refreshing beer. Hefeweizen = warm weather, working in the yard, sunny days, bratwurst on the grill, and just plain ol’ good times. This is one of my favorite hefeweizens (Live Oak, Franziskaner, Weihenstephan). There is a nice balance of fruit (mainly banana), and spice. Beautiful in its simplicity, this is a go to beer for me, especially when I’m in the mood for something light and low in alcohol.

M: Solid feel. Plenty of carbonation. Nice clean aftertaste.

D: Chuggable. A fantastic session beer.
On cask at Hemma Bar. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a fair white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, wheat and caramel. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. Lovely.

Cloudy golden colour, thick white foam. Mid to strong sweet fruit smell. Taste strong, sour-sweet. Leaves a strong sour taste which becomes a pleasant feeling in mouth for a long period of time. Very tasty beer which I enjoyed drinking (I bought it in a local store, so I hope it will still be avaible).

Greg and I compared a series of three respected, true-to-style German Hefeweizens: Paulaner, Erdinger and Weihenstephan. All three were tasty and refreshing but this one was my least favorite. The Paulaner poured a slightly cloudy light amber color, a shade darker than the others, with the best head retention and lace. Aromas of banana and bubblegum. Mild malt and wheat, light breadiness. Buttery mouthfeel. Light body and medium carbonation. Overall, good not great.
Decent aroma, appearance, taste and palate, overall memorable. Rated from the can.
A little cloudy,  Thin white head.  Somewhat creamy.  Buttery.  Slight bubblegum.

An amazing hefeweizen, and among the very best. As far as appearance, this is just astonishingly beautiful. As far as taste, people tend to match this to the world famous Erdinger, but the Paulaner is a tad sweeter overall and the palate more complex and leaves a lasting aftertaste. I can get this locally on tap, so I would never consider the bottled version, but I’ve been told it can hold it’s merits. If you drink a Paulaner (or any other notable hefe) just after a hoppy brew say IPA, you’ll get a shock to the system and probably spit it out immediately and demand another IPA or Pilsener. The banana/abricot sweet and fruity taste dominates totally, and it can really be a turnoff.

Draught @ Maltainen Riekko, Helsinki



Quite well balanced and tasty hefeweizen.

Cloudy orange pour with a nice creamy white head. 
Aromas of banana, wheat, and citrus. Sweet, with flavors that match the aroma. Creamy.
Finishes with a light sweetness.
Very easy to drink.
Cerveza de trigo por excelencia. Genial para tomarlas los días de calor para refrescarse.
Buen color, con bastante cuerpo y un exquisito sabor, suave pero consistente. Aroma de calidad.
very nice bavarian beer. not to sweet, not to strong, enjoyable to drink. one of my favorites
Far and away one of my favorites. Very clean taste, and extremely smooth. Wonderful light color and aroma.

On tap: cloudy orange color. Good white head. Aroma of citrus, spice, maybe cloves. Taste is vey smooth. Early on this was one of my favorites. Still one of the best hefes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow, fantastic hefe.  Pours a beautiful hazy gold color and is unfiltered.  Aroma is very rich, strong malt notes with sweet yet light fruit notes to round it off.  Taste is a perfect example of what a hefe should be, good malts that seem almost yeasty/bready with a sweetness that hits the spot.  Extremely drinkable/palatable and a great seasonal for the summer.

Cloudy orange to yellow, soapy white head. Clear banana, but also some herbs, basement and clove. Misses a tat bit of the malty backbone that some of the other big German hefe brewers have. Taste is as expected, medium sweet and with enough flavour. No surprises here. In fact, it’s a bit more boring to me than a Weihenstephaner or Franziskaner. Still decent and very drinkable though. (On tap)

Pours a hazy orange with a yellowish creamy head.  Classicly Hefe, with its aromas of orange peel, banana, yeast & cloves.  Very bright and tangy on the palate.  As far as Weiss’ go this one is pretty much as straightforward as it gets.

Bottiglia 500 cl. Giallo dorato opalescente, bel cappello di schiuma bianca persistente. Naso abbastanza intenso e poco persistente, con lievi sentori di chiodi di garofano e lieviti.....
secca, corpo snello e poco amara........buonina, ma c’è di meglio......
very nice aroma with a very good head. smooth taste with a good hefe flavor

Review written from bottle though have also had on tap. Pours lovely golden orange with a nice thick yellowed head. Aroma quite banana/watermelon like. Tastes really similarly to the aroma; continuing with a watery banana taste. Nice soft and fruity taste with a little spicey aftertaste experience. This is one of my favourite beers so my review is always going to be positive, overall I would say that this is a really nice and easy going wiessbier, definitely worth a check-in if you can get it!
Draught at ISO pub Sde Boker College. Pours cloudy amber with a big rocky white head. Bubblegum, banana and some clove aroma, soft sweet taste. Light-to-medium body, abrupt, peachy finish.
More "maltier" than I expected and not dominated by the banana and clove characteristics that are typically predominant in hefs.

500ml botttle. Dark yellow unclear beer with white head. Yeast and flowery fruit on aroma. Flavor has heavy yeast and a bit sitrus. Nice paired with a sweet dessert, but a bit heavy beer for a day out in the sun.

Pours a cloudy amber with with white foamy head that goes to the brim of the pint glass. Aroma is light and fruity with banana and spice esters. This beer is super-smooth and light with the classic weissbier esters. Good light and refreshing wheat, tastes better colder rather than warmer.

Bottle. Pours dark golden, with a thick creamy head. Aroma is light spices, yeast, hay and bubblegum. Full body, with a quite lively carbonation. flavour is very fruity, with plums, yeast and some sweet fruits and orange evolving through the finish.

11.2floz bottle into a pint glass. Pours is a cloudy golden yellow, with three fingers of fine, white head. The head fades quickly and somewhat violently (with lots of movement) to a small cap. The aroma is very nice with some floral notes, banana, orange and a bit of yeastyness. Some sweetness on the attack with some banana, transitioning to a slightly watery orange mid palate. The finish is pretty wonderful, with a good dose of lemon, a touch of hops and a lovely roasted malt flavour. This beer is tasty, but not as wonderful as I was expecting.

bottle, poured more orange than yellow with big frothy white head. the aroma was heaven sent, the smell of wheat and sweet malt is wonderful in this beer. the flavor was spot on and delicious. great wheat and some spiciness in there. perfect touches to the german standard.

Wow - now this is a hefeweizen.  Pours a cloudy gold with a thick white head that slowly dissipates into some moderate lacing.  The aroma is full of fruit and spices.  The taste follows through with a lot of spiciness upfront but finishes just a touch dry to me.  Nevertheless, this blows away any American hefeweizen I’ve ever tried.  I was pleasantly surprised!
This is just so terribly good. Cruel thirst quencher but also exceptionally good for food. Fits in all circumstances and in any weather.

Die Schaumkrone hält 3min. Der Antrunk ist fruchtig im verlauf des verkostens wird es bis zum Abgang immer fruchtiger, wobei es auch immer leckerer und süffiger wird. Fazit: Für meinen Geschmack ist das Hefeweizen von Paulaner ein Weißbier, das sich im guten Mittelfeld einordnen lässt.
	
Test vom 11.7.2008, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 12,9,11,10,-,10 - 10,21

Nebuloso color giallo intenso con soffice schiuma bianca. Aroma leggermente floreale con sentori di fieno e banana; gusto acidulo, in parte dolciastro ed in parte erbaceo con note fruttate e lievemente speziate; retrogusto amarognolo e decisamente asciutto. Di corpo lieve ma non acquosa, effervescente e dissetante.

Pours a bright golden color with a full white head. Pleasant fruity aroma. Taste is dominant in banana and wheat, though pretty mild. Good, not too heavy, very refreshing side. Light and easy to drink. Perfect for hot days...
Classic Hefe-Weiss (well, I’ve only tasted 3 but they seem fairly typical. Banananananananananananananana. Not spectacular, but pretty fresh.

Pours a bright golden color with a full white head.  Pleasant aroma of banana, orange, wheat, and grass.  Taste is dominant in banana and wheat, and altogether it is a bit muted more than the aroma.  It is still good, just not as heavy, while being on the more refreshing side.  Light and easy to drink.  Perfect for hot days or if you're in the mood for something a bit easier.

Good wheat beer but nothing special. There are better options available. That one is good in hot summer terraces.
Kuparinkeltainen olut lyhyehköllä vaahdolla (muihin kollegoihinsa verrattuna). Kiva ja virkistävä tuttavuus, mutta makua ei ole parhaiden kanssakilpailijoiden veroisesti.

golden with big frothy head. this isn’t a bad hefe, but it definitely didn’t live up the lofty ratings. typical hefe banana and clove, but muted somewhat. missing any tartness, which might have helped push the flavor.

Botella de 500ml. Vaso Weizen. Saboreada en abr´12- y muchas veces con anterioridad. Color amarillo limón y apariencia nublada. Corona blanca, tupida y persistente. Aromas intensos de clavo y banana, toques de levadura y malteado suave, notas de corteza de pan y fenoles. Sabor afrutado con matices ligeramente ácidos, Amargor bajo. Paladar especiado y leve sensación mantecosa. Cuerpo sabroso y medio, carbonatación moderada. Final seco. Refrescante y asimilable. (Ahora disponible en numerosos supermercados, conviene reposarlas un tiempo antes de consumir).
500ml bottle. Weizen glass. Enjoyed on apr´12 –and many times in the past. Lemon yellow color,  foggy appearance. White, close, lasting crown. Intense clove & banana aromas, yeast & mildy malty touches, phenol & bready crust notes. Fruity flavor & slightly acidic hues. Low bitterness. Spiced palate & subtle buttery sensation. Flavorful medium body, moderate carbonation. Dry finish. Refreshing & drinkable. (Now available at many supermarkets. Store at home for a short time before drink it. My suggestion)
Nice banana aroma with a full white foamy head and an amber color.  Significant sweet taste with a creamy, long, banana finish.  Very enjoyable

Cloudy orange color with massive foamy head.
Aroma is full of cloves some bananas, grassy grain, bread malt and mild hop bitterness.
Light bodied and soft, very easy to drink.
Hefeweizen that you must try!

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL., and served to a tall weizen glass with a hazed to cloudy, orange/golden hue, substantial white fluff to the head, and lasting, clingy strands & spots of lacing. The aroma was light wheat, soft banana & clove, citrus, and a hint of vanilla. The flavor offered similar notes, with a little tartness, light to medium body, but milder effervescence and softer carbonation than the style demands. Otherwise, very tasty!

from bottle. magnificent amber-orange colour with a three finger frothy head that lasts for quite a long time. aroma is yeast, banana and vanilla, flavour is mainly the same, some citrus notes as well. very creamy texture, light to medium body and average carbonation. perfect beer for a hot summer day!

330ml bottle. Cloudy orange body with a good big fluffy white head.
Aroma of coriander, banana, grassy hops, yeast, apricot. Taste is almost too light, a touch of sourness, yeast, banana, spices, a shy attempt of bitterness. 
Got the impression it’s too watery.

Excellent hefe. The nose is banana, spice, and just a jint of bubble gum. The beer is hazy orange with a big pillowy white head. The taste is banana and spice. The body is medium with nice carbonation and a refreshing crispness.

Bottle from local Yamaya. Strong banana, yeast, and creamy fruity aromas. Cloudy, dusky orange-brown with a solid one-inch head -- a real beauty. Light fruitiness, touch of sweetness, and a very mild aftertaste. Medium body, goes down so smoothly. Very refreshing. A well-made wheat and a pleasure to drink.

Draft at Frühlingsfest München. Aroma is light citrus and yeast. Appearance is cloudy and golden with a hughe white head. Taste is slightly sour. Medium carbination with a medium body. Overall a great Weißbier.

May 2009: You will never know how pleased I was to find this beer in a small supermarket on the holiday island of Skiathos (Greece). It was the beer highlight of the holiday.

I only had two half-pint tumblers in my Studio, so that is what the half-litre brown bottle was poured into.

The welcoming murky, dirty, cloudy body just oozed Hefeweizen at me.

Bananas and vanilla esters attacked my nose as the sun beat down onto my puny white body, great.

Spritzy, tangy and those banana and vanilla smells carry on into the taste.

Full flavours stay well after the beer has left the mouth, this is a good, good beer.

Really enjoyed it.

Sweet Orange-peel, yeasty, wheaty nose. Tangerine gold with huge thick white head. Good amount of carbonation. Smooth, creamy palate dominated by tropical fruit, orange, pineapple and hint of citrus. A pleasant, sweet, hot summer night type of beverage.
Bottle, Pours great dark amper, love the color, long lasting white head. Frutty aroma with a hint of banana and hops. Refreshing taste of spring and fruit and banana.
0,5l bottle, 5,5% abv. Cloudy dark yellow/orange color. Medium head. Wheat, grass, bananas, honey as aroma, very nice. Well balanced taste. Low carbonation makes it very easy to drink. Good beer.
Hazy golden colour with nice big head. Aroma is yeast and banana. Flavour is sweet,  yeast and banana.

Bottle. Pours a dark cloudy golden color. Fluffy off-white head. Nose was strong wheat and banana and nutmeg-like spice. Very wheaty and grainy flavor, with strong banana and vanilla notes. Palate was a bit more lively than I would expect from a weizen, finished crisp, yet still wheaty. But it was refreshing and met all the characteristics I like in a good beer.

Pours cloudy, dark orange with a big white frothy head. Smells of yeast and some banana. Wheat & banana taste, kind of fruity overall, low bitterness, good carbonation. No apparent lingering aftertaste. Balanced
Draft in Munich airport. Fruits, banana, grass, thick yellow color. Excellent weissbeer!

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange body, with an average white head that stays fully. Yeasty aroma, with fruity notes. Notes of malts and citrus in taste. Thin to medium body, oily texture. Good weisse overall, but nothing special to comment.

Smells of clove and banana. Pours with a some froth and an oily sheen, has a nice soft carbonation. Taste is wheaty, soft on the tongue but a full palate of spices and wheat. A small touch of citrus as well. Small bottle
Subtle spices with a sweet citrus flavor, I prefer wheat beers so I thoroughly enjoyed it

Pours deep orange cloudy yeasty. with white creamy head. Aroma is bananas, honey melon, citrus and some grass and vanilla. Palate is slick, oily, mouthful and little tart. Carbonation is mouthful, soft and smooth. Taste is sweetish, caramel, wheat malty, yeasty, with hints of grassy hops and dryness. Finish is medium dry, with sweet licorice, malts and fruity with plums. Good stuff, complex enough and still balanced for a Hefeweizen.
Hazy golden colour with a creamy white head. Lots of banana aroma and flavour
A very nice hefeweizen with lots of banana notes however it is outclassed by the ayinger hefeweizen
Bottle. Banana, yeasty, wheat, clove aroma. Hazy golden with a moderate white head. Banana, wheat malt, clove, citric  flavor. Light crisp carbonated body.

330ml bottle from the LCBO (Ontario). 5.5% ABV.  Pours hazy yellow-orange with a large white head with average lacing. Aroma of vanilla, yeast, wheat, bananas, fruit. Wonderful aroma. Taste is medium sweet no bitterness very mild sour. medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel soft carbonation with very small bubbles. short finish. Overall this is a pretty good beer but all the flavours are too mild for my liking.
pours a huge head and very hazy and orange colored. the smell is of light citrus fruits. faint orange smell, slightly bitter. the taste is very citrusy, banana clove, light honey, robust flavor.

Yes! That’s what a hefeweizen should look like! An absolutely huge, creamy, off-white head forms willingly on top of a gorgeous medium orange body. The head stays big for quite some time, before settling as a 3 mm dense everlasting layer. Good lacing. Strong, sweet, refreshing, crisp and very pleasant aroma with all the usual suspects: sweet fruits (i.e. banana), yeast, spices and perfume, and a sweet malty component that I can’t quite nail: is it sweet caramel, or maybe mild sweet honey? The taste is moderate to light sweet, accompanied by a moderate acidity and traces of something bitter. The flavours fit the aroma like a glow, maybe apart from the citric notes (mostly lime) that are a tad more evident on the palate. The body is quite light, which I guess it’s supposed to be, but I’ve had weissens with a bit fuller body which I must say I prefer. Still, the perfect carbonation and the pleasant dryness and that more-ish feeling saves the 4 in Palate. An absolutely top of the line weissbier! 

[50 cl bottle, enjoyed 9 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Grønland, Oslo]

Floral, citrus, banana.
Golden, orange, hazy, white foam.
medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness.
Thin feel, long finish.
Elements combined perfectly.

Hazy golden orange with a big bright white head and plenty of effervescence. Banana and clove aromas, sweetish wheat flavor with an orange peel twang. Light body, lively carbonation, light pillowy mouthfeel, and a crisp finish.

Bottle. Hazy Yellow/Orange. Cloves and spicy yeast. Great banana notes.  Another textbook wheat beer. One of my favourites among the standard range of Hefe. Love this brew - I remember it from Munich.

11.2oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a cloudy orange with 2 fingers of thick white head. Aroma of banana, clove, yeast, wheat and citrus. Taste is the same. Lightly sweet with banana, clove, wheat and citrus. Medium bodied with a sticky and creamy texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, a very good beer. I would love to drink this again.

3/14/12 Enjoyed at Hiram Haines’ Coffee House, Petersburg, VA. Poured into a fluted glass out of a pint bottle drank warm paired with a roast beef turkey and Swiss on sour dough. The color was of of apple juice with a two inch head. An aroma of pressed cider, sweet with fruity notes and a hint of all spice. Taste was sweet and cider like but the sandwich made it more mild and brought out the "Natural wheat". Palate was a medium carbonation and very bready. Finishes like apple juice, for me apples were everywhere.

Hazy golden colour, with a big white head. Massive rich nose with yeast, banana, malt and some citric notes. Flavour are also massive and well blended, lots of banana, sweet malt, fruity, light citric. When you first get one it is impossible to stop :-) Wonderstuff straight from heaven!

Draft in Munchen, can and bottle

One of my favorite weissbiers.  Most recently drank it out of a can from the airport.  I was surprised that the quality was the same as from the bottle (but not quite as good as from the tap.  Golden hazy delicious pour, thick head.  Taste is smooth and mildly sweet, bold for a weiss.  I think the distribution of this beer in particular had helped cement the reputation of the style throughout the world.  Awesome.
330ml bottle. Unfiltered with a strong white head this was a tasty example of a style I really like. Citrusy taste. ABV was listed as 5.5% on the Canadian bottle.
Pours the expected cloudy orange with very thick white head, lots of lacing. Aroma is obvious of wheat, yeast, citrus, and spices.  Just and overall solid hefe.

I sapori di bubblegum e di banana fanno a pugni per contendersi il primo assalto al palato! Dopo, quasi in sordina, arriva il sapore di pompelmo aspettando di essere magari accompagnato da una forchettata di spigola al sale!
floral, herbs, banana, bubblegum, pale, orange, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium sourness,

Pours hazy orange/yellow with a medium white head. Smell a lot of wheat, yeast and fruit (citrus, banana ). Taste is fresh, fruity, light floral, light bitter. Soft light mouthfeel, watery finish. Typical Weissbier but not my  favorite for winter times.
Tap - small foamy head, hazy light straw color, mild spice aroma and flavor with some banana and apricot flavors, better than most hefe’s
exceptional beer. perfect example of a weissen. Everything right on target. However my favorite beers tend towards more flavor, more hops and more complexity.

Cloudy orange colored pour. Big white head that sticks around a bit and leaves healthy rings of lacing along the glass. Big aroma of banana and malt/bread. A slight mineral/iron aroma. Sweet banana and malt flavor. The slight tinge of metal is there in the mouth as well. Pretty decent beer.

Bottle:
Medium vast creme white head that disappears slow on top of a hazy yellow orange colored beer.
Smell a lot of wheat, yeast and fruit (lemon, citrus, banana and orange). Some hay, herbs/spices (cloves and pepper) and hop tones.
The taste is fine, well balanced and refreshing and the same as smell but all ingredients are stronger present.
Nice fruity (yeast) touch with hops, herbs, light floral, light bitter and lesser sweet.
Low to medium carbo, soft light tingly mouthfeel, good medium bodied and a texture between creamy and watery.
I like this beer, for it’s style (not my favorite style).
Better than I first rated.  Clove & Banana only shine through if this beverage warms up a bit.  Probably be a good session beer.

50ml bottle. Sweet banana aroma and in fact taste. And yes a couple of other fruits, let me say wheat and apple. Why not, a good experience...!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It poured a very hazy amber liquid, with orange highlights; the head was a mousey off-white that had great volume.  The aroma has notes of: banana, black pepper, sour-dough, and a faint hint of vanilla. The taste is medium-light sweetness that finishes with delicate smoothness; it contains notes of: bananas, pepper, sour yeasty bread, and clove. The palate has a light-medium body, a thin watery texture, boisterous small carbonation. Overall, the beer is pleasant but really lacks in body and much too delicate.
.5l can from Estonia harbour. Pours cloudy orange with medium head. Aroma is banana, yeast, malts, dried fruits. Flavor is malts, banana, yeast, dried fruits, hint of alcohol. Smooth.

0.5 bottle. An elaborate aroma consisting of scents such as orange peels, clove, banana and yeast. Washed orange color, quite hazy with a creamy white head on the top. Taste is mostly sour with a sweet addition, fruity to a limited extent, slightly dry. Medium body and a creamy texture although a tad too watery. Carbonation is soft, finish medium and simple. A good brew, refreshing that’s for sure yet not completely living up to the expectations I have of Hefeweizens.

Pours pale orange, fizzy white mostly diminishing head. cloudy/hazy appearance. Inviting medium intensity smell with aromas of cloves and orange. medium to high intensity, med to full bodied, with a medium aftertaste. Bold creamy texture with a sweet spicy start and a citrus finish. Refreshing, Straightforward, Well balanced in quality. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is one of my go-to summer beers. I’m a huge fan of hefeweizens and other wheat beers but I especially enjoy this one. I think its sometimes seen as THE German hefeweizen and I think there is a reason for that.

Appearance - cloudy and straw-colored, gains clarity as it warms, but tastes best cold.

Smell - delicious, wheat that doesn’t overpower.

Taste - also delicious, very crisp and not too much malt presence - something that I think some American hefes struggle with.

Mouthfeel - smooth, perfect, avoid dead yeast at all costs.

Overall - a great example of what wheat can contribute to an already exceptional beer.
Bottle. A very good Hefeweizen. Spicy cloves, lemon and vanilla. Mild sour taste. Nice carbonation. Smooth finish with a hint of tart bitterness. Tasty.
Cloudy amber with ivory head.  Aroma is banana and cloves.  Taste is wheat malt sweetness with an earthy finish.  Slightly pungent taste.  Somewhat watery, but still refreshing.
50 cl. bottle @ home. Hazy golden colour with a big white head. Yeasty citrusy smell. Yeasty taste with some banana en lemon. Very round body.
earthy, cooked vegetables, licorice, banana, amber, hazy, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, umami, full body, lively, bitter, long finish,

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it’s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!


Perfekte Blume und goldgelbene Weizenfarbe. Es riecht nach Sommer und auch Geschmacklich hälts was es verspricht. Sehr Kohlensäurehaltig, spritzig frisch!!! 
Meiner Meinung nach entfaltet sich das ganze Aroma beim Paulaner erst, wenn man mehrere große Schlücke trinkt. Herrlich. Die perfekte Mischung aus Hefe, zitronigem und bananigem Aroma!
Decent hefewiezen considering its availability. Banana, cloves, some citrus. Smooth and easy to drink.
Poured into a weisen pint glass. Aroma is proper banana and Clove. Flavour is watered down. There are better examples, but this would be refreshing on a hot summers day!
Appears cloudy yellow with a big white head. Smell like wheat, citrus and spice. Taste nice and thick with wheat, fresh citrus and spice with a clean after taste. This a great Hef.
Hazy golden color with a frothy white head. Aroma is citrus and yeast. medium body with lively carbonation.
I had this one a long time ago. If I have the chance to drink it again, I’ll update this rating
Light yeasty aroma, golden yellow pour.  Taste is very very smooth, nice wheat and light citrus notes.  Maybe a bit too lemony on the end but still very nice.  Not overly complex but so well done.

Pours pale orange, fizzy white mostly diminishing head. cloudy/hazy appearance. Inviting medium intensity smell with aromas of cloves and orange. medium to high intensity, med to full bodied, with a medium aftertaste. Bold creamy texture with a sweet spicy start and a citrus finish. Refreshing, Straightforward, Well balanced in quality. Greatly Appreciated

Výborné, leč dle mého názoru možná přeceňované pivo. Výrazné aroma, ovocné a  lehce kouřové. Barva standardní, pěna hutná. Výrazná pšeničná chuť s příchutí ovoce s patrnou hořkostí a nádherným dozvukem. Výrazný říz.

AROMA: peppery, herbs, citrus
APPEARANCE: cloudy, golden, frothy
TASTE: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour
PALATE: medium body, slick feel, lively, bitter,
OVERALL: good weissbier, but too overpowering pepperiness

12oz bottle pours cloudy light yellow with a decent white frothy head.  Aromas of orange citrus bit of yeast and cereal.  Flavor is slightly sweet and light fruity with a touch of malt.  Body is light and finish is smooth

On tap. Yeast, banana, slight clove and a little boozy on the nose. Medium mouthfeel. Not as bready as I like a wheat beer. Flavours are mild. Same yeast tiny bit of clove. Finished with a slight hop minerality. Completrly mediocre.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from a family member. Pours a clear golden colour with a pretty active white head that calms down to a ring of head, lots of lacing that is thick sheets on the glass. Aroma is really sweet, a little yeast and some booziness. Tastes sweet, light, a little yeast again and some grain. I have an overwhelming taste of banana on the back end.
Draft - pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is orange and wheat. Taste is sweet.  Good and sweet.
Hazy amber with a white head. Sweet, hints of vanilla. Not too bad, although this is not my favorite type of beer.

Pours opaque orange with strong abundant head.  Aroma is cloves and bananas, bread, some nuttiness.  Taste is clove, marshmallow, bready malt.  Body is sticky and smooth with tiny bubbles of carbonation scrubbing the palate oh-so-gently, finishes chalky and dryish.  Overall, this is fantastic.  German beers in America seem to be getting fresher.

Golden pale colour. Huge white head. Immpecable appearance in Weizen glass. Aroma is fresh wheat malt, floral and citrus. Balanced flavour in acid and sweet and bitter. Wonderful beer, perfect for a long conversation!
Murky pour with yeasty aroma. Taste is yeast with a slightly citrusy finish.
Pours a murky golden color with a fluffy white head.  Tastes slightly bitter and salty on the tongue, but offset by a rich bready aroma. Very satisfying.
Nice murky blond color, nice fluffy white head. Very crisp and refreshing. A bit more bite then I like, and a bit of a tart or bitter taste, but overall a great example of a Weissen.

0,5l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Nice appearance. Hazy dark orange color with big white frothy head. Fresh yeasty aroma with citrus, banana. Classic wiessbier aroma. Medium sweet taste with some bitterness. Medium body with slick texture and average carbonation. Long malty yeasty finish, what I like very much. It’s a classic German weissbier. No more or less. Good one, but I think, it might be tastier, richer flavored.

From a 500 ml can. Amber/orange with a big, stable and creamy head.  As you open the can, an intensive smell of banana and yeast surrounds your nose. The first gulp is very spicy, then it becomes more fruity (banana) and yeasty/malty. Light bitterness at the end. Lively carbonization and full body.

11.2 oz bottle.  Cloudy orange with a whipped white head.  Nose is dough, wheat, light lemon and coriander.  Medium light with a nice citrus tang to cut the wheatiness.  Taste is green banana, Juicy Fruit gum, lemon zest and pith.  Clean and crisp.
I like this one not bad. It’s yeasty and wheaty, cloudy, kind of sweet. It’s a nice refreshing beer.
0.5l bottle. Yes, that’s what I call Weissbier.  Fruity, bubbles I like it! W/O lemon and rice of course!
One of my favorite Weissbier. Very drinkable, with sweet grassy notes on the palate.

Pours lovely light golden and with the expected thick pillowy foam. It has the aroma of sweet banana and some malt. The flavour of this beer has some sourness with an underlying sweetness and a touch tart on the finish. Over all well done.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow with large white fluffy head. Standard wheat beer aromas and flavours. A great example of this type of beer.
Cloudy yellow color with an fin standard weissbier foam. Wheat flavor. Taste is wheat and little yeasty. Good easy drinkable weissbier.
Very nice. Wheaty aroma.good carbonations.soft one the palate and suttle finish.I like the cloudy appearrance
Orange colour...good head retainment, half finger head...distinctive wheat character aroma...easy drinking beer

What if a hefeweizen decided to stick around after summer was done?  It would have to get a little fatter for the winter.  It would have to be full bodied to fit in with all the stouts and porters.  Paulaner is a medium bodied hefeweizen.  Full of that citrusy flavor, yet not light at all.

Bottle.  Pours a golden orange color with creamy white foam head.  Aroma of lemon zest with slight hints of banana and clove.  Sweet lemon taste.  Some banana and clove mixed in.  Decent amount of carbonation.  Gives it a biting mouthfeel.   Tasty.

Bottle. Dark, sunny orange colour, with a very stable, foamy white head. Great aroma with loads aof banana, hefe and some sweet, mellow citruses. Medium-bodied, the taste is rich, banana, hefe, malt, citruses going on there... very ballanced. Light bitter. Very refreshing.
Date: November 23, 2011 Mode: Draft Source: Old Chicago AV Description: Semi-opaque hazy orangish-yellow pour, nice amount of head and lacing, aroma and taste of fruit, bread and spice.
Too much fruit and herbs in this beer that doesn’t suit me that much. It has a great aroma though. Good quality beer....
Bottle shared at a neighbor’s birthday party - like a hefe, but somewhat forced...
12 ounce bottle that poured a a golden yellow color with aromas of banana, clove, and a touch of spiciness.  Flavors of orange peel, lemon zest, banana, clove and a touch of spicy yeast as you drink.
Bottle from Must Wine Bar. Not too shabby. Very easy drinking as far as most hefe’s go. Refreshing and very balanced. Not great but would settle for this

50 cl can. Hazy, hay, somewhat amber liquid with medium to big off-white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, noble hops and some sweetness. Taste is light sweet, light bitter. Quite a lot of wheat and hefeweizen esters. Medium to full bodied with light to medium carbonation. Really nice hefe. One of my favourites in the style.

Bottle 330ml from Parkhill cellars. Great beer, rich and malty. Aromas of caramel, grain, bread. Taste is sweet, with average duration. Palate is thick, with a medium-to-full body. Amber, cloudy, with a frothy head.

0.5L Tesco. Very murky orange, large fluffy white head, lots of bubbles.
Aroma wheaty. 
Sour, starts very fruity/sweet - banana and fades to little aftertaste.
Very thin.
Very drinkable, but fades too quickly.

Deep burnished golden and hazy with a dense, creamy off white head that hangs around pretty well.  Nose is banana cream with vanilla and some spicy phenols in the background.  Flavor is banana and sweet toasty malts with some almost caramelized malts and spicy cloves but very muted.  Just a touch of oxidation.  Mouthfeel is creamy and not thick but not light and watery either.  Somewhat sweet throughout.  Nice. but expected a more pronounced banana and clove character all over.

Me encanta la paulaner naturtrub un delicioso olor a banana y citricos, al paladar el clasico gusto de una buena cerveza de levadura suave pero con aroma intenso deja un after taste bien agradable,decisamente una de las mejores weissbier de Alemania. Muy recomendada

500 ml can imported from the Motherland, thanx Adam! Off clear yellow orange with a big pillowy white head which fades quickly. Coriander, banana yeasty nose, citrusy, wheaty and some spicey flavors, mild bitter finish. Very nice hefe. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
Bottle.  Translucent gold pour with a two finger head.  Aroma of banana and bubble gum.  Taste of banana and apple.  Biting carbonation.
Bottle. Pleasant aromas have caramel & banana. Solid taste a bit fruity. Just a hint of bitter in after tarte.
Tap. Cloudy caramel. Smells a little off- like when you burn popcorn. Reminds me of overdone veggies. Spicy (like baking spices)  and a little harsh on the tongue. Meh- not my thing.
Goudoranje kleur, dik romig wit schuim. Heel mooie geur van bananen, beetje zoetig, veel gist. Smaak zoetig, banaan, fruitig. Erg lekker.
(bottle) hazy orange gold with fluffy white head. Aroma of yeast and clove, some banana. Flavor is clove, banana, sweetish wheat malt.

Draft at Paulaner Brahaus Im Tal, Munich.  Hazy orange pour.  Opaque with a fluffy white head.  Notes of clove and banana on the nose.  Floral and aromatic.  Bubble gum and clove flavor.  Cherry candy notes.  Dry with a moderate bitter finish.  A bit thin, but goes down nice and easy.

Appearance: deep orange, with a thick, foamy just off-white head, which left shimmering, thick curtains of lace.   Aroma: cream of wheat, orange peel, banana, and clove.   Taste: cracked, slightly toasted wheat kernels, with big notes of citrus and banana, with a hint of bubblegum and clove.   Finish: smooth yet crisp and prickly, with an equal balance of flavors slowly fading.   Notes: Wonderful HW.  Flavors were perfectly balanced, and the palate was rich, yet full of an addicting sharp carbonation that kept it fresh and zesty.  Me likey.

This was a nice old brew to round the eek off with. Aromas were pretty nice, with the same banana-ish yogurty body with hints of zest and citrus peel as many other in it’s category. One thing I appreciated about it is that it pulled it’s flavors off using the core ingredients, unlike a certain Young’s brew I tasted recently which put a terrible shudder of doubt in me about craft beers but to the point. Taste was zesty and that yogurty smoothness, but with more of a hoppy bite at the end then say, an Erdinger. Complemented by the alcohol warmth at the back. I liked it more than an Erdinger, but don’t think it carries it’s flavors as smoothly as a Hoegaarden. It almost felt like I was drinking two separate drinks in one, with zesty, wheaty goodness at the start then a totally different, almost typical alcohol/hop flavor at the end. Would have liked them to have married their flavors a bit better. Still, you could do a lot worse.
Cloudy honey with nice head, some lacing.  Taste of caramel malt and wheat balanced by hop bittering.  Excellent easy drinking ale, well worth the time.

Fuller amber than its Weihenstephaner counterpart. Hazy and a white head that subsides in short order. Smells of golden syrup, sweeties and banana bread, mixed and restrained rather than Big floating overt aromas. First impressions on tasting are a huge swirl of fresh bubbles that becomes more sophisticated, sweet and malty as it settles and sits in the mouth leaving a lingering tingling mouthfeel and a soft biscuity coconut finish.
Bottle. Hazy Yellow/Orange. Cloves and spicy yeast. Some banana. Another textbook wheat beer. One of my favourites among the standard range of Hefe.

Can, 50 cl: Cloudy orange yellow color with a rather short but creamy head. A sour wheaty malt-note that hits your nose right away folowed by fruity aromas and a tiny yeast note. Not as intense and fresh as other comparable german wheat beers. Taste is rather simple: Sweet fruity with slight notes of banana. Creamy dry mouthfeel. As expected next to no bitterness, but it’a also strangely non-spicey. Short mild finish. Not bad, but lacks charachter.
Tap. Yellow pour with a big white head. Aroma and taste is grain, banana, but mostly cloves. Very tasty, and better cold.

Drank from the bottle, so can’t comment on the appearance, aroma from what I got was yeasty and quite fruity, more the other wheats I’ve had, fruity taste with smooth finish, crisp and bubbly. Not bad
Tap. Pours a muddy dark yellow. Smells of cloves with a slight grapefruit aroma. Taste is smooth, with the subtle grapefruit coming through; a delicious clove finish. I like this!

My standard Hef. Cloudy yellow orange with an average head. Standard bread, wheat nose, with hints of yeast spice and Hefeweizen yeast. The flavor is more wheat, yeast, spice, and less fruity banana, which I prefer.  Good palate, and great overall.
Nice look, hazy golden body with a white head. Fruity aroma where there is a distinct scent of banana and obvious some  wheat in smell. Good taste with some fruits and some cereals.

Hazy yellow/orange beer, thick creamy head. Sweet malty aroma, wheat, lots of breadiness, yeast, ripe banana, strawberries, cloves and a dash of herbal hops. Fresh and bready taste is dryish, wheaty and slightly grainy with a decent amount of yeasty fruitiness. A hint of toasted almonds in the finish. Sour/yeasty finish with light bitterness. Light to medium body, high carbonation. Mellow, wheaty aftertaste. Solid, traditional hefeweizen.

Appearance: pours a beautiful orange-brown color with a white pillowy head that quickly disapates.  
Nose: Bananas;
Mouthfeel: creamy, 
Taste: bananas, .
Overall:    Delicous.  One of my favorite beers.  Franziskaner and Weihenstephaner don’t have that thick creamy body and imho a creamy body is a nicer touch than the lighter/more effervescent ones.

(Flasche in 0,5l Weißbierglass) Das hefetrüb Weißbier ist Dunkelgelb mit einer feinen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist Stark Hefig mit einer Spur hopfen. Geschmacklich ist es leicht vollmundig-hefig mit einem würzig-hopfigen Abgang. Insgesammt wetwas enttäuschend.

Bottle 50cl. Murky golden with off-white head that has big bubbles and they dissapear soon; any way, the rest of the time the beer maintain a fine layer of head. Aroma to malt and wheat but also citrus and banana are present. Taste to fresh malts, sweet fruits. On palate it is a light beer, with soft carbonation and perhaps with some watery final.

Bottle(s).  So, I’ve purchased many of these, independently, throughout the summer with intention of rating one live.  Well, this beer is so perfect for quick summer drinking that I would continuously just grab one and go and never get around to rating it.  I’m not sure I can really say anything else more positive about this beer than that, so I’m just going to stop there.  Here’s to next summer, where I plan on doing it all over again.  Cheers.

On tap.
Cloudy dull orange pour with lots of frothy head.  Nose of wheat, clove, banana, and cereal grains.  Lots of wheat in the flavor with a bit of citrus.  Creamy mouthfeel and quite refreshing.  I usually only drink this once at year at Addison Oktoberfest.

Poured from bottle into a weizen glass. Appearance is densely hazy copper with a silky white head of foam that lingers. Aroma is tart orange peels. Taste is mildly bready, cheerios, bananas, and maybe a touch of cinnamon. The tartness from the aroma is just detectable on the tip of the tongue as a nice tingle.Quick finish and a light doughy aftertaste. Very easy drinking.

16.9 oz bottle. Label says "Best Before 2/12." Alc. 5.5% ABV. Pours a cloudy orange with a large cream-white head that collapses faster than the Weihenstephaner I drank before this. Aroma is a little bit of wheat. I’m not getting as much of the hallmark German Hefe scents. Faint banana maybe. Bubblegum comes out in the flavor. Highly carbonated and light-bodied. Tasty, but it pales next to the Weihenstephaner.

Murky, deep golden color with a medium, frothy, white head which diminishes to a small, creamy, white head. Thick, creamy lacing. The nose is spicy and malty. Soap, clove, honey and lemon. The flavor mirrors the spicy, malty aroma and then delivers a big blast of lemon zest. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, semi-dry, tart finish.

0.5l at paulaner bar. Pours thick hazy golden orange. Aroma what you’d expect from a Bavarian hefe, taste what you’d expect. Leans slightly more towards the spicy side, clovey, cinnamon. You’ve had one, you’ve had them all...

Efter det utseendet med en fantastisk krona som aldrig verkade vilja krympa, och efter de dofterna av frukter och blommor, var smaken dessvärre en besvikelse. Inte alls dålig, men långt ifrån de bästa i den här kategorin av öl. Synd. Den lovade ju så mycket.

On tap at kaiserhof restaurant. Pours a translucent gold color with a small white head. The aroma was classic hefe with banana and bubblegum. The taste was similar lots of bubblegum and banana with a touch of spicy hops. The palate was light and crisp and appropriate for the style with light carbonation. The finish was long with lingering wheat. Overall: Very tasty stuff on tap. Paired surprisingly well with sauerbraten.

Draught. Cloudy, hazy yellowish gold with a large, billowy, white head. Aroma is banana, bubblegum, some sour wheat. Taste begins as banana with a strong undercurrent of sour wheat and finishes as bubblegum with the same undercurrent of sour wheat. Nice.
3/5 i mörkhet. Luktar fruktigt besk. Fruktig, beskt fyllig smak med en söt besk eftersmak.
On botlle. Lighly muddy, yellow with high head. Aromas of banans and corn. Slightly metallic taste, some wheat and bananas.
Bottle, light aroma with a hint of wheat. Undifferentiated flavor appeals to the masses.
Bottle. Cloudy and golden with a white head. Typical hefe. Citrus, yeasty and spicy flavor and aroma. Medium bodied.

Brilliant German Hefeweizen. Very well balance of aroma’s with banana, vanilla and hops. It’s overall taste is very rich and it’s aftertaste is nicely sweet. Pours in a thick orange/yellow colour with a big white foam head.

Draft in Berlin.
Dorée-orangée trouble, col épais blanc.
Beau profile d’esters, note de banane et fruits tropicaux avec une pointe d’épices et d’amertume. Plais reste épais et agréable avec un profile de froment et levure. Reste une classique dans le style mais pas la meilleure.

Great hefeweizen. Good body, great carbonation, great taste. Maybe the best hefeweizen that I have had, and I’ve tried quite a few. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great cloudy pale orange colour with a big white head. Smooth and very easy drinking palate. Cereal, banana, vanilla, yeast, great aroma. Top class weiss flavour with banana and wheat. Great. (8/5/8/5/18)
Cloudy orange body with a white head. Banana, wheat and some vanilla in the aroma. Incredibly smooth and refreshing body. Great yeasty flavour with wheat and banana.
Amazing colour, pleasant aroma, quite strong yeast flavour in the end. Very good but not exactly my type.
Nice hefe weisbier but not the best iv had but is still really nice beer at a good price

50 cl bottle. Rated on 22.6.2011

Slightly light aroma has banana esther and wheat. Flavour is slightly light too and a bit too straightforward and sweet. It has somewhat ripe banana and some wheat. A bit too light hefe for me.
(This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)
En trevlig weissbier. Den klassiska doften av banan. Något mer karaktär av humle än med många andra weissbier gjorde att jag uppskattade den.
Bottle. For a larger brewery this is an outstanding hefeweizen. Notes of banana. Yellow and little cloudy. Bready. Very tasty and refreshing.

50cl. bottle from a local supermarket. It pours a hazy light-amber liquid with a high bubbly and spongy white head that lasts beautifully throughout the beer and leaves some lacing. It looks very lively carbonated. The aroma has some grassy hop notes, vanilla and bananas along with an obvious wheaty character, a little yeast and a distant malty base. Not very intense, but complex as it evolves, and nice overall. It tastes likewise but intenser, with more notorious fruity notes of bananas, some distant mild spices and a little citron. It also has a malty touch of caramel. It is medium sweet and has a characteristic and pleasant slight sour touch. In the mouth it feels mild but lively carbonated, thick and creamy, with a medium-full body. It ends dry and very slightly bitter, with a nice aftertaste of bananas, yeast, wheat and a distant herbal hoppiness. Presentation is nice and leaves clear it is a hefeweizen. Pretty cool beer for hot days; a perfect thirst-quencher, but with quite a body.

11.2oz bottle.  Cloudy orange tan.  Thick, creamy off-white head.  Delicate, sweet banana aroma.  Quite yeast forward as to style, this is a great Hefeweizen.  Medium bodied, with a slight orange-clove-citrus tanginess up front, fades into creamy yeastiness.  A little bit bigger and fuller feeling that typical.  Fresh, refreshing, quite enjoyable.  Well done, classy example of the style.

0.5l bottle. A classic beer that it’s been quite a while since I’ve tastes. Pours a hazy almost glowing- orange body with a massive everlasting fluffy white head. Aroma is light yeasty, wheat, oranges with hints of banana and cloves. Really light drinkable! Has a oily mouthfeeling, average carbonation and it’s medium-bodied. Nice and refreshing flavors. Wheat, yeast, oranges, grass, with a mild watery finish and a light sweet and yeasty aftertaste. Really the beer I’ wanted and needed just now. So light to drink and it really killed the dry mouth I had some minutes ago.

Pour is creamy yellow with a large frothy bone-white head. Aroma is of bananas, citrus, and a little bit of sourdough. Flavor is heavy on the banana with some other fruity esters shining through. Pretty bland, but very drinkable.

From a 330ml bottle on 22/7/2011. My bottle was 5.5% and labelled ’Hefe-Weizen’. Pours a murky apricot colour with a big, fast disappearing head. Has a nice aroma of banana and rye bread. Flavour wise, there’s sweet ripe banana, a bit of tangy citrus, and spices. A very nicely put together hefe.
Pours a dirty copper color with a nice thick white head.  Yeasty aroma.  Nice wheat flavor with a lot of bananna and some spicy clove.  Creamy mouth feel, a very good hefeweizen.

Out of a bottle.  I am a fan of Weissbier.
Pours Bright Gold with a frothy head.
Smells yeasty. Not my thing. 
I don’t taste much with a mineral feel.
I wouldn’t describe it as pleasent when compared to other white wheats but manageable.
Won’t be stocking up on this.

Bottle. Pours clear gold with a reasonably sized white head; pour the last inch or so of the bottle for some cloudiness. The aroma is yeast, nectarine, and a touch of spruce. The flavor is almost identical to the aroma, but with more spruce. Toward the bottom of the glass it gets zestier. Predictable, but okay.
This is the beer that introduced me to wheat beers and I thought it was an amazing beer but now after I tried a few others I think of it as above average.

0,5 l can, banana, citrus,spicy..... nice cloudy golden with white head, nice taste of spicy banana, wheat, light sour...medium body with some creamy texture....average carbonation... nice bitter finish....

500ml Bottle.  Appearance is golden, yellowish orange color with copious amounts of frothy, off-white head.  Aroma is sweet and fruit on the front end moving into a somewhat earthy spicy note.  Taste is fruity with a typical Hefeweizen banana flavor along with some cloves and toffee.  There’s also an uncharacteristic citrusy tartness that tends to override the fruit esters, especially toward the finishing.  Palate is medium-bodied, slightly thin, foamy carbonation, and a astringent finish.  This is an average Hefeweizen with some very noticable weaknesses.
Sweet and spicy banana nose. Toasty and fresh in the mouth with a long toffee finish.  Smooth and sleek. A very, very nice weiss.

I’m not going to describe this. It has almost 1800 ratings so it’s useless to more or less copy what others already wrote. It’s just a normal hefeweizen like there are tons of others. Nothing special. Drink, rate, forget.
Typical hefeweizen beer. To some that might be a good thing, to me it’s not particularly. In it’s style it’s good though. To me it’s too sweet and to much the same like tens of others hefeweisbieren.

Beautiful, hazy, pale-amber beer with a white head. The aroma has subtle tones of cloves and banana and a rather dominant citrus (lemon and lime, not orange) character that works very well and would have merited higher marks if it were a little less subdued. To the palate it feels thin but creamy, making it very refreshing and extremely easy to drink. The taste is dominated by the wheat and isn’t bitter or sour at all. The finish is completely dry and gentle. It leaves some of the ester and citrus notes on the mouth, and also a mineral feel, but neither sticks around for too long. The malts don’t really come through. Overall, this is a very pleasant, tried-and-true wheat beer that one could drink all day, but it’s just really unexciting.

Bottle. Poured with the yeast created a dense murky gold with big foamy head. The aroma has a healthy dose of banana and clove, balanced and fermented well, a nice spicy honeycomb malt undetones. Flavors are spritzy orange, while banana and clove play more of an understated role, peppery yeast finish. Clean, crisp, and refreshing makes for a good hefe, the banana and clove notes are also nicely muted as more interesting citrus and pepper. A very good Hefeweizen that I’m surprised I’m just now trying. It was $22/case at Costco! Might be my go to summer beer this year!

three-finger head; cloudy orange-yellow; very nice carbonation; sweet sheet of lacing. pleasant, gentle lemon hanging over yeasty smell. very smooth, pleasant wheat beer; clarity of the flavor is amazing; low hopped; great solid rendition of the classic purity laws
Had this on a beautiful day on Father’s Day. I hate to make this comparison, but it tastes like a Blue Moom with the orange already in it. Outstanding weiss beer.

Can. Pours a nice golden orange color with a frohty white head. Aroma is of banana, spice in the way of clove, some wheat and bubblegum. Flavor is again of ripe banana, some dry wheaty notes, bubblegum, subtle spice with notes of clove, some fruity esters from the yeast, and some breadiness. The body is light with a slightly dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty nice Hefe, but not as good as Schneider or Weihenstephaner.

A very well made hefeweizen that looks really good and is a joy to drink overall. It is smooth, has good carbonation and is great all round. A real nice hefeweizen that I look forward to trying again & again. * * * 1001 beers to try, visit: www.abarwithnoname.wordpress.com * * *

Säuerlich, leicht hefig aber vor allem wässrig startet das Paulaner. Herb wird es anschließend auch, zum Nachgeschmack hin wird das Bier säuerlicher, auch wenn sie sich immer im annehmbaren Bereich befindet. Im Nachgeschmack wird es zwar auch noch mal hefig, trotzdem kann das Bier nicht überzeugen und kommt insgesamt zu lasch rüber. 	 
Test vom 26.12.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 14,9,9,8,11,8 - 9,05

Pint on tap @ Flying Saucer, KC, MO. So nice and refreshing on a hot day. Hit the standards, bubble gum, banana, sweet almost butterschotchy, loads of wheat and a solid yeast with a great balance of hops.  I like German wheats and i don’t order this often but it never disappoints. I will probably have a couple more by the time the summer is done.
Cloudy dark yellow with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, fruity, yeasty, citrus and coriander. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light acidic finish. 040611
Cloudy brown. Lots of head. Sweet. Aroma of wheat malt and yeast. Smell of the same.

Bottled, 50 cl. Pours cloudy amber with an irregular white head. Aroma: Banana. Fruits, citrus. Malt. Yeast. Earthy tones. Taste: Over medium sweetness, slight tartness. Palate: Soft bodied, a bit thin. Average carbonation. Pleasant and traditional hefeweizen.

On tap at Paulaner Bräuhaus in München. Poured orange in colour with white fluffy head. 
Sweet wheat and yeast mostly in aroma. Sweet wheat with banana notes in flavour. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Medium carbonated. Sweetish fruity banana aftertaste.
On draft at Huppel, The Hague.  Refreshing, good enough beer but notes of banana in the flavor spoil it slightly.

50ml on tap at Huppel in the Hague
Cloudy blond colour.  Decent head.  Nice refreshing beer

Looks great with a big white head above a hazy orange beer. Aroma has some citrus like lemon and lime and some spice yeastiness. Flavour is incredibly fresh and easy to drink. Didn’t cost any effort to finish my 500ml glass. Really good beer to enjoy in the sun with some cheese

330ml bottle. Pours cloudy yellow-orange with fizzy head. This beer has the aroma and taste typical of a good hefe-weiss, orange and citrus, spice, banana, grains. But I also got a little smokey roast taste out of it, which makes it just that much more interesting. Really good beer, and thoroughly enjoyable on a summer day.

500 ml bottle, best before 6/11. Would have liked this to be a little fresher, but what do you do? Pours a beautiful hazy copper with a surprisingly small off-white head. Head retention is so-so--but it looks beautiful! Smell is subdued tropical fruit sweetness with just a hint of spice. Smooth and balanced, with a bit of bubble gum. Taste is like the smell but a little muted with a bit of mineral. Much more wheat, with less spice and fruit. It’s smooth, but the carbonation bites a little more than I’d like. All in all, really good stuff, and compares favorably to the NG Dancing Man I had earlier in the day.
Nice and cloudy, lasting white head. Typical wheat beer fruitiness but well balanced with the grain.
Nice color, great taste. Banana comes forward, very fresh for spring and summer days, don’t mind drinking it in winter too ;)
Aromatic, good appearance, a GREAT beer to drink on.. forever. Much better than macroswill.
Well balanced, not too sweet or citrusy, noticeable wheat taste and no strong fruit flavours

Fine head, lasting, cloudy
deep banana, a little burnt caramel, honey.
Medium body some length
Lighter taste than nose, light fruit, raspberries, sweetnes,
Fine Hefe

Pours copper cloudy, medium  sized and lasting head. Malty sweet aroma, scent of banana. Flavor is sweet malt and yeasty. Finish is a bit empty but with some noticable sweetness. Palate is medium bodied, smooth, bit watery. Medium/high carbonation. Overall a decent beer.
Great balance wheat beer! Some citrus some maybe banana hints. Great refreshing beer.

0.5L bottle, 5.5°, from Billa AG. Dark hazy golden orange, fruity an sweet scent, very nice head. Typical banana and citrus taste, a feel of herbs, very smooth and pleasing. Quite dense, sticky, yeasty, sweet but also dry. Very nice one.
draft - tasty hefe. plenty of clove, bananas, touch of cream. Sweet touch of caramel, dry wheaty body with plenty of grains. A bit old tasting but that’s not Paulaner’s fault, I’m sure.

Fairly standard authentic Hefe, no frills, no drawbacks, just straightforward wheat beer.  The bananas and cloves are apparent but subdued, leaving more-lagerlike flavors to guide the brew along.  The cloudiness of the appearance is nice, but the head is fleeting and thin, as is the nose.  You can get by on Paulaner’s chief wheat beer, but there’s plenty better to be had.

0,5 l. can from the supermarket. Golden orange colour with an off-white lasting head. This hefeweizen has a soft aroma with a hint of banana.  Banana, bubble gum, and citrus are the key ingredients in the taste. A good beer to drink in the sun on a summer’s day. Very good price - taste ratio.
Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium white head. Nose of Bananas, Clove, Yeast. Body is medium at best. Taste of Bananas and cloves. Very smooth. After a round of golf it’s delicious!
Bière blanche de 5.5 % d’alcool. Goût de froment très élevé, bière légèrement fade. Je compare cela à boire de l’eau avec du sel dilué. Pas super !
Imported from Beerseek, no description given with original rating. Need to re-rate beer.

20 April 2011, bottle. tan-orange colour, very hazy, some bubbles, big frothy head that fades fast. great weissen nose. soft bananas, cloves, spicy wheat. disappointing body. thin and slightly creamy and slightly fizzy. tastes like a frothy banana smoothy w/ some spices. nice but not great.

Beautiful hazy amber golden colour, firm and fluffy white head. 
Aroma of malts and some vanilla, not much more can escape through the thick fluffy foam pillow.
Flavour of banana, malts, weizen, toffee, vanilla and yeast. Moderately sweet, almost no hop bitterness. Some lingering banana and sweetness in the finish. Most common weissbier, but setting a good benchmark.
(from tap)

50cl bottle. It pours a cloudy amber/gold colour with fantastic head and steady bubbles. The nose is not quite as intense in the usual banana and toffee but it is there all the same. The banoffee is confirmed on the taste but less sweetness than expected .The palate has a big structure, a very creamy texture, yet a clean finish. Great beer and more balanced than a lot of this style.

A cloudy dark yellow/gold fills my glass all the while a big fluffy friend sits atop asserting his foamy brilliance.  Aroma is very light with hints of yeasty bananas.  Flavor is definitely on the mellow side of the German Hef scale: malty bananas with the slightest lingering of clove.  I don’t get any bubblicious in this brew.  Body is light and creamy.  Another great summer sipper.
Cloudy and yellow color, a big and creamy white head. Aroma is yeast and some banana. Taste along the same tracks,  yeast, banana, malts and hay. Mouthfeel ok. Quite nice overall.

The beer pours a hazy, cloudy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is a wonderful mix of wheat, bananas and cloves. All of the aromas mix very well together and make the aroma very inviting. 

The flavor is also very nice. The predominant notes I get are wheat and bubblegum. I also get some nice banana and clove notes.

Medium, creamy mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Nagyon gusztusos opálos sötétsárga szín.
Erős édes kukoricaillat. Érezni a komlót rendesen de a vége még sem keserű.
Nagyon ott van. Csapolva kóstoltam.

Drink by/best-by date is 4/2011

Cloudy orange, with nice creamy off-white head,taking it’s time to fizzle away,sticks around for a good while. Creamy white lacing,fairly thick. Wow.

Tartness,malt backbone, with some good nuttiness,fruits,maybe peanuts?? Nice aroma, a good hint of what’s to come.

Sweet taste of banana,nuts fruits with good malt balance.Light carbonation,light bodied and smooth. Great for a those coming soon(hopefully) hot summer days.

Another solid German session brew, from a respectable brand. Look forward to having more.

330ml bottle.  Pours a cloudy light amber with a decent sized white head.  Aromas of banana, clove, dough, spiced apple.  Taste is almost malty, with some wheat bitterness, yeast, and faint citrus.  Good stuff.

Bevuta al Lockness Pub di Roma. Aspetto dorato chiaro torbido tipico delle weisse, non molto allettante alla vista. Aroma di frumento, malto, lievito, banana. In bocca risulta grezza, amara, stucchevole. Corpo medio. Deludente.
I love this kind of hefe-weissbeer. nice aroma, wonderful taste and no hangover at the next day.

@ brewpub. Murky ochre color with thick lasting head. Aroma is floral and spicy. Flavor-wise, the banana really esters kick in but they are clean and good. Surprisingly well-made.
Earlier Rating: 10/27/2007 Total Score: 3.4
Pours dark gold and hazy. The ample, excited head left me little lacing. Smell is predominantly rotten apple and yeast. Taste includes orange cream, overripe banana, and anise at the end, but remains relatively dry in spite of it all. Airy mouthfeel as if the beer evaporates on the tongue. Low amount of stickiness, which can be a problem in weissbier. It is a solid one but from the bottle lacks the depth of character it might have in Munchen...bottle in Guilin poured by server without the yeast is strangely clear but with very thick lasting head. Aroma is fruity and not just banana but rather also yellow plum and fresh fruit skins. Soft velvet palate is smooth and goes down really well. Not sticky. Smooth easy weizen with orange as the predominant flavor. Solid. 6-3-7-4-13

Bready hay aroma with hints of alcohol. Pours a beautiful hazy golden orange. Sediment settles beautifully underneath an impressive and disciplined white head, leaving a cloudy golden orange hefe-weizen. Medium-sweet taste that reminds you of the wheat and yeast inside. Perfectly-balanced full body that has an impressively creamy/thin texture. (Also, I might add that the water this beer is made out of must be among the purest on earth!!! Comparable to the freshness of Samuel Smiths). Soft carbonation that accentuates this amazing water taste. Amazingly long, smooth finish is the cherry on top of the banana split. The finest hefe I’ve ever had and among the best beers crafted. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Great crisp German weizen offering. Despite being unfiltered, pours very nicely and settles with a pleasant golden cloudiness. Back end provides a tiny bite that pleases the palate.

500 mL bottle from Tesco poured into a pint glass.  Orange cloudy beer with a good head on it.  Smells fresh and wheaty.  Easy on the palate and surprisingly mild.  Not your average wheat beer, its got something about it, the barley/wheat blend adds something.  Can’t wait to taste it in its home town soon.

This is probably my favorite hefe-weissbier largely because the citrus flavor is more mild than what is found in some of the others. It pours with an light and opaque amber color, culminating in a very large white head. The aroma features some mild citrus references, along with hints of bananas, wheat and clove. The sweetness in taste comes with citrus, caramel and bananas, but I’ve never managed to find the clove flavor that is featured in the nose.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with large excellent weiss head. Banana and clove with some grassiness in aroma. Banana and spices also in flavor. Nice long lasting finish.
Pours a dark cloudy orange with an off white head. Aroma is very wheaty with fruit. Taste starts frutiy and sweet then turns a little drier. Pretty nice Weiß.
Heavy wheat action on the nose. Balanced taste. Pours with a thin head with no lacing. Very clean and dry finish.
Pours a light brownish hazy color. Aroma of tropical fruits and yeasty fruits. Taste add some light hops and sweetness from the fruits and malts.

pours cloudy golden, with a fluffy white head.  the aroma is wheat, yeast, and small amount of hops banana and bubble gum.  the flavor is very clean, with citrus, orange peel, and some malt. this is so good.. i cant stop drinking it!
The best outside summer beer, ciruts notes on notes, lemon peel, oranges etc, the body as a very light complexity to it, very attractive, keeps you going back for more, i love it
Pours out a very cloudy light amber. Has a nice white head to it. Get a little bit of a citrus aroma. A very clean taste, a mixture of banana and citrus.
Out of bottle pours a light amber with large white head.  Very smooth taste.  One of the best Hefe-weizen I have tried.
Aroma is wheat and big bananas/bubble gum.  The flavor is bananas, bubble gum, wheat and mild/medium sweetness/tartness in the finish.

Six-pack from ABC Liquor. Pours an orange body under a sizeable white head with plenty of slow-sifting lacing. Rice and vanilla in the nose. Flavors include citrus, coriander, orange peel, subtle piney hops mixed with green apple in the finish. Soapy yeast presence. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Refreshing, but rather generic for the style.

500ml bottle. Fluffy one finger lacing & lasting white head; cloudy light orange body. Bubblegum aroma. Estery, lemon, banana & yeast hefe profile. Subdued bitterness, fruity, crisp & very refreshing. A real an easy drinker. Fairly light in terms of body, full carbonation with a short, dry finish.

Bouteille de 33cl. Bière dorée voilée, pas blanche mais quelque peu orangée. Nez de levure, clou de girofle et de blé. La bouche est rafraichissante, agréable, bon goût de levure, de clou, d’épices. Quelle légèreté !! Elle est soyeuse, mais qu’est-ce qu’elle est gouteuse.
A solid Bavarian Hefeweissbeir. It has everything you want, bubblegum, lemon, wheat, clove, and banana.

A very good brew.

12 oz. bottle, into 16 oz. Shaker

Appearance: 2" of beautiful, frothy head that disappeared very slowly.  Dark orange color, very cloudy.  Appearance is right-on for the variety.

Aroma: Typical Hefe notes.  Heavier on banana than some hefes - I like the mixture of aromas here.  Yeastiness is also present, but not overwhelming.

Taste: Delicious.  Perfect amount of sweetness. 

Palate: Appropriate amount of carbonation - not exceedingly bubbly -- just right.  Creamy texture, and relatively heavy body for a hefe.  One off note in this beer is the slightly bitter finish that I was not expecting.

Overall: A very good hefe.  Not as good as some of the best, but for what is really a macrobrew, this is very good.  My main reservation on this, which resulted in the slightly downgraded aroma and overall scores, was that this hefe seemed to lack character.

12 oz bottle poured a hazy yellow with very little light passing thru. Thin white head.  Great lacing. Aroma of bananas and bubblegum. Perfect traditional hefe, appearance and nose.  Rather highly carbonated. Taste is dead on with the nose. Medium – full  bodied. This finish is a bit dry. Therefore, making it a little less drinkable.  Still a fantastic brew.  But I would choose Mahr’s before this one.
