Pours cloudy orange with two fingers of fluffy white head. Smells citrusy, and a little malty. Tastes wheat, slight orange peels and faintly of bananas. Medium-bodied, creamy texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Paulaner Natural Wheat Hefe-Weizen finishes sweet and citrusy.

bottle.  Pours hazy orangish reddish color with fluffy off white head.  Aroma of banana, sweet tropical fruit, dough, spiced wheat.  Medium bodied, smooth, creamy but well carbonated mouthfeel.  Flavor is at first crisply spiced wheat, with some banana and clove, which moves to a finish of sourdough and lemon.  This is the prototypical hefeweizen, very nicely done, a traditional classic and symbol of the style.

Not a hefe man, and this was a bit less than I expected. Solid and easy, this is the macro version of a hefe. Not going to offend anyone, but the flavour is cleft, with the clove and banana very much in the background.
22-jan-2011. 50cl bottle at beer tasting. Nice ambergold cloudy beer with silky head. Strong sweet aroma, and pretty sweet taste. Nice refreshing beer, I liked this one very much.

Tämä on oranssinen ja samea hefe kohtalaisen runsaalla, mutta katoavaisella valkoisella vaahdolla. Banaanisen hedelmäinen ja vehnäinen tuoksu. Maussa on kypsiä banaaneja ja vehnää. Selkeän simppeli hefe, jossa mukavan runssa suutuntuma ja reilusti hiilihappoja.

Rating #488, bottle from Lagersalget 
 


A beautiful dark yellow beer with a nice head. Aroma is straw and a certain fruityness, but not specifically banana. Flavors are banana and straw finished with a light bitterness and a bit alcohol. Medium palate.
I like the touch of alcohol that prevents the beer from giving a too sweet impression, as it is the case with many other weissbiers.
pours cloudy golden with a more than decent head. tender wheat and malts, fresh. spicy (clove) and bananas, not too much though. dry finish. classic and very good.
La hefe-weizen più ritrovabile d’Italia, infatti si trova anche in ferramenta ormai... Però per essere sinceri è sempre una discreta bevuta...
This is the first Hefeweizen I’ve drunk. Yeast flavour, very persistent froth, cloudy blond and fruity. Not extremely special, but drinkable and refreshing.
Grate traditional hefewiezen.I have had it many times but must have neglected to rate it. Smooth, crisp and refreshing with a great mouthfeel.
Pours a nice dark opaque golden. Smell is of wheat and banana. Less banana on the taste. Light in body and flavor, but quite enjoyable.

Poured a cloudy golden color.  Aroma of fresh fruits, bananas, lite malt hop flavor.  Taste is lite to med sweetness but has a drier finish.  Lite bodied.  Slick body. Ave carbination. Nice smooth dry hefeweissen flavor.
Glowing light orange in color. Good head. Nice crisp citrus nose. Tastes like a heffy, just not my thing.

Szinte világító narancs színe van, hatalmas, hófehér kemény habbal, gyönyörű. Illata banános, élesztős és kissé fűszeres, borsos. Telt ízében a finom búzamalátához csatlakozik egy erős banáníz, olyan banánpuding amiben friss banándarabok is vannak, megszórva egy kis szerecsendióval, fahéjjal és narancshéjjal. Pont eléggé testes, és száraz, malátás utóíze van. Tápláló, szomjoltó, és nem utolsó sorban valami iszonyatosan finom...
Thick white head with a hazy and cloudy gold-dimmed body. Yeasty, with wheat, fruity notes (especially banana) and citrus. Looks as good as it tastes. Very nice! Much enjoyed!
Cloudy with big white head. Wheat and yeast in the aroma. Taste of banana, wheat and yeast. Quite good for a weissbier.

Dåse 500 ml.  Diset gylden farve, med et stort varigt hvidt hovede. Mild aroma af hvede og en snert nellike. Smag af banan og en smulle krydderi. Lidt for blød eller vandet i smagen. Mangler bid og virker meget flad i afslutningen. Giver den en chance på et andet tidspunkt. DK-B-30,00

Typical warming banana, clove, and fresh citrus esters on the nose, palate and aftertaste, which lend a sweetness that betrays an otherwise dry and crisp finish.  Attractive deep orange haze with a resilient German foam.  Pleasant medium body.  Slight vodka notes at the back of the palate, which slightly dampen an otherwise classic German wheat ale.  Consumed from a Zwei Maß Bierstiefel.

Bottle @ home into a Paulaner Weissbier glass. Cloudy, a touch brownish, colorful orange appearance with a big white head tinged with orange. Big, clove phenols, banana, moderate citrusy fruity esters, fairly spicy yeasty, sweet wheat malty, mild bubblegum aroma. Fairly spicy yeasty, big clove, moderate banana, orange, lemon, bubblegum, sweet wheat malty flavor. Somewhat citrusy, spicy yeasty aftertaste. Probably my second all-time favorite weissbier only surpassed by Weihenstephaner’s offering. I never tire of having a Maß or five Maß of this.

Draught @ Kaefer’s Restaurant Dachgarten, Berlin

Pours cloudy deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and clove. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

I’m a very big Paulaner fan.  Thick, foamy head that lasts.  It has a golden-amber appearance and when it’s held up to the light, you can see a filminess (a consequence of its being Naturtrüb).  A banana bread like aroma with a taste to match it.  The sweetness becomes quickly bitter, bordering on horseradish, then, in aroma.  The palate is full and dry.  It has a creamy, thick texture with lively combination.  Its finish is its weak point, bordering on unpleasantly bitter and tinny.

Currently the most rated beer I haven’t rated. 500 mL bottle from Harris Teeter Barracks, Charlottesville, VA. Pours a hazy orange with a tight offwhite fizzy head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of bread, stone fruits, clove. The taste is caramel, bread, banana, pear, peach and a faintly spicy finish. Medium bodied. Pretty nice.

Poured from a 500mL bottle into a traditional weizen glass.

A: Pours a dark apricot peach color with a torrent of bubbles rising upward before joining the monstrous four-finger head that has emerged after a standard pour. Lacing is left behind as the wavy head finally begins to recede.

S: Initial whiff is of course the German hefe yeast. This one seems to favor banana and, to a lesser extent, clove over the third member of the triumvirate--bubblegum. I’m also detecting a faint hint of nuttiness, which adds a nice touch. As it warms up, a little bit more bubblegum characteristic comes through, replacing some of the initial banana.

T: Surprisingly, a good amount of malt comes through alongside the yeast in this. The aftertaste, however, is dominated by clove and banana. A little bit of soft pink bubblegum on the palate.

M: Medium body with a good amount of creaminess. Some bitterness comes through. Moderate carbonation.

D: Pretty drinkable, although it doesn’t have the intensity or intricacies that I look for in a really outstanding hefeweizen.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-17-2010
Bottle 330ml. Pours cloudy amber with a yeasty aroma. Didn’t find it too good, will give it a go later to see if I can change my mind :)

Cloudy amber yellow. Medium snowy head. Aroma of sweet malt, citrus and banana notes, yeast.  Smooth and easy mouthfeel that doesn’t feel watery, but pleasantly refreshing. Tastes malty, with strong banana notes, some spice. A good hefe.
Wow! Great beer. Taste is a mix of wheat, bananas, and a certain smokiness. Great hefeweizen
Aroma is yeast, wheat. Taste is banana, a bit sweet, thick and yeast and some spices.

Cloud, light amber appearance. Foamy head. Banana, sweet malt aroma. Medium sweetness. Very little bitterness. Slightly full on the tongue, with a lively carbonation and excellent finish. A great example of its genre. Pairs with German or Polish sausage, mustard, and crackers.

For me, this beer sets the standard for hefe. Hazy straw color with tons of creamy head. Big yeasty aroma. Taste is banana clove and wheat. Sweet mouth full and lively. Again its a great rep of the style.

All the hallmarks of a good hefe here. Lots of banana and some clove in the aroma, a little darker than I expected. plenty of carbonation this beer is a classic example of the German Hefe Weissbier style and it should be. If you want to brew a hefe this beer is a great example.
bottle. Cloudy pale yellow, large white head. Yeasty, whetay, hints of banana. Decent, but there are better Hefeweizenbiere around.
The aroma is of bananas and wheat. The taste is mostly wheat with a light amount of banana and spice. Not my favorite hefeweizen, but not bad either.
500ml bottle.  Pours a really hazy orange with a small head.  Aroma is is nutty, banana and some lemon.  Lemon and nutty start.  Banana and yeasty finish.
Good hefe! Citrusy flavors witha  bit of spice and bubblegum. Add a lemon-wedge and your golden. Light alcohol flavor with finish of bananas and pears. Good hefe!
yellow orange hazy beer.Nice smell,banana,vanila,pear,citrus.Taste sweet wheat malt,banana,spicies,cloves,bitter,light alcohol,citrus.
Again,too sweet for my taste as a heffe-weiss,and I must say I prefer a little more the Dunkel one.Its scents are more intriguing than this,It’s a bit sour this one ...
Not exactly my type of beer, i’ve always found it too unpleasant at the taste

On tap;  Citrus aroma with a hint of spice and wheat to it.  Cloudy, amber body.  Large, white head.  Taste is banana, wheat, and a little sweetness.  Nicely carbonated and finishes dry but sweet.  Medium body.  Outstanding flavor and extremely drinkable.  My favorite Hefe.

Labeled for the US as Hefe-Weizen Ntural Wheat.

Poured from 11.2 oz bottle into a Duvel Tulip.
This beer has a nice large head that subsides very slowly.

The aroma hints of  light bananna and cloves.
Taste is sweet with more bananna and spicy flavors.

Overall this is a great beer with alot of flavor that is easy to drink.
Also a gret beer for those that are not fans of the bitter.

Bottle. Cloudy amber with good head. Pleasant aroma - fruity- bananas. Light body, well carbonated. Sweet fruity start developing a citrusy tang with some hints of pepper and bread with some bitterness in the finish. Nice hefe-weissbier but perhaps the taste falls a little flat after the great foretaste.

Bottle. Cloudy orange body with a fluffy and lasting head. Aroma is unassertive but I detect some citric notes. Taste is solid and wheaty with enough fruitiness to balance it. Great but not as spicy as the very best ones.

12 oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.  A classic example of the style. If you don’t know what a German Hefe is... I feel sorry for you.   Do the research.
I could drink this until I pass-out on the floor.  And then get up the next morning and drink some more. Great drinkability.  If I ever find this on draft, I will count my lucky stars!! And hope I have a DD.

Bottle at fantes. Pours a mellow golden color as you’d expect. 
Good weise taste with banana, and a soft camouflaged bitterness.
Can. Aroma of wheatmalt, banana and yeast. Unclear light amber colour with huge white and soft head. Fruity flavour dominated by banana and wheat. Rather sweet finish. Soft mouthfeel

12 oz bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a hazy orange/amber color with vigorous carbonation shooting up the glass, and a fluffy 3" white head.  Aroma of clove and banana.  Taste is lightly sweet and citrusy, very crisp and refreshing mouthfeel.  Very nice hefeweizen, almost perfect for the style!

Pours hazy yellow/orange with white head, aroma of banana, clove, touch of cinnamon.  Taste up front is nice sweet banana leading into a creamy combination of spices, finishing a bit dry and sweet.  Very nice version of the style.

Orange-yellow cloudy look with a frothy white foam. Spices, herbs and maybe some apricots and banana in the aroma. Herbal, lightly sour, light sweetness and some citrus in the taste, well balanced. Soft carbonation, light-medium body and a nice bit herbal after taste. Very good.

500 ml bottle.

Pours a hazy, deep orange colour with a frothy, lacy head. Aroma of wheat and mild banana. Flavour of wheat, spices, mild hops and some  citrus. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel. Quite pleasant.

Wonderful. Poured a light golden hue with an enormous white head. Upon the first sip, smooth citrus notes play gently in your mouth like Beethoven’s Moonlight Sonata being gently played on a Mahogany piano...earthy yet refined, a true winner. 

K-3.9/5
S-4.1/5

Bottle, pours a hazy yellow-brown with ample carbonation.  Taste is earthy, light clove, low fruity esters.  Wheat and malt on the sweet side, not a robust flavor.  Very thin mouthfeel, a little too watery.  Clean finish, refreshing, not too interesting.

On draft at Teca. Pours a hazy orange with a generous white head. Gorgeous in proper glassware. Aroma is highly citrus. Taste is fruity and juicy, almost thirst quenching. Soft grass malts balance out the citrus nicely. Great hefe.

Tap@Cardinal. Murky pale orange with a creamy off-white head. Aroma is fresh with malts, clove, spices and banana. Sweet and acidic flavors with a metallic hint and the aromas coming through. Driysh mouth feel with a light to medium body and a rich carbonation.
Bottle. Foggy orange colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma of orange. Ful smooth taste with a dry finish. Very nice
Picked up at the local Liquor Store.  Aroma is orange, banana, citrus and clove.  Taste is much of the same.  Great all around hefe
Bottle. Cloudy orange with a fluffy off white head that dissipated fairly quickly. Aroma of banana and apricot. Tastes a little sweet and fruity.  Very easy drinker.
One of the best hefe weiss.  Great yeasty aroma, foamy head that lasts, thick, cloudy, gold.  Clean finish.  Excellent beer.

I couldn’t rememebr if I had ever tried this beer, so I had to have some when I noticed it on tap.  First impressions, the head dissipated quickly and seemed a little flat.  The beer itself looks, smells and tastes like a hefe should, it just wasn’t above and beyond what I expected.  Still a good beer but I will order a Hacker Pschorr the next time I order a weiss.
Very nice hefe; full aroma of banana cloves; nice balance of fresh wheat and spicy notes and quite refreshing

You know, I don’t like most Hefeweizens. I really don’t. This surprises me because I absolutely love this beer. Most Hefs kind of overdue the citrus, are thin, and in general one dimensional. Paulaner assuages my anger of this style with ease, grace, and authority. Pours yellow orange in color. With a very decent head. This beer has all of the orange, lemon, and citrus that often overwhelms me impeccably balanced. Enough malt and sweetness to keep them in check. The beers texture and mouth feel is spot on. Just creamy enough but not too heavy. Good stuff.

Bottle.  I usually don’t like the spicyness in the taste of that style but this is so far and by far the best HW I had, one I’ll buy again for sure.  The aroma is still very salty and spicy but the taste is more discreet with the spicy side, leaving a lot of place for a rich cerealish and grainy-like malty base, a refreshing and crisp citrusy twist and an herbal hop finish.  My reference.
a textbook example of hefewizen.  pours cloudy yellow with a thick white head, it has fruity aroma of banana and a hint of citrus.  the flavor is also banana and yeast with creamy texture.

A - Citrus and bubblegum
A - Hazy gold with with head
T - Nice sweetness with a light bitterness
P - Ample soft carbonation with medium body
O - One of the really good beers

On tap somewhere in Dublin, Ireland.  Poured a clear yellow-gold with a white head.  Nice lacing.  Very good beer.  Easy to drink and crisp, with a little bit of spice to balance out the sweetness.  Had a little bit of a lemon feel to it, but subtle.  Really one of the better one of the style that I’ve ever had.
Ottima weiss, tra le migliori secondo me con un gusto dolce amaro molto gradevole, poca banana al naso e ottima combinazione di lieviti. Fruttata e ben equilibrata.

On tap @ Irish Rover Pub in Denver.  Hazy yellow-orange with a white foamy head that lasts only a little while.  Smelled to me like Bubble Gum and lemon, with some yeast in the background.  Kinda odd.  Taste also had some elements of Bubble Gum but was accompanied by citrus, wheat, and yeast.  It all kinda came together nicely, I might add.  Great medium bodied mouthfeel with medium carbonation, kinda a banana aftertaste.  Weird brew, glad I tried it but I probably won’t again.

Bottle: Pours a golden color, with an average head for a hefe. Aroma is a little yeast, a little dough, and spices. Flavors are similar, added with your typical hefeweizen characters of citrus, clove, but it goes down a little bitter for me.

Bottle @ home. Hazy yellowish orange, medium off hwite head.
Aroma of, well, hefe, banana, lemon spice, the usual.
Flavour is the same. Standard but nice hefe.
Cloudy golden color with a big head. Aroma of yeast, citrus and yeast. Some spice, dry, not very bitter or sweet. Medium body.

Poured from a 11.2 ounce bottle into a weizen glass.

Appearance: Pours an opaque golden brown with yellow tones. Enormous 8 finger off-white frothy head which stays around for what seems like an eternity. Moderate lacing.

Smell: Banana, cloves and wheat are the dominant aromas with hints of citrus.

Taste: Sweet up front with banana and wheat dominating. Hints of spice, orange and cloves in the middle followed by sweetness and mild phenols at the finish. Aftertaste is bittersweet.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied with a very low amount of carbonation. Very smooth. A little bit too light for my liking.

Drinkability: Excellent drinkability. This is a great summer beer.

Overall: Very good hefeweizen. This is one that I’ll be going for again.
A good weissbier but still a bit too "flowerish" for my taste. But could be very good cold on a warm summerday.
Large white head and a med orange hazy body. Aroma of wheat, banana and citrus. Fresh, fruity and good. Medium sweet, light bitter.  Very good.
This beer is the embodiment of a hefeweizen. Little-to-no hop bitterness with the wonderful bouquet of a hefeweizen yeast.
Cloudy amber with a big creamy head and lace. Nice fruity, hoppy aroma. Very Tasty! Excellent flavor, and everything perfectly balanced.

for me is the second time taste this beer.
Yesterday with friends from bottele 50 cl; thx to Rik G.
Hazy darkgolden color, with a little white head. 
Aroma fruits, wheat. 
Medium body. Taste :sweet,
fruits, wheat malts, good.
Orange, thick head.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Taste of banana and bubblegum with a clean finish.  Good.
Pours with a nice foam into a orangish cloudy straw color.  Hints of orange zest and citrus.  Very good and worthwhile Hefeweizen to seek out

Completely forgot to rate this one, which has been my favorite standard weizen for a long time. Pours a nice light hazy nougat-brown body with a large white head, persisting for a long time and leaving laces in the glass. Nose is banana and bread, with hints of clove and citric notes. Taste is a light, citric flow of bready sweet malt tones, flanked by some banana and clove. Very nicely blended. Fluffy weizen mouthfeel, just as it’s supposed to be. More citric and light than many of its counterparts, Paulaner is really top of the line as far as commercial macro weissbier is concerned.
Large creamy lasting white head and a thick orange hazy body. Aroma of wheat, banana, hay. Fresh, fruity and good. Medium sweet, very light bitter.
Can 50cl. Nice creamy beer, very refreshing, classic banana smell and wheat, good body. This beer has a sweet creamy palate with a nice hoppy finish which is very nice, good hefeweizen.
on tap at bier market in TO. hazy golden with a lasting white head. wheaty clove aroma. straight forward hefe flavour. full and satisfying in the mouth. decent hefe, id have it again.

Bottle pours a cloudy brownish gold body with a tall and pillowy vanilla head. Aroma of wheat, ripe banana, clove, and coriander. Creamy yet crisp palate. Taste is dominated by ripe banana and clove atop a bready wheat base. Hints of orange and coriander underneath. Delicious!
Decent wheat beer on tap, better than the common few, but had better from bottles. Good price so would definitely drink again soon.

A: The pour is a cloudy copper color with a finger’s worth of white head.

S: A fairly mild, but traditional nose on this beer. Cloves, bananas, and even some orange zest. I didn’t find the nose to be all that intense, but the right aromas are there.

T: Unfortunately, it seemed the flavors where even more muted than the aromas. Sure, the clove and banana where there, but they were mild and muddled, which I did not find all that enjoyable.

M: A slightly watery feel on the tongue with medium body and low to moderate carbonation.

D: A good but not great hefeweizen. I wanted to try this because so many people have told me they enjoy it, but I was not all that impressed.
Bottle @ Bubbles Sanctuary Cove. Hazy gold with a fluffy thick white head. Fruity banana, vanilla & citrus. Excellent German Hefe. Nice find.

Pt. bottle to a weissbier.  Pours golden and cloudy with a pillowy white head.  Nice wheat taste with a good amount of sweet.  Aroma typical for style, lots of clove, citrus and grass.  A very good beer.
bottle. really good weissbier, great smell and palate, spicy and fruity taste.

Színe szép, ködös narancs, habkoronája hozza a fajtájára jellemzőt.
Illata banános/citrusos, fűszeres és gabonás.
Csípősen kezd, teste a búzasörökre jellemző kissé vizes, de nem a kellemetlen fajtából.
Íze gyümölcsös, aromája egy igen kellemes citrusos, gabonás, szegfűszeges és élesztős.
Befejezése fűszeres és száraz.
Szép, étvágygerjesztő külleméhez hasonlóan, ízében és aromáiban is azt hozta, amit az ember egy jó és frissítő búzasörtől elvár.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with fairly small white head. Taste is slightly sour with a hint of sweetness, palate has a creamy texture accenting the sweetness and the hint of bananas and fruits in aromas.
Pours beatiful hazy orange with small off-white Head. Yeast bananas wheat dry hay. Acidy bitter, yeasty and slightly cereal flavor. Acidy sweet sour on palate. Finishes acidy tart.
Banana wheat aroma. Cloudy golden with big white foamy head that thins but stays. Sweet fried bubbly banana taste with a sweet banana wheat aftertaste. Easy drinking.

Le liquide est doré et troublé.  La mousse est élégante et durable.  Arômes et saveurs complexes de banane frite, de malt grillé, de blé, d’épices avec une touche légèrement citrique.  En bouche, le liquide a une effervescence soutenue et une texture crémeuse et légère.  Impression de grande fraîcheur sur la langue et sous le palais.  La finale est aussi pluridimensionnel mais se fait principalement sur des notes acidulés et sur des céréales de blé pratiquement croquantes.  En résumé, superbe.
Pretty good Hefe. Just a bit below what I consider the best hefeweizen. It did have a funky smell that weaved it’s way in and out as I drank it.

12 oz bottle - BevMo



Aroma - classic german hefe aroma...ripe banana, punchy cloves, some light crackery notes with some underlying bubblegum but the banana takes front and center.



Appearance - it really is a perfect pour into the hefe glass.  Cloudy, bright yellow body, a creamy and fluffy white cap and really nice lacework left behind.



Taste - light dried apricots, banana, wheat ...some subtle wet cereal flavor too.  The warmer it gets, some citrus-like notes come out.  Incredibly refreshing.



Palate - smooth, creamy, light bodied, carbonation was suprisingly evident, almost too much



Overall - just a superb summertime beer, easy to knock back several and flavorful enough to keep wanting more.  My 6-pack was gone pretty quickly.
Hazy golden yellow with aromas of banana, clove and citrus. Flavors mirror the aroma.  Fruity, light and refreshing. Smooth on the palate.  Great summer hefe!

Bottled.  Slightly hazed orange, big rocky white head as befits a hefeweizen.  Aroma has a lot of clove, some banana and citrus notes, biscuity wheat.    Light biscuity wheat flavor, more clove and banana, finishes on an odd herbal/floral note.  Pretty watery feeling body, as wheat beers go.  Not my favorite amongst the german hefs I’ve had.

Poured orange/amber with a medium sized white head.  Aroma is creamy and sweet.  Oranges, coriander, and lemon.  Taste is sweet and of oranges.  Slightly tarty. Spices and yeast in the aftertaste.  Slightly watery, but still flavorful.  Not my favorite hefe, but still very good.
Bottle from Csakajosor.hu. Poured orange-amber with a nice white foam. Aroma of citrus, slight banana, vanilla and yeast. Sweet taste in a medium dense body and good carbonation. Fine one!

Hazy orange appearance with a somewhat thick and creamy white head.  Lots of bubbles.  Aroma of banana and some spice.  Taste has a spicy beginning and a smooth finish with notes of banana.  Lingering bitter and spicy aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is smooth, creamy, and light-bodied.  Medium carbonation.  Probably the most complex hefeweizen I’ve ever tasted.
Poured from 12oz bottle into wheat glass.  nice golden, cloudy color with a 3 finger head.  Smells like it should: banana and clove.  Taste is very crisp and nice.  Great hefe...3.7

Man, quite a lovely looking beer. Golden-orange colour and hazy. The nice frothy head left a pretty decent lacing. There is a small bubbly carbonation going on. I can smell a light banana scent. Mmmmm... can taste a slim lemon flavour, and the finish is pretty dry. Makes a great summer beer !
Really nice Weissbier. With the perfect amount of head, is the perfect after work drink, with a proper glass of course.

On tap at Kaiserhaus in San Diego tonight.  Hazy light amber with big white head.  The German Weissbiers are so much more enjoyable to me than are the American brews.  Tart and light with high citrus, without having to shove a lemon into the glass.  Complex with a nice spiciness.  This was more dry than the other one we had.  Not nearly as fruity sweet.

12oz. bottle poured into a weizen glass. Produced on date is 07/09. Not sure what the shelf life is supposed to be but this seems a bit old. Pours a cloudy yellowish orange with two inches of lumpy head that dissipates w/o any lacing. Orange, coriander, and a surprisingly heavy and sweet malt on the nose. I would expect the malt to be lighter, allowing the wheat and yeast to come through more. I will attribute this to the relatively high abv for the style and the fact that this bottle is nearly a year old. Medium bodied and light carbonation. Not quite syrupy but still heavier than I would expect. Moderately to very sweet on the palate: honey, orange, and a little bit of peach are what I get. Still goes down fairly clean. I don’t feel like I’ve been sipping on a big beer, just a fuller bodied medium-light one. I could session this but I would expect to be good and drunk by the end.

Bottle. Nice rather clear gold pour with fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat and citrus, some banana a hint of clove. Banana flavor, some yeasty notes (spice) would be a lot better if not as attenuated and watery . Palate is a win, quite effervescent but not too sparkling, good silky texture. A very refreshing hefe.
Clolours is golden with a rich white top, Aroma of malt and citrus, Flavours follows the nose

World Cup England vs USA beer #1.  I don’t think its unamerican to drink foreign beers during this match since there is only macro swill at this bar.  Pours a hazy gold color.  Taste is of wheat and some banana.  slight floral aftertaste.  goes down down easy

Pours a slightly cloudy yellow, half inch of white foam that dissipates pretty quickly. Aroma is bready and grassy, very pleasant, maybe a hint of fruit. Taste is a bit more subdued than I was hoping for, with some very subtle fruit -- maybe banana -- and a lot of carbonation.

Appearance: Dark brown and cloudy.
Aroma: Good aroma of banana and cloves.
Palate: Soft mouthfeel.
Flavor: Very well balance set of flavors: fruit (banana)-spice-yeast-roasted malt and hops are all present but not one overpowering the rest.
Overall:  Excellent, top of the line beer when it comes to Hefeweizen. It and Franziskaner are neck-and-neck as my favorite beers in this style. In side-to-side comparison it is hard to tell the difference between the two aside from color. Flavor-wise, Franziskaner has a slightly more fruit/banana flavor and Paulaner has slightly a more roasted malt flavor.

6-pack from The Beer Store.  341ml bottles.  This is one of my favorite hefe-weizens!

Pours a thick bodied, cloudy hazy deep golden color.  Cream colored foamy head.

Smells of some citrus and spice, maybe a hint of banana, and maybe wheat.

The taste doesn’t have such a predominant fruity flavor as some beers, but enough that its still noticable.  Very very refreshing, with some carbonation as well.  I taste some spice as well, a good balance so it is not overwhelmingly fruity.

Definitely would be a great patio beer on a nice hot day.  And probably even better on tap!
full bodied white headed and hazy golden yellow colour. excellent thick but freshly fruity.

12 oz. bottle. Pours yellow-gold with a creamy white head.. Aroma has hints of wheat, banana, clove, and yeast. Flavor is composed of similar characters. Palate is smooth and creamy. A strong finish with touches of alcohol and bitterness. An enjoyable hefeweizen.

The aroma had a fruitty smell. I was able to pick up a banana fragrance to it. The beer was cloudy with a  thick head and lacey. I could taste banana and other fruits with it.  It was a really good beer. The flavor bursts in my mouth giving it a nice complexity.

From 25 oz (?) bottle. Appears orange-gold; minuscule white ring; barely hazy. Aroma banana, clove, bread, yeast. Slightly sour with similar notes as the aroma; almost no bitterness. Light-bodied, fizzy/silky carbonation. Nice, clean, easy-drinking hefe though not really my thing.

Pours a nice light golden colour, cloudy, of course. Nice head that dissipates. Aroma could be stronger, and flavour too. Taste is weakly spicy, a tiny amount of fruity ester, but a straightforward wheat beer. I enjoyed it greatly because it was a hot and beautiful day out, but I would choose Schneider or Weihenstephaner over it every time which just stand out so much more to me.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow orange colour with a creamy white head. Aroma of malt, wheat and citrus fruit. Some yeast in the flavour with a hint of sourness. Mouthfeel is quite soft and the overall character is subdued. An average hefeweizen.

Cloudy golden pour tint of amber/orange ..... white head ... aroma of wheat light banana and a little skunk .... light lacing ... taste of clove, light banana and mostly wheat with a decent floral hop bite that lingers in the finish .... a very good hefe

Cloudy beautiful amber/orange color with a  thick creamy white head, foamy lacing. Hints of banana, spice, and wheat. Similar in taste as well. Smooth and creamy. A wonderful Hefeweizen with great drinkability. One of the best, goes especially well with seafood or spicy thai.

Bottle, 500ml. Pours a murky, golden/copper colour with a large, fluffy offwhite head and visible sediment. Perfect weissbier colour. Aroma is strong and refined, lots of banana and spices. Taste is stronger than expected, not a light weissbier like many others, but complex and different. Not too many typical weisse flavours (banana, vanilla, bubblegum, etc.). Instead, it has a robust bitter finish with noticable alcohol. The best weissbier I have tried (until now).
Hazy golden amber, thick creamy white head, foamy lacing.  Hints of banana, spice, and wheat.  Similar in taste as well.  Smooth and creamy.
The first beer I ever rated in my kitchen with Tim. Pours copper/gold in glass. Nose and taste of crisp fruits, citrus and wheats. Rated 12/28/99

On tap at the Fox and Hound on Gulf Fwy in Houston in a pint glass.  Hard to see in bar lighting.  BT didn’t pour it with a head.  Poured a light copper and slightly hazy.  Smells primarily of citrus with a hint of floral hops. The taste is grass and lime.  Effervescent, crisp and light.  Quite nice, pleasant and easy to drink.

Bottle.  Pours copper-amber with good white head.  Fragrant aromas of wheat, and hops.  Taste of wheat is very pure with only minimal hints of malts and spices.  It ends with a medium bitterness.   My favourite Hefe to date.  Its lack of complexity but high quality proves that sometimes simple is the best.
17 ounce bottle-a straw gold pour-white head-aroma andtaste of clove, banana, spice -smooth finish

Bottle 33 cl from Le Grain d’Orge in Crissier (CH). Hazy blond orange, with beautiful white collar. Nose of yeast, wheat, banana, exotic fruit. Beer sweet, fruity, with a touch of refreshing lemon acidity and notes of clove. Nuances of apple in final, creamy.
Cloudy orange pour with frothy white head. Scent of citrus. Taste is crisp, with swett flavors.

This hazy yellow beer was bought to help with both the humid weather in Boston and the lack of clean running water in town. This started out with a huge head that took a minute to fade. The aroma was mostly a wheat/bead thing with a touch of clove. The taste is that yeast and clove again and finishes a bit banana. The flavor is pretty light but well balanced. Nice clean finish and did me good considering the weather.
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a huge off-white head. Aroma of bananas and yeast. Taste is a bit sourish with wheat & raspberries
Pours a lacing, off-white head with a hazy, golden body.  Aromas of banana, yeast, malt, and clove.  Flavor is banana, yeast, malt, and clove.  Clean finish.

As i am not the most experienced beer drinker, i have tried all the Hefe-Weizen’s in my area and i have come to the conclusion that this is by far the best. It has the perfect amount of spice, breadiness, and banana. It reminds me of eating a thick slice of banana bread. Very refreshing.

Very hazy golden amber looks like apple cider... not very aromatic some clove some wheat... decent flavor for a hefe, not as good as I remember though, very traditional... medium bodied a tad yeasty, drinks heavy...

12 oz bottle. Pours  pale golden and cloudy with a medium white head. It has a very nice wheat, spice and yeast aroma. It has a wonderful creamy quality to it. It tastes of banana, clove and citrus with a great wheat aftertaste. I really enjoyed this beer and will try to drink this one again.

Paulaner Brauerei Munchen--Hefe-Weizen--1997-8 12 oz. & 16.9 oz. Bottles.  5.00%  ABV.  (2.75 / 5.0)  Cloudy orange golden color.  Medium Head.  Restrained citrus notes balanced by decent malt body.  Sampled 10/10/1997 & 9/29/1998.

Paulaner Brauerei Munchen--Hefe-Weizen--2000 16 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (3.25 / 5.0)  Hazy dark amber golden color.  Bavarian wheat front with citrus spice notes built on rich malty character.  Mild spice and rich favor.  Finishes with lingering citrus malt flavor.  Sampled 7/24/2000.

PAULANER Hefe-Weizen Natural Wheat--2004 16.9 oz Bottle.  5.50% ABV.  15 IBU’s?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Rich foamy lacy head.  Cloudy bright lemon orange color.  Rich Bavarian wheat spice mild hop front.  Crisp spicy sweet citrus banana ester Bavarian wheat body.  Clean spicy citrus mild hop end.  Rich.  Sampled 8/16/2004.

Paulaner Hefe-Weizen Wheat Ale--2007 12 oz. Bottle.  5.50% ABV.  15 IBU’s?  (4.5 / 5.0)  6-Pack $7.99.  Dense rich lacy head.  Hazy bright orange color.  Rich Bavarian banana ester wheat spice mild coriander hop front.  Tangy mild sweet citrus ester wheat body.  Refreshing mild tangy wheat hop end.  Bavarian!  Sampled 1/2/2008.

Paulaner Brauerei Munchen--Paulaner Hefe-Weizen Natural Wheat--2010 11.2 oz. Bottle.  5.50% ABV.  10 IBU’s?  (4.5 / 5.0)  Hefeweizen--Bavarian.  Rich loose suspended sediment creates foamy thick lacy white wheat head and clouds pretty bright orange gold juicy color.  Rich Bavarian banana clove mild hop wheat ester front.  Rich mild sweet creamy fruit Bavarian Hefe body.  Clean fresh zesty citrus end.  Sampled 4/24/2010.  6- Pack $6.94.
Hazy gold colour with a natural smooth head. Aromas of spice and banana. Taste is light sweetness, apple ans some hints of spice. A bit too light
Pours hazy golden with a massive white head and a fruity yeast aroma. There is a lively wheat flavor with some banana ester, subtle hop bitterness and a sharp citrus finish.

A- Translucent straw yellow body with uniform cloudiness. Large head eventually tames to 1 finger and has great retention. Lots of bubbles rising to the top.

S- This one has a big clove nose. Behind this is some bananas and yeast.

T- classic. Clove and bananas upfront with firm yeast backing. The finish is consistent with the start-clove bananas and a sweet bready yeast. What lingers is sweet-sugary bready yeast.

P- Medium carbonation and smooth yeasty body.

O- Though this one is good and a good example of the style I found myself getting bored with it quickly. It just doesn’t carry that extra zest or creamy body that other hefe’s offer. Though I would not mind having it again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-06-2007 15:12:56

500 mL bottle.  Pours murky amber with a two finger white head into a weizen, great look.  A very nice smelling hefe: quite a bit of banana and apricots, subdued musty yeast, floral/honey.  Quite a sweet smell which transfers to the taste.  Bread malts, yeasty, banana, apricots, make up the bulk of the initial flavors.  Quite sweet in the finish with clove, floral.  Light bodied with a frothy mouthfeel and a medium level of carbonation.  Very easy to relax while drinking one of these.  Nice one.

20oz draft with ridiculous orange wedge at Detroit airport. Hazed, honey appearance with minimal head. Yeasty bready nose and a sweet, not too bubblegum taste. Lite spiced, orange and cream. Smooth but a bit hazy overall.

12oz bottle poured into hefeweizen glass.  Pours a hazy copper col0r with a 3 finger foamy head.  Just might be the best looking beer in a glass I’ve seen.  Smells and taste of banana and clove.  Not overpowering fruitiness like American hefeweizens.  Great summer beer.

Pours a hazy amber with the usually massive white head. Tropical fruit (pineapple?) nose with a slight noble hop bouquet. Standard yeast derived fruitiness but with a hint of autolysis. This one must be a bit past fresh. Brewed in February 09. That’s pretty old for a wheat beer and it shows.

Will re-rate with a fresher bottle.
Pours a hazy amber with a nice white head.  Rather lively carbonation.  Has a nice mix of banana and clove in the aroma. Flavor is wheat, bananas, and clove that lead to a honey like finish.
On tap and bottle.Appearance, cloudy amber gold with a superb white foamy head. Aroma,  bread. taste, fruity, spicy. Full bodied and modestly carbonated beer. Tasty.

Appearance:  Pours a cloudy amber gold with a gorgeous dense white foamy head.



Aroma: Crusty,bready notes and banana. To be clear, it doesn’t smell like banana bread..



Taste:  Fruity banana like yeast, bread notes and spicy, non abrasive hops..



Mouthfeel: Full bodied and modestly carbonated..



Overall:  The most flavorful, hearty hefe I have had. I might have liked others better, but this one stands out for its awesome appearance and body.

330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a cloudy gold with fairly large nearly white head.  Big aroma of banana with more subtle spice and citrus notes.  Taste is also big and banana-y, with spicing more prominent and citrus still fairly restrained.  Mild hoppy bitterness in finish.  An enjoyable, well-made beer.
From tap at my hotel in Germany a hazy orange/yellow colored beer with a white head aroma banana malts and some spices taste banana malts and spices a very soft taste

Pours perfectly, almost with German engineering behind it, you could imagine some BMW systems designer doing this in the evenings. It’s still sitting there with its yellowy body and perfect foam head, calm and amazing. Aroma is a soft scent of lemon meringue pie. Taste is a relaxing witbier mix of hops, grains, and citrus, but not too overpowering or sweet. They held back a little. This is a carefully crafted brew, and it shows.
Bottle.  Poured golden color with a nice white head.  Aroma of banana.   A fine example of why Hefe-Weizens are some of my favorite beers.

Toffee apple aroma.  Very cloudy golden brown with massive head. Slightly bland unbalanced flavour reasonably smooth.   Not much aftertaste.   I used to think this was a great beer, this time only average. Perhaps I am drinking it at the wrong temperature. Updated review served chilled. Much better flavour - complex bitter sweet with some cloves. Nice.

Pours a hazed orange with a large white head. Aroma is banana, esthers, wheat, spices. Flavor is banana, esthers, wheat, spices, fruits, prickly carbonation and well balanced. Very refreshing and well done not to mention inexpensive hefe.

Deep cloudy orange in color, white head. Very robust and sweet. Orange, clove, and banana flavors. Fine example of the Hefe Weissbier. Nice traditional style, but may get overlooked in the beer cooler, don’t skip this.

33 cl bottle, Winnipeg, MB, Canada. Pale hazy amber infused yellow. Banana and citrus aroma, warm doughiness on the first sip. Very light, little alcohol on the finish, dangerously drinkable with a very nice lime flavor at the end.

Bottle.

A - Cloudy, golden tangerine color. Large foamy head with a off-white/cream color.

S - For the most part traditional Hefe smells. Wheat is in the forefront. Also some banana, bubblegum, and clove. Also had a slight lemon citrus and mineral smell.

T - Wheat provides the base for this, but it seemed to have a bit more of an earthy/grainy taste than other beers with wheat as the main base (particularly other Hefes). Banana, bubblegum, and honey interplay with the clove and lemon giving it a slightly sweet taste with a little kick to it.

M - Medium to light body and decent carbonation. Definitely a smooth drink but not as creamy as what I was expecting.

D - Good as it is light on the tongue and in the belly it is easy to drink a number of these. Flavors won’t overpower your palate, but linger long enough that you want more.

Notes: Good summer brew, like most Hefes. Solid example of the style, I found it a bit lighter and less creamy than others, but that’s not necessarily a bad think (a could be a good think as far as drinkability), however the flavor is also not as intense.

Draft at Mulligan’s in Cincinnati.  Pours a hazy orange-gold color with a frothy eggshell-white head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, yeast, citrus, caramel malts, hops, and a pinch of clove.  Wheaty flavor, with yeast, caramel malts, banana, and a bit of hops and clove.  Big, bready mouthfeel with low carbonation and a lot of body.  Didn’t blow me away but this is a better hefeweizen than I had anticipated.
Good beer. Very smooth. Small white head that dissipates too quickly. Aroma is good but light. Smells of wheat and yeast.
Bottle. Light amber, hazy with a large offwhite head. Aroma; wheat. Flavor; wheat with some malty sence. Weissbier is not my favourite...

Poured from 12 oz bottle into a nonic pint.

Appearance: Opaque, pear juice color w/ huge, creamy head that dissipated rather quickly. The head was initially so huge that my 19 oz glass couldn’t contain it. Impressive!

Smell: Fruity, some apple and pineapple with a citrus twist.

Taste: Tangy pear mixed with lemon flavor, somewhat sweet. None of the banana or vanilla that I expected. Very slight bitter finish that counters the sweetness some.

Mouthfeel: Creamy but moderate carbonation, a little syrupy.

Drinkability: Perhaps too sweet and syrupy for me to want more than one in a single session. I love that it didn’t leave a bitter aftertaste.

Comments: My first ever hefeweizen. Definitely would buy again, especially at the low price I found it. Not as much banana or vanilla as I was expecting from a hefe. Much creamier than any other beer I’ve tried to this point.
Golden colour with a huge lasting head.Decent aroma.Classic example of good hefeweizen.

My two favorite beers are Paulaner Lager and Oktoberfest. So I thought this would be natural. Nope. It is lame, don’t let the rating fool you, Its light, fairly bitter, and pungent. Not my choice and a let down.

500ml bottle. Very thick white soapy head. Color is light brown /gray, very cloudy. Fruity aroma with bananas, apricots, pineapples and chalk. Low carbonation. floaty. Flavor is also fruity with bananas. Sourish end with chalk.

Pours a nice hazy yellow with a medium head that leaves little lacing.  Have had in bottle and on tap, much prefer the tap(sometimes the beer has a mettalic taste when poured from bottle.  Aroma and taste are a combination of citrus, banana and cloves.  Complex flavors reveal themselves as the beer warms up. Light bodied and quite easy to drink in multiples.  Overall its excellent and delicious.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy golden orange to golden color with a creamy white, lasting head. Familiar banana and bubblegum aroma that is often present in these hefeweizens. This time it smells quite fresh and pure, nice. Flavor is fruity with banana and some mango and also has a hint of bitterness in the finish. Very smooth and creamy texture as well. Great hefeweizen.

Bottle, 8C. Cloudy gold; white head is modest for the style. Austere nose has grasses, yeast and citrus. Medium bodied with some wheat thickness. Not very sweet, with some sourness and spice. Slightly medicinal aftertaste. A nice drop, but not an exciting one. [3.2]

Can. Spices show up a little in the nose, altogether a little more vibrant. Solid enough, but nothing out of the box.

Birra color giallo chiaro, con una legger foschia dovuta ai lieviti, all’olfatto colpisce la banana, i lieviti e odori floreali, piacevole, come piacevole e al palato, con la banana che ritorna, ma non disturba, perchè ben equilibrata con sentori di arancia e spezie. Facile da bere col suo corpo morbido, stereotipo per eccellenza delle hefeweizen.
500mL Bottle -- Pours golden amber with a thick white head.  Aroma and flavor is mainly wheat and lemon with a sour finish.  There is some band-aid funkiness.  Not too sweet or bitter.
Cloudy golden color with a big fluffy white head.  Aroma of bananas and citrus.  Slightly sour flavor, very full bodied.  Bitter and dry finish.  Nice example of the style.

Yellow color, thin head; aroma is bold, but straightforward, mostly of banana ester, even glueful; mouthfeel is highly carbonated; taste is better than the aroma - or should I say harmless: slightly sour wheat and dry fruits, not too sweet - so if you restrain yourself from sniffing the beer it should go down with not much of a problem, however it ends up feeling a bit of banana limonade due to it´s light body and carbonation.
maybe one of the best weizen beers ive ever had, great color, carbonation, head retention, and a very delicious, unique flavor that tastes of fruit and citrus, perfect representation of the style.

Yellow-orange with a super thick rocky head. Bready aroma with spices. I’m looking for that banana aroma, and I can’t quite detect it. Flavor is moderately bitter, just enough to be pleasant. Very thirst quenching, very drinkable.

bottle. pours a hazy yellow beer with an huge head. wheat aroma with hints of the typical german hefe-weissen smell. Good wheat taste with some bitter notes. Liked the weihenstephaner more. Good beer.
Better than your average Hef. Tastes purer and with bracing acidity and doughiness. This one doesn’t need a lemon. Nice long finish.

Bottle - World Market -  Aroma and flavor have a nice clove, maybe some citric/limon nose.  I was expecting a little bannana for this style but didn’t find it here.  Nice yeast aromas and flavor but wheat (malts) seemed a little light; normally full wheat beers seem heavier so I don’t drink too many in one setting.  Golden haze color with full white head.  Decent head retention. The citric flavors are a little strange on the palate but not too far off for style.  Pretty good overall and worth a try.

A: Copper golden yellow color with a medium head.

S: Lemon and Orange zest nice light smelling brew.

T: Tons of citrus, Lemon and Orange with a nice yeasty quality.

M: Light bodied brew

ct-gl, thick-foamy-wh-head, ^eff, creamy-med-body, med-co2.



clean wheat aroma.



sweet-wheat-malt(doughnut) T1, sweet-weizen §banana T2, bread-dough T3.



not very complex or estery like the hefes i like better.



-----



Aroma is toast with a hint of applesauce and green banana.

Appearance is translucent dark gold.

Taste is alcohol esters, stale malt, mild yeast esters, a hint of caramel, and fairly high minerality.

Body is medium, but full of bubbles, making it feel like there’s more there than there really is.

Fresh taste of pineapple and banana. A bit boring after a while.
Good top that stays for a while

Pours luxurious hazy golden color with suggestion of brown. White, pillowy head is glorious to look at and certainly helps with aroma.

Nose has a banana lemon creme component, with seductive yeasty/bready notes that make you yearn for that first sip.

Palate has a good balance of the standard banana/clove interplay, with a pleasing wheat cracker taste. One of the best examples of this style.

Finish highlights the carbonation, wheat cracker again, and leaves a pleasant toasty bread-like taste on the palate. Amazing beer, world class.

Cloudy greyish yellow pour with a small but persistent head.
Aroma shows doughy wheat, with some cloves, but little in the way of banana.
Flavours are similar, with sweet wheat and a hint of cloves. The finish is somewhat metallic.
Great high carbonation and medium full body.
Pours a cloudy light orange. Smells like chemical banana flavoring.  Tastes like bad banana juice with an old used band-aid floating in it. I just don’t care for this.

On Tap at the Denver Oktoberfest, 22nd & Larimer Street 27/09/2009
Some carbonation. Banana fruit aroma. Amber coloured and hazy in appearance with a banana fruit flavour. Crisp slightly dry and wheaty malt finish.
Bottle - pours a cloudy golden with a thin white head. Aroma is of orange, banana, wheat and a bit of citrus. Flavour is banana and what, predominantly. Very smooth and refreshing.

Provdatum: 2008-08-28 , flaska, Göteborg
UTS: Molnig gul med högt skum.
D: Doft av aprikoser och bananskal.
F: Bananen och syrligheten.
Large creamy white head with good lacing. Cloudy dark orange color. Characteristic yeasty-wheat aroma and flavor. Medium body.

Picked up a bottle of this at my local BevMo. Maybe the bottle was old, but the aroma was a little musty, shrouded in maltiness. Full of robust flavor, the texture was not as characteristic of hefeweiss beers in my opinion.
Bready biscuity,  banana heavy not enough spice to balance, still crisp and enjoyble just not the best.

500 ml can. From Lübeck, Germany.

Hazy darkish orange colour with average creamy white head. Sweet caramel, wheat, fruit and some spices in aroma. Sourish crisp flavour with fruit, wheat, malt and bitter hops. Very enjoyable Weißbier. 



500 ml bottle. BBE 01/17. (Alko) Tampere, Finland.

Hazy darkish orange color with a mid-size foamy white head. 
Bready malty, caramel sweet and yeasty aroma with mild spices, some sourness and wheat. 
The flavor is bready malt, wheat, yeast, mild caramel and some crispiness. Balanced. Nothing wrong with this.

It pours a hazy orange-yellow liquid with a large fluffy head. Initial taste and aroma of spicy fruit. Tastes of mild sweet tropical fruits with a hint of cloves, slightly "fresh" sour typical weissbier flavour as expected.

One of my first 100% wheat beers and I definitely want more. A good casual drink with a nice spicy taste.

Bottle. Pours foamy honey yellow. Citrus and clove aroma. Citrus, mild spice, light banana, clove, and a hint of orange. Cool  and smooth citrus finish. Classic hefeweizen taste. Could be a bit more "aggressive"
banana clove and bread on the nose. yellow cloudy pour with lots of white head. banana and clove and bread continue in the initial taste with a hint of banana and sweet clove on the finish.
Bottle; good beer overall, subtle banana and spice notes. Better than I thought it was going to be though still prefer Ayinger or Franziskaner hefeweizen

bottle - amber color,  large, frothy head. Typical weizen aroma banana and spice, very fruity and acidic. Flavor not as sharp as aroma would have me believe, light hint of apple danish. Good all around weizen.

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass. 



App.:  Cloudy orange-amber with a large off-white foam.
  
Aroma:  Some toasted cereal, some bright, kinda green banana esters, banana bread, a little organic acid brightness, a bit of clove and warm spice, kinda creamy-smelling (odd, I know).
  
Palate:  Medium+ body, full but soft effervescence, creamy.
  
Flav.:  More of the traditional banana and clove, yeasty, bread dough, banana loaf, still a hint of organic acids; dry with no appreciable bitterness. 



Quite nice.

Pours a hazy golden-orange hue. Medium white head. Very attractive beer. The aroma is of yeast, fruit, maybe some banana in there. Flavor is fruity with hints of bitterness. Pretty thin body. Not bad.

Bottle. Orange and very cloudy. Large not too dense foam.

The aroma was not too intense but it contained the classic banana scents that I associate with a German wheat beer. Although some other spices were there like a little yeast.

The taste was pretty fruity taste with a lot of banana, also some yeast, pepper and a slight acidity. No bitterness, rather thin body and really feeling a bit watery but still pleasant to drink.

What can I say? This is a GOOD hefe, and a good hefe is a brilliant anything else!  Has all the hallmarks, including that lovely banana taste, the only downside is it’s not quite as smooth as other hefe’s I’ve tried, still a brilliant beer none the less.
50cl bottle, Alko. Large head. Fruity aroma. with taste of citrus and bananaexcellent wheat beer with a smooth finish. Easy to drink.

~Clove and banana in scent. Clove dominates.
~Pours a cloudy gold with rich creamy white head.
~Flavor of yeast, clove, and bananna.
~Creamy feel, sweet dry finish.
~Good German Hefeweizen.

12oz. Poured into a Warßteiner hefe-glass. Pours hazy orange, smallish white head. Wheaty aroma. Banana flavor, pretty straightforward. Flavor isn’t earth shattering, but the texture and mouthfeel of this beer may be the most enjoyable I’ve ever had. Good German beer.

Nice dark, cloudy colour with white head that lasted long enough. Nice fruity aroma. Taste was less so and was in fact rather bland. A bit malty here and a bit fruity there, also tasted a bit of spices and wheat but nothing special. Not great, there are better wheat beers available.

Poured with a nice, thick creamy, slightly off-white head with decent retention.
Color was straw with a hint of orange, about 6-8 L. Cloudy appearance.

Faint yeasty aroma with a hint of spice.

Smooth, slightly acidic taste; fairly dry with a hint of yeast.
Didn’t taste the clove or banana esters that are usually indicative of this style. 
Not much of an aftertaste; not particularly bitter, either.
Decent mouthfeel; not highly carbonated.

Overall, not bad, but fairly "meh" and unremarkable.

A squeeze of lemon didn’t really improve the taste, but it didn’t hurt it either.
Bottled. Pale straw colour. hazy (sure), good head which is not lasting so much time.  Flat caramelly palate (plus cloves and bananas). Nothing special.
Tap at Old Chicago.  Cloudy orange color, not much head.  Faint wheat/yeast aroma.  Sweet tangy, slightly citrus flavor.  Light mouthfeel, smooth fruity finish.  Excellent hefeweizen.

One of my very favorite beers.

Wheat with strong citrus.  Extremely smooth and great texture.
Lighter in color and body than the Franz. Wheat with some clove and citrus zest. Some banana too. Good body, pretty solid.
Pretty solid hefe here. Pleasant hazy orange appearance, yeasty and citrusy nose. Flavor notes include coriander, orange, lemon and banana. Very smooth mouthfeel. Quite tasty.

500 ml bottle - light haze, muddy yellow with fluffy egg white head; cloves, wheat, lemons and yeast; nice, light cream texture; kind of stale and flavor not living up to the nose; would love to try in Germany some day!

Appearance: Hazy orange
Aroma: Slightly funky
Flavor: Maltier and with more body than the Weihenstephener, though with less flavor and a shorter finish. Some coriander.
Palate: Fine creamy mouth feel.
Comment: On Tap. Relatively bland, heavier and less focused flavors than the Weihenstephener. I’ll pass on this one.
smells cheesy, yeasty. its dark amber with a lasting head, tastes lemony, wheaty, straightforwardly wheat. bubbly, popy, nice
Cloudy with a very good off white head. Aroma of grassy wheat and hops. Tastes of sweet grassy wheat quite smooth
Bottle.Pours cloudy golden with a white head.Orange ,banana and cloves in the nose.Banana ,cloves and sweet wheat in the mouth.Refreshing hefe.

This is your run of the mill good hefe from Germany.  All the great clove and banana flavors, with that fantastic wheat background.  This ranks in the middle of all the Bavarian hefes for me.  Good, but not great.

Weird finish. Almost sharp.

The nose is very typical for the style &#40relying on my limited exposure to this style&#41. The flavor is also typical with a nice citrus/fruit note. The mouth-feel is a little fizzy for me. But the real problem lies in the weird finish. 

Despite the finish, beer is fantastic.
Bottle from a European bar and grill on Park Row in Pantego.  Very healthy head, nice flavor.  A little much banana.

Bottle 330ml 5.5%. Poured muddy golden orange with a large, white, creamy head which lasted amazingly. Strong notes of clove and ripe banana’s in the aroma with notes of sweet yeasty malts, lemon zest, orange citrus and light notes of ginger. Flavor was very smooth with a very mild bitterness, creamy vanilla, sweet sour dough, dried banana, ripe pears, cloves, cinnamon and a crisp/dry finish. Light to medium bodied with lively carbonation, a dry mouthfeel, watery texture and a good length finish.

500. Pours a murky medium toffeeish amber. Creamy white head and plenty of it. Decently powerful banana nose. Creamy medium body showing banana but not a heck of a lot of clove. Mild finish. A very understated and somewhat refreshing beer.

from tap in Montpellier, yellow colour and white head. Malty and grainy smell like the taste: also fruity and a light bitterness with sweetness. A decent beer but I don’t know why it’s rated so high. It has no complexityl.

Pours a yellowish brown, small white head, smells like yeast and wheat.  Tastes a lot like yeast and wheat too, some citrus notes as well.  All in all, a pretty solid hefeweissen - drink it and you won’t go wrong.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, dirty-yellow, not quite orange. Medium white head that is quite persistent, nice lacing. Nose is clove, coriander, citrus, bananas, and yeast. Palate is very fresh and clean, not overdone on the banana side, which is nice. Flavors of yeast, wheat, bananas, spice, oranges. Not the most complex Hefe, but very classic and surprisingly well-done for a broadly distributed beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with a fluffy white head. Aroma is fairly wheaty, with notes of citrus, honey and vanilla. Flavour is also rather grainy with hints of tropical fruit, pepper, citrus&#40lemon&#41 and yeast. Palate is dry and light bodied, a little watery but still very enjoyable. I never get sick of this beer.

Strong orange look with a fantastic fruit taste. I never stop enjoying this beer cold!
Definitely worth a try!

05-SEP-2009, Can @home.
Hazy, orangy, with huge head.
I put my nose in the glass, and it is what I expect. Yeasty, fruity and nice.
Very creamy and nice carbonation.
Finde weisse.
Poured hazy golden yellow, sweet, citrus, bannana, little spice, little vanilla.

Tried the Paulaner Hefe-Wiess on tap at the local bar.

Poured a nice hazy blond with a one finger head, and had a nice smell. Overall first impression was favorable.

Taste was dry and not to malty on the front end, pretty bland as I would like to taste more of the wheat flavors. On the back end the taste was strongly influenced by the yeast with fruit and a lemony flavor. Way too much yeast influence.

For my tastes I found the beer way out of balance.

Bottle from my local Tesco. Cloudy orange thick lively white head. Citrus and a rather dusty tripel like smell, yeast. Vanilla, banana, cloves, maybe a little garlic. Smooth and for having such a lively head, quite low carbonation and a touch watery. Fairly mellow and uncomplicated but tasty enough.
Nice creamy head, sweet banana flavor with a slightly sour citrus undertone, a great hefeweizen.

Bottle.  Pours an opaque orange-gold colr with a nice frothy white head.  Basically, the perfect beer head.  Flavors of anise and clove.  Light to medium bodied.  Easy on the palate.  Very well-balanced brew.
330ml bottle. Deep golden colour and pours with a thgick dense white head. Aromas of citrus and bubblegum and sweet and lively flavour with a good mouthfeel. Good balance.
Have had this from the bottle and on tap.  A very solid German hefe that I enjoy when it’s around.

Bottled.  Poured healthy, hazy medium orange with a thick, well-retained cap of white head.  The aroma picked up deep banana notes accented by white peppery notes, cloves, and sweetness in the form of bubblegum and vanilla.. very well presented.  The flavor had toasty, darker banana and vanilla notes at the core, with tart lemon zest and cloves surrounding.. balance was solid.  Medium-bodied and well-carbonated on the palate.. just a little watery at the very back, otherwise a great feel.
Hazy orange color with a lasting offwhite head. Aroma: fruity yeast, banana, peach. Taste: Dry, low sweetness, a little watery, fruit and malt. High carbonation.
Bottle.&#40Naturtrub&#41 ABV 5,5 %  Pours cloudy orange, with a big off-white creamy head. Banana, wheat and citrus aroma. Fruity taste, yeast and citrus dominates, lovely hefeweissen

6-pack from my local grocery store.  Pours a cloudy orange color with an off-white head.  Smells and tastes of wheat, lemon zest, and clove with faint banana and cinnamon in the flavor.  Fair, at best.

Tap in Meppel. Hazy coloured, dark golden colour. Fruity aroma, Thick taste,  a bit sweetiness and very refreshing. Nice.
29-04-2010 from bottle. As from tap: Big head, fruity aroma, not that much banana but more peach-like, but not too sweet at all. Good hefe weissbier, one of the better to my opinion.
Tasty and flawless hefeweizen, but without anything to excite the palate. It did take me back to Munich though, and for that, I give it a couple of highly subjective extra marks. :)

Pours hazy, yellowy orange. Moderate head which lasts. Aroma of banana and mild spices. Subtle flavours but an enjoyable Hefeweizen. This is my staple beer that I drink almost every weekend. Easy to drink and doesn’t sit too heavy when consuming in larger volumn at a party.

One of my favorite Hefes-nice balance-clove nicely modulating the sublte banana, vanilla and cookie-like breadiness.Creamy texture with lively carbonation that doesn’t overwhelm the flavor. First rate.
Can (cellphone rating). Slight hazy golden with a huge white head. Banana, wheat, yeast and citrus in aroma. Fruity flavour with citrus, some banana and wheat. It’s not bad; it’s just bland.

She practically glows a gentle white in my glass with a brushing of soft yellows and orange. Her head is equally as soft and voluptuously white as the snow, melting only ever so slightly into a blanket of snow-white foam. She swirls nicely, and even though no lace is left in her wake, her head remains stubbornly unmoved. Well played, indeed. Waiting for me is the ultimate banquet of German hefeweizen delights: ripe bananas, banana bread fresh from the oven and sprinkled throughout with nuts, clove aromatics abound, greatly assisted by soft white wheat, orange esters, and a sprinkling of coriander. There is almost no greater bouquet of aromas. I could sit here all day long breathing her in, but then she would grow too warm and I would be remiss in neglect. Lips wet with anticipation, I dive into her bounty with a generous first quaff. As a blanket of lace follows her deep into her first quaff, my palate is softly greeted by a gentle embrace and a smooth creamy mouthfeel. A clean finish with orange peel, cloves, and banana lingering long into my breath. I wonder which is more aromatically pungent to another’s senses, cloves or garlic? Personally, I could care less. Drinking deep once more, my palate is caressed by soft bananas, rich banana bread, nuts, and a brisk zip of lemon nipping at her heels. The more I quaff, the more her cloves permeate while the wheat acts as a life raft for her over-ripe bananas, banana bread, and oranges. Quaffing bliss, I sup, savor, and repeat until she is no more. All that remains is a scattered patchwork of puffy lace and an aroma of memories that linger long into her finish.




Yum. German hefeweizens; you either love them or you hate them. Me, I love them heart and soul. I can drink them any day of the week, any month of the year, but I enjoy them most in the summer. Thankfully, summer in Florida lasts twice as long as anywhere else, so that is twice as long that I get to enjoy the Paulaner Hefeweizen.

(12oz bottle) Pours a cloudy orange that eventually clears with nice fluffy 1 finger head that dissipates quickly. Maybe the best thing about this beer is the smell. Tons of banana and a subdued clove aroma are present here. A little bit undercarbonated I wish it had more. Good thickness though.Could have 4 or 5 of these on a hot summer day and love every one of them. Overall this is maybe in my top 3 or 4 hefeweizens I have ever had. Given its wide availability it is amazing how consistent they have kept this beer over the years and I still rarely top it in the style when trying new hefeweizens.

I’ve had this beer in Germany and it was the best beer id tasted on my euro holiday. However tasting it from the bottle here i was more than disapointed. It had a musty kind of aroma with a very dull flavour and finish. Unfortunatley i had a Paulaner Munchen Helles that also portrayed the same characteristics.

Bottle 0 cl. Pours a cloudy yellow with a creamy white head and an aroma of banana and wheat. The mouthfeel is very soft and the flavour is citric with more sweet notes of banana, grains, bread and wheat. Nice hefe!

Aroma is lots of sweet wheat, a little toasted barley, banana, some white bread crust, bubble gum, pepper and a little citrus. Flavor is clover floral notes, wheat, banana, vanila custard, floury bread dough, just a little lemon rind and a mellow sourdough bread dough finish. Palate is medium body, slightly chalky, yet creamy all the way through to the suprisingly dry finish
Bottle @ Metro Billiards. 5.6%. Faint aroma of citrus and wheat. Delicious, noticeable citrus taste and a hint of spice. Hazy golden pour with a foamy white head. Another favourite.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a hazy, golden-orange body with a foamy, white, two-finger width head that dissipates at a moderate pace and leaves a moderate, streaky lacing as well. Aroma is wheat, banana bread, yeast, and a light citric fruit. Flavor has much more of a noticeable citrus taste with a nice amount of balancing wheat, dough, yeast, banana, and a light spice that dries this out and lingers for a moderate duration with a little bit of everything in the aftertaste. Palate is light, smooth, and refreshing. Overall, no complaints here. Reliable as always.

Draft at Flying Saucer. I can’t believe I have not logged a rating. It pours a hazy orange amber with  a white head. Very assertive banana bubblegum nose. Light bodied, but refreshing with that great unfiltered mouthfeel. Initial flavor of lemon, banana, and tropical fruit that transitions to a tame yeast clove finish. A solid hefe,

Poured lighter golden and a bit hazy.  Nice fluffy white head slowly dissapaited but held on towards the end.  As Lynyrd Skynyrd sang, "oooh that smell’   Love the aroma, pure Bavarian Hefe, clove and banana.  Flavor is spicy, sweet, a bit musty.  Palate is a bit prickly on the tongue.  I wish I could bathe in Bavarian hefe’s and Paulaner is top notch.

This poured with an energetic foamy, ivory-coloured head and was well carbonated.  The head produced some nice lacing, and the colour was a cloudy orange.  Aroma was fruity, mostly citrus with maybe a hint of spices in the background.  Taste was clean and refreshing, again displaying some citrus influence.
Pours cloudy golden with a big, uneven white head.  Nose is banana and wheat.  Taste is crisp and smooth, with notes of banana, wheat and spice.  This is delightful stuff.

Hazy dark golden with a white head. Fruity, spicy sweet aromas of clove and over ripe bananas. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Good flavor strikes a balance between ripe bananas, sweet pale malt grist, clove, with a tart wheat taste to finish. Great hefe.

Pours a very cloudy pale gold with a 2-3 finger creamy and chunky eggshell head. Aroma is lots of sweet wheat, a little toasted barley, banana, some white bread crust, bubble gum, pepper and a little citrus. Flavor is clover floral notes, wheat, banana, vanila custard, floury bread dough, just a little lemon rind and a mellow sourdough bread dough finish. Palate is medium body, slightly chalky, yet creamy all the way through to the suprisingly dry finish. Really nice stuff, seems a little more plain than other great hefes I have had but still quite good.

I was surprised, but at the same time I was not.. I guess with 370 plus years in the beer business you would know how to make a good brew...  This has to be my preferred wheat bear on the market.  Traditional color, great taste.
50 cl can. Cloudy yellow body with big off-white head. Flavour is wheat and banana.

Bottled.
Yellow with white head. Aroma of wheat and yeast. Flavor is banana, wheat and spices

Overall Impression: 
I’ve had this one a few different times, it’s a pretty solid example of this style, they do a nice job of combining the standard flavors: yeast, banana, citrus, etc together to make a pretty solid Hefe.  Certainly worth a drink especially if you enjoy this style.
50cl bottle. Pours hazy pale-gold with white head. Grain and herbal aroma with some spices. Yeast and banana taste with some citrus. Great weizen!

Pours hazy gold with decent white head and good carbination. Aroma is quite nice and right where you would expect a Hefe-Weizen to be and includes fruity and clove. Taste is a little underwhelming after such a good initial presentation. Clove and fruit tones are noted with a slight sour taste. Overall a good wheat brew I will definitely drink again and could drink several
refreshing and fruity with clove,banana and touch of green apple. a bit astringent and sour it has some sweetness and is a bit grainy with visible wheat. moderate body it is quite a good wheat brew.

(Bottle 0,33l) (27.6.2009)
Light fruit aroma. Light golden and cloudy color. Medium white head. Lightly sour. Average weizen. (6.3.6.3..10=2.8)



(Bottle 0,5l) (22.4.2015)

Aroma: Sweet, wheat.

Appearance: Cloudy orange color. Huge, white head.

Taste: Medium sweet, light sour, light citrusy peel, very light wheat.

Palate: Medium body. Creamy texture. Astringent finish.

Overall: Average weizen, a bit annoying. (6.5.6.3..13=3.3)

Enjoyed on tap in a weizen glass.  The beer pours a bright, hazy yellow, with a white head.  The nose gives strong hints of clovey banana, along with some other phenols that I had a bit of trouble fingering.  The palate is spritzy and surprisingly full across the mouth.  The yeast-derived esters dominate the flavors of the beer, again throwing some, but not a ridiculous amount of banana.  A smooth texture in the beer is also fairly prevalent, likely from the additions of wheat malt.  Overall, a nice beer for summer, and a solid example of the style.
poured unfiltered gold with a fluffy white head that faded quickly.  smelled of bananas, clove, and other spices.  tasted of spice, bananas and light citrus.  not much of an aftertaste

Pours out a light, cloudy amber-orange with a two inch white head that was gone quickly after the pour. The aroma was mostly clove, with some wheat and maybe a slight hint of citrus fruit. The flavor was big on wheat, clove, pepper and light citrus. Very refreshing and I’m starting to get confirmation that even though I hate American hefes with a passion, their German ancestors aren’t half bad.

House of Brews: huge Weizen glass: Orange, almost Blue Moon looking color and cloud.  Great head, lingering.  Nose is complex, very light, citrus, summer, young fruits.  Taste is also very summer, citrus, very refreshing.  Also notes of aromatic spices, possibly cloves?  Very good brew.

16.9oz bottle.  Pours a hazy orange-tinged amber with a big white head.  Aroma is light and hoppy, with aromas of grain, yeast, banana, coriander and other spices.  Taste is medium-bodied and refreshing, with a mellow hoppy flavor of grains and citrus giving way to a finish of bread and spice.  Very solid and very refreshing -- wish I had tried it sooner.

Hazy orange with white head.  Smell is wheaty and banana like with some light clovey yeastiness.  Taste is similar with some yeastiness.  Nicely wheaty and slightly fruity.  Medium body.  Solid, and worth another try when I haven’t had so many beers.

500ml bottle. Really a great looking beer - murky gold/orange, perfect head. Standard hefe aroma, though more subdued than most....taste is similarly understated - banana, a little sour on the finish. Really excellent drinkability, well carbonated and could drink many. Solid hefe - nothing terribly special.
Nice. Arome isn’t very great and it looks murky and not particular appetizing, but it’s nice, smooth beer with sweet/sour hints. Good.
Top notch Weizen. Most likley one of the best of the big brewers. You can find this beer almost in any country.

For a Weizen the aroma is pretty average. Appearance is an unfiltered golden color with a white long lasting head. Flavor is average with some clove and only a hint of banana. Not a bad drink but not that exciting either. I’d still drink it again.

Taste test with Paulaner, Terrapin Sunray, and Allagash White. Aroma - Sweet, Medium clove, medium banana, citrus. Appearance - Nice cloudy orange-yellow (darkest of the 3 which i liked) with some spotty lacing. Flavor - lightly sweet, clove, citrus. Palate - light body, thin feel, lively carbonation. Overall impression - It is super effervescent and crisp (the most of the 3). It has the most clove flavor/scent. I give this beer 1st place in flavor and value! Can’t go wrong with this.
Tap. The beer that sets the bar for all hefeweizens. Excellent balance and smooth creamy texture. A real gem.

On tap. Cloudy amber-orange. Prominent citrus note and wheat funk. I don’t like wheat beers, this is a better than average wheat. Very slight bitterness, smooth finish for a wheat beer and a slight caramel sweetness.
Poured a not-so-hazy orange yellow with a decent sized head. Tastes of citrus and wheat. Overall this was a pretty good hefeweizen.

I’ve had better Hefe’s than this by a long shot. Cloudy orange (thin weak Metamucil) with a big fat white head that did not last and left nothing but a ring. Nice yeasty aroma with sweet bananas, some clove and some other lingering fruit. Taste wasn’t quite to my liking (odd for any Hefe, aside from those terrible West coast attempts..cough cough Pyramid...Widmer Bros....) - dull yeast, syrupy bananas, leaning towards the watery side and an annoying slight sourness. Can a beer feel dry, dusty and oily at the same time? Not bad, just not as good as the others. Maybe a glass of Royal White with some banana chips and steak spice mixed together will prove more interesting.
pours a cloudy orange yellow with an off-white head..not much for lacing..vanilla, banana, wheat flavor with moderate straw hay malts and yeast present...overall a nice German wheat very drinkable...

Quite cloudy orange with thick, creamy head. Classic wheat character in the aroma with bananas, vanilla, bubblegum, some spices. Moderate acidic initial flavor. Bready, clear grainy maltiness with a subtle spicy edge. Crisp clove finish. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation. Classic german hefeweizen.
Bottle. Cloudy dark yellow colour with a white head. Aroma: Lots of wheat, spices, bubble gum, sweet fruit. Taste: Wheat, banana, spices, bubble gum, pepper, slight sourness. Creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a thick foamy head with great retention.  Aroma is wheat, with some spices and a hint of fruits. Flavor is grainy, with wheat, bread, raw grains and a hint of fruit. Thin to medium body.
On tap at Bedford-Bamberg Spring Fest ’09. Hazy orange with a small white head. Clove, wheat and yeast in the aroma. Sour wheaty taste with some banana. Slight bitterness. Not bad.
Poured a not-so-hazy orange yellow with a decent sized head. Tastes of citrus and wheat. Overall this was an alright hefeweizen, there wasn’t anything wrong with it, but it wasn’t very memorable. LC

Poured from a 5L mini keg. Hazy gold with a decent off-white head. Nice aroma of sweet malty wheat and banana. Flavor matches the aroma with some sweetness and a little citrus. I am not a big hefeweizen fan, but this was good.

330 mL Bottle. Slightly murky gold body with a 2-finger frothy white head that settles to a tenacious foamy film lacing the sides of the glass very noticeably. Aroma is grains, bread, floral, orange peel, innuendos of pineapple and banana, and yeast. Flavor is sweet malt and grains with notes of banana,, apricot, and a subtle hint of cloves. Nice, creamy mouth feel. Gorgeous!
Bottle. Yellow cloudy pour with two inches of foamy white head. Taste is kind of watery...it is what it is...
A hazy yellow in color.  A taste of honey, with a sweet aftertaste.  Very light and drinkable.  A good hefenwizen for hot weather days.
Draught. Normally I like hefeweizens a lot, but it was the wrong time and place. Cloudy orange with a sweet cloying aroma. Taste quite sweet as well. I´ll rerate another time.
A great Hefe. Cloudy yellow/orange color. Easy and light on the tongue. Smooth finish with hints of citrus fruits left. Great with a lemon wedge.
Pours hazy yellow with a large white head. Aroma of bread, yeast, apricot and other fruits. Flavour is a bit messy, sweet, fruity and a metally character to it. Smooth and creamy.
Pours pale hazy yellow orange with a light off-white head. Fruity / wheaty aroma. Medium bodied. Flavours of sweet fruits, banana, also wheaty flavours. Moderate bitterness in the finish.

Colore giallo con riflessi tendenti quasi all’arancione,schiuma bianca aderente e persistente.Aroma un pò acido,di arancia o limone e di lievito.Sapore citrico(si può dire?)con note di banana.Ben bilanciata in complesso.Vale lo stesso discorso della Franziskaner,ovvero pur essendo una birra di facile reperibilità,diciamo da grande distribuzione,si fa comunque apprezzare.

Bottle, Asda, Carlisle.Classic cloudy wheat beer. Refreshing, creamy and aromatic. Nice fizz on the tongue, the herbiness tickles the top of the mouth and back of the throat. A peaches and apricot flavour is revealed with a gentle swill around the mouth. A pleasure to drink.
