Pours a hazy orange with yellow accents and has a fluffy white head that looks like meringue. Aroma is slightly sour, it also has some orange, coriander, bubblegum, lemon, and lager yeast. Tastes citrusy, coriander, floral notes, banana, bubblegum, and cloves. Nice balance of wheat and barley malt. Effervescent  mouth feel. Simple yet complex. Nice!
Cane. aroma of yeast and fruits. Pours a cloudy yellow, carbonation high, head is thick.; sweet flavour and mild citrus. Similar the other German Wheats.
(bottle). Pours a dark yellow color. Large size white head. Wheat aroma. Strong wheat taste, with light spice. Smooth finish. Soft to moderate carbonation.

Aroma was mostly banana but a little of citrus spice mixed in. Copper color with decent head, but I had to settle for a Shaker glass. Flavor had some spicy banana flavors with a bit of citrus, refreshing. Palate was lively and medium bodied. Good.
Bottle.  Cloudy yellow pour with a thin white head.  Aroma of yeast and wheat with faint bananas.  Taste of yeast, citrus and bananas.  Somewhat thin finish.

Nice gold colour. Pure beer taste and a strong one too. One of the best blonde
 beers you can get. You just feel that you drink true quality product.GUT BESSER PAULANER!
Bottle. Pours foggy gold with a white head. Clove like spicy aroma, with some fruity sweetness. The flavor is well balanced, with clove, banana, and a wheaty base. Pretty good.

Pours a cloudy gold color with a small white head that does not last. Aroma is bright and fruity - bannanas, cloves, and a little spicy yeast. Taste is the same plus a bit of bread and sweet, juicy bubblegum. Lively carbonation and thin body. A little too carbonated for my tastes, but overall this is better than I expected. Very drinkable and thirst quenching. Good summer beer.

Bottle. Aroma of wheat, grass, slightly fruity yeast and some mild hops. Light orange with a small bubbly head that disintegrates fast. The flavor is very smooth, mostly sweet and malty with a fruity undertone. Crisp mouth feel, very refreshing. This is probably my favorite Hef, I would love to try this on tap.
hazy yellow pour with a large white head. Aroma of malts and citrus. Light flavor of wheat and citrus. No lingering flavor. Very smooth and easy to drink.
Crushed with Jakebra at Falling Rock. Nice wheat all the way through. Pretty damn tasty, full-bodied hefe. Dug it but New Glaris kills.

Bottle, 12oz. Pours a clear gold color, with a large, plain white head. Smells mainly of wheat, light amounts of spice. Really not that spicy smelling for a hefe. Definitely enjoyable, but lacking in complexity for a hefe.

(Draught at Hyddan, Åre, Sweden, 19 March 2009) Cloudy brownish yellow colour with a firm, white head. Fruity, malty nose with banana, tropical fruit and clove. Hints of yeast. Fruity, malty taste with clean notes of wheat, over ripe banana and hints of clove. Well made and fresh with a balanced citric touch of yeast. Solid and reliable.
hazy, rocky foam, golden colour, medium bitter, bitter end, ,full body, Very good

bottle/can.  Poured hazy orange-yellow with fizzy white head. Aroma has yeasty esters. Light bodied,  creamy carbonation, smooth mouthfeel. Mild flavoured, mainly citrus and banana peel with yeasty notes, . Not very bitter and not overly carbonated.
50 cl bottle, cloudy orange color with a medium creamy white head. Aroma is spicy and some fruity. Easy to drink weissbier.

12 oz bottle.  Pours cloudy copper.  Head is is creamy smooth and abundant.  Smells of wheat, clove, and nutmeg.  Tastes of nicely malted wheat, smooth citric edge, and nicely spiced.  Some clove, pepper, maybe coriander or nutmeg.  Pretty good hefeweizen.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange color with a decent white head. Aroma of yeast and spices.  Flavor was wheat, spicy and some fruit. This is a good beer.
Hazy gold color with a thick white head with good lacing. Wheat and yeast aroma. Good taste with a clean finish

Marvelous for a hefe, fruity, full-bodied, natural tasting. Def. worth the price. Has a little champagne like tingle which is good, but would prevent me from chugging a few of these guys in one night.

This pours a cloudy yellow color with a fluffy white head. Aroma was really clovey and spicey with hints of yeasty aromas as well. Flavor was wheaty, lots of clove spice, not much fruity notes as it proclaims. A decent plain wheat beer.
Had it awhile back. I remember it to be a fairly enjoyable hefeweizen beer...
A hefe which is more clovey, tart than fruity. There’s a hint of grainy character in the arome and flavour. Its very cloudy. A good beer that would be very easy to drink on a hot summer’s day.
Great wheat.  Good cloudy color and refreshing citrus flavor.  Would recommend to anyone that is just trying out craft brew.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orangery color. Has a fairly decent white head. Some lacing was found on the side of the glass. Aroma was  nuts, toast, dough, basement aromas, earthy, banana, and vanilla. Flavor was a malt explosion. Very complex brew.

2009 Bottle - Pours a cloudy tan with a nice white head...aroma is fruity yeast, heavy clove, rough grain...flavour is tart lemon and a bit tropical, lightly bready, but not as much as I expected...finishes the same way...interesting...
Sweet but not overly so. A very fruity taste. A lovely cloudy golden colour and good head. Overall a lovely beer.

(bottle) pours a hazy light golden colour with a dense white head. aroma of banana, light pineapple, herbal hops and yoghurt. flavour is mostly peanuts and wheat with a light touch of caramel. full-bodied with medium carbonation and a dry wheaty finish.
Yellow in color and cloudy with a decent sized white head. Aroma is of banana, clove, lemon, and wheat. Taste is of citrus, banana, and spices.
Pours cloudy yellowwith a large white forming head.  Great taste of malt and spice.  Good overall feel and not long lasting taste. Crisp and great.   Good german Hefe.

On tap. Multiple tastings (remembered from previous tastings). One of the first hefeweizens I had tried and still one of my favorites. Great summer drink as it is real light but still full of great taste.

Good character and body. Nice balance of malt, hops and other flavours (notably clove and banana, which adds to the aroma as well). The added carbonation expected of a wheat beer but, no overkill. Moderate on the palate but savoury nonetheless. Better on tap than from the bottle. Pleasant with German style food. Great in hot weather. Attractive cloud and colour.

Bottled. Murky golden, huge pale head. Old banana and good bubblegum wheaty aroma. Wheaty, little cellary flavor with ripe bananas and little alcohol. Medium bodied, very soft and strongly carbonated palate. Reasonably fresh and solid hefeweizen.

Probabaly one of the best hefeweizen ever drinked. Amazing cloudy colour with a nice head. Fruitty, Vanilla, Exotic fruits. Nice mouthfeel and good aroma. I will probably drink this here in Italy so so much.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a thin head with minimal lacing over a cloudy yellow body.....nose is redolent of spices, coriander, clove, banana....tastes of multiple spices, citrus....light mouthfeel....excellent hefe.
Tap. Pours cloudy orange with full white head. Aroma is full of yeast and banana. Flavor is full of fruit. Just a great refreshing beer.
12 oz bottle poured cloudy straw yellow. Clove and bananas in the aroma. Flavor is sweet, tart, clove and banana. Easy to drink.

On tap somewhere in Munich (too drunk to remember).  This is what hefeweizen should always be. Cloudy orangish brown color, nice white head.  Wheaty aroma with banana and clove, some citrus.  Flavor is wheaty with a sweet, light, refreshing citrusy taste. Really refreshing and incredibly drinkable.  Why can’t they all be this good?
12 oz bottle.  Poured a cloudy yellow color with a two finger white head.  The aroma was banana, cloves and citrus.  The flavor was bubble gum, cloves and bananas.  This was an excellent hefe.

12oz. bottle as an extra in the trade with GMCC...Thanks Gabe! Aroma is not strong enough...but whats there is very nice...Florals, citrus, and some yeast...smells like Delirium Tremens just not nearly as strong. Pours an amber color with a very think white head. The flavor isnt bad...but again just too light...Whats there is grapefruit...other citruses and yeast. Leaves a weird and unpleasant seltzer water feel on the palate. Overall...its drinkable, but doesnt have many redeeming qualities...I wouldnt buy it.

i enjoyed this, though it’s overall appeal is dampened when on the front end of a 10 or 12 beer taste-off... it’s not the best hefe, but by no means a bottom of the barrel brew... classic, refreshing, fruity taste... soft white head, delicious finish.
Aroma de fermentos e frutas, pouco acentuado. Coloração amarelada com espuma cremosa, mas pouco duradoura. Paladar pouco acentuado, com residual discretamente metálico. Refrescante.

Bottle courtesy of GMCC2181 – Thanks Gabe!   Pours a hazy peach with a one finger snow white head.  The nose is sour wheat and spice.  Taste is fruity bubble gum, malt and spice.  Medium mouth feel.  Nice refreshing brew.  Thanks again G-Sizzle!

5 Liter mini keg pours somewhat clear/hazy golden color with a thick white head.  Aroma of sweet caramel, wheat, and clove follows into taste with the same flavors.  Has a medium mouthfeel with a lot of carbonation.  Overall what I expected.  I personally prefer a little more banana flavor in this style.  A solid brew.
FRom 330ml bottle. Pours cloudy amber and a thick white head. Subtle aroma of citrus fruit and wheat. Flavor is smooth and complex. Citrus and banana slight hint of cloves. good hefe weisen.

A bit cloudy and dark, it smells fruity and starts off strong but then the flavour is mellowed  way down with fruit flavours and then the flavour and alcohal prickles the tounge and gives you just a hint of bitterness. It’s fresh and makes your tounge feel like a CO2 bath you get with highley carbonated beverages but it doesn’t mute the flavour, and there’s even a touch of texture, the cloudiness at work.

Very hazy yellow with a big fluffy head, but just a little lace. Aroma is coppery and metalic at first with a light citrus and dougy aroma. The flavor is mildly spicy with some mild banana overall it is a fairly mild flavor that is more dry than sweet.

Bottle.  Cloudy orange with generous foamy white head.  The usual wheat beer aromas, mainly banana and yeast.  Banana/bubblegum flavours with hints of clove.  Citrus finish.  Light, creamy palate.  Very drinkable and a subtle example of the style
beautiful colour, firml head, a clean palate and a fruity, fresh aroma. A very good Wheat Beer
Bottle. Orange-brown colour. Big white head. Smells yeast and citrus.  Tastes sweet and fruity of orange. Small bitterness. Dry aftertaste.
Pours hazy golden with white head and lots of co2.  Initial tastes of straw/hay which moves into a crispy banana and clove finish with light hops.  A pretty good German style hefe.
Light fruity head, with a solid yeast body. Middle gets a little bit of lemon and Apricot. Finish with aromatic hops and a long animating bitterness.

$5.00 16oz. pint served at Front Page News in the Little Five Points area of Atlanta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours an opaque, obviously unfiltered, dark orange-gold body with a thin, fizzy, white head.

Smell: Wheat male nose with notes of honey, caramel, spice, muted citrus, grain, and unripened bananas.

Taste: Firm malted wheat flavor, appropriately tangy, and with a touch of sweet caramel. Light lemon and banana fruitiness. Dash of ground cloves. Light spicy hops with a mild bitterness. Drying finish with a hint of wheat chaff. As it warms a bit, a taste of unsweetened lemonade creeps into the aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high, fizzy carbonation.

Drinkability: Recommended. A classic, expertly-crafted hefe from the respectable Paulaner brewery.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden body with a white head.  Sweet malt, grassy hop bitterness, fruity esters of citrus and clementine.  Good stuff, simple and session able.

Large frothy head medium carbonation misty straw to mild yellow colour aroma grassy malt wheat clove flavour banana wheat bitter hoppy taste mild malt note of honey but bitter not a good flavour very bland finish.
Its pauly baby! crisp, sorta sweet and peachy almost...Hefe-weizen so thats always a plus! orangish yellow color with good head....overall it was good little beer. -End
Bottle. Cloudy orange in color, big frosty white head. Good aroma of bananas, citrus, and some spices. Taste is decent...banana, spices, yeasty. Light in texture. Nice little hefe.
Cloudy soft orange with a thin white head.  Spicy wheaty aroma.  Taste is soft wheat, citrus oranges, lemon tartness and zest with a small spice bite.

SUPREME.Bought at Mexicali,Mexico Soriana supermarket for 25 pesos a .5 liter it is great.Nice subtle banana flavour,full bodis taste whaet really good with pizza a bit strong great balance between carbonation and palate some sticky body.HEAVENLY

bottle poured a clear light golden color with a thick two finger white head that retained very well. aroma has banana yeast, sweetness that is almost honey like, light lemon, and some floral qualities. mouth feel is crisp and light with good carbonation level. flavor has a light wheat body, banana, light flowery spice, lemon, faint nutmeg, and sweetness. finish is clean with a touch of biting bitterness. the short commercial description is actually spot on.
Pours a golden orange color, with foamy white head.  Decent hefe, but nothing out of the ordinary.  Biscuits, wheat, banana, orange peel, and sweet light fruit.  It would make a nice summer beer.

Dark gold in color with a frothy head. The flavors include pineapple, banana and lemon. The fruit presence should not be feared however. This beer is delicious and easily outperforms other Hefeweizens in its price range.

500 mL on tap. Pours a hazy dark gold/orange with a two-finger white head that goes down quickly. Aroma is a little skunky with some grass, wheat, yeast, body odor, and lemon. Taste is a little thin with some yeast, lemon, faint spices. Aftertaste is long and dry with some white pepper. Cardboard notes show through in the end. Meh.
pours clowdy golden yellow with a white head. Has an aroma of florals and wheat.  A smooth flavor of citrus and wheat with a mild finish. A very descent german hefe.

330ml bottle from the SAQ as part of a trade for a server cabinet
The aroma is sweet and yeasty like a Belgian 
Pours a really nice hazy orangey amber with a huge fast fading white head
The taste is a little bitter and dry and sweet yeasty
Very nice actually
Banana and floral nose, with a slightly off-white head and a cloudy golden liquid.  A pineapple banana taste followed by dry wheat with a little sweetness left over.  Nice medium creamy feel.
Bottle 500ml. poured dark golden orange and cloudy. Nice head, that quickly dissipates. Aroma of wheat and spices. Wheat and peppery flavors, finishing slightly bitter.

50cl bottle. It poured a very pale yellow colour with an enormous white foamy head that settled down fast in the glass. The aroma smells of wheats, bananas and hints of pepper. The flavour is a bit thin and watery. It tastes of sweet bananas, wheats and a bit of citrus. It has a short aftertaste.

Bottle. 
Rich, deep golden orange/amber color. Huge head. Very cloudy. Faint fruity aroma, citrus, banana,
Rich, austere flavor. Big wheat malt and banana, spicy, sweet but mildly so, nice bitterness, little sour or fruit. Excellent balance. Mature tasting, something slightly funky going on. Rich malts all the way. Medium to better body. This is great even from the bottle in Japan. I know it was better on draught in Munich, but alas, no ratings survive!

Brown 330ml bottle, BB 06.09
Served chilled in glass.
Thick moussy lasting white head atop a hazy orange-gold body.
Excellent nose of tropical fruits, candy banana, pepper, clove and husky wheat.
Mouthfilling creamy texture, lively carbonation, full bodied with drying wheaty sharpness.
Cereal wheat backdrop a base for sweet fruit flavours; pineapple, candy banana, peach, apricot, pepper and spice linger with warmth. Drying finish, lingering spice and slight wheaty grain dryness.
Damn, this is a good hefe! Plenty of flavour and body, up there with its Munchner brothers!

12oz. Bottle:  Aroma of yeast and slight fruit.  Poured dark yellow/flaxen in color with a small, rocky, fizzy head that disappeared.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of yeast, wheat, slight citrus, light spices, and white pepper.  Light to medium body.  Thin, watery, chalky texture.  Lively carbonation.  Lightly bitter yeast finish is rather dry.
Bottle, poured into pint glass. Smooth and refreshing, tastes fruity (citrus) and a bit spicy. Very good aftertaste. Recommended.

The Paulaner Hefe-weizen will not blow your socks off with complex flavor or mindnumbing bitterness.  What it offers is a mild, semi-sweet development that presents great drinkability.  It’s my preferred beer on many occasions.  If I weren’t so adventurous I’d stick to this beer all the time.  Lively and fun for the tongue, there’s a balance of banana and yeast.  It pours a perfect gold with a rich and thick creamy head.  A fantastic beer.

Bottle poured into chilled pint glass. Nice wheat and yeast aromas oozing through the clear orange like color. There are bannanas and some bread like flavors. A very easy to drink and great hott weather beer.
mild aroma, awfull appearance looks really dated, flavor is not bad although is nothing special. not as good as i expected that a german beer should be. i wouldn’t recomment it to anyone.
Nice pour big head.  Nose of light fruit citrus.  Flavors of light citrus and bannana yeast.  A bit bitter loved it amazing
bottle- nice spicyness here- clove as well- coriander flavors follow with some orange citrus- not too bad.

Poors a spicy mustard brown/yellow color. Cloudy with a fine head.  Apricot, lemon, fruit, clove, pepper.  Very tasty and almost as spicy as franziskaner.  Smooth with a touch of sweetness.  Wheaty fruity after taste, mmm.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass. Medium golden in color. Cloudy with massive white creamy head. Somewhat tart aroma of light malt, orange, lemon, clove. Tastes of  malt, orange, lemon, banana and clove and lots of yeasty goodness. Medium mouthfeel, perfectly carbonated. I had this on tap in Germany several years ago and surprisingly enough, tastes very similar. If ever there was a warm day session beer, this is it!
Bottle. Lovely cloudy appearence with a good decent  yellow colour, and a huge head. The aroma is malty and yeasty with a hint of banana. Good stuff

Cloudy golden pour with a foamy white head that lasts a while.  Aroma of yeast, wheat, banana, clove and citrus.  Smells exactly how you expect a good hefe to smell.  Flavor is yeasty and citrusy, with the spice coming through more on the finish.  Smooth and refreshing on the palate.  A really good hefe.
Thanks to ghawener.  Pours a light yellow color with a fast disappearing white head.  Light bodied, sweet, some fruit but also a little bit of spices.  Very drinkable and refreshing.
Gracias hawener a traves de casta en la casa del gordo con el pollo y hawener y el gordo

12 oz bottle.  great golden color with just a hint of orange, slightly cloudy  very good example of the hefe style.  i tasted some banana but also some nice smooth clove flavor.  very smooth with a nice carbonation.  perfect summer beer.
bottle 500ml 2,91€ from Alko EXP 03/09 color: dark yellow tiny white head Scent: strong banana plash Taste: pleasant tickling banana bit yeast citrus, biscuit  phenols. Pleasant phenols aftertaste.

11.2 oz bottle.  Fairly light on the aroma, i get buttery popcorn, some yeast, and a spicy sort of citrus, but not as much banana as others seem to think.  Good standard hefe appearance with a good frothy pour, super cloudy look, and golden tangerine orange in color.  Very smooth tasting, with nice medium feel, organic spices and mild citrus fruit with dough, a mostly citrus lemon cookie ending and linger.  Pretty good overall as a beer in general with a few unique qualities here and there (which is nice), otherwise just a solid example of a german wheat beer.
Very nice traditional hefe. A must have for the beginner. It is very flavorful of banana and very light on the clove. Incredibly smooth and happy.

bottle thanks to the fridge of the house i was watching over the weekend.  poured a hazy yellow with a white head that had excellent retention.  aroma of banana and clove.  flavor was wheat and some fruit notes.  pretty good stuff.  maybe i should grab another one.
Bottle, thanks ekstedt. Golden, hazy, with white head. Light, anonymous, fruity aroma. Taste is light and refreshing. Light carbonation.

I thought I had rated this before, but I guess not so I took the time to do some on tap at the Addison Octoberfest.  The beer looks a very cloudy golden orange color with a decent beige colored head.  Smell is mucho banana, wheat, clove, and yeast.  Taste is yeasty, fruity, and wheaty.  Pretty decent beer.
Bottle, poured into weizen glass.  Looks and smells delicious.  Clove, banana, and yeast smells.  Tastes nice and yeasty, with some wheat flavor.  Ends citrusy to me with a long sour finish.

12 fl oz bottle purchased as part of a mix a six at Lukas, Kansas City, Missouri. Produced on 02/08 on label. I have no idea how I haven’t rated this beer yet. Pour is hazy cloudy yellow golden with streaking carbonation bubbles and a big 3 inch white head. Head slowly falls, leaving nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is clove, bananas, bubble gum and nice wheatiness. When I think Hefe nose, I think of this. As the beer warms, some smokiness becomes evident, adding a nice layer of complexity.  Taste is initially the slightly tart wheat, with a nice clean  transition into the cloves of the yeast. Clean palate, medium to thin - drinkable and refreshing. I have always really enjoyed this beer. Nothing complicated, just straight forward and delicious.
Great beer! Taste is very nice with a hint fruit/banana/wheat/spice. Close to but not quite as good as the Weihenstephaner

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 11.2oz or 330ml bottle into a weizen glass.

Appearance: It has a cloudy appearance, lots of visible carbonation and a deep golden yellow color with a thick foamy white head. The head which builds up big and pillowy has very good retention and leaves lots of cool lacing on the glass.

Smell: The aroma has a deep malty wheat scent with hints of banana and a touch of spicy clove.

Taste/Mouth feel: The flavor has a refined and well balanced mix of tangy wheat and sweet malty grain with fruity/earthy yeast that has hints of banana and clove. Hop flavor is very mild, clean, somewhat lemony and most noticeable in the finish which is fairly dry. Its mouth feel is smooth and creamy with a medium body that is very drinkable.

Notes: Overall it’s extremely refreshing and flavorful. Very well done.

One of my standard beers I drink at my local pub and normally have at home. Edges out both Franziskaner and Hacker as the 2nd best German Macro hefeweizen. More flavorful. Tons of banana-clove, bread, yeastiness and fruit. There is no better summer beer. Puts the embarassment that is American-style wheat beer to shame. It is the standard that I weight all Weizens from. Some bettter most worse.

From bottle, hazy bright honey color with beautiful large white head that diminish slowly, aroma of yeast banana and lemon, a pleasant banana flavor with crisp citrus (mostly grapefruit), aftertaste has some clove and a bit hoppy, great wheat beer.

Pours a turbid, opaque gold with white fluffy head that persists for a wee bit. Nose is of wheat and that banana-clove that we all come to love. Taste is the spice that is followed by a lingering banana taste as the beer rolls down your throat. There is a hint of unpleasant aftertaste at the very end. Otherwise, pretty damn good.

From bottle.  August Dayton Beer Tasting event - Favorite Summer Brews.

Pours cloudy yellow/orange with big, long-lasting white head.  Classic Hefe aroma of banana, clove, and grain.  
Balanced flavors with a long finish.  One f my go to Germans.

Date: 09/08.08, 12 oz. bottle


Aroma - Banana, clove, light fruit and grain all contribute to a traditional hefe aroma


Appearance - Cloudy yellow orange that has to be poured carefully because of the explosive, billowing white head that shows good durability.


Flavor - Excellent balance of flavors with the fruitiness of the malt complementing a light wheaty tartness and soft dryness at the finish. 


Palate - Light body, healthy carbonation, smooth and clean palate


Overall - A very fine hefeweizen in the classic tradition from one of Bavaria’s most respected brewers.
Bottle: Great beer.  I almost do not remember drinking the beer because it went down so easy.  Aroma and flavor of banana and yeast.

Draught. Hazy golden colour with a nice white head. Nose is yeast and banana with some lemon. Taste is banana, yeast, sweet and also fruity. Creamy mouthfeel and some bitterness in the aftertaste. Very nice summer beer.

I have always enjoyed this beer.  Nice cloudy golden pour with a decent mostly white head.  Aroma is a yeast explosion with some wheat.  Flavor is all yeast and is fruity and goes down so smooth.  Good creamy mouthfeel.
50cl bottle, hazy golden colour, persistent white head, wheat and yeast aroma, balanced flavor with citrus notes, banana and some hops aftertaste
29.08.2008, 0,5l Bottle. The colour is golden and the beer is cloudy and lively carbonated. Fruity aroma with citrus and flowers. Very fresh and good beer.
Pint of Hefe-Weizen pours a golden color with a nice white head of foam.  This beer has a fruitty taste and aroma.  When in the mood for this style this one is worth a shot.
Mainstream German wheat beer. Beats the American ones any day hands down. If you got to have Hefe, here you go.

Out of the bottle it is a hazy orange beer with a quickly forming white head that dissipates after a while. Smells wheaty, with cloves, a bit of citrus and some banana. Tastes less of the clove, more of the citrus and wheat. Maybe some banana or dried fruit taste. Well carbonated and very drinkable.

Pours a hazy orangish yellow with a big puffy white head that linger for a while leaving good lacing.  Lots of carbonation bubbling up in this one.  Smell is textbook hefe with lots of yeast and cloves with a huge fruity banana sweetness on top.  The taste is a little less sweet than the smell indicated and had a heavier dose of the spices and a more prominent hop presence.  The mouthfeel is medium bodied with a ton of carbonation.  This is a very good hefe and extremely drinkable - makes for a wonderful summer beer.

Pours a beautiful hazy golden color with a massive rocky head.  Nice aromas of banana, clove, yeast, fresh bread and sweet citrus are most noticeable.  The taste is very spicey.  Spice is followed by wonderous flavors of banana, grain, and a nice citrusy aspect.  Finished lightly hoppy.

12oz bottle from Publix Supermarkets. Pours a hazy dark golden color with a massive foamy off-white head. Aroma is wheat, lemon-citrus, apple, banana, some subtle spice. Flavor is sweet and malty with grain, hay, yeast, citrus and spice notes. Generally light to medium body with a clean bready finish.

Somewhat watery, sandy. highly carbonated. short lived finish. Cloudy, with a nice head. pretty, golden. creamy. medium bodied, with lively carbonation. Banana, citrus, and spices. medium craft. Well done, if a bit weak.
Cloudy wheat color.   Tons of esters in the nose.  Great clove and banana taste.  So easy to drink.  Very dry, yet fizzy finish.  Yum.

Spicy banana clove, notes of zwieback and honey.  Cloudy amber, huge billowy head.  Sweet mellow malts, lemony tartness, slight bitterness, almost undetectable, but works for the balance.  Bubbly carbonation, spicy bready finish.  Excellent Hefeweizen, good complexity, yet easy drinking and refreshing
Nice weiss.  Cloudy yellow with a creamy white head.  Lots of banana and spice up front with a dry, yeasty finish.  The yeast is quite assertive with almost no bitterness.

Bottle courtesy of tupalev. Pours a hazy yellow-orange with a large frothy white head. Pleasant aroma of yeast, banana, lemon, wheat and grain. Flavour’s the same, yeasty with banana and lemon along with a touch of spices, a bit of grain and very light hops in the finish -- very easy to drink. Medium bodied. For something so readily available in Ontario this is a pretty damn good Hefe -- well done!
restored my faith in hefeweissens, what a great beer. tremendous smell and taste. had from bottle from bevmo.
This is a good Hefe beer.  It has a little fruity taste.   It pours cloudy with a large white head.  Nice aroma of wheat and yeast.  Nice beer.
Draft: Pours cloudy with a white head. Strong Banana and clove aroma. Taste is of citrus, banana, and clove. A watery feel. A great Hefe.

Perfect for a summers day. Pours nice and golden til you swirl in the dregs from the bottle, then the cloudy yeasty spice hits you. Superbly tart and refreshing, not mouth puckering but definitely wakes your mouth up. Good hefe...
Cloudy straw color with a thick head.  Banana and clove aroma.  One of the Better Hefeweizens available in the U.S. The perfect drink for a 107 degree day in August.
Many bottles. Cloudy yellow/orange colour, white head. Aroma of banana, yeast and wheat. Taste is banana, dry wheat/grainy flavours. Prickly mouthfeel, rather dry. Not really refreshing.
500 ml botlle. hazy orange colour. small white head. just another white-beer.

This is a personal favourite of mine. Pours cloudy, and produces a nice white head wich diminishes slowly. You can feel the banana there, and theres some citrus hints definitely. Not bitter at all, which i dont care but i understand it can be a problem for some folks. Overall quite similar to Franziskaner Hefe, both are ideal for those bloody hot 35º nights of July and August in spain!
50cl.  Typical hefeweissbier - citrussy and banana notes.  Has a persistent head and pours cloudy.

Draught. Pours cloudy yellow, with brilliant white copious head. Distinctive both on the nose and palate, with notes of citrus and yeast suffusing both, and addtionals of hops on the palate. Decent wheatbeer.
Large frothy white head.  Hazy yellow body.  Aroma of banana a some citrus hints.  Not much taste here.  Pretty bland.
A creamy yellow beer with a nice white head.  Smooth and crisp with fruity hints, particularly banana.  Nice refreshing beer.

12 oz bottle-Cloudy orange color w/a moderate white head that never went away. Malty, fruity aroma. Had a malt flavor w/touches of banana, orange peel, colander, yeast, bread dough & cream soda. Had a very creamy mouthfeel, almost to the point of distraction. Could have used a little more of a bitter finish, but overall quite good. Long, creamy finish
Aroma was citrusy yeast, taste of banana and wheat malts.  Almost creamy feel on the tongue, but not very strong.  Some what disappointing, left me wanting something more.

Smells good when opened. Esters like grasslands near a stand of trees. Lots of malty, yeasty color... dense in cloudiness. Earthy, banana goodness. Went great with smoked meat! A hint of clove and spices. Delicious!

Bottle. This just hit the spot. Very surprised at my enjoyment of this, had the Optimator before and wasn’t too impressed, but this was great on a summer day on the lake. Big fluffy head atop a wonderfully cloudy yellow body. Fruity, wheat, yeasty, do I detected coriander (in a German hefe? weird.) Crisp, refreshing, bananas and cloves, a touch of citrus and coriander again. A pleasant surprise!

Very pleasant. 
Big citrusy nose and great effervescence on the tongue.  Sooths your thirst.

0,33 l bottle. Delightful Weizen - cloudy, yeasty with a wide range of aromas: orange, lemon, banana, wheat, coriander. Flowery hoppy aftertaste.  Really refreshing and enjoyable, especially now in the summer.

One of the classics.  From a bottle in the United States.  Nice aroma of herbs, citrus, and a little yeast.  Pours a cloudy orange with a persistant white head.  Clear, wheaty flavor with yeast in the background, with a note of lemon and a clove spice kick at the end.  Goes down smooth.   Great as a thirst quencher, and also pairs well with a lot of foods.

Bottle dated 05/2007. Cloudy, golden appearance. I was barely able to see the outline of my fingers through the glass. Banana flavor followed by very subtle honey and citrus notes. A nice accompaniment to sitting outside by the pool.
Bottle. Pours a hazy copper colour with a white head. The aroma has notes of perfumy herbs, orange and coriander. The flavour is yeasty with notes of orange and perfumy herbs. Thin on the mid-palate.
Gold color with a medium head.  Strong wheat and Munich malt aroma.  Light banana flavor.  Very yeasty.  Tastes very much like fresh liquid bread.
Golden yellow colour with off white head. Aroma of orange, coriander and strong wheat. The taste is more fruity than wheaty. Slightly bitter taste and aftertaste. Overall a very good beer.

Pours an opaque golden yellow with medium off-white head.  Big wheat and some citrus on the nose and the taste.  Different from the "American style" hefes I’m used to, but I enjoyed it.  A great refresher on a hot summer day.

Appearance: Dark orange, cloudy. Lots of head.
Aroma: Bit of wheat. Citric. Orangy.
Taste: Quite fruity, not much wheat. Hopsy. Bitter aftertaste.
Info: 500ml bottle, 17/2-2007, 145/500
I have had this on bottle and tap and it is worth every drop you get from the bottle or cup. I find Paulaner to be one hell of a Hefeweizen. Drink it, drinking it makes it you friend!

great for summer! poured a  cloudy shade of light amber with big off white head very smooth, aromas of wheat and citrus taste is clean and crisp with flavors of hops and and citrus with a slightly bitter dry finish the best thing about this beer was i picked it up at woomans for .75cents not bad for a beer rated 90

Paulaner is one of my favorite beers to drink alongside a football match.  Pours cloudy golden color with white head.  A perfect melding of wheat and citrus flavors.  This beer is absolutely wonderful.
(Bottle 50cl, Rema) Pours a hazy golden body with a huge white creamy lasting head. Aroma of wheat and fruites (citrus and banana). Flavor is sweet, wheat and banana notes.Very good.

Bottle courtesy of tupalev - thanks, Jeff! Hard to believe I’ve never gotten around to rating this one. Hazy golden-orange with a ridiculously large white head. Big hefe aroma with a nice citrus edge. Full bodied with a creamy middle and a crisp finish. Flavour is bang-on for the style. Finish is a bit sweeter than some, but still, this is a great example that I enjoyed immensely.
Had a small sample of this at Gingerman’s in SoNo, CT.  Overall a solid hefe.. I am more partial to Weinhenstephan but this was good.

From bottle.  Pours a vibrant golden amber.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, and spices.  Flavor is initially sweet, with spices and wheat.  Finishes mild with orange notes.  Flavors linger pleasantly in your mouth, sweet and mild.  Very good.

Absolutely Brillliant Hefeweiss. I had this in a pub (Bukowski’s) in Back Bay Boston. The waitress made a special point to leave the yeast at the bottom of the bottle and then return a few minutes later after the head settled to finishing pouring the end of the beer plus yeast. Delicious, refreshing taste. I taste fresh grass in the brew with a hint of citrus. Highly recommended.

12 oz. bottle.  &quotPaulaner Hefe-Weizen Natural Wheat&quot  Cloudy golden color.  Creamy white lasty head.  Fruity yeast smell.  Very fizzy carbonation.  Initially very sweet flavor with a slight bitter saltly finish.
Bottle and Tap,  A smoking example of a Hefe! I cant think of a better way to spend an afternoon in the summer!

A great example of this style.  One of the most refreshing and fruity without being over the edge in terms of sweetness.  I was very surprised at how good this was compared to how I thought it was going to be.
On draft at the Yard House in Las Vegas.  Great hefe characters with subtle notes of fruit (citrus).  Great for a 100 degree night!

Bottle at Union Jacks.
Cloudy golden, Big creamy head. Aroma of wheat, fruit. Flavor of yeast, wheat and light apple. Sweet fruit finish.
Draught. Pours hazy yellow with a fluffy white longlasting head. Aroma of banana, sweet candy and wheat. Flavour is very citric with banana, clove and spicy notes. Great thirst quencher.

Pours a deep hazy gold, bubbly and carbonated but probably less so than many other german wheats. Much head-- bright white. Aroma is not particularly notable-- mostly just wheat. Doesn’t
do anything too special on the palate at first (though it does tingle), but I picked up more flavors with the aftertaste, which is sweet and fruity, and sometimes spicy. Each sip felt a little different as I tried to pick up the flavors, which is a great thing. On the whole, it’s a good experience.
Bottle. Orange/dark yellow color, very good off-white head. Solid wheat taste, citrus, very bready. Good amount of hefeweizen spice. Very good refreshing beer, could easily drink a 6 pack in a day.
Nice light brown/orange color, quite good head. Wheat, banana and hints of citrus in the nose. Same elements are notable in the flavor. Solid Weißbier.

Bottle from Papous Wine, pours a hazy dark yellow with a great foamy head.  Aroma is yeast and and fruit.  Great carbonation and very smooth.  An above average Hefeweizen.  Great for a hot day like today

Poured a golden yellow with a nice head.Very hazy looking.Smells like citrus and fruit as it should. A little banana and wheat in there also went well together.Tasted more sour than I was expecting. Had more banana and lemon flavoring than anthing.Overall worth a try but not my favorite of the style. Still a drinkable beer.

0,5l bottle. Pours hazy dark yellow, a bit orange with a mild head. Aroma is a bit too stingy with wheat, that?s also the problem with the flavor. I like my hefeweizens a bit more easy and this one is a bit too stingy and bitter for me. Despite it?s flaws it?s good and I?d drink it again. (636212)
Re-rate: Disregard the negatives. It’s a good hefe.

Seriously active cloudy orange beer, with a constantly growing head - crisp and lemony aroma, with a nice earthy, nutty wheat character, and a light acidity - a tiny bit of apple-ish sweetness up front, followed by light acidity and a touch of tartness - just a touch of banana and phenolic flavor - a lot of citrus arrives late, as the beer dries out and the wheat becomes apparent at last - not as good as weihenstephaner, but one of the better readily available german hefes, especially at 2 bucks a 50cl bottle.

This stuff’s mint.  Almost reminds me of champaign.  It’s quite bubbly, has a light mouthfeel, and has a fruity nose.  Don’t let the fruity thing discourage you; it doesn’t have stupid flavoring like you see in ML/BL Lime beers or in Lienkugels (sp?).  Great if you’re going to a semi-fancy event where there aren’t a lot of "serious" beer drinkers, even though they ought to appreciate it too.  It shows that beer can have flavor without being too heavy or intense.  Not exactly a beer for a night of hard drinking with the guys, but perfect for one or two on a warm afternoon with mixed company.

Bottle. Pours a translucent golden amber with a thick white head that lingers and leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Nice yeasty aroma with hints of citris and banana. Mouth feel and taste are outstanding. Light, refreshing and not over done with citrius like lesser hefes. If it werent for the price of a six, this would be my top choice for an every day hefe.

Bottle pours a hazy golden yellow with a foamy white head that quickly recedes.  Nice light, crisp aroma of wheat, yeast, and cloves.  Flavor is slightly sweet, bananas, some citrus, and wheat.  Very refreshing
On tap at Frankfurt airport.  Yeasty, wheaty.  Some taste of bananas and slightly sweet.  Citrus.  Very tasty, even in my jet-lagged state.

Bottle, 6 pack, LCBO.  Man, a world class Hefe at the LCBO and I never knew...cool. Anyway - pours a beautiful hazy medium yellow with a huge frothy white head with great lacing and lots of active streaming bubbles - perfect.  Very nice yeasty, dry, some citrus, lemon, hint of banana aroma.  Taste - bang on style again - full flavoured, full bodied yet very refreshing, drinkable, and perfectly carbonated.  Tangy citrus, yeast, lemon in taste - maybe just a little more here would get it perfect marks if I was being extremely picky and is finished a little short for me.  But really, this is as good as a Hefe as you are likely to find from the bottle - I’d put it second only to Dennison’s on tap here in Toronto.  A nice discovery.
Cloudy golden colour, nice big head, and lots of sweet floral and wheat aromas. I think i smelled a little squash as well. Lively fruit character, sweet and inviting. a friendly brew all around.

Very, very similar to Hacker-Pschorr’s hefeweizen. That is not a bad thing, as I really love Hacker-Pschorr’s. Most people tend to prefer Franziskaner over Paulaner or Hacker-Pschorr, however, I don’t. Both HP and Paulaner have a fruity, more tropical feel to them. Slightly banana-esque, easy to drink, shocks the taste buds. Classic cloudy golden hefeweizen hue. I’d have to drink this and Hacker-Pschorr right next to each other in order to really document the difference in flavor, but one thing I noticed was that this didn’t have the same overpowering, lovely flowery aroma that Hacker-Pschorr had- it was comparitively weak. Very good hefeweizen, you can’t go wrong with either this or Hacker-Pschorr.

Bouteille de 330 ml. Au départ on aperçoit la bière de couleur paille voilée avec une belle mousse qui diminue lentement. Par la suite notre nez nous apprends que la bière contient des arômes de blé, de zeste de citron, de levure, de banane et de pomme rouge. Pour terminer notre palais détecte un corps moyen, une texture crémeuse et  nos papilles gustatives des flaveurs de blé, de levure, de purée de banane et de citron.
Bottle. Cloudy Yellow with a frothy white head. Wheat, Banana, Citrus, Yeast and Spices. Light body, easy drinking and very refreshing. A quality weiss.
Bottle, pours hazy and yellow with a large, white head. Nose of wheat,  banana and notes of yeast. Crisp and medium sweet flavour with grain and citrus. Light bodied. A pleasant brew.

12oz. brown bottle served in a pilsner glass (my hefe glass is a 500ml). Pours a hazy pale gold with lots of carbonation. Three fingers of fine, white bubbled head. Subdued aroma of spicy clove. Light bodied, some citrus. Banana and clove in the finish. A very refreshing summer beer, but not my favorite hefe. Aroma was a little lacking to me.

Pours from the 16.9 oz (25% more than your regular 12 ouncer!) bottle a cloudy apple juice amber with a foamy one finger head that settles int a thick collar.  Mild carbonation present in the haze.  Aroma is tangy citrus with maybe a hint of banana. Taste is a sharp snap of crisp, tart citrus and banana.  The tell-tale wheat zing is very present and also very refreshing!  Mouthfeel is crisp, slighly effervescent, and medium bodied.  Drinkability is very good, especially on a sweltering summer day!  Overall, this is a very tasty beer.  I picked up a single for sampling & rating purposes, but i’ll soon be going back for a couple of sixers to put away for those hot, humid summer days to come!

Rerate: Pours a hazy orange color with a nice white head. Nice, typical aroma of spices, yeast, banana. Flavour is pretty much the same with a light acidity. A bit thin in the mouth but it’s truly refreshing and good. High drinkability.

Pours brownish yellow, very thick head as expected. Slight citrus aroma. Definitely can taste banana in it, delicious. The flavor of alcohol comes through more than I’m used to in this type of beer. A little more bitter than a typical hefeweizen too. It’s definitely unique and worth a taste.
bottle, good bubbly tapioca head, cloudy orange color, banana and spice nose, smooth lemon and spice flavor with banana notes also, a very nice finish and very drinkable hefe

Bought a case of this last weekend.  Very happy with it.  Poured a nice cloudy dark gold color with nice fizzy/bubbly white head that lasts.  Aroma is banana, lemon, a bit of yeasty doughiness.  Flavor is nice and light, but not watery, spiced banana with bit of lemon.  Overall, perfect warm weather beer.  Had this with a friend around a bonfire and couldn’t have asked for a better choice.

Easily the best unfiltered I have had to date, and it is widely available. There is always a robust head to go with the yellow-orange body, and the citrus flavors are present without too much sweetness.
Flaske. Faktisk en rigtig skuffende Hefeweize. God duft af banan, men ikke en særlig pæn øl. Rødligt skær i den uklare normale farve. Smagen er en anelse frugtig, men er ikke rigtig forfriskende.

12 oz. bottle from John’s Grocery (Iowa City, IA). Pours a cloudy glowing golden orange hue with a nice white head that looks like merangue. Aromas of yeast, banana esters, and a touch of sweet citus. Initial taste is light, with a nice subtle yeastiness, some esters that are understated, yet appreciated, and a slightly bitter finish that lets me know I didn’t miss the citrus and banana. Aftertaste leaves some more of the esters on the tounge. A very light bodied brew that seems to quench very well and is not on the sweet side, but still makes its presence felt. Good, but not my favorite Hefe.
Zesty lemony full of citrus and a hint of banana, crisp finish.  Easy to drink light head cloudy golden appearence.  I was impressed.
cloudy light orange with little head or lacing. allspice and cloves aroma. banana spice taste, crisp finish.

Paulaner Hefeweissbier is cloydy, yellow-orange beer with medium white head. Aroma is typical: wheats, bananas and yeast. Wheatness is quity light, but instead of that there are some bitterness and hops in the flavour. Carbonation is balanced and so this is quite smooth to drink. Differs from typical hefes so that there are more hops and maybe Paulaner is not so sweet plus some biting aspect makes this more interesting.

On tap at the Paulaner Biergarten in Munich, which is the only way to drink this delicious hefe.
This is an excellent example of this wonderful style, aroma, flavor, color, all exemplary.  Wonderful beer.
Pours a hazy golden orange.  Aromas of bread/bananas/ and some fruit.  Had a taste of yeasty bread with some spice.

500 ml bottle. Deep yellow color, only slightly cloudy, huge head. Pleasant aroma,  yeast, wheat and fruit -- but not too much banana. Taste is fruity, with a wheaty finish. Big  on carbonation, low on banana. A very nice example of the style.
Germany’s pride and joy, and with good reason. Fruity nose with good lacing. Lovely orangish tint. Lemony with a little yeast and orange on the back-end. Definately one of the best in the world.

Pours hazy yellow, white head; the nose not too prominent. Taste of lemons and wheat, almost no sweetness at all. Average finish. Overall a good, light and very easy to drink wheat beer-but aren’t they all?
Bottle: Pours a hazy yellow gold with a white head. Aroma, lemons, yeast, wheat. Flavor, wheat, lemons, a light tartness, bready malts. Good stuff.
Had on tap at Palmers Place in Lagrange, IL a while back. Pours light golden color with a white head. Flavor is light and crisp. Not to bad for a Hefeweizen which is one of my least favorite styles

4 beer sampler a Old Chicago tCloudy amber with a good quantity of foamy white head. Smells of fruity yeast, citrus and pear. Flavor is very well balanced and rounded with hints of coriander and orange. Aftertaste is somewhat bready and leaves a tartness in your mouth but not bad. Smooth and heavily consistant mouthfeel. A very good Hefe.
very pleased with this hefeweizen. tastes very good. one of my favorites. i love it. cant get enough

12 oz bottle from Total Wine in Jacksonville, FL.  Pours an unfiltered yellow/gold color with medium white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, banana and maybe a touch of clove. Tastes is light citrus, wheat and light banana, with a light finish.  Not too bad, but nothing special.

Huh, another one I missed.  pretty typical hefe, though I still think it’s a bit overrated. I feel better about Ayinger and even Hacker Pschorr than this one. Decent though. Nice body, lot of effervescence.
A little on the light side, plenty of citrus tones and pleasant enough.  Nice lemon yellow golden color poured from bottle with a nice haze.  perhaps just not big enough Plenty of head

Great aroma, refreshing and some citrus in it. no alc. Looks nice, with a god sized head.. Fantastic flavor, the alc. is totally hidden, very refreshing, but not watery. Palate is not out of the ordinary, but not watery as one might expect. Overall one of the best of its kind that i’ve tasted (not that i’ve tasted so many of this kind, but stil..)

Pours a medium amber with more than one inch of head. 
Aroma is malts and spice.
Flavor is very well balanced sweet malts and slightly bitter hops. Wheat smooths the taste overall and makes this a session beer for sure. 
Served about 40 deg. F.
Good summer beer, very refreshing.

On tap at St Veronus. Shared with a friend. Reminiscent of Denison Weissbier. Milder in flavour and overall impact. Taste heavy in bananas and clove. Nose dominant in banana and cardamom. Clean finish, and a very refreshing and flavourful beer.

Draught - pours a dense dark gold with a thick white head and lace. Light body, slight banana/clove aroma. Very soft mouthfeel, light wheaty flavor.
Earlier Rating: 9/27/2007 Total Score: 3.6
On draught at the brewpub. Poured a dense dark amber with a very thick white head. Mellow banana-clove aroma and early hop bitterness. Medium-bodied with a soft mouthfeel. Wheaty flavor balanced with pale malt and a hint of clove. Nice job!
Unfiltered yellow with medium white head.  Aroma of yeast, wheat, banana and clove.  Taste of lemon, wheat and light banana.  Decent beer with a light dry finish.

330ml bottle 

5.50% ABV 

I tried this beer on March 20, 2008 at "Smokeless Joe’s" in Toronto, Ontario.  The beer poured a hazy orange gold colour with a huge fluffy white head.  The aroma was malt, and spice.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied and highly carbonated.  The flavour was grainy malt, and some sweet banana hints

Ahhh... Those guys at this brewery know their stuff. Excellent Hefe Weiss! Has all teh classic hallmarks of the quintessential bavarian weiss beer. Pours with a nice white fine head and good lace. Typical cloudy yellowish amber color. Good sharp tang and carbonation. All the traditional  esters in this kind of beer. Easily a session beer. Very clean pleasant finish. I’ve been drinking this for many years and I believe that it’s actually improved over time. Having a mug a this at Bodega Brew Pub downtown La Crosse, Wisconsin. USA

Pretty good hef.  Poured a nice unfiltered gold with plenty of head. Smooth and more mild than most in this catagory.  Aroma of wheat malt and bananas led to a crisp refreshing flavor and equally subtle finish

A solid hefe.  I love wheat beers and feel like they’re an underappreciated lot.  Everyone goes big for the massive IPA’s or the insane Imperial Stouts, but the balance and flavor of a great wheat beer is not lost on me.  This one had some nice banana clove aroma...  I got something additional as it warmed - nutmeg?  cinnamon?  some kind of darker spice.  Clean on the palate, mildly sweet and a refreshing finish.  Summer’s coming.  This one would be great on a hot day.

Masterful.  Highly fruit and banana nose, with that ever inviting bubblegum scent as well.  It’s appearance is solid, with a decent cloudy body and nice head.  It’s flavor is sweet fruit, banana, vanilla perhaps, and definitely bubblegum like.  I can’t say anything, but smooooth and refreshing.  Awesome!

First time I’ve tried this German Wheat Beer.  It is a very light blonde colour with a frothy white head.  Doesn’t seem as cloudy as other wheat beers.  A noticeable fruity aroma.  I found it tasted more like a lager and might appeal to first-time wheat beer drinkers.  When I looked for it in the aftertaste, I could notice the bananas.

Re-rate 9/16/08.  Sampled on draft.  Pours a hazy yellow color with a thick fluffy white head.  Bananas, cloves, yeast, slightly creamy, and a little spice. Nicely done.  Palate is full enough.  Crisp and refreshing.  A very good hefe.
Hazy Yellow with a huge head. Aroma of wheat, orange and banana. Flavour of lemon, banan and some sour apple.

I can’t help but think this is labelled wrong on here. The reviews of other members match my experience, but it’s labeled as a "Paulaner Hefe-Weizen Natural Wheat" on the bottle, and I couldn’t find "Paulaner Hefe-Weizen Natural Wheat" on ratebeer.com, so I assume it’s just mislabeled. I understand this is supposed to be for China, but Paulaner Hefeweizen isn’t even on here...

That aside, here is my review. Poured a cloudy copper color with an off-white head that lasted throughout. Smelled like banannas and flowers and yeast and something else... possibly cinamon. Tasted lightly of banannas and grain and a bit of citrus. A nice balanced mouthfeel, goes down smooth and refreshing.

Great beer.

Serving type: bottle

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, this is a classic fruity wheat beer.  Nice banana colored with a traditional hefeweizen head.

Poured from a 12.oz bottle from BevMo Mission Valley.   A nice cloudy golden color with a nice puffy white head to it. smell very sweet citrus maybe a little banana. taste is very good a little bitter at first than i mellows out to a very mild lemon/ orange taste finished very clean.
nice Weizen beer. 50CL bottle, full body, sticky, lively, astringent. Light bitter, a nice weizen.
Paulaner sets the bar for all other Hefeweizens with the quality and taste brewed in this beer.   A little higher in alcohol, with full body, light bitterness and drinkability.

...one of the best bottled Hefe’s.  Great yeast sediment in bottle, that truly must be there for ultimate flavor.  Pours a cloudy goldish orange, with a decent white head that lasts, and lively carbonation. Strong hints of fruitiness, clove, and candy, blended with balance to the wheat malt. Has a great creamy consistancy, very flavorful. Citrus notes there too, with a nice creamy finish and lingering wheat flavors.  If you like Hefe’s, you must try this bad-assed beer.  I want to find it on draft, but havn’t had any luck. -_-

A very very good Hef.  To me, one of the best available in the US for sure.  I really enjoy its flavors - light, crisp, fruity, slighty sweet, with hints of orange and lemon.  Nice carbonation.  Should be poured out of bottle for true enjoyment, as with most hefs.

Bottle.  Pours a nice golden yellow with a beautiful thick, creamy white head.  Aroma and taste of wheat, citrus, banana, spices- your typical hefeweizen.  Smooth to drink, very carbonated, light-bodied taste.  An excellent hefeweizen, although not my favorite of the style.  Still, I love my hefes!


Update 6/13/08: On tap at local bar.  I don’t know if the keg was fresh, but this draught version was not as good as the bottle version I had.  Spices were less pronounced and it was less flavorful in general.  Flat too.  I won’t change my rating and hopefully can get a better tap version of this.

Poured from bottle into Weizen glass.  Cloudy golden honey color with large white head.  Bready aroma, also cloves.  Didn’t notice the banana, will try and pick this up next time.  Flavor typical of a wheat beer, nice citrusy crispness.  Nice mouthfeel, made you want to drink more.  Overall a very decent hefe.

One of the better hefs out there.  Pours a cloudy golden orange color with a cremy head.  Strong fruity aroma of banana and some citrus.  A very full smooth and creamy mouthfeel for a hefeweizen.  Fruit flavor is strong, but not overpowering.  This is a good beer year ’round, but is one of my favorite summer beers.

Pours a nice, creamy head.  Nose has a noticeable banana aroma with a hint of citrus. The flavor is pretty consistent with the good German hefes with definite cloves and perhaps a little  coriander.  Especially like the 5L mini kegs- kind of hard to find, but worth the search. This is one of the best examples that i’ve tasted of this type; therefore, tends  to disappear rather quickly when my hefe-drinking buddy pays a visit.
This is the first hef that i ever had and it is my favorite for that reason.  There are better ones out there. but this one has a lot of nostalgia behind it for me.
pours nicely leaving a good creamy ,thick head. Has nice hints of banana and is very fresh. Goes good with just about anything. Very good baseline Hefeweizen beer.

Pours great for a hefe, muddled and golden, small head with light lacing..  Heavy barley aroma that is sweet and strong with hints of citrus.  First taste reaction: That is good!  Somehow almost full-bodied, rich and creamy, yet bitter and salty and truly hefe-like.  Very good! - and that is coming from a guy who doesn’t like hefes - i prefer dopplebocks.

22 oz Paulaner glass, if im not mistaken. this is by definition a perfectly re-drinkable beer. thin head wilth a little lace. cloudly with citrusy aroma(didnt help the bartender put an orange slice in it). light spice, strong on citrus, great smooth mouthfeel. yeastyness that dissipates quickly. honestly on a warm summer day or humid evening, this is just about a perfect beer.
12 oz bottle ..hazy golden orange , thick off white head, some lace . aroma of citrus and bubblegum . fresh citrus flavor with a munich malt background and doughy yeast. decent body and carbonation .

I really enjoyed this beer. Rather new to ’tasting’ beer and trying to find out what I like and what I don’t. Have not tried enough to give a really good explanation, but I will do my best.

I’ve had this beer in the bottle and tap. The aroma out of the bottle is good, a hint of citrus. the appearance is a nice dark golden, almost orange tint. The flavor is very good. Best with an orange I have found, but almost just as good without it.  Goes down smooth, and just a good beer to me.

The definition of German hefeweizen. Heavy baked bread, clove, bubblegum on the nose. Too much for my individual taste but certainly the style. Decent head. Light bodied with high carbonation, a quaffable beer with very light hop character.

Lightly fruity, clove with a slight citrus aroma.  Beautiful in a glass, great white head and orange hue.  Flavor is munich and wheat grain with a fantastic yeasty and dough flavor.  Hints of fruit with a good strong clove finish.  Banana flavors come out as it warms.  Nice mouth feel, full and slightly chewy.  Overall never ever a disappointment.  A very solid HefeWeizen.

Thick off white head. Orange hue with suspended yeast when poured as intended. Fresh tart wheat with little discernible hop. Drank in midwinter, but would bet this is a cracking summer thrist-quencher.
cloudy gold color.  fruity in aroma and flavor, quite malty.  a little overcarbonated...
Bottle. Pours cloudy wheat with thick white head. Spicy lemon aroma, nice sour hefe taste with good body. Even better draft.
at first the beer has a sour taste to it, and then theres a after taste that comes and makes this beer taste great.
Good hefe, has a citrusy aroma with about a one-inch white head.  Tastes of wheat, citrus, and some banana notes.  Has a mildly bitter finish and is good on a hot day.

Bouteille de 330 ml, acheté à l’SAQ de Rosemère (Québec) le 28/2/08, bu le 1/3/08. Blanche orange brumeuse, petit collet. Arome de crème de blé épicé, banane et petits fruits. Goût de blé peu épicé et malté, très légé et très rafréchissant.

A good wheat, to be sure...to me, it’s among the small handful that ’set the standard’ for the category.  Sweet, bready, not overbearing, apparent and not overly-complex flavors, and above all, very very drinkable.

Pours a hazy light gold with a good size somewhat lingering head.  The carbonation is very apparent.  The aroma is typical of a wheat...bready, with bananas and apple pie/clove spices with just a faint hint of citrus, mostly grapefruit.

The taste is straightforward, and much like the aroma.  Very bready with hints of banana and a citrus taste that is more predominant than in the aroma.  The clove/spice taste is reserved for the finish, which is relatively bitter, dry, and clean.

A pretty standard, all around well-done Hefe. Basically all that you could want in a hefe, banana, clove, yeasty goodness. I don’t really know what else to say without feeling a bit redundant. Quite fruity and a king-sized stein is pretty filling! The yeast adds almost a weird dry touch in the finish, which is something I haven’t experienced before in any wheat beer. Maybe that was just from the sheer amount of the stuff that I had.

Draft.  Orange pour with almost no head.  Aroma is citrus, grainy malt, generally sweet.  Flavor is typical for the style; light and refreshing.  It’s a little grainy, bananas, citrus.  Slightly above average for the style.

Aroma faint and a bit chemical -organic, but  an off note.  This is the typical wheat beer yellow with medium foam.  Flavor is like watered down orange soda with a small bitter whang.   The body is watery and not what one would suspect from a premium beer.   Passable for drinking if mega brews are all that is available.

Aroma of coriander, clove, some orange and a little bit of banana. Large, creamy, off-white head covering a hazy orange body. Clean tasting hefe with a bitter finish. Lively carbonation. Pretty decent overall. Thanks to ilovedarkbeer for this one.

This is a nice hefeweizen with a lighter bubblegum/banana quality and stronger toasty grain quality.  It is lightly cloudy gold with a very big, dense off-white head that lasts long and is creamy.  Teh aroma is 1st toasty grain but this gives way to bubblegum, banana, light yeasty wheat bread, fresh plums - very nice.  The taste is tingly with a light grain quality throughout plus a light bubblegum and banana quality, lemon-lime soda pop, balanced sweet-bitter character, then in the finish the toasty grain takes over for a long finish, more so than seems usual for German hefeweizens.  It’s a great example.

Pours out a cloudy amber with a thick, white, fairly persistent head. Aroma is strong and wheaty with some citrus component - but this may have come from the obligatory slice of lemon. Flavor is rich, wheaty with a hoppy undertone and just a touch of bitterness, and a lemony hint. Smooth, enjoyable, refreshing.

Beautiful amber-hazy appearance with a huge foamy stable head. The nose is complex:citrus some vanilla and banana fruit. The flavour is vanilla, some fenolic hints and a little fruit and yeast, moderated carbonation. Nice smooth taste. Classic of the style, correct and delicious.
Apricot color, white head. Unfiltered. Not a huge nose, yeasty aroma. Good wheat. Flavor is light yeasty, zesty, not seltzery, Nicely carbonated.
Didn’t do much for my palate, seemed a little too bland for me.  The appearance was a hazy yellow with moderate head.  Enjoyable but not that special for a hefeweizen to me.

Very nice aroma of wheat, vanilla, slight citrus. Gorgeous mid-amber color, slightly cloudy. Starts with a thick head that takes about 10 minutes to settle, leaving slight lacing on the glass. Its flavor is very nice- slightly sweet, honey/wheat, with a banana and vanilla aftertaste. Smooth on the palate- a GREAT beer! Overall it’s awesome.
Poors golden yellow with decent head.  Some fruit.... banana with yeast flavor.  Good wheat beer I like it.
Hazy light yellow color with a big white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, citrus and bannana. Flavor of wheat, banana and some citrus.

Rated tast time: 30.12.2007

On tap / Bottle brown 500 ml, extract of wort 12,5 %, unfiltered, pasteurized>

Appearance: Pours cloudy, murky to muddy body, orange and wheat in colour, reminding carrot juicemixed with apple juice, some hints of metalic hue, body looks medium, density is average. Head is initially large, then slowly decreases to small and remains for a long time, frothy in structure and perfectly white like a fresh snow.lacing is present but rather small. Carbonation of the body is visually medium.

Aroma: Nice, strong aroma of a good quality wheat and wheat malt together with mellow yeasty background, strenghtened by gentle, aromatic and a bit grassy refreshing hops. When you plongue deeper into the aroma you can feel barley malt, orange, banana and fresh toasty bread and wheat rolls. A hint of carrot juice.

Flavour:Texture is very smooth, mild. Components are very well balanced and the taste is full. Front is mellow, smooth, yeasty and hoppy with its freshnass and herbal aromatic nose. Then comes some mild carbonation and moves through a tongue. You can natice wheat grains and barley grainy malt, toasty, floury, white fresh bread, very well balanced and reach flavour, satisfying the consumer and completely achieving its goal. Banana and orange peal is distinguishable, flowery nose, some bitterness in the aftertaste of hoppy origin but playing nice impression together with slight accidity in the beer texture from carbonation.

Palate:Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation on palate is soft to medium and the beer seems naturally effervescent, finish feel is smooth, mellow, creamy, alcohol is well hidden.

Sampled this beer on draft at a restaurant in Berlin.  It had a cloudy, straw color with a very big, foamy, white head, and a sediment look inside.  The aroma featured wheat tones, sweet caramel, herbal hops, some banana, and a touch of citrus.  The taste was a good bitter-sour blend with some wheaty sweetness.  It has a mostly full, wet body, and is mostly smooth, but a bit grainy with little carbonation.  Definitely a quality hefeweizen, but does not quite separate itself from the pack.

Bottle, 50cl. Hazy golden yellow, with a white head. Fruity and sweet aroma with notes of yeast, wheat, banana and esters. A soft, medium bodied and highly carbonated mouthfeel with a citrusy taste with notes of banana, yeast and wheat. A decent  hefeweizen, but could use something more to make it unique.
My favorite hefeweizen.  Looks great unfiltered.  Wonderful arom of lemon, citrus, wheat, and yeast.  Very smooth from front to back.  Finish full of ariomatic hops.  A wonderful summer beer.

Tasting at Three Cellars. I agree 100% with AFBbeerczar ,It has very good aroma to it and the color is a beautiful gold. I like to drink when I cook out hamburgers and brats.
But otherwise just an average brew.
It has very good aroma to it and the color is a beautiful gold. I like to drink when I cook out hamburgers and brats.

On draft at the Flying Saucer.  Served in a pint glass, oh well.  Has a light orange color with rich white head.  Aroma is of banana, but not overwhelmingly so.  Also note some unidentifiable citrus as well.  Tastes of banana and apricot as well as phenols (clove and styrifoam?).  Still the best hefe I’ve had.

One of my favorite hefewiezens.  Has a nice hint of banana upon the first smell and taste.  Goes down well with a Bratwurst and a hunk of Brie.  Requires a slice of orange dropped in to set it off just right.

Pours a hazy golden color with a huge white head, standard Hefeweizen.  It has a wonderful flavor like all weissebeirs, but this one just stands out from the rest.  
Wonderful.

Ehhez a szüretlen búzához szoktam hasonlítani a többit mint az egyik alaphoz.Szép "opálos" mély színe és kemény vastag habja van.Illatában érezni a citrus gyümölcsöket és az sörélesztőt.Ez megmarad az ízben is amiben van egy kis banán és vanília is,Szép fűszeres,malátás utóíze van.
A hazy yellow beer with a beautiful head. Aroma is yeasty and banana. Taste is also yeasty with citric notes. Good mouthfeel. Refreshing and drinkable. A good weizen
500ml Bottle- Hazy golden/amber in appearance with a large white head. Grainy aroma with lemon and a very slight hint of banana. Wheaty, yeasty taste with banan and syrup featuring strongly. Not bad.
Hazy, duller in color than most, nice head. Aroma is of banana and some bread. Taste is the same but also has some weird (not good) astringency.
I did NOT like this beer. A strange fishy smell. I actually thought it had gone off. but my buddy had a bottle of it also and it was the same. Bitter taste. Hard to enjoy.
pours a cloudy golden orange with a large white head.  Smells is a sweet malty banana aroma which translates into the taste, along with a nice spice flavor.

Bottle. Tanx to Tjalve!!
A white head to this hazy yellow bier. Fruity and sweet in aroma and taste. Some citrus and fresh hops.
Gold and slightly orange with a thick white head.  Aroma is sweet, wheat and a slight fruit note.  Has a nice solid body and the flavor is wheat, not too sweet, with a little bite of spice.  Good Hef
Bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with a good size head, with a nose of bananas and citrus.  Taste of fruit and wheat.  Very light and mild.
Draft Firewater’s Atlantic City, NJ-Cloudy Yellow pour, with quick diminishing head. Slightly fruity light tasting beer with hints of banana’s, nice malt’s.

The Aroma,  is of Bananas and caramel. Higly effervescent. The taste has a very refreshing feeling. The after taste is slightly fruity with a low IBU. This may very well be one of the best all time summer beers Ever. One can drink 5-6 and suffer no filling ot hangover.No lemonm it doesnt need it!

Only out of a keg, leave the bottles for the unwashed!
murky golden pour with a nice citrus scent.  very easy to drink and a great taste of wheat and fruits.  the best hefe-weizen i’ve had to date.
A good beer with a scent and taste of candy along with the wheat.  Nice sweetness to this beer.  Not quite as good as the Weihenstephaner though.

Clody yellow appearance with a big foamy white head. Sweet aroma of malt, banana, pineapple and some citrus too. Flavor is mild bitter, malty, and a bit citric and yeasty. Thin texture, average carbonation, and very smooth. I’ve just tasted Heaven with this beer.

Poured from bottle a cloudy straw color. Head was 1cm and fairly dense; dissipating into a fine ring as the glass was finished. Fruity but not overwhelming. Less carbonation than expected. I enjoyed this glass to be sure, but not my favorite style.

1 Pint .9oz bottle.  Pours a thick amber orange color with nice foamy white head.  Smells like wheat, citrus, spice and a little yeasty.  It is slightly fruity, very crisp and dry and finishes with a lemon, wheat and yeast flavor.  Very smooth on the mouth, very refreshing!  Reminds me of a slightly less fruity version of Franziskaner with a slightly higher alcohol content.  I like this a lot.

Draft, no fruit. A nice straw color with cloudy appearance. Dense head with medium lacing. Aroma of banana, wheat and mild clove. Taste is dominated by banana upfront but finishes with a wash of bite and mild clove. A nice German Weiss beer but there are better examples of the style to be found.

[1.19.08] Pours gold with some tiny bubbles and a large off-white gorgeous creamy head.  Aroma of bananas and bread.  Not a whole lot of banana flavor, ts a bit on the fruity side, very dry and soft.  Lemon yeasty finish.  Palate is decent.  Its alright. 6.4.7.3.13 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  [rerate 3.1.10 bottle] wow, seems a I was a bit harsh on this the first time around.  Pours the same bright rich golden.  Aroma is quite nice, lemony yeasty, clean and refreshing.  Flavor is quite dry for style, lemony meaty yeasty, clean banana, a bit nutty with some light richness accented by the alcohol.  Medium/light body, not as watery as I remember, better fizzy carbonation, fairly dry and easy drinking.  7.4.7.4.15

Pours with a nice, hazy amber/brown color with a loose, foamy off-white head.  Aroma is light, but smells of bananas and other fruit.  Taste is light and refreshing, I could have asked for a bit more flavor.

Pours a strong, hazy yellow color with a medium, creamy white head. It leaves a nice lacing. 
Aroma is malty, cereally with little banana which is weird compared to the other weizens I’ve drunk. It smells mostly of wheat, citrus, straw and cereal grains. 
Flavor is mildly sweet, agreeable with notes of citrus, some banana and spices. Touches of wheat flakes are also noticeable.
Medium to big body with efervescent carbonation that dies fast in the mouth. Refreshing, crisp and well-made. No alcohol present. Nice dry finish. Good Hefe.

From a bottle. Pours a nice tan, cloudy yellow with a thin, creamy white head. The aroma is very mild,  containing wheat, a hint of citrus and spice. The taste is banana, cloves and mild, but very nice spiciness in the finish. In my opinion that little kick of spice sets this Hefe apart from others (Weihenstefaner included). The beer is fully bodied, but not to the point of overwhelming the refreshing taste. Really excellent overall - one of my favorite session beers.
Tap. standard weisen citric aroma and orange color. Kind of a watered down. easy to drink but unimpressive.
Bottle. Nice cloudy dark yellow with a white head. Yeast and wheat aroma, medium body. fast begin and end but very tasty. a Nice Beer.

16.9 oz bottle-A nice cloudy yellowish orange with a nice two finger white head and a slight aroma of citrus and wheat. Taste of banana, cloves, wheat, and cloves. I remember this being better but as I am doing a Hefe tour this one is a bit lacking compared to others but still very good.

A solid beer that poured a medium to dark golden with a white fluffy head.  Medium citrusy aroma and taste.  Also some fruit in taste.  Decent beer but I wouldn’t(didn’t) rate it as high as many others.  Would buy again but wouldn’t consider it anything super special.
Draught. Sweet nose, flowery with lots of citrus. Good cloudy pale orange color. Some sourness balanced out the sweeter flavor profile. Full bodied and drinkable. Great hefe.
Definitely one of the better Hefeweizen’s out there. The flavor is crisp and fruity and finishes smooth. I wish I could find it on tap.

[833-20071110] Tap @ Bier Markt (Toronto, ON; just called "Paulaner Weissbier"). Mild banana malt aroma. Hazy, orange body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Bit of banana skin flavour and an long slightly tangy orange citrus finish. Medium body. In good condition, hidden alcohol.
17 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Fort Lauderdale, FL for $2.29 Very good!
Heavily spicy, pepper nose with cloves and yeast. Deep cloudy yellow color. Taste was cloves, some banana, a nice mouthful of spice. Finishes yeasty and spicy.
Has a sweet fruity taste. Definitely liked it buy probably wouldn’t search out and buy again.
Pours nice with a fine head. Taste fruity with lots of carbonation, but the taste didn’t last very long. Not one of my favorites though.

Bottle.  Poured to a golden apricot color with a quickly disappearing fluffy white head.  Very Little fizz.  Medium Body, very light sryupy consistency.  Sweet honey & wheat aroma.  Quick beginning, no fizz strong poppy middle wheat & slightly sweet taste.  Fast & sharp end.  Little fizz in aftertaste & slight wheat aftertaste.  Wheat & sweet malts but not overpowering.  Clean,  crisp, & sharp mild flavors.

Was a nice cloudy yellow color with a moderate white head that ultimately dissipated.  It had a fruity, banana aroma with a hint of sweet malts.  The flavor was mostly from the sweet malts and ended with an almost unnoticeable bitter and sour taste.  It was pleasantly smooth and easy to drink.  Could happily drink all day long.

Pours a cloudy honey color, with a dense white head of very small bubbles.
Smells sweet of malt and other grains. Smells are dry. Tastes sweet, lots of grains and malt. Nice and crisp, a great Hefeweizen. Crisp, thin palate, with good carbonation. This is a classic, drink it all day, on the beach or wherever. Lemon or no. This is a good choice for a Hefe.

Bottle. Pours deep amber with hazy swirls when held to the light, moderate off-white head, quickly dissapating, leaving lacing. Hearty grain dominates the aroma along with  doughy yeast smells and a slight bit of spicy citrus - lemon or orange peel. Flavor is bready grain flavors, then a bit of lively sourness, followed by a light bitterness in the cheeks, finishes clean with a citrusy aftertaste . Mouthfeel is full-bodied, quite creamy and textured.

Pours orange with a nice head. Aroma has floral hops and wheat, with some maltiness coming through. Flavor is heavier on the malt side, which I liked. The banana that others have mentioned played a part, but the malts have the upper hand here. A well-crafted and consistent beer that I’ll come back to.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a dense light off-white head. Mild fruity and wheaty aroma. Flavour starts sweet with a soft banana fruity note, not so much bubblegum in this. Mild wheaty flavour and creamy texture. Mild bitterness in the finish which also holds a lingering wheat note.

Appearance: orange amber color, cloudy. Great head, white color, dense and very lasting. Good adherence to glass.
Aroma: yeasty with reminiscences to bread and banana; wheat and light sourness. Aromatic fruitiness similar to apricots, tangerines and blond raisins.
Flavor: sweet wheaty start. Yeasty quickly progress with banana, bread and vanilla’s reminiscence. Slight and refreshing sourness. Fruitiness similar to peaches, apricots, candy oranges and blond raisins. Yeasty aftertaste.
Palate: medium body. Creamy and some earthy texture. Few carbonated.
Nice and refreshing yeasty touch. Notably texture.
Pours to a white head. The aroma was citrusy. Flavour was sweet and moderate yeasty. Finish was sweet. Very pleasant beer.

This was the first beer I tried from Paulaner. Nice banana notes to it....Great mouth feel but really didn’t impress me. Nice color and aroma as well as good head retention. I did brew a clone...Almost...I added more to the malt bill for a higher gravity and used an American Heff. liqued yeast.....Now that one impressed me!!!! I just thought it needed more of a clove note to it.
This was my first beer, at the age of 5. And hope it will be the last aswell. ;-)

frothy white large head. good lacing. mostly diminishing.  cloudy, dark yellow, thick body. very sparkling. aroma: banana,clove, heavy yeasty. if: light sweet (banana and malt). ff: light sweet bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, lively carbonation, watery oily/texture, metallic finish. Malty background, not too strong. 40s

dec.21.2009.por muito tempo, essa Hefeweizen alemã ocupou o posto de melhor cerveja de trigo em minha opinião. Não é pra menos. Sua belíssima aparência é capitaneada por uma espuma de aparência inicial média, coloração branca e boa formação de colarinho, com boa longevidade. O que a torna tão apetitosa, no entanto, é seu corpo turvo e de grossa densidade, de tonalidade âmbar amarelado. Seu aroma, clássico, comporta notas concentradas de banana e cravo. Seu agradável e refrescante sabor é levemente ácido no início, tornando-se levemente amargo no final, este de curta duração. O paladar é composto de um corpo médio, de textura cremosa, carbonatação borbulhante e final levemente adstringente.
