Very nice flavors of some banana and some citrus. Very refreshing enjoyable to drink.
Aus einer Großbrauerei können auch gute Biere kommen, das lernt man hier. Dieses Weissbier ist wirklich ansprechend, sehr süffig und wohlbekömmlich. Aber das Dunkle finde ich noch besser.

Puffy white head that disapates quickly.  Good banana esters.
Mouth feel is bright and refreshing.  Sweet banana bread balanced with a nice dry german hop.  
Very refreshing
Could be the the Perfect Hefe weissen.  Need to do more research

[Bottle] Pours hazy golden with a good white head. Aroma is about what I look for in a hefe with banana and clove. As Guerde said, there is an unusual apple flavor that appears as it warms though. Taste has more of the good banana and clove with a bit of wheat towards the end. A very nice beer and one of the better hefes I’ve had.

Light cereal aroma, slight banana at first, followed by some clove and corriander. Full white head with lacing. Color is a hazy apticot. Excelent carbonation.This is a well balanced Hefeweizen with no apparent flaws,

Tap. Aroma has light cereal, moderate lemon and earth, and corriander and clove in the background. Head is small, white, with no lacing and is fully diminishing. Color is a hazy amber. Flavor is lightly sweet and moderately acidic to start and finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is medium, creamy, and has a lively carbonation. A well balanced Hefeweizen with no bad characteristics, just an easy drinking beer.

I love the Oktoberfest that Paulaner puts out so I wanted to give this a try.

Very cloudy pour with a smallish head and some decent lacing.  Smells very fruity with a dominant banana nose.  Very dominant.

Dominant banana taste with a little yeast thrown in.  

Not a bad beer and this was following a Sierra Nevada Bigfoot, so it may have gotten drowned out, but I don’t know that I will seek this one out again.
bottle, coppery fizz with thin white foam. subtle flavor and pop-like fizz makes it refreshing but nothing magical about it.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy apricot with a fluffy white head. (I did rouse the yeast.) Wheat, honey, banana aroma. Light body and medium carbonation. The taste starts sweet, with wheat and fruit. Spice shows up in the dry, lightly sour and wheat-laden finish.
Tap - Lemons and candy, that was the aroma.  A cloudy body with a decent white frothy head. A fruity mouthfull with a yeast-hop finish, very enjoyable!

(bottle thanks OSLO) Pours a nice hazy gold with a large fluffy white head that retains nicely.  Aroma is strong of banana at first, with some clove also.  Upon warming, the smell morphs into more of an apple-like tartness, and bready notes make an appearance.  Taste was somewhat lacking, but what was there was a hint of sweetness followed up by some lemon zest sourness along with a brief wheaty finish.  Not a bad Hefe.
Golden hazy color. Small head. Great fruity aroma, with strong hints of apple. Good sweet, fruity taste.
Bottle. Spicy citrus aroma. Hints of lemon, spice in the nose. Light mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Very refreshing and drinkable. A great Hefe.

Had this beer on 1/22/1998.  Color is a pale golden with a slight haze in it, carbonation is good with a small amount of head being held on top.  Aroma has a sour  fragrance with a touch of lemon hidden in the back. Taste is wonderful full of spicy, and citrus flavor.  It starts off with a medium body that as it goes down the flavor begins to come alive, and finishes with a sour taste that has back tones of malt, spice, and citrus.  I think the best way to describe the flavor of this beer is that it is bursting with flavor, but is not overwhelming.  Its the berst Hefe and is what all Hefe’s should be judged by

Dunno if I got a bad bottle or something but its just not what I was expecting. The appearance of a German Hefe is there no worries there. Its beautiful but the smell is just off. I just dont smell the banana I have come to love when I pick up a German Hefe. Classic Hefe taste is there but I think the alcohol comes out just a bit more than usual.

33cl bottle. strong aroma of banana and peach. magnificent white big head, that lasts very long.
the color is dark yellow, a bit cloudy with lots of bubbles. 
the flavor is lemony,watery, soapy and fruity. very light sweetness, exactly the wrong amount. generally bad flavor.
the bitterness is very light. 

a big disappointment, as I remember the draft version to be standard good Weissbier.

Bottle: Poured a hazy brown yellow with a creamy off white head. Nice hefe aroma filled with bananas and spice, light yeast. Nice bitter first bite grabs your taste buds and opens it up to that spice wheat flavor. Doesn’t have that overwhelming bread loaf feel so its more balanced.

I’m not a huge hefeweizen beer drinker but when I do, I prefer the German style. The aroma definately has  banana/lemon/spice notes to it. The appearance is a nice hazy golden color which is text book for a hefe. It has a nice balance of wheat, banana, citrus and spice with a touch of hop bitterness. It is a solid, reliable hefeweizen.

Pours a cloudy gold with a surprisingly small head and just a bit of lace. Aroma is very potent and sweet. Tastes very bready and thick, light citrus (orange). Body is incredible - completely coats my mouth, great carbonation and a thick, chewy body. Wow! A very nice wheat beer, a bit on the subtle side as far as spicing goes, but very pleasant. More of an early fall or late spring beer rather than a summer beer. Tasty!
Got this one on tap at Old Chicago in Madison.  Hazy gold pour, some citrus flavor, minimal bitterness.  Excellent hefe.

330 mL bottle.  Cloudy, dirty blonde in colour with a good head.  Mild hefe aroma.  The flavour is citrus sour balanced by banana-yeast sweetness, but not strong.  Some bitterness in the finish.  Good, but far from overwhelming.
From a bottle poured hazy golden color with a good amount of head, and a little particulate in the bottom.  Nice citrusy flavor with a good finish.

old rating: 7/4/7/3/15 - 3.6

pours cloudy dark orange with a medium size foamy head that sticks around, very good lacing.

smell is wheat, lemon, touch of orange, yeast, banana notes in the background.

taste is thick and smooth, very wheaty, banana, a spice or two, touch of lemon, pear, apricot.

I’m not a hefe fan, but this one’s listed on the top 50 accessible beers, so I had to try it. Pours a typical hazy citrus orange colored hue. Nose is yeasty and bitter. Flavor is similar, with a touch of spice and sweetness. Finish is bitter and clean. One of the better hefe’s I have had, and the only German one. Not one of my favorite styles, but over all, not bad.

330ml bottle. 

Pours a murkey pale orange with a small diminishing white head. No lacing. Aroma of yeast, fruit and spices. Feels full but still light and refreshing. The taste isn’t overfruity like other wheats I’ve had, which is nice. Flavour is citrusy fruit and yeast and ends on a warmer note of banana. Might buy again, Might not.
Once again I find myself in love with another wheat beer from across the pond. Love it.

I can’t figure out which is my favorite summer beer, this or Hoegaarden. But there’s nothing I like better on a warm summer afternoon than to sit outside at a beer garden and work my leisurely way through several of these with lemon. When they don’t have this or Hoegaarden, I’m kind of annoyed because it’s all I want. Hanging out and talking to friends, drinking these, it just yields a perma-grin. I imagine the purists scoff at the lemon, but it just came with it the first time I ordered it and it was great. So refreshing. And the lemon seeds rise up and down in it as the bubbles form and pop. This is a thirst-quenching beer with excellent fresh flavor. And yet it’s somehow also just a bit warm in the throat, inside or simultaneous with the chill. Really this review is fungible with Hoegaarden so I’ll post the same thing there.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a strong white head. The taste is yeast, banana, some citrus and a light hop. The body is what makes it really nice; it’s thicker than other Hefes and quite good. A good drink overall.

bottle.  long lasting huge foamy off-white head.  sparkling hazy orange body.  aromas of yeast, caramel, light hops, noticed very light alcohol notes.  flavor is sweet into light bitterness with long finish duration.  good hefe.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden hue with a nice white head. The aroma has more hints of apples and caramel than I usually expect from the style. Clove and banana are present as well, but hide behind some of the maltier scents. The flavor is mildly sweet without much dryness. I get hints of apples, honey, cloves, garlic butter, and banana. This is all right. It’s an easy drinker and great for a session, but lacks the more extensive depth and complexity that can be found in the finest of hefeweizens.

Smells of clove and nice wheat aromas.  Pours cloudy orange/yellow with the yeast suspended.  Tastes of wonderful spicy wheat and a little butter flavor from the malt which is nice.  Finishes suprisingly clean after all the complexity.  A brilliant example of a weizen that should serve as a control for rating other Hefe-Weizens.

330ml bottle, 5.5% a/v

Pours orange gold colour, almost like light orange juice, and almost as cloudy. Thin slightly offwhite head. Nose is bananas, spice, and yeast. The taste is spectacularly complex, clove, nutmeg and floral fruit with a nice banana finish. Very good beer, just finished my 6 pack, gonna go buy another!
Had this in a Paulaner pub in Munich, it was everything i’d hoped it would be, good body with clove and buttery flavours but surprisingly clean in the finish

I bought this on a whim more than anything else and was pleasantly surprised.  Have had it on tap and from the bottle, both excellent.  Was served with an orange when on tap.  Had no preconceived notions prior to having it and came away impressed.  If you like wheat bears, this is worth the try.
A lot of banana and a little clove.  Pretty sweet and like banana bread, yeasty.  Some citrus and bread also.

I agree fully with silo31- one of the best hefeweizen beers i`ve tried so far. Yet i wouldn`t give such a high rating as bottled beer can`t reach the quality of freshly drafted beer drunk in germany`s capital city of beer.

Pours a cloudy orange with a strong nose of bananna corriander and citrus.  A good leveling of hops in the  medium to light body.  Legs are top lined and not complex.  Images of Alpine chalets and moutain lakes appear out of nowhere.  I need some bratwurst and some pretzels!

Poured a semi-cloudy yellow with nice head.  The nice aromas of banana, clove, and wheat were strong.  The flavors were typical again, with strong banana, clove, and even a slight vanilla note.  It wasn’t as thick as I like it; so the mouthfeel was just a bit off for me.

Bottle.

Pours cloudy light yellow with a nice fluffy head. Cloves and banana esters as expected both in the aroma and flavor, gently sweet, adequately sour, straight-forward but enjoyable.

Bottle-  Poured a cloudy yellow, nice head formation, aroma of wheat and a little fruit, mmm.  Hits the mouth with a small-meduim wheat body that tails off towards the finish, nice fruit notes.  Very drinkable, just keep that lemon away because I like drinking it without!
this is pretty classic. typical cloudy yellow color with citrus aroma. Just really tasty - it doesnt get old!
One of the best Hefeweizen’s in the world. Cloudy yellow/orange color with great cirtusy aroma. Pour it into a tradiitonal hefeweizen glass for best taste.

Good german Weizen.  Hazy orange.  Very tasty, smooth, drinkable.  For me the banana and fruit were not as pronounced as other German Weizen’s I’ve tried.  But still very good and drinkable, a solid beer.

Bottle--Gosh, what a great surprise.  I picked up the beer as a single to fill out a six pack of new beers.  The pour left a medium to large head and the beer, oh how the beer had a wonderful blend of haziness and cloudiness that dull the orange color.  It is and was the best looking hefeweiss that I’ve reviewed.  It has all the fruit, banana, a bit of oranges and lemon.  Each sip leaves a charming lip smacking feel on the lips.  This is going on my warm weather drinking list, of course in Florida, that means 9 months of year!

produce place-mix six pack.

My favorit everyday Hefeweizen. Perfect cloudy golden look, with a thick white head. Aroma is full of fruity esters, banana, oranges. Palate is smooth, which makes the sensation like a fresh desert. Flavor is again very smooth, with sweet wheat being dominant and backed up by a nicely mesured amount of hobs, giving the brew an edge. Nice

Nothing to say that hasnt already been said but.....I use this as the benchmark to judge all other Hef’s by. It’s a true classic, that always taste great with a perfect balance of citrus, banana and wheat. Great summer beer.

1pint 9oz bottle.  Aroma is malty and yeasty with notes of bread, caramel, cobwebs, mold, banana, and dried dark fruits.  Large foamy off-white head that mostly diminished and left no lace.  Murky dark yellow hue.  Flavor is moderately sweet and a little dry and salty on the average finish.  Palate is medium bodied and watery soft.  A good wheat brew when you’re in the mood, chewy, yeasty, and aromatic.

12 oz. bottle, "Produced On" date in the lower right hand corner of front label (06/07), sampled in a weizen glass.

Yeast cloudy in appearance, reddish orange hued golden yellow in color. Large frothy, rocky topped white head, slowly settled into a thin creamy lacing, small amount of ringed laced sticking.

Aromas of lemon and banana peel, clove and nuts, a really nice yeasty smell. A light spiciness mingles with the honey bready malts.

Velvety, creamy smooth medium body, moderate carbonation, goes down quite easily. Balanced and tasty, squeezed lemons, bubble gum, mild nutty banana, a mushy fruity sweetness. Traces of honey grains and sweet bread, the malts dry out at the end. The hops provide a delicate spiciness in the finish.

An affordable German hefeweizen that delivers everything I could want in the style.

right away i can tell this is a good drinking hefe. a hefe i could drink a
 6 pack of if i wanted. actually crisp and refreshing. good cloudy hefe honey color. Smells a little yeasty. A little mild tasting, but very easy to drink. Nice summer beer.

50cl can.   Cloudy amber/gold with a big white head that leaves a delicate layer of foam after a few minutes.   Tart and sweet banana aroma with plenty of yeastiness.   creamy medium body with fizzy but smooth carbonation.   Rerate shows much more fruity and interresting flavors, maybe even a little more than i would like.   almost no hops in the finish.   On par with the other bavarian weissbiers I’ve had, but not special. (7,4,6,4,14)

Rerate: bottled at the hostel in Munich, three years later. A relatively washed-out yeast profile on the whole, though the essential elements are still there. Body is a bit watery as well. Just a streamlined weizen for the mass market and lacking the character that I came to appreciate i many of the more flavorful Bavarian examples while in Munich.
Refreshing, hints of banana.  Large frothy white head, very lasting.  Sweet taste along the standard for the style.  Nice finish, a bit of alcohol.  One of the best hefeweizens in my opinion.

Immediately very bright aroma, wheat and lots of banana.  Very nice and refreshing.  Unclear and golden, very cloudy with lots of bubbles rising to the top.  Nice small white head that is lasting.  Really nice flavor, i like it.  Some light fruitiness, a little alcohol in the finish.  Some banana in the flavor too.  Mouthfeel is bubbly and refreshing.  Nice beer.

This beer is a cloudy amber/straw color with a thick and foamy white head that dissipates slowly. Patchy lacing. Aromas of citrus, wheat and clove dominate. Medium body with a nice array of flavors. Wheat, grainy malt, banana and spices are all intermingled with an underlying tartness. The finish is yeast and bananas followed by a light hops aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

0.5 l bottle. Vol. 5.5%. Pours murky golden body with medium head. Very nice aroma of banana and wheat is also noticed, with also hints of orange hops. Flavor is sweetish, wheat is again felt of course and there are some hints of fruits. Light bodied but definitely not empty, very well balanced. Carbonation felt mostly on palate. Very pleasant long and quite light finish. Indeed, great wheat beer.

On tap - Poured hazy yellow color with small head. Hefe weiss beers are not my favorite but this is one of the better ones I have had. Very light mouthfeel and is almost like drinking a non alcoholic drink.

Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier Naturtrüb, 500 ml bottle 5.5% at Systembolaget, Sweden.  Hazy, cloudy and beautifully golden. Medium whitish head. Creamy mouth feel, carbonation fairly high. Aroma of wheat, banana (strong), lemon, orange, cloves (faint) and yeast. Strong banana flavor with wheat, lemon, orange and cloves; maybe a hint of toffee. Aftertaste of bitter grapefruit. Very, very nice! Wonderfully refreshing! Can’t wait to drown some on a hot day!

Aroma of wheat, apples, and citrus.  Appearance is a cloudy tan with a creamy white head.  Sweet flavor with an excellent balance of fruit and grains.  Palate has good body and moderate carbonation.  Overall an outstanding hefeweizen.
Hazy orange with white head.Aroma ofwheat and banana,sweet and fresh with smooth mouth feels o.k.Hefeweizen.

Pours hazy golden orange with a bubbly head, zesty lemon, wheat sweetness on the nose, velvety body with slight sweetness and just a touch of hops in the finish.  Probably the smoothest hefe-weizen around.
tap. served incorrectly, however still good. very sweet and fruity breakfast beer. goes well with pizza.
Bottle. great beer, best Hefeweisen ive had.  Flavor is execellent.  Orange cloudy pour.
From Draught :A medium light amber color with small deminishing white head.  Aroma of Lemons and spices.  Tastes Malty in the beginning with a semi bitter ending.  Thin on the palate.

Poured from a bottle found at Shores Inn, SCS, MI.  Great hazy golden color with a nice white head.  The wheat was not as noticeable as I thought it would be, which was a plus.  Aroma was lightly of banana, but the taste not so much.  I liked this beer.  Not much else to say but that.

Pours a deep hazy yellow. Excellent aroma which includes a ton of wheat and spice. Goes down smooth and has a nice sweet aftertaste. 

Ya know what, I had this beer a few more times and I really don’t like the flavor. It’s sour; almost taste like vomit. Sorry.

0.5 l bottle. Hazy yellow to brown color with decent head. Refreshing and balaced aroma with clove, banana, bread and smoke. Grainy and oily taste with appriate amount of  clove and banana. Tart fruity finish.

I completely disagree with the consensus rating. This beer is watery and one sided. The taste is dominated by wheat with some yeast flavor. Very light bodied and watery. Easily drinkable but too weak.
355 ml bottle.  Pours a turbid butterscotch with a copious white head.  Buttery banana and spice nose.  Smooth medium body with a full complement of fruit and spice flavors.  Nice lingering finish.

On tap at Stone 11th Anniversary Party. Cloudy murky look with a nice mod white head. Pleasant Hefe wheat smell with banana. Very smooth slightly rich with good retention of flavor. Not a huge fan of Hefe but this is the best I have sampled to date.

Aroma/Malty-light,
Appearance Head/large,
Head/Color-white,
Head/Longevity-fully diminishing, Body/Hue-cloudy,
Palate Body/light
good beer

Bottle.  Poured a beautiful cloudy and murky blonde with a thick and fluffy head.  Spice and banana aroma that’s very refreshing smelling.  Easy to drink with a wonderfully crisp palate.  The taste is a mild fruit and yeasty combination.  I’m a wheat beer fanatic and this is an archetype of what a wheat beer should be.
Had on tap at Nelsons Bay.  Nice head with a cloudy appearance.  Aroma of banana and bubblegum with cloves.  Excellent beer.
Dark clowdy orange beer with a creamy endless lasting head. Malty aroma with some  oranges popping up in the background. Fruity taste as well relatively sweet at the end.

This was one of the very first foreing beers I ever tasted - back in May/June 2004 - and my grandiose rating was: Dry, OK beer!! Now it’s a year later and the rating goes like this: A typical wheat above average. It’s nicely balanced with sweet and nice notes of flower, honey, wheat, banana and apple. Uncomplicated and easy to drink. 7/3/7/3/13 2007.09.03 New rating: Orange-yellow, unclear, huge, creamy head. Both aroma and flavor has mild notes of banana, wheat, yeast and light clove. Easy to drink, but also a bit on the thin side, and not so full-bodied - but quite OK.
Better aroma than Franziskaner but not as good tasting.  Bavarian yeasty, cloudy and spicy.
Thick, cloudy, hazy orange body. Bananas, spice, clove, mint aromas.  Smooth and creamy.  Tart and crisp lemon flavors, earthiness with a slightly sweet finish.

Name: Paulaner Hefe-Weiss

Date: 07/11/1996

Mode: Draft

Source: Taco Mac, Cumming



cloudy yellow, good head, mild wheat aroma, mild malt flavor with a very sour aftertaste

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Paulaner Hefe-Weiss

Date: 06/22/2001



lots of wheat character, mild clove, 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Paulaner Hefe-Weiss

Date: 06/01/2005



good rich wheat malt flavor with just the right amount of clove, 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Name: Paulaner Hefe-Weiss

Date: 07/05/2007

Mode: bottle

Source: aa



light sweet banana aroma,
creamy body, 
banana flavor is well balanced by the clove, 



Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 11/20

Rating: 2.9/5.0
Drinkability: 7/10

Score: **/4

I always thought that people who said their beer tasted like bananas were crazy, pretentious, or idiots until I tried this beer and paid careful attention.  Delicious alone, like many hefeweissbiers our German friends produce, this brew really shines when served with a lemon or orange slice.  Perfect for summer drinking.
For $8 at Helen this beer was way to damn expensive but it sure was a wonderful beer. And the server was hot too.

Aroma is nice banana, yeast, and the slightest hint of clove. Pours a nice hazy bright yellowish orange. Flavor is dominated by the sweet banana with a little bit of vanilla and an amazing crisp citrus finish. Refreshing and very enjoyable.
pours hazy gold with thick creamy head and lacing.  Banana on the nose and mouth.  Very palatable and refreshing.
I’m not that crazy about ’cheifs’ but this Jefe is the best of the many I’ve tried... very drinkable and refreshing!
HITW, Waterloo 23/08/09 - Fantastic Wheat beer, thick, cloudy, citric, great aroma of yeast and apricot. Strong firm body with a velvet texture. How all wheat beers should be

Canned 50cl. It pours a hazy orange beer with a nice head. The taste is of banana, lemon and oranges. Slightly sour. Biscuity. The finish reminds me of melissa. This beer leaves a beautiful lacing. A pretty good Hefeweizen.

A hazy golden pour with a nice head. The aroma is mainly wheat with banana and citrus notes. The flavor matches the aroma with a strong wheat flavor and banana throughout; some clove notes as well--the finish is quite sour for this style. The carbonation is soft and complements the smooth taste. Overall, one of the better wheat beers around--great for summer.

Orange body that is very cloady with a small  creamy head.
Aroma of wheat and citrus.
Flavor of mostly banana and citrus, wheaty aftertaste. Very much citrus still balanced.
Palate is thin and smoth and little syrupy.
50cl bottle in Munich.  Rather surpising for a mass produced hefe.  Nice appearance and notes of citrus.

A very enjoyable Hefe. Poured golden brown with nice puffy head. Smell and taste was banana with a touch of lemon. Clove taste also noticeable. In my book, not as good as Weihenstephaner...but my beer hating wife took THREE sips of this beer and said, "I could drink this." So, this will reappear in my fridge for certain. :)
Amber brew, big foamy head. Strong fresh light fruit and wheaty grain aroma. Cloves and pear flavor combination. Very nice. Semi dry, smooth, small warmth.
Hazy golden colour foamy white head. Citrus and banana in aroma and taste. Flavour has also some coriander and cloves. Very smooth body, not too much carbonation. Nice mouthfeeling. Very pleasant.
Bottle. Pours hazy gold, off white head. Aroma is citrus, bananas, coriander, sour dough. Flavor is the same and wheaty.
Excellent Hefeweizen.  Wheat, Citrus and bananas are evident in aroma and taste.  Medium body.  Carbonation is right making it crisp.  Good and balanced.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden body with a nice head. Low carbonation with the bubbles slowly dancing up. Aroma is of banan, cloves, light citrus. Flavor is lightly sweet, nicely crabonated, light banana flavor with some spices dancing on the tongue. Slightly dry.
Draught. Hazy dark yellow colour. extremley dry with some banana and  pineapple notes. long bitter and unappealing aftertaste,

On tap at Capone’s.  Cloudy brass color.  Citrus and wheat aroma.  Pleasant, effervescent mouthfeel.  Flavor is light and refreshing hops, citrus, and wheat, with a strong banana and clove finish.  Would definitely order again.

330mL bottle:  Cloudy amber with a good quantity of foamy white head.  Smells of fruity yeast, citrus and pear.  Flavor is very well balanced and rounded with hints of coriander and orange.  Aftertaste is somewhat bready and leaves a tartness in your mouth but not bad.  Smooth and heavily consistant mouthfeel.  A very good Hefe.

tap at barley johns.
Almost a straw colored pour w/ a thick white head and good lacing.  palate is well coated and lightly creamy for a hefe.  Aroma is light bread some clove, a hint of what i would have to say is orange rind, & the std touch of bananna.  Flavor pretty much follows the aroma w/ more bread/bannanna emphisys.  Nice hefe.

Cloudy golden yellow color with a white head. The smell is of wheat, citrus, and a hint of floral. Taste is wheat and citrus and a hint of hops. the mouth feel is smooth and a nice finish. A good hefe-Weizen.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden/orange with a large long lasting white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma of citrus, yeast, wheat, light clove, an light banana. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium creamy mouthfeel that finishes slightly tart. Very good.

Newly distributed beer, Bottle date of 12.06, Sampled August 2007

Pours with a frothy, three-finger thick, light tan colored head that sits atop an opaquely hazy, orangish gold colored beer.  Lots of wheat & malt aromas are apparent as are some of the characteristic yeast notes; Aromas of clove, lemon zest, fresh crushed wheat, at times notes of bananas, sweet grain notes and some yeasty / bready aromatics.  This beer has a nice level of yeast-driven phenolics & esters to it.  Quite a nice nose to this brew really.



The taste has a sweetness that seems more driven by notes of clove & banana esters than by the grain sweetness; the wheat and barley malts do contribute some sweetness though.  The carbonation provides a sharp bite to this brew, which, along with the light tartness & touch of hop bitterness, provide balance to the sweeter notes of this brew.  There is a certain spiciness here that is most definitely yeast derived, but also brought on by the zesty carbonation / carbonic acid; hints of white pepper, lemon zest and maybe even a hint of wisp ginger.  This is a really nice Hefe, one which I always enjoy having
A good tasting beer.  I typically don’t enjoy Hef but this is the best i’ve had.  I probably won’t buy again though.
Bottle. Cloudy gold with a strong white head. Decent aroma of cloves, bananas, mace and citrus. Flavour was banana packed with more spice and citrus fruit. Very refreshing.

Bottle. Nice spicy orange and lemon aroma over an orange colored beer with a quickly forming and long lasting white head. The flavor is exactly what I’d expect and want out of a hefe...orange, banana, and tang with a bit of spice. Not quite enough hops or malt shining though to be my perfect hefe, but a good one and I’d certainly love to drink it again on a hot day. Very refreshing.
Orange/amber in color with a tangy apple fruit taste.  great tasting and refreshing

draft.  cloudy orange, brown.  almost looks like an unfiltered  cider.  tart apple taste with a light yeast aroma & flavor.  a thick and fruity hefe.  i haven’t tasted anything like it to date.  very drinkable.  the only downside was that the sediment and heavy sugars left me moaning in bed for the better part of the next morning.  its a fantastic beer, but not a good one to end a session on. ;)

Daft. Hazy orange-amber with an off-white head. Nice banana-clove aroma with lots of yeasy spiciness. Flavor not as strong as the aroma, but still has clove/banana and some wheat (not too much) and fruit. Medium body. Easy drinking. LIngering spiciness and fruit.

I tried a bottle of this earlier this summer, and it was way too fizzy and tasted awful. Bad bottle. This one was dated 11/06 and was great. 

Nearly opaque yellow/orange color, cushy white head. Very creamy texture. Taste is fruity, but also seems to have a bit of spice. Refreshing, although it has some substance to it as well. Top notch Hefe.

Paulaner puts out a solid hefeweizen, probably the best that’s readily available at most liquor stores. It’s got such a heavy citrus taste that there’s really no need to serve it with an orange/lemon slice (I don’t know why a lot of bars do that). Anyways, despite the thickness of the yeast, it’s a really refreshing, hot weather beer.

One of the best among many competent german weissbiers. The complexity of fruit (not to much banana, more along orange and a slight bit of hey) and wheat along with the thick conistenstency and plentiful Naturtrüb of this very unfiltered orange weisbier.

Quite possibly my favorite session beer.  Strong aromas of clove and cinnamon with some banana and yeasty spice.  Palate is delightful light to medium light and quenching.  White head stays to the last, but mine don’t last long.

A very good hefe. Not my favorite style, so that gives you an idea. Pours a brownish-orange with hints of yellow and red. Nose is bananas, lemon, and some oranges. Tastes of unfiltered wheat and malts, the oranges come through strong here, as well as a hint of peach. Had mine with an orange slice, delicious. A perfect beer for that transitional time between summer and fall.
possibly my favorite hefe, better than franziskaner. not just bananas but also other fruits, lemons and peaches perhaps? very nice long and changing aftertaste
Bottel.50cl. One of the best hefenweizen you can get, in my humbel opinion. High banana aroma, and taste i like that.

medium sweetness, lightly bitter, bread, cereal, citrus, banana, bubblegum, clove, vanilla, golden, hazy, white foam, medium body, oily feel, lively, astringent... de touts petits superlatifs (en) anglais afin de commenter cette sympathique petite bière (petite, peut-être mais, ô combien savoureuse), très appropriée pour une chaude journée d’été (journée d’été idéale pour laver son pickup’ et y passer l’aspirateur) ; banane, gomme à mâcher Bubblicious (la rose, celle à pseudo-saveur de " bubble gum ") et un léger soupcon de cannelle et de clou de girofle se font sentir en bouche et au nez, dans le trou de la narine. Les petites bulles me rappellent l’événementialité du dasein, façon « gates of Heaven ». Dans l’ensemble, c’est une très bonne bière, très accessible pour le néophyte ou, voire, la lopette (ie. la « peureuse ») qui craint la bière (moi, c’est idem., mais pour les poissons préhistoriques).
Dry lemony smell. Cloudy dark gold body with a big fluffy head. Lemon and banana flavor, only dry.  Thick and smoothly carbonated. I love it. Drank it in an actual weizen glass too
Bottle. An excellent wheat beer, probably the best Weizen I’ve had, and I’m not a big fan of this style. Really nice.

Rated 7/20/07.  Pours a cloudy yellow-gold color with a small white head.  Aroma was primarily wheat in the background, with some citrus, spices, and even a bit of dishwashing detergent.  Hmm?  The flavor was a crisp wheat and citrus.  Overall refreshing beer, but nothing to write home about.  Decent Hefe.
Clean aroma, clean on the palate with a nice banana finish. I normally don’t go for the wheat beers, but this one is excellent.

Baby food, banana, clove, and pastrami aroma. Cloudy and dingy golden color with a thin to medium head. Lemon and banana flavor, but more of the former. Banana finish. Nothing much remarkable about this, but it is good.
Cloudy, golden, with white head. Nose is sweet with a scent of spice.  The flavor is clean with plenty of wheat. Mouthfeel is very carbonated.

12 oz bottle..very much like hoegaarden.very refreshing and only 105 calories!!!citrus, herbs, banana, clove, golden, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, creamy, lively,
Dark hazy orange with a large head. Very big bananas flavour, clove notes not as prevelant as in some other hefes I’ve had. A pretty good, refreshing hefe.
bottle.  nice carbonation and lacing.  dry finish.  Slight flavor of orange zest.  Lacked in overall flavor.  I haven’t been a fan of Paulaner, but I gave it a shot.  Not bad.
50 cl bottle. Cloudy yellow color, white head. Citric and fruity, yeast. Dry finish.

[i]On tap, Cafe, Lille, France, 28-06-07[/i]  Nice warm golden pour, lovely clean flavours with vanilla being the most dominant, but with some banana and citrus thrown in there too. Really nice beer, had lots of before but never rated.

Bottle packaged in 12/06: Pours a hazy dark golden with a clingy-lacing froth of off-white head.  Peppery clove and sweet banana and wheat rule the aroma.  Body starts fairly normal for the style, with some thin carbonation and a lightly sweet malted wheatiness.  Has some bready yeasty notes and a touch of lemony citrus toward the finish.  A pretty average Hefeweizen.
Tap in Munich 0,5ltr: The first beer i drinked in Munich, yellow hazy Hefeweizen with an banana taste.

Bottle. Pours forth in ambered pale gold and rimmed with a heady froth in off-white. Aroma carries distinctive, yet subdued standard banana and peach ester. Calming. Flavor is solid, but lacks the body I expected. Hoping for more wheat oil and density, this falls a little short with some wafting caribbean spice through a mild fruit festival. Clean, crisp and respectable. Hop bite at the end in noble makes for an appreciable balance, yet I long for something more substantial. Not sure this really deserves its’ lauding. In all earnest remarks, I could drink a shit-ton of this beer, served cold on a hot day. I see why the Germans do. PS I think I’m terrible with this style. It’s probably, in all reality, exemplary for the style
yellow with orange haze body and a average white head  a malty  aroma a herby flavour and a dry herby finich
one of my favorites. pretty common, and a good beer to drink on its own. dont recommend eating with it, its just a waste of beer if you do so.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head.  Smells of lemons and bananas.  Tastes of bubblegum, wax and some tarte citrus.  Pretty below average.
From tap: yeasty, dough, some sourness, a little lemony, some buttery notes, medium to light body, not a great wheat beer but pretty good.

Hazy golden with fabulous frothy head.  Bananas, wheat, yeast on the nose with some sly hints of pine and citrus.  The taste itself is wonderful...fruity, rounded notes  are balanced well by a hoppy, dry crispness.  There are bananas, pears and plums which compliments a sparkling crisp finish.  A very nice hefe indeed!

Neutral nose of yeast and cereal.  Pours a hazy blonde.  The mostly lasting frothy off-white head leaves no lace.  Well balanced, moderate acidity, sweet & floral with a light crisp finish.  Medium body that is both creamy and soft.  Easily forgettable.

Pours a cloudy gold with a big, fluffy white head.  Smells of mild wheat, with a little bit of citrus.  Pretty subdued actually.  The taste was better than the smell.  It was livelier.  Nice floral wheat characters jump out right away, with a pleasant citrus finish.  Very easy drinking and refreshing wheat beer.  Full-bodied and flavorful.  Good stuff.

per essere una birra da grande distribuzione non è affatto male nel suo genere. Bevuta una quarantina di volte in pizzeria (!!!) a Ronco, anche se quand’ero un poco più piccolo non ero in grado di apprezzarla più di tanto, chissà perché. Oggi non mi fa dispiacere se mio padre la compra al supermercato quando gli capita di trovarla a buon prezzo. Ribevuta (x2) alla pizzeria "23 Febbraio" in Corso Europa, ho notato che ha un’aroma (e un sapore) singolarissimo di olio d’oliva.

(Bottle BBE 05/2008; ABV 5.5%) Banana, bubble-gum and wheat aroma. Orange colour, hazy (sedimentation in the bottle) and average size, white head with fair lacing. Fruity (banana), wheat and acidic flavour. Fizzy carbonated, medium-bodied and slightly sticky palate. 28/06/07
xxx not my favorite hefe, but definitely a drinkabl;e one, good brew, just not the best.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow gold. Subtle nose of bananas, wheat and yeast. Medium bodied. Slightly spicy and fruity with a ton of yeast and wheat. Good summer beer.

a classic looking hazy hefeweizen.  the flavor is very subtle and the beer must be slightly under room temperature to appreciate much of a flavor at all.  not a bad hefeweizen, i just expected a more flavorful one
Bier trip in Köln, yeah! Light banana, toffee aroma. Hazy pale orange, whick small head. Taste yeasty and wheaty. Medium finish.
This is a fantastic hefe.  Pours out a cloudy yellow color with a nice white head.  Aroma is fruity, citrusy and vaery wheaty.  Flaovr is very much the same, but with a bit of spice to it.

Poured this one into my authentic weizen-biere glass, looked mighty fine in that.  Thick, thick white head.  Fluffy and lasting!  Aroma wafted out of this one from afar, you guessed it bananas and cloves!  Strong wheat and banana taste in the palate, banana bread anyone?  Great hefe.
Nice golden color with a thick creamy head.  Classic wheat smell.  Tastes of wheat and citrus.
Golden lightly hazy pour.  Nose of lemon and wheat.  Sour lemon and banana in taste.  Prototypical German Hefe.  Not quite as good as Hacker or Franz though.

I’ve had this on tap at Isacc Newtowns.  Great with a lemon, citrusy, tarty smell.  The taste is lemon/citrusy/tarty.  When you spin it to get the oxygen in it, it sorta smells like bubblegum, that’s what my friends say at least.

Pours a hazy dark gold with a dense, creamy, off-white head. The nose is wheat and heavy yeasty esters: banana, bubblegum and a faint cotton candy. Quite nice. The mouthfeel is light, creamy and soft. The flavor is a solid, mouth-filling wheat with a distinct bubblegum note finishing with a short/crisp end. This is a very clean, refreshing and drinkable beer; the Germans certainly know how to make some tasty wheats.
Pretty much a blueprint of a weizen. Not too sweet or yeasty, nicely hoppy, smooth, tasty. Nothing too interesting either.

When i die i want to be embalmed with Paulaner Heffewiezen. I could not get enough of this beer when i was in Germany. I even purchased a six pack and carried 2 of the bottles through 10 other countries for over 2 months just to bring them home and let my friends try it. I also managed to score 2 beautiful paulaner 500ml glasses, easily the most asthetically pleasing beer glass in the world.

I love this beer. truly. madly. deeply.

When ever I’m in Germany I try to get my hand on a nice cold Hefeweissbier.

The smooth taste and the refeshing feel is great!
Heavy, yeasty orangish, colored beer, very full bodied. These really fill you up, it is almost like eating a meal.

500ml - Aroma of musty yeast, wheat, wet malts, orange and clove.  Pours cloudy gold with medium head and great lacing.  Flavor is refreshingly tart and clean.  Citrus, yeast, wheat and a subtle spice in the finish.  Palate is crisp, bubbly, tart, and creamy.  Very tasty hefe.
12oz bottle, lots of orange, coriander, sweet smells, nice ammount of sediment, nice big white head, this is a great beer.
Nose is very ripe bananas, caramel, clove.  Flavor is banana, clove, a hint of orange, earth.  Lightly acidic banana bread finish.

12oz bottle. Hazy orange color, with a huge, frothy white head. Aroma is primarily yeast with some wheat, and spice in the background. Well balanced and refreshing. Wheat, spice and banana flavor, with some citrus in the finish. Very drinkable, perfect beer for a hot summer day.

Pours hazy light orange with a large white head.  The aroma has some banana, citrus, bit of cloves and a bit of richness.  Medium lightly grainy body with some semi-soft carbonation.  The flavor starts with rich wheat malt, mild banana, minor spiciness and some smooth lemon.  The finish is peppery spicy and fairly crisp.  Overall a good and enjoyable beer.

No fruity flavor. Tastes wheaty with a very malty bitter aftertaste. Pours yellow white with a cloudy body. Big white foamy head. Nothing special but a good hefe none the less.

Additional Rating: Mini Keg! Oktoberfest weekend. Poolside. Oh so fresh. Pours a hazy yellow color with a nice huge foamy white head. Smells of wonderful fresh wheat and malt. Tastes super refreshing and the body is silky in the mouth. Great hefe!
bread aroma, chewy-creamy mouthfeel, cloudy yellow with a one inch off-white head, lightly bitter with medium sweetness and a bit of sourness

500ml bottle in weizen glass.  Pours cloudy orange with dense, lasting off-white head and some lacing.  Aroma of banana, tangy orange, slight bread yeast.  Tangy flavors of fruity orange with a hint of caramel and yeast.  Medium-light body and medium carbonation make this a most refreshing brew and a personal fave.  Great.

great looking cloudy golden color, very nice head, and retention. Man i love the smell of a good hefe. Lovely banana, and yeasty esters aroma. mouthfell is perfect carbonation is great. Flavour is again, banana with some bubblegum, and yeastiness. nice balance, very well made.
Bottle.  Cloudy orangey amber with a good rumpled head.  Smells of wheat and lemon.  Tastes of light wheat and bananas.  Good mouthfeel.  Decent beer but perhaps a little overrated.

Of all the beers i’ve had this has the most distinctive flavor.  It’s really good.  The first time I had this was in Helen Georgia where they charged $7 a glass.  It’s worth it though.  It has a nice, cloudy, honey colour and a white head.  Very good but the only wheat beer I think I’ve ever had so I need to try more so I can start comparing.  Imported from Munich.  I’m actually drinking it right now!  I drank this out of a lager glass (similar in shape to a wheat beer glass)
Classic example of a hefeweizen. Unexceptional, but really competant in all respects. Lightly wheaty aroma, refreshing on the tongue, and sweet clean malt taste.

Gift from Shan’s Uncle Mark during a nondescript visit--ever so thoughtful of him...pours a perfect cloudy haze with a four-finger head that settles into sparse cumulus clouds...fresh citrus smell...soft palate, smooth and crisp...as far as long-range partying through a hot day, this is the most available choice, sure to win even the most apprehensive beer drinkers...

Bottle. Beautiful cloudy ornge/amber colour, large fluffy white head. Fruity malt aroma with banana and raspberries, earthy, woody and spicy hints, as well as yeasty tones. Medium bodied, with a smooth mouthfeel, yet lively carbonation. Perfectly balanced with a light sweetness and a dry and slightly bitter finish. Am excellent hefeweizen.
Very cloudy light copper.   Very mild citrus and wheat aroma.  Flavor has some cloves and banana.  Oily start, clean crisp finish, but this could use a bit more substance flavor-wise.
Draft at Woodys. Poured a cloudy yellow/amber with a nice size head. Aroma is wheat, grass, lemon. Flavor is the same plus a little hint of banana. Very drinkable and a nice summer time brew.
Draught at Hotel Ringkøbing. Unclear orange - white head. Orange, elderflowers, yeasty, light banana, citrus. Soft mouthfull. High drinkability - but a boring style !!

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a small white head that dimishes quickly. The aroma is fruit and wheat with some spice. Bannana flavor in the taste with a smooth clean finish. This is a very good hefeweizen.
Dark blonde and slightly cloudy. Spicy, yeasty aroma. Some banana sweetness and citrus in the taste which is fresh, clean and moorish. Very clean and easy to drink. Would make a great session beer.

Rated 1/28/07:  Nice Hefe, good golden orange pour thick creamy head and nice lacing. Aroma of wheat and mild banana. A little thin but surprisingly creamy feeling. Pretty good standard flavor, nice amount of malt with moderate banana and clove flavors. Nice and yeasty it’s not the cream of the crop but still makes for a good drink.
A nice rrefreshing beer in the spring and summertime.  Hazy color. Nice aroma , good taste for the palat.

This is an absolute belter of a Hefeweizen from Deutschland.  One of, if not the best, in my opinion.  A lovely cloudy yellow colour and a hoppy yet sweet, citrus taste to die for.  One can add nothing more.

I found this great beer with a huge aromas actually had the hops upfront and the and the sweet body following afterwards. It has a long aftertaste that reminds me of fat on bacon. I could drink this all night and it has to be just great on tap.
Bottle.  Yellow cloudy pour with two inches of foamy white head. Taste is kind of watery. Strong finish of bubblegum and banana.

Bottle; Poured a dark gold, almost orange color; small to medium white head.  Aroma of bananas/yeast, cloves and apples.  Refreshing and crisp.  Some acidity.  Flavor was very subdued to me; Flavor of banana and yeast, a small amount of spice, and some fruity esters.  Good, but have enjoyed others in the style more.

bottle.  The aroma was slightly bready with hints of CO2 in the nose.   The finish was a bit yeasty.  Light/medium body, golden haze appearance.  nicely carbonated.   I spent a day trying about 7 different hefe’s and this one was my favorite.
Tasted at Stone Brewery.  Good aroma of banana and cloves, which are just as apparent in the taste and ends with a crisp finish.  A good beer for the end of a hot day.

From Bottle. Amber hazy body with a fluffy lasting white head. Ripe banana nose with bready wheat hints. Banana flavors in mouth with a rather acid finishing. Creamy and round, lacks some crispiness because of low carbonation. A well-done weizen for german standards.
Re-rate 2011: Improved carbonation increases crispiness and highlighs aromas. It is now close to the top of the weizen.
Lots of fresh banana on the nose of this cloudy yellow pour.  Thick head.  Yeasty body with hints of banana among the wheat flavor.  Yeasty with lots of carbonation

Second beer during Cellar’s Wine & Spirits Friday beer tasting of "Lawn Mower Beers." Pours a cloudy dark golden yellow brew with a thick white slowly diminishing head. Nice lacing. Aroma of wheat, yeast, banana, bubble gum, and citrus. Taste is very mild, medium creamy and soft carbonation. Finish is soft and dry with a slight banana aftertaste. A terrific summer brew.
excellent heffe....great summer brew, full of flavor, one of the better mass producd heffe’s out there, a good go to brew in the summer time, refreshing, mmmmmm.......sort of tastes like bubble gum

great, great beer.  it’s all been said here.  just a wonderful summer time beer, and personally I think it’s the best hefe out there.  I’ve yet to taste one better.  this is what beer should be, my favorite beer.

These damn wheat beers...I don’t know..not digging them as much as I want to...maybe they’ll grow on me. It gets a 3.6 ONLY because it ranks fairly high in the separate categories. Something is just not making me desire them....maybe it’s the love of hops and malt...
a good hefeweizen is my favorite...this did not disappoint.has decent amount of head.

Tap at the Happy Gnome.  Cloudy golden yellow appearance with staying foam.  Grassy aroma with some biscuits and citrus notes.  Some brown sugar flavor alongside a lot of banana esters.  Crystal clear and crisp palate.  Easy and refreshing.

Light citrus aroma, strong banana flavor.  Great session beer.  Gold in color with medium carbonation.  Slight haze.  Well rounded palate with medium body.  Definitely a beer for summertime in Hotlanta....
nice and cloudy. yeasty aroma kinda like a loaf of wheat bread flavor is similar. nice day drinking brew
Hazy orange of color with a cloudy beige head. An aroma of wheat, banana, yeast and fruit. A nice flavor of wheat, banana and yeast.

330 mL bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden colour with moderate head.  Aroma is fruity, but also has a bit of a musty smell unfortunately.    Flavour is light and citrusy, with a bit of a peachy taste as well.  Palate is nice, with a bit of a lingering, fruity, bitterness.  Combined with the carbonation, it reminds me of peach fuzz.  Overall, a nice refresher.

From bottle poured into weitzen glass. Beautiful hazy golden with an incredible four finger head. More banana in smell than taste... taste is mainly citrus with tangy, slightly bitter aftertaste. Easily one of the most drinkable / session beers available.
Very nice beer, one of the most refreshing beer that I drink in germany, Clear golden color and a strong aroma, a bitter flavor but refreshing.
On tap at Mile Square in Hoboken.  One of my favorite Hefeweizens, i love a tall glass with a lemon (really just for appearance, i never like to "fruit" my beers).

Let me iterate firstly that I have always been impartial to wheat/white beers. I really enjoy the citrus taste and find it a delicious alternative to the bitter side of beer when I need reprieve. 

This beer has a foamy bright white head that dissipates at a medium to slow pace. 

The taste is leans towards being one sided as most beers this style tend to be, though the individuality of the ingredients  is best enjoyed without the usual orange/lemon slice that’s served in the glass.

The beer itself is gorgeous. A delightfully opaque bright orange glow accentuates the thick, sediment laden character of the beer, usually leaving flavorful sediment in the bottom of the glass/bottle you drink it from. 

I’ve had this beer a thousand times either in a bottle or on tap -- it’s always a treat. Especially when you need to town down from a recent IPA binge. 

I seem to bounce between these two styles of beer semi-regularly.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden/orange colour with a small fluffy head. Aromas of banana, wheat, clove and citrus. Taste of wheat and citrus, very smooth, medium body and good carbonation. One of my favorite heffeweizens.

Delicious beer all around, and the one I always point to when trying to get people to enjoy a true german hefe instead of the american style ones. Strikes a great balance of sweet banana esters, dry wheat, light clove, and light citrus hints. Palate is lively carbonated and perfectly balanced. One of the best hot summer day brews in my opinion.
On tap. Golden yellowish in colour with a rather large fluffy white head. Disgusting and sweet. Notes of fruity chewinggum, banana and yeasts. Very artificial and extremely sweet.

Pours medium orange to amber, head disappeared within one minute, wheaty and "fizzy" with a little alcohol taste.  Taste was not as sweet as many wezenbiers.  Aftertaste was pleasing.  In the plethora of Bavarian weizenbiers this one is in the mid range.  I haven’t tasted a bad one yet.
A very good Hefe, very smooth.  Pours a nice orange color.  Nice banana and grain aroma.  Very nice wheat taste, a great all around beer!!
Boa cerveja de trigo. Coloração caramelo escuro; espuma caramelo claro, densa e presente; cheio de malte de trigo. Uma cerveja encorpada, frutada. Refrescante.
12 oz. bottle at Zeno’s, Penn State.  Poured hazy orange with chunks of white lace.  Lots of banana in the nose.  Citrusy flavor with a fizzy mouthfeel.  Fairly acidic aftertaste.

12 oz bottle served at the Bull Run Inn. Served in a tall pint glass with lemon. The beer’s body resembled a sort of witbier. The taste differed in the sense that it was a bit more wheatier. Nice beer. Smooth, good taste.  This brew pwns any other gimp-ass beers in its league.
a fun glaa for a fun beer, tasty and sweet, I’ve had quite a few by now and I def enjoy.  My fav type of beer!!

in can 500 ml.,
It is hazy with a golden color (hints of red). The lace is full creamy and slippery.. A well-balanced effervescent and smooth mouth feel. Smell is of bananas and lemon.
The taste is a little citrus, with a slightly dry finish. It is inside the best weizen.
Garrafa, em janeiro de 2008. Coloração âmbar média, com bom creme bege, persistente. Pó no fundo. Sabor fraco de banana. Fermento. Agüada. Carbonatação média. Tendência de notas fracas.

As Paulaner Hefe-Weizen Natural Wheat in "1pint 9oz" bottle. Aroma of wheat, banana, clove, but not hop. Hazy orange gold color with a transient white head. Starts with medium mouthfeel, that true banana component, followed by spice and wheat. The finish is kind of dry. Bitterness seems present, but not identifiable as a particular hop type. Pretty nice.

Bouteille. Arome d’agrumes, de levures, légèrement épicé. Couleur orange assez foncé et voilé. Mousse qui reste et lacets qui collent au verre. Gout très fruité, frais, agrumes, levures, la banane est présente, mais pas trop. Effervescence parfaite qui enrobe la bouche, corps plein. Finale épicée et de malt de blé. Excellente blanche.

[Sampled from a 5. ltr. can at Jens & Rie.]

On a hot summerday in april this german qualitybrew made many throths happier. Served with almost german sausages from Popp, it could hardly be better.

On tap, pours a murky orange/golden color with a thick, creamy off-white head.  Very good lacing on the glass with notes of malt, hops, bananas, lemon and spice.  The flavor is dry and biting with a nice mouthfeel and good back of the throat tingle.  Very nice Hefewiezen.

Bottle 0.5L.
Golden-orange, muddy body with a huge, rocky, white head, fully lasting with a good lacing; small bubbles with an average density.
Moderate malty aroma, light-to-moderate yeasty and light hoppy character (citrus, orange); banana note also present.
Flavour is moderately sweet and acidic, while the bitter character develops from light to moderate in the finish.
Medium body with an oily texture; lively carbonation; light-to-moderate astringent feeling in the finish.
Pleasant and satisfactory beer; maybe the flavour is a bit too acidic for me.

33cl bottle.
smells of sour citrus much like lemons.  Pored with a medium fluffy head and looks cloudy orange. Tastes of light malts, tartness.  Perhaps a bit too much carbination masks the tastes, but the carbination died off quickly.  Let it sit for a bit after pouring? A better hefe for sure.
Aroma was of light malt.Pours a cloudy orange with a medium white head.Light malt and light fruit stands out in the flavor.Medium mouthfeel with a smooth malt finish.
a clowdy yellow orange colour ... with a lovely tart citrus banana wheat nose ... fresh ... light hop wheat fruit.
Draft.  Pours orangey. Fruits, banana, etc.  Little bit of acidity .  Good stuff.
500ml bottle. Hazy orange body with a big white head. Lots of fruity banana/yeast aroma. Flavor is prototype German weissbier, sweet, fruity, citrus banana. Really refreshing.
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a huge off-white head. Aroma of bananas and yeast. Taste is a bit sourish with wheat & raspberries. Not bad.

Had this on tap when I was stationed in Germany.  This quickly turned me in to a wheat beer lover!  It pours a beautifull pale yellow with a nice frothy white head.  The smell hints of bananas and the beer bubbles down the pipe.  The taste is lightly sweet with hints of citrus and wheat.  It leaves a very smooth, sweet, and clean after taste.
Bags of flavour. Lots of character. Looks likea hefeweizen should. Great beer. One of my favourites of this style.
Sorry, but this beer was way too carbinated for my taste. The initial flavor had a little acidic bite to it, which seemed to settled down about halfway through the glass.

Much lika a glass of fresh white wine, but a hardly notable trace of smoke. If there ever was a type of beer that should be described as vinous it is the german hefeweizen. Fruity, spicy, citrusy, banalike taste. Not as evident in the scent. A bit lighter than some of the other bavarian wheats I’ve had, but it remains a favourite.

Drank in a weizen glass.  Poors a murky golden poor with a nice frothy off-white head.  Aromas of coriander, orange nad lemon zest, a hint of caramel and banana.  Serious lack of carbonation, very light with little bitterness.  Nice yeasty flavors but nothing spectacular.  Not a bad beer, but disapointing.

Bottle. Large frothy head that mostly lasted. Spare lacing. Light golden cloudy colour. Aroma was yeast, banana, wheat, coriander and citrus. Light bodied with an average carbonation. Flavour was light sweet with hint of acidic. Finish is fresh sweet and again hints of acidic.

Bottle, march 07. Bright, hazy, orange-yellow color with a massive, bubbly, white head. Aroma is cloves, and a touch of bananas. Taste is explosive phenols, bananas and a clove ending. MF is light to medium, high drinkability, refreshing and tasty. Great, well rounded Heffe!

This had an average head.aroma was a pleasant wheaty-floral.The color was straw.Palate was above average.It tasted quite balanced and had a good body for a wheat and non of the sourness most have.I really enjoyed this beer.I plan to buy more and share.

Draft. Poured cloudy orange color with decent head. Some lacing. Aroma was of fruit and spices. Tasted of bread, fruit, wheat, and clove, which blended together nicely. Finish was medium with nice mouthfeel.
Hazy golden color with medium white head. Yeasty, fruity aroma. Tastes of peach, banana, yeast with a tart finish. Creamy wheat mouthfeel. Excellent hefe.

***Re-rate***
One of the best German hefes out there. Love this style now and this is always a go-to hefe. Nice thick aroma of banana and wheat. Pour is a nice cloudy gold with a pillowy 2 finger white head. Taste was an almost thick mix of banana, clove and some yeast with a tartness coming in and out. After a few sips, a breadlike taste forms on the back of the throat. Great hefe.


Original rating: AR6 AP3 FL6 PA2 OI15
Not a great beer but my first rated hefeweizen. Better than I remember them being. Banana and yeasty aroma. Pour was a cloudy golden color with a one finger white head. Taste was all (blah) banana with a bit of yeast and bread. Considering I’m not a fan of wheat beer and I hate bananas I should hate this.
Bottle.Large white head.Looks good,cloudy gold color.Banana aroma.Light banana flavor with some spice.Soft,full body,with a smooth finish.Refreshing, easy to drink,Very good.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a beautiful creamy white head. Grain, yeast and banana in the aroma. Banana in the flavor. Pretty long finish with a little fruit-sweetness. Classic Hefe.

From a twenty-four ounce bottle purchased at "Keller’s IGA" in Cincinnati, Ohio - First, this beer has been relabed as "Paulaner Hefe-Weizen" for the American market (but it’s still the same fine beer). Okee-dokee, now on to to the review... this beer poured a hazey, orange-amber liquid with a very fine-bubbled off-white head and  the requisite banana-clove aroma of a good hefe. Tastewise, it’s a rich, wheat beer with an interesting bitter finish... it’s good!
Pours a murky orange with a big off white head. Aromas of banana and bread dough. Flavors of banana and hints of citrus. Smooth mouth feel that finishes sweet and dry.

Hoegaarden used to be my favorite, but then I found this Paulaner brew. Well balanced, fruity (banana is prominent) - overall very well balanced. Best of all is this beer’s full texture - more like a meal than a beer. Thank goodness for Munich and their brewmasters! It’s recently available at ABC liquor in Sarasota, FL.
This was my favorite beer in an assortment of foreign beers i purchased. It has a nice golden color and a fruity aroma.  I noticed a hint of banana but overall a nice wheat flavor.

pours very hazy orange. I recommend swirling the bottle like a Hoegaarden, and to do that with every weissbier actually. Gives it a nice creamy head. Very subtle taste, easy drinking, and appetizing in appearance.

12oz bottle at the winking lizard - Pours cloudy golden with a big creamy white head that leaves plenty of lace.  Good aroma of bannana clove and lots of yeast.  Flavor is bannana, clove, some yeast, and a touch of bubblegum.  Palate is smooth and well carbonated with a good soft mouthfeel.  Pretty good as far as hefes go..  I cannot believe that I haven’t rated this yet..
vey nice beer, typical "bajuwarisch", a delightful flavor, may be too "white" and cool for me, but it’s an obligaton when I’m in Munich to drink a Paulaner... with Eisbein!
One of the better Euro beers to buy in bottle.  A decent hefe as long as you swirl at the end.  Good flavor and aroma, bananas and bubblegum.  A good overall beer.
Bottle. 11,8C. Hazy golden colour with a large white head. Fruity aroma and banana taste. Refreshing beer.

Had this one on tap at Old Chicago. Cloudy golden with a thick, frothy white head. The aroma was of citrus, orange and lemon. The taste is dominated by classic hefeweizen notes of clove and banana. There are also notes of lemon and citrus. So many American wheat beers have a big burst of flavor up front and then quickly fade into watery ambiguity, but this one remains consistent all the way to the bottom of the mug. One of my all time favorites. Great summer and session beer.
ohh yea, I remeber this one! As soon as I saw Paulner I remember having this... I loved it, had a couple of these in Holland.

On Tap and in a bottle poured into a glass. A sweet almost banana smelling beer. Pours a nice cloudy yellow color with a thick creamy head. A mellow and smooth tasting Hef. It is a pretty good Hefeweizen, but I actually preferred Hacker-Pschor’s Hef. A little too sweet tasting for me.
12oz bottle.  medium hazy golden orange.  thin  white head.  aroma of wheat and bananas.  flavors of creamy malt.  medium bodied.

pours a cloudy golden color. Slight hints of orange to the color. small white head. The aroma was quite nice. It was yeasty, wheaty, and spicy, also with notes of banana. The flavors mirrored the aromas.
Pours golden with a great big fluffy head. Aroma of wheat and fruit. Tastes like bannana in a glass. Sweet crisp and fruity. Yeasty. A nice Hefe
Kinda like drinking fruity clouds.  Definitely one of the best hefes out there.  Rich yeasty aroma but very light on the palate and filled with classic bubble gum hefe flavors.
This is the only hefe where I tasted raspberries, peaches and I think the beer is too sweet. Page 353 of Michael Jackson’s Great Beer Guide and only 299 of his 500 Classic Brews to go.

Draught - Kean’s Head Nottingham.  A hazy dark yellow coloured hefe with a nice bright white head.  The aroma has lots of bananas and bubblegum, and estery notes.  The taste has more of the same and it is very nicely bodoed.  Some toffee flavours also.  I think hefes work better from tap than from the bottle.

You’d think you were smelling a banana in a glass.  Seriously.  The smell is AMAZING.  IT pours a hazy, dark gold color with ample white head which seems to really stick around.  Flavor is quite sweet with fruity subtle notes.  It is VERY smooth and silky, which matches the color and aroma quite well.  Overall I’d rate this as one of the better Hefeweizen’s I’ve had.  A must try.

500ml Bottle
Bottled on 5/06

Paulaner’s Hefe poured really nice looking hazy bright orange with a big 2+ finger white micro bubbled head. The head faded to a nice creaminess.

Smells like a hefe-weizen should. I smell the wheat. Along ith banana and a touch of clove. Brings to mind a banana bread. There is also a citrus (lemon) freshness coming through at the end.

Taste is good as well.The wheat comes through along with a spiciness of the yeast coming up front.Finishes with a squeeze of lemon. Very nice.

Mouthfeel is good. A nice carbonation tingle throughout the mouth. Medium-light bodied. 

Drinkability is up there on this one. It’s refreshing and the mouthfeel lends itself to a very drinkable beer.

Sampled 10/8/06

Pour was a hazy gold with a stiff white head. Nose was yeast with some lemon-banana and sweet candy hints. Taste was a bit grainy with all the tastes from the nose. Some lingering fruit on the and. Nice .

16.9 oz can...Clean, dark-gold orange appearance with a generous snow-white head. Aroma is of banana bubblegum. Palate is a bit light and watery. Flavor is of citrus, banana, and bubblegum. Not too bitter, not too sweet, this wheat tastes amazingly balanced. Would love to get some more of this stuff.

Bottle.  Poured hazy gold/amber with a big white pillowy meringue/marshmallow head.  Bready and lemon aromas with a bit of an herbal/grsssy note in the back.  Light bready/biscuit malt flavor with a lemony and mild spice essense. Medium bodied with lively carbonation.  Very nice globally dispersed Hefe-Weizen.

One of the best hefeweizens that you will find. Pours to a dark golden hue with lots of carbination and forms a nice head. Flavor is excellent and certainly dont recommend a lemon in it, not necessary.

Bottled, 5.5% ABV. A cloudy orange beer, with a huge, frothy, mostly lasting white head. The aroma is moderately malty and lightly yeasty, with notes of wheat, bread, clove and banana. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, not a very long finish with a touch of bitterness. It looks good, and even though it’s pretty straightforward, it’s clean and with all the characteristics that make a German Hefe enjoyable.

On draught (tap) at what used to be called the Lux Bar in Hoxton Sq. London.Typical Hefeweizen style flavours - bubblegum, banana a hint of corriander. To my taste buds there was more lemon citrus flavours than others of the style. Looks great in the glass - translucent orange with a big fluffy head and strong lacing. It’s a little thin in the body, but  refreshing, easy to drink ( I got my 1st pint down in under 10 mins!) and more-ish.
Draft from Mellow Mushroom Citrus Park. Orange/yellow body, white head. Aroma of wheat and some fruit. Medium mouthfeel and carbonation. A bit sweet on the finish, but a nice effort overall.

Good and old Paulaner Weiss, one of best cervas that you can drink in Brazil for R$ 10. It gives to the accurate dimension of the Lager Bavarian Weiss. White, muddy, cooling, extremely fruity. It loves it or it hates it. I love it…..........................................PORTUGUÊS: Boa e velha Paulaner Weiss, uma das melhores cervas que você pode degustar no Brasil a R$ 10 paus.
Dá a exata dimensão da Lager Weiss bávara. Branca, turva, refrescante, extremamente frutada. Ame-a ou odeie-a.
Eu a amo...
The best of wheat beers that I’ve drink. Great body and taste. Bottle of 500 ml.

Bottle. Hazy dark yellow body. Mostly lasting, firm off-white head. Nice lacing. Nose is wheat and ripe banana, mild spices and  scents of candy and bubblegum. Flavor is much the same... with a pleasant malty and fruity sweetness. Medium body. Mellow mouthfeel. Nice all over.
500ml - Cloudy yellow/orange pour, small bubbles and nice head.  Mild banana and straw on nose.  Smooth, easy going flavor on palate.  Nice

Re-rate 5/19/11: Bottle sample at a blind Hefeweizens tasting. Slightly hazy amber. Aroma of yeast, caramel, a bit of bubblegum and fruits. Sweet caramelly  flavor with some yeast, spiciness and a mellow and slightly drier finish. Medium-bodied, a bit oily. Something weird happened to that botte, really doesn’t like it should. My 14th place of the tasting. 5/3/4/3/9=2.4



Cloudy orange. Aroma is yeasty & fruity with some banana. Flavor is fruity, a bit sour, with yeast, banana & wheat-malt. A light to medium body, with some nice carbonation. 7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Bottle; Aroma was light lemon and some aluminum aroma as well. Yellow body with white head. Flavor was light in all areas, lemon, spice, malt. Easy on the palate. Don’t know how well this ages but has a date of 05.06 on bottle.

Hefe-Weissbir naturtrüb. Hazy golden colour with a nice mostly lasting white head. Wheaty, banana and fruity aroma. Flavour of yeast, wheat, some sweetness, bit banana. Some bitterness in the yeasty finish.
Bottle: hazy reddish orange. Aroma of citrus with light banana. Light white head. Sweet, citrus tang up front, then ends bitter, leaving a bit of a bitter aftertaste. Not the best, not the worst.
Bright, copper, and translucent.  Estery, floral nose.  Great wheat beer in the german style.
Nice amber glow about a half inch of head, and a solid wheat taste with a smooth mouthfeel. Very drinkable.  Not the best Hefe I’ve had, but definitely worth a shot.

Pint Bottle...Poured a thick, hazy, golden orage with a great frothy white-to-beige head that lasted quite a bit. The palate was well carbonated with flavors of  strong bananas, toasty malts and yeast, very sweet and sugary. Smooth finsh with a slight metalic kick back. One of my fav German Weizens.
Poured from bottle. Cloudy golden color. Decent head. Nice sweet aroma...Taste was very smooth, bananas, citrus, lemon...Very drinkable, a decent Hefe for sure, just not a favorite of mine.

Bottle and tap. A bit cleaner and fresher tasting on tap. Pours a wonderful golden yellow with a huge, dense head. Aromas of yeast, banana, lemon, some candied orange towards the end. Crisp, refreshing mouthfeel, with wheat and yeast being most prominent. Plenty of carbonation, with some wonderful banana esthers for a finish. A Great beer.

paulaner hefe-weizen
1 pint bottle poured into weizen glass


huge, long-lasting white head.

light amber color. a little cloudy. unfiltered. slight lacing.
smell: rather complex. orange, wheat, banana, clove. some other scents i can’t quite place.

taste: a nice wheat flavor. malty. the fruit flavors are not strong at all. complex bitterness.

mouthfeel: light carbonation is perfect. it has a nice crispness.
overall: a great representation of the style! give it a try for sure!

Pours a hazy peach amber briefly topped by a quarter inch of white foam. Minimal head retention, slim lacing. Mild sweet wheat and lots of clove in the aroma.

The malt flavor is a blend of an almost honeyed sweet malt and a dry tang wheat. Lots of clove flavor in there too, minimal ripe banana and yeast. The finish is quite dry, almost dusty, with some hop presence and a touch of citrus.

Light body, light carbonation. Fairly smooth. Good enough beer, and I really shouldn’t knock it, but I’d prefer a fresh brewpub hefe any day. Caveat: I am not a clove fan.

Bottle.  Pours a light orange color with a huge, foamy white head that leaves thick lace down the glass.  Aroma of citrus, orange, grass, dry.  Really great smell.  Taste is creamy, fruity, smooth and sweet. Very refreshing. This is a great Hefe.
Nice Heffe.  The right amount of carbonation and a nice fruity finish.  Well done.  I’ll come back to this one in the summer.
Pours opaque golden with some yeast floating around.  Big head.  Aroma is fruity and tart.  Flavor is a tad fruity, and sweet with a nice fizzy mouthfeel.  Good esters in the finish.  Nice hefewizen.
Beer 40 Summer 2006 trip in Europe.  Drank on 7/6/06 at my hotel in Frankfurt, purchased at a little convience store.  Overall defent Hefe, nothing super special, very refreshing.

Canned at Suvarnabhumi Airport, Bangkok.  Muddy golden, lively creamy head. Evident papery banana aroma. Sweetish with soft mouthfeel - perhaps a bit mellow. A fair amount of  esters and a solid body makes for a pretty good standard weizen.

(Tap) Pours a hazy golden color. Aroma of citrus and banana, with light spice in the flavor. Mouthfeel a little light compared to some of the better examples of the style. A good hefeweizen, but not the best I have had.
cloudy yellow, lotsa creamy head, kinda citrus , but also a nice banana nose. great refreshing summer beer.
Draft - Munich. Nothing like a Paulaner in a Paulaner Brew Pub. Banana and lemon aroma with a sweet but smooth finish.
Good pour with thick white head. Clear red color with a bread smell Not a complex brew but not without a good taste..
If only you knew the german beer code...... bannannas????  I dont know what your talking about....... only water, yeast hops and barley...thats all... bannanas?????
light golden yellow body with buff, white head...aroma and flavor are largely of banana and a touch of wheat..very crisp, very refreshing...nothing too complex here, but a great beer nonetheless
This wasn’t actually too bad, I think it was the better of most Hefs I’ve tried. It was a very refreshing beer, nice crisp flavor, sorta fruity, banana flavor. Really nice brew all around.

I was happy with this beer. Seems that Germany is still manufacturing some great hefes. I noticed the smell of bananas as mentioned earlier by many folks. The color was very nice a bit inbetween cloudy and hazy I’d say. Something worth trying, but don’t get yourself too excited many other hefes to try!

Thick white head that will stay all day if left undisturbed, brown/orange color, It also has some beautiful lacing. Smells lightly of bananas. Has a great taste, a little fruity, where you can again pick out a banana flavor. Very palatable.
This is a great Hefe, I highly recommend it.
Had this beer a few months ago, but just came across this listing. Hazy golden color.  Wheat with a touch of banana.
I really liked this Hefe.  Pours a bronzish color and has a sweet aroma.  Easy on the palate and contains an almost apple-like taste to it.  It’s a great hefe and I’d definately try it again.

Pours hazy, opaque gold with excitable carb and a little lacing. Aroma is wheat and yeast with a touch of banana skin. Flavor is bubblegum and banana with some lemon and wheat to finish. A bit thin but maybe this is just the style. I’m too used to drinking IIPAs i think. OK hefe.
Another gift from a friend, pours with a slight copperish, cloudy color.  The aroma has hints of Banana bread, as too does the taste.

Bottled, I tasted it in Goiânia, Brasil, at 2006/09. Good appearence, dark yellow and very consistent head. Banana notes and a fruity taste, also a very sweet flavour. Rich taste after swallow. This bier, with Weihenstephaner, is the best weisse in brazilian stores.
aroma of yeast but indistinctive, almost white head but not long-lasting, yasty, mild and soft, tangy to some point, aftertaste very pleasant,smooth
One of the best of the big bavarian breweries. Medium dark/golden color, estery nose and taste. Soft toffee in the mouth, full body, yet refreshing.
On tap at Flying Pie Boise ID, Pours out a cloudy yellow topped with a white head. A very good HEF. That is all I have to say.

A very good hefeweizen!  12 oz. bottle.  On the pour, loose, foamy white head, a nice brown-orange color.  Very refreshing smell, slightly sweet, bready, fruity.  Initial taste is bananas, cloves, fruit, vineous, wheat.  Lots of flavor and complexity! Flavor deminishes with a sweet, very mildly bitter aftertaste.  Delicious! A top rate beer.  Expensive for the six($10- ouch!) but I’m not a bit disappointed.

Pours a deep yellow, slightly orangish tint, with a nice white, lasting head.  Fair amount of lacing in a Weizen glass.  Very smooth, nice citrus flavors and decent finish.  Can’t wait to try on tap.  A good hefe readily available.
Nice fluffy white head.  Decent aroma.  Very good flavor of I think banana, clove & yeast.  Could be a little stronger but overalll a very good beer that I plan on having again.
Beer has a ornage/copper color, tastes great if you can find it on draft, but tastes good from the bottle too. Nice wheaty flavor that goes good with a slice of orange. Nice head.
This is a good hefe, and it is available in alot of places... on bottle in it a little tame, but shines on tap!..good head....smooth and delicious!..why did it take so long 4 me 2 review?
On tap at Dopey’s Elixir. Citrusy hefeweizen. Slight orange flavour. Prickly mouthfeel. Very enjoyable.
Bottle. Cloudy orange colour with a huge head. Aroma and flavour of yeast and fruit.
dough, citrus, bread, cloudy, white foam, pale, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
Bottle. Wonderful golden yellow color and subtle citrus taste typical of hefeweizens. This is one excellent weissbier. One of my favorites.

Another excellent white beer. I picked this up at a hostel in Munich and drank it while waiting for my friend in the lobby. Typical spicy white beer taste, but done excellently. ONe of the best white beers that I have ever tried and probably the on that changed my mind about the entire style of beer. This is like a gateway drug, but the drug is beer.

Wow, this is the beer that got me on my German beer kick.  I love it.  The taste the texture, many people like stiffer beers.  I mean I do too, but this beer tastes like nothing I have ever had before it.  It really showed me how complex beers can be and that they aren’t just for tailgate parties.  I will be with this beer until the end!

Orange colored, cloudy appearance with big yellow head. Aroma is fine with good spices, yeast and banana, even some berries and mild alcohol can be found. Medium bodied. Flavor has more yeast with milder spices and banana, fruits and dryness also there. Aftertaste lasts with some spices, sourness and crispy carbonation.
The best Hefeweizen beer ever! Taste, appearance and palate perfectly harmonize. A great beer .... if not the greatest in all over the world!
This is the best beer in existence. My favorite ever........................
bottle. murky pale yellow color. large head. clear aroma of bananas. very soft and mild. lots of bananas.

Sampled from 12 oz bottle on 10/25/2006 at the Junedale Beer Klub meeting...  

Gold color and generous lacing.  Light clove, banana, wheat, and yeast aroma and flavor.  Very smooth and quite tasty!  This is a very solid German Hefe!

Need to revisit in the future...

Draught.  I thought this was very tasty, and a very smooth and extremely drinkable beer.  Poured golden with creamy white head that it retained forever. Has a crisp citrusy flavor.  One of the best Hefeweizens out there, this is a great beer.

My bottle said Hefe-weizen 5.5% but this site says weisbier.  No translator but I think it’s the same.  A slight  aroma of fruit that is not ripe.  Poors a beautiful swirling yellow cloudy haze in my steeler stein.  Interesting flavor to my taste buds like other good cloudy light yellow wheat beers.  Finish is OK with little bitterness. Bitterness does not linger.
0.5l bottle in “Poinger hoff” in Poing (close to Munich). Hazy amber color with big white head. Good taste, refreshing and easy to drink. This beer is very popular in Bavaria.
