bottle from an indy beer shop, poured a cloudy amber colour, slight frothy white head on the initial pour which settled to just a light dusting around the edge of the glass. lovely aroma of banana and citrus hints, very nice coating of the mouth, very refreshing indeed

Smooth and refreshing with tastes of citrus, banana and cloves. Reminds me a lot of Schneider Weisse, although this one is definately more carbonated. Pleasant aroma of citrus fruits. Very decent Hefeweizen.
Very mild aroma.  Moderately carbonated.  Very smooth taste, nice and malty with that classic hint of banana.  Fresh, crisp, very good.

light brown, dark yellow color, cloudy with sediment i definitely love the wheat beers how they don’t filter makes it taste better. a little sweetness to it, three finger off white head  that lasts halfway thru the stein. not bad, but don’t have more than five or a bad hang over will haunt you! has the standard banana and clove that comes with a Weiss.

500 ml bottle. Light brown and very cloudy from lots of sediment in the bottle. Throws a tall off-white head. Bread and cloves in the nose. Aroma feels slightly sweet and acidic at the same time. Very rich aroma. Highly carbonated. Crisp, yeasty mouthfeel. Texture is rich and smooth. Some bitterness in the finish.

330ml bottle - pours a hazy pale gold with a nice head that lasts until the bottom of the glass.  Usual hefeweizen aromas of citrus, light banana-y esters and I picked up some very faint cloves?  Highly carbonated and easily drinkable.....a nice finish.  Solid hefe, but I’ve had better.
Draught in Kaiserslautern. Everything a HW should be - I could just drink this stuff all night. So much flavour and body, but so refreshing and satisfying at the same time.

Pale gold color, very hazy. Medium head. Aroma is banana and yeasty. A mild flavored hefe-weizen. Mild malts, some banana and clove flavor. Smooth taste. A touch citrusy. Lively carbonation. Well balanced.

Draft. It poured a nice cloudy orangey gold hue with a full thick white head.  Aroma was a nice mix of yeast and lemons.  A good balance of bread notes and citrus notes.  Crisp and full yet easy t to drink.
One  of the best weisse beers. The taste and this cloudy body with the nice heading makes Paulaner one of the nicest.
Labeled "Natural Wheat", I assume this is it...  its very refreshing, strong citrus, banana aroma and a nice sweet sour flavour.  Great beer, good example of the style.

Vibrant apricot-orange, snowy white head. Begins with succulent crunchy green apple and banana, parts with a woody dryness. Remember those long-outlawed candy cigarettes you could buy in the 80s? That’s what the nose reminds me of. Sweet, but plenty enough tart wheat and resiny dryness to have me reaching for another. Nicely rounded Hefe.
Very dark cloudy amber color, very good fruity malty flavor Nice beer, I enjoyed it!
tried this one at old chicago in their octoberfest tour.  a sweet hefe with fruit notes.  nicely done.

Cloudy, golden, with white head. Smells largely of bread - wheaty, malty, sweet, with some interesting spice and fruit notes (apple?). The flavor is quite nice - very wheaty, hints of hops, and large doses of yeast - delicious weizen yeast (bready, sweet, cloves, fruit). Mouthfeel is medium feel with a decent bit of carbonation zing.

500ml bottle. Pours amber-orange with a large, thick, white, frothy head. Aromas of grass and slight pepper. Differs from the Erdinger with a fruiter and sweeter taste. Very fine carbonation and pleasing palate.
Bottle. A very nice hefeweiss, exactly as the classic german beer should be, doesn’t lose much in the importation
nice. cloudy straw color of course fizzy head like a bj with an alka selzter.  smells like fresh scallops and straw light clove. yeasty peppy i like always a great refresher

Hazy honey yellow, huge pillowy head. Terrific weizen aromas of banana, sweet spice and a little vanilla biscuit. Fruity (banana), a little bready, sweetly spicy with a creamy mouthfeel and a tart finish. This is the best weizen I’ve had in a long time!
half a 33cl bottle:  Classic wizen here all the way.  huge fluffy head above a golden orangish cloudy body.  Flavor of crisp citrus... fruity and yeasty.  medium body.  very enjoyable

Bottle.Pours a cloudy golden light amber with a nice head.Aromas of citrus,banana,spices compel you to have a sip and then you get the flavor of citrus and spices.This really goes down so easy and is very refreshing.This is especially  great in the summer .

Bottle: Hazy, deep golden to orangey coloured, creamy, firm mid-sized head; distinctive citrus-fruity nose, a bit zesty, with a touch of bananas; soft MF, sweetish flavour with some bitter spots..., light to medium bodied; a shy maltiness in the fruity (bananas, also some cloves) and tart finish; some bitterness detectable in the aftertaste. A pleasant and tasty Weizen...........

Bottle pours a classic hazy lightorange yellow witha very nice creamy egg-white looking head.  Lots of Bavarian yeasty notes in the aroma. Spices and cloves and a littel bananas.  Flavor is a creamy banana with some other fruity and light clove like spices.  Very soft creamy feel,. and a lively but fine carbonation.  Classic German Hef!

Bottle.  Poured a hazy gold with a moderate of-white head.  A slightly sweet aroma with a faint spicy clove scent.  Taste was quite subdued a little sweet with a slightly tart fruity finish.  A nice thick mouth filling finish.
Excellent Beer.  Nice murky color with a vry nice head that retained itself for a long time.  A nice after taste of lemon that provided a very enjoyable swallow.
Bottle. Cloudy orange with an above average head. Good banana and vanilla nose. Flavours start sweet and fruity, gradually developing spicier and drier. Quite sparkling with a slightly bitter finish.

I really enjoyed this beer, which was a surprise at the local high-end grocery here in Panama. It poured a cloudy amber with a large beige head with lots of lacing. Aroma was heavy on the yeast: bananas and apples. Flavor was fresh, smooth and complex and it was great given the heat here in Panama. I really enjoyed this one.

A re-rate gives it slightly lower marks.
A really good hefeweizen. Complex flavors with hints of bananas, apples and cloves. Pours a really nice hazy amberish orange color. Reccomended

Pours cloudy gold with a lasting white head. Aroma of bananas, wheat, and some unknown fruit. Also some cloves. Flavor of wheat with light spices and the same unknown fruit. Excellent palate, pleasant finish. Great on a hot day.

Had on tap last night at a local restaurant.  Pours a very cloudy medium yellow- much lighter than weihenstephaner.  Billowy lasting white head as well.  Aroma is a good balance between spicy earthy clovey phenols and fruity banana esters with a nice wheaty profile.  Flavor is smooth sweet wheat, light clove spice, some pepper, citrusy and zesty.  Nice smooth palate although seemed a bit slick after a while and became annoying.  Pretty solid hefe.

Bottle: Pours a cloudy orange with a large head.  Taste is very subtle compared to most hefes I’ve tasted.   Aolt of spice in this beer.  Low carbination gives way to a very smooth mouth feel.  I usually don’t like hefe’s, but this one is quit surprising.  Especially on a hot afternoon like today

12 ounce bottle. Smooth taste and mouthfeel upfront, which turned heavy at the end as I swallowed. The beer felt almost syrupy for a moment, with a pleasant finish and aftertaste. Notes of banana and citrus. Very pleasant overall, but I wonder if that heaviness would get cloying after more than one or two bottles.

A 12 fluid ounce bottle poured a thick, deep golden, papaya juice-like consistency and was topped with a huge frothy foam head. The head lasted through the first three slurps from my mug leaving me with a "got milk" mustache. Tame typical hefe flavors reigned supreme. Spice clove, and some citrus. Mouthfeel was smooth with little to no carbonation or alchohol detected. The aftertaste was all spice and clove.  All in all the flavor was great. But unfortunatley, the brew from my bottle was borderline FLAT which ruined what otherwise could have been a great beer drinking experience.

Awesome all round flavour, good amount of carbonation, nice malty flavour, good aroma, and even a nice appearance. This is definatly one of my favourite beers that is readily available, ive noticed it gaining popularity in australia. Great beer, go out and try it

1pt 9oz bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors St. Joseph poured into weizen - Pours murky golden with a 3 finger beige head; Mainly wheat and malt to the nose with a hint of banana; I don’t smell much citrus at all, which is strange for a hefe; wheat, a little banana and a slight bit of citrus initial taste; A very wheaty backtaste with a hint of spice and orange at the very end; Not a bad hefe, though I’ve had better. I had to take a pretty big pull off of it to get the citrus taste. The aroma just wasn’t there for me, but I’d definitely drink it again!
On Tap, Very good hefe possibly the best.  Well balanced all round with the best characteristics of hefeweizen.  Good flavor with full range from sweet to bitter.
Pours like a good hefe should-small, tight head, cloudy tannish yellow. Smells of all that is good hefe. Tastes same but plus heavier carbonation.  Overall a solid choice for a good hefe

Cloudy orange with an above-average head.  Good banana and vanilla nose. Flavours start sweet and fruity, gradually developing spicier and drier. Some grainy texture, quite sparkling, but not overly so. Probably my favourite hefeweizen (so far).

Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Aromas of banana, grass, clove, and slightly roasted malt. Notes of wheat, slight sweetness, with a slightly bitter finish. Excellent beer! Very well balanced, refreshing, and easy to drink.

Brown-yellow cloudy appearance with white head.
Banana aroma with notes of vanilla, cloves and roasted malt.
Sweet flavor with notes of banana and wheat. Somewhat dry finish.
My favorite german wheat.
On a sea view cafe in Satorini after a day in the sun - a perfect place for a weisse. Proper grainy feeling of wheat malt, round flavour with a hint of yeast and a fine lemony finish. I had one more!

Nice hazy golden/yellow color, huge white bubbly head which resulted in a permanent coating of bubbles on the surface.  Aroma was flowery and citrusy with some hints of wheat, yeast, spices (especially clove).  Nice crisp refreshing mouthfeel, very light without being watery.  A really good range of typical hefe-weizen flavors:  citrus, banana, clove/spice, wheat/bread, yeast.  Awesome.

[bottle] Pours a very hazy yellow color, with a plentyful, white head. Aroma is very nice- bananas, wheat and some nice yeast. Flavors are crisp, refreshing and finish kind of dry. Lemony citrus, yeast and some moderate spices in the finish.  Very nice.

On tap at the Brickside.  Pours a hazy milky golden orange amber with an average creamy white head that laced and sustained.  Aroma of wheat, banana, lemon, orange and yeast.  Flavor was even more of the yeast, banana, some citrus and a slight tart.

Bottle 51F Weizen.  A wonderful spicy and sweet and citrusy aroma. Nice amount of pepper balanced against yeast and orange. Nice and delicious smell. A nice hazy orange color, with a grea long lasting white thick head, with little to no lacing. Good taste, nice wheat flavors, finishes dry yet starts spicy and sweet. Delicious sour notes, plenty of great wheat taste. Good beer with great yeastiness, A nice wheat definately. Light palate fully refreshing, kills the summer heat, moderate carbonation, nice. I dig this brew ganz gut.
bottle.  Pours a hazy/murky light orange with a small off white head.  Aroma is banana, spices, tart citrus.  Taste is about the same with some clove thrown in.  Light lemon finish.

Draft @ Great Lost Bear in Portland - Poured a quite hazy yellow in color with a medium bright white head.  Significant lacing.  Aroma was bready/yeasty with a substancial amount of the classic clove/banana that you would expect of a weizen.  Flavor was nutty with the wheat and quite strong of the clove/banana.  Nice palate.  Really nice...

Never been a fan of wheats, but this is a good one.  Tastes almost like an exotic fruit juice.  Frothy white head and decent lacing, opaque tangerine color, spicy and fruity flavor.  This one might make me a convert.  VERY nice.
Golden pour with a big pillowy head of soft bubbles. Clean crisp wheat aroma. The flavor is slightly sweet with a wheaty refreshing body. Delicious.

cloudy with an off-white head.  complex flavours such as orange peel, lemon zest, bubblegum, melon nuts and banana that makes this an excellent choice.  very clean finish.  highly refreshing; an excellent summer beer.
One of my favorite Hefeweizens.  A good wheaty flavor with a crisp finish and nice golden color.
Pours hazy gold into a tumbler.  Banana and butterscotch notes.  Consistent bright white micro head with excellent staying power. Upfront banana low/medium carbonation with a dry crisp finish.
Bottle. A cloudy yellow pour with a large white head. I didn’t get anything other than wheat in the aroma. A nice wheat taste with hints of banana. Generally pretty boring.

Draught @ Red Bones 7/12/06. Pours a bright orange color with a large foamy bright white head. Nose is fruity and citrus with some spicy coriander and light banana hints. Palate is crisp, smooth and clean, amazingly refreshing. Flavor is more of teh orange citrus with some banana and spicy notes with hints of lemon zest.

Bottle.  I don’t drink a ton of hefenweizens so call me an amateur, but this beer was tough for me to drink.  Salty, spicy, wheat taste.  I didn’t pick up on a lot of fruit flavor at all.  Nice looking hazy, golden color with a pretty white head.  I’ll have to drink a few more natural wheat beers to develop a taste and then come back to this.

Pale yellow with small white head. Aroma is moderately strong, but still stronger than the flavor — malts, banana, bready yeast. The flavor is mainly wheat with some sweet banana and a touch of lemon. A slight tanginess throughout. Highly carbonated, medium body. Refreshing.
Light fluffy head; typical cloudy medium yellow color; good balance, slightly sweet, citrus finish
Very finely balanced beer.  Nice aroma, not too strong.  Good pour, orange gold color.  I don’t really taste any banana in this one, more of a yeasty sourdough flavor.  Easy to drink.

Bottle.  Cloudy golden pour.  Fluffy head with some large bubbles present.  The usual for this style, banana and clove.  Refreshing summer beer.  Another quality hefe from the Germans, who rarely disappoint with this style.  They know their wheat beers well.
On tap. Aroma of banana and spices, citrus comes though in the flavor. Nice sweetness, pleasing beer on a hot day.

Classic Hefe.  12 oz bottle.  Cloudy yellow/orange. with fluffy white head that lasted forever.  Aromas of clove and banana.  Flavors were similar, but a bit weaker.  More Clove than banana.  Definite wheat finish.  Pretty good.

I could not find this on draft so settled for a bottle which I got at an outdoor cafe in Erfurt, Germany.  Poured a golden orange with a very nice white head that left good lacing.  Greated by a good nose of fruit (mostly banana) and some light spices, again mostly clove.  Smooth mouthfeel, and a solid finish.  A good hefe and tasted really fresh.
Orange golden with fine white head. Aroma of yeast (wheat) & citrus fruits. lively carbonation. fresh. Light sweet finish. Good German WeiSS! Pleasant  - n ot very abstract-easy to enjoy!

<!-- i -->12 oz bottle.<!-- /i -->  Pours a cloudy orange/light amber (not yellow) with a light head that dissipates after awhile to a bubbly ring around the glass.  Aroma is typical of a hefe with a fairly strong banana scent (no cloves though).  Taste is clean and crisp with moderately strong banana and clove flavors (good balance).  Medium body.  Very nice beer if not "big" for a hefe (but still within style guidelines, barely).
Pours Opaque yellow with nice white head.  Lots of carbonation.  Aroma of bananas, spice and citrus.  Taste a little bit of moutain dew sweetness.  Good stuff on a hot summer day with a brat.

Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier Naturtrüb, 500 ml bottle at 5.5% ABV. At Irish Pub in Sundsvall, Sweden. Pours a golden shady beer with a huge white lasting head. Typical wheat beer banana scent. Nice refreshing taste with banana aftertaste.
Hazy yellow, big hefe head, high carbonation. Aroma-cloves big time! Big clove taste,very crisp, pretty bold. I liked it alot.
On Tap: A great hefe.  The gold standard in readily availible hefes.  Aroma and flavor are quite nice to say the least.  Typical bananas, clove spices, bubble gum.

Paulaner Hefe-Weißbier Naturtrüb. 500 ml brown bottle. Alc. 5.5% vol. Medium-sized light beige head that fades away quickly. Cloudy. Amber. Very aromatic - fruit, banana, alcohol, sugar. Relative low concentration of carbon dioxide. Flavors of citrus, sweet taste, slightly sour from the carbon dioxide, a little burnt aftertaste. A nice beer.
Pours cloudy orange colour with a nice white head. Good fruity aromas. Really good!

Bottle.  Hazy light copper color with a thick, creamy head that last.  Aroma is full of the nice hefe phenols...cloves and bananas along with a hint of wheat.  Very nice....somewhat subtle.  Flavor: big bananas upfront, finishes with a hint of spice.  Some bubblegum in the finish.  Carbonation is high and the body is light.  Overall, a very nicely done beer....refreshing.  Definitely a nice beer for a hot summer day. Banana is a little too prominent for my own taste, but I can’t knock them for that.

Hazy darker golden in color, huge white head. Aroma rather subdued rotten banana and yeatsy wheat. Flavor much the same with some fruit esters just hard to pinpoint. Re-rate in the future as I really don’t think this bottle is too fresh.

Big, offwhite head of fine lace over opaque yellowish brown body. Grapefruity aroma with notes of yeast, and some wheaty sweetness. Taste is sweetish wheat dominated by tart grapefruit with notes of yeast, coriander, and soap. Milky, muddy mouthfeel. Aftertaste is bitter grapefruit. Very nice! A refreshing, clean weizen. (0.5l bottle.)

Bottle produced 12.05. Poured a hazy orange/yellow with a two finger, frothy, white head. Both the aroma and flavor found a nice balance of banana, citrus, and clove. Light body and slightly watery which was very refreshing on a hot day.

It’s hefe season for me and this is a favorite.  Citrus notes with some slight spice elements and a clean taste.  Nicely carbonated and finishes well.  No need to "hang fruit" on the side with the citrus notes.   Best on tap.
Long lasting head, good fruity ester aromas. Nice carbonation. Full palate without being overpowering. This is really nice.

Bottle, Yellow clear colour. Nice white fom. Aroma of  sweet banana and a citrus in the end. Sweet vine/banana, and citrus, with a nice balanced bitternes in the end.. Short to medium sweet and balnced bitternes in the end. Thin body.

Refreshing without being watery or bland. Perfect summer beer. Orange and cloudy appearance, with Incredible head- in a weizen glass you can get it inches above the top of the glass without overflow. Yeasty aroma. Lemon/citrus taste, some spiciness. Walk to the nearest place that carries this (preferably more than a mile walk), work up a sweat, then drink about 20 oz to really appreciate it.
Thick white head on an yellow-orange body. Fruity hints in a very well-balanced brew.

Pours typical for the style, nothing to stand out, but nice initial crowned head, good lacing. Cloudy and golden. The aroma was a soft balance of spicey phenolic compounds and a smooth wheaty base, some bananas. Definitely doesn’t overwhelm on either side, again decent balance within the hefe world. Mouthfeel was moderate for the style, this thing was really drinkable, as the flavor wasn’t cloying or too strong (I love Franziskaner, but can’t session them). One of my limited draft experiences was a little bit sulfury, not sure if that is typical for this beer.
Orange cloudy colour with a big head. This beer had a very strong citrus taste  which I really enjoyed. Great stuff!
The color is a cloudy golden orange with a nice white head.  The aroma has hints of clove and citrus with a flavor that is slighly lemony with a light dry finish.

Bottle.  Brilliant white head and a nice cloudy orange body.  The aroma is lightly citric and bitter, and the flavour is very smooth, refreshing and citric with a syrupy texture.  Overall a very nice beer.
Light, refreshing, and spicy, without heavy hop flavor.  Instead of hoppiness, the beer has flavors of citrus, banana, and spices.
A very nice German wheat beer.  A nice golden colour with a hint of clove spice on the nose and a nice malty wheat taste with good carbonation and a nice white head.

poured from a 12.oz bottle a nice cloudy golden color with a nice puffy white head to it. smell very sweet citrus maybe a little banana. taste is very good a little bitter at first than i mellows out to a very mild lemon/ orange taste finished very clean. love this beer planned on only one for the night but couldn’t resist a second

Poured from 12 oz. bottle to a hazy yellow-orange with a thick off-white head. Strong wheat and dough aroma, with clove spice. Hint of some fruits, but couldn’t determine what they were. A good medium body and a flavor that was fruits and spices....very good. My only complaint was the finish. From the first sips to the last warmed up swallow, this beer did not imopress me with the aftertaste..part dry, but mostly just short and bland. Overall, though, I could see several of these on a hot summer day later this year.

On draft at Darcy’s, Denver. Poured a much richer orange color than I remember and was served with an orange slice (why?) which made me wonder if I wasn’t drinking a dunkelweiss, despite the non-dunkel tap handle. Still, it was an attractive beer and I removed the orange before it could taint the beer, which had a nice clovely aroma and flavor with some wheat tartness and a little caramel maltiness. Good creamy mouthfeel and subtle bitter finish.

This hefeweizen has a soft aroma with a hint of banana. It’s appearance is slightly cloudy and a solid, bland yellow. The taste is not overbearing with a little accent of banana, bubble gum, and citrus.  It’s very mild and great to drink in the sun on a summer’s day.  Good stuff.

Cloudy dark yellow, thick creamy and persistent white head.  Looks good.  Banana aroma.  Taste is rather mild but rather complex with the banana, wheat, some citrus and mild spices.  Doughy yeast.  Medium creamy body.  Soft carbonation.  An easily drinkable beer that’s mild enough for the occasional drinker yet solid enough for the real beer lover.  You won’t hear me say anything bad about this beer.  Actually you won’t hear me say anything at all since you are reading me.

a fine brew indeed.  I got lots of gumball wheatiness in the aroma, along with some lemon and banana of course.  Some clove and nutmeg rounded out the aroma.  The flavor was palpably lemon and banana.  Like banana nut bread in a bottle.  The clove flavor was excellent, and it really softened the lemon.  Excellent malts and just a very fine session hefe indeed.

Appearance: Cloudy, hazy golden with orange hues. pours with a yellowish head with nice clingy lace
Aroma:Yeasty some grainy notes and muted spices and effervescent fruity aroma. Caramel and lemony flavors emerge as the beer warms
Flavor: Caramelly, wheat malt, some sour notes.. finishing with big fuity flavors
Palate: Medium-light body, very spritzy making it lighter than it seems. Finishes dry and with lingering banana and some honey flavors 
Overall: A very good hefe-weizen seems a little insipid and fizzy than anything else
Having tried it on tap in Germany and the Ayinger I think this leaves something to be desired. Then again on a hot summer day, a fabulous refreshing brew... Cheers!
Hazy yellowish orange color..  typical cloudy hefe... has a light citrus bannana flavor, with a mix of apricots and raisens.  A nice refreshing brew on a nice warm day...

I’ve had both bottled and Draught. Draught is definitely better with stronger flavors, but I think this is more an issue of freshness and distributor handling. Pours a nice orange-yellow with a tall creamy  head that seems to dissipate little more quickly than it should for the style. Nice aroma with mild banana and clove flavors. Definitely better than most Weiss or American Wheat beers and is worth a try especially if it’s on tap.
Hazy orange color with a thick creamy white head. Sweet banana aroma with light pace. Noticable banana flavor.
In bottle:  Great golden blonde color.  Smooth wheat taste, bubble gum flavors, some citrus.  Very good Hefe.  Love it.
Robe blonde foncée voilée surmontée d’une mousse blanche épaisse. Arômes de bananes, de citron et de levure. Saveurs de banane et de levure.

I detected an almost overwhelming toasted wheat flavor that was a little bit overpowering.  I can’t help but compare it to Erdinger and find that I prefer the smooth rich (and not toasted) flavor of Erdinger.  I sure as heck didn’t notice any banana or citrus flavors others have noted, only strong toasted wheat tones.
On draft at Just Sports with Stegosaurus. Poured hazy golden with a fat fluffy head, good smell, good smooth taste with fruity flavor, this beer was very drinkable.

500ml can.. ..	Cloudy yellow orange, tall white head. .. …	Banana, Cloves, apricot. . .. .. 	Sweet, citusry flavor with yummy esters. . ….	smooth, medium body… .	Classic weissbier flavor.  Good stuff.
Bottle. Good solid wheat beer. Nice banana backbone with some clove and cirtus flavors. Just the perfect bit bready in the mouth. Nice light-creamy finish. No lemon needed in this beauty.
Bottled. The flavor had an excellent combination of yeast, fruit (banana and orange), and soy sauce. Good carbonation, not too gassy. Excellent to sup with. I love this beer!

For a wheat beer, this is one of the best. Have had on tap at Sam’s in Nashville and only with a lemon in the beer. Always hits the spot, expecially on a nice sping day when you are looking to keep drinking a a while.

It’s 5.5% as you can see by clicking the label-image...But allright then ;-)
Muddy amber color with fine head. Yeasty aroma. Very acidic or citurs flavor. Feels a bit watery- Not my favorite weissbeer.

(03.31.06) On tap at Paulener Brauhaus, Beijing, China.  Hazy orange beer having a large white head with good lacing.  Soft carbonation. Spicy clove in the nose. Medium bodied wheat beer that stars with light malt sweetness and fruitiness/spicy clove flavor. Finishes with light malt and clove aftertaste.  No discernable hop presence. A very good drinkable malty wheat beer that went well with roasted pig knuckles.  Of the three tap beers (including the Munich dark and Munich lager) that I sampled, the weissbier was the best.  
Earlier Rating: 1/10/2006 Total Score: 4.1
(12.28.05) One pint, 0.9 fl oz brown bottle purchased from DiCarlo’s, Mundelein, IL. Bottled on 10/05. Hazy golden yellow hued beer having a large long-lasting white head with good lacing. Soft carbonation.  Nice banana and clove aromas. Light-to-medium bodied that starts with light malt sweetness and banana, spicy clove and smoke flavors. Finished with pleasant malty aftertaste.  Flavorful, crisp and refreshing.  A very good drinkable weisse beer, one of my favorites.
Bottle 0.5l served in a Weizen glass, fruity banana like aroma, with little clove aroma, nice body and head. One of my favorite Weizen Beers.

Can bought in Germany, braught back by a friend. Served in a weizen glass. Golden hazy weizen with creamy off white head. Bananas are so present in this, with cloves, and grass. In mouth, super fresh sweet malt, fruity bananas, like banana bread, rich and creamy mouthfeel, fresh. BB date is 10-06.
light citrus flavour.  cloudy pale yellow colour.  finely carbonated.  very refreshing.

Draught.  Pours an amber-orange color with pretty good head.  Yeasty aroma, somewhat sweet with a bit of citrus.  Somewhat sweet yeasty wheat flavor, again with a bit of citrus.  Lightly carbonated, and finishes nicely.  A very good summer beer.
Quintessential hefeweizen. Beautiful head and crisp scent. Sweet yeast flavor.

Pours a five-finger white head that fades to a thin layer leaving traces of lace. Nearly clear light amber color. Light carbonation and light bodied.  Yeasty nose. Starts with a wheat-yeast flavor, nice clean finish.  Good example of a hefe-weizen.  $1.50 for a 12 oz bottle from Capital Convenience Concord, NH.

Tap @ Sherlock’s: Pours a cloudy yellow~orange color, smallish head, white, small bubbles, semi-decent lacing.  Slight aroma of malts, perfume.  Light tasting, citrus, lemon.  Fresh tasting, kind of watery, sweet.

out of the bottle pours light copper with a tall/good size bubbly cream head that fizzes and dissipates to a more minimal height. high carbonation throughout.  smells fresh. cloves, light hops, lemon. tastes light on the palate. almost watery. it takes some time to pick up the subtle hints of clove, banana and bubblegum. there is a slightly sour, clovey aftertaste. the flavors are a bit too subtle for my taste so this ends up just seeming a little too watered down and weak. however, it is generally refreshing and what there is of flavor is good. s’ok.
02apr06 one bottle for 2-3 dollars.  golden wheat with touch of lemon or citrus finish.  I like the other hefe this weekend better.

The best Hefeweizen I have had so far.  Found this at Bevmo and was surprised by how good it was. You can definately taste the wheat. If you are ever going through the Munich airport, they have it on Tap!

500ml on can. Present from beer rater Catweazle (thanks!) Yellow golden with a nice white head mostly lasting. Hazy body. Aroma of sweet grain and citrus. Sparkling. Light bodied mouthfeel, but   well balanced flavour with the sweetness of banana and the acidic of lemon. A touch of malt in a rather short ending.

Great wheatbeer. Colour is pale yellow with a smoky feel. Aroma is very much wheat and a lot of banana from the yeast. Taste is sweet to begin with then enhances to a dynamic mix of berries, hops and banana flavours. Very highly carbonated as well.

12 oz. bottle from Trader Joe’s, "Produced on 09/05." Had a rather wretched Ekstra hefe last night, luckily I had this along to help clear the palate. I a tall wheat glass, pours a somewhat creamy orange color under an inch-thick head. Big banana and clove smell at first, then undercurrents of bubblegum and lemon. This carries through in the taste, with additional notes of coriander and vanilla. Definitely a summer beer; I stored this at 45°, and on a chilly spring evening, it feels way too cold. Softened water for a slightly buttery finish. Hews straight to the style, with no excessive malt of hop characteristics.

Can sent by brewer's rep, tested 8/7/21. A little darker in malt than other hefes. Big puffy head. Banana and clove smell were more subdued, but they came through as I worked my way through the glass. Maltier than I remember from last time.  Having a .5 liter can instead of a 12 oz bottle helped me see and enjoy more of it in the glass. Worth rating up a notch or 2 from the 3.2 I gave it 11 years ago. No extreme spice or manner character that others doing a hefe works arrive for. Just a note everyday version.

Pours slightly hazy and orange-yellow with a thin head, leaves a little lacing.  The pleasant aroma is of yeasty malts and citrus.  The flavor is sweet and fruity, and the finish is light and refreshing.  This is a respectable, if uncomplicated, hefeweizen, great when you want something light.

Unclear golden, white head that leaves a little laces; Quite simple malty, buttery nose, some freshness of clove and citrus; Great carbonation in a balanced body to the acidy side; Very soft, quite long, but watery finish, again with clove.

Bottled. Sparkling, hazy orange beer with yeast-clouds drifting in it. Nice, medium, off-white head. Lots of banana-esters when poured, but they calm down after a while, and yeast and cloves finds their places. A bit thin mouthfeel with flavors of banana, lemon, cloves and some yeast. The finish has some metallic notes, as well as spices. Best enjoyed in a Bavarian Bier-garten on a hot summer day. (060324)

Hefeweizen is my favorite style of beer.  This beer met & exceeded all my expectations.  i had it w/ some traditional German rye & sunflower seed buttered bread (www.pema.de ;sold under ’Bavarian’ name in U.S.); and the combination was heaven.  smooth, tasty, & savory.  there will always be a spot in my fridge for paulaner.
Bottle. Orange colour . off-white head. Beuatifuk banan aroma.Banana and citrus flavour. Harmonic.nice finish.

Bottle: Yellow orange cloudy colour, aroma is fruity and heavy on wheat. Taste is typical hefe with notes of banana, bread dough and vanilla. Lack a bit of character for the style; I don’t understand the commercial description.

One of my favorite wheat beers! Golden orange color with a light golden head. The body looks dirty and murky, and it has a sweet grain smell to it. The palate creamy and smooth. I always have a six pack in my fridge... it goes with preety much everything.

What a treat.  Orangey color with nice fluffy head, lasted almost the whole glass.  Fruity aroma,  almost pina colada.  Flavor of banana’s tropical fruit.  Could have used a little more BEER flavor, a little less fruit.  Would have again in a heartbeat.
Pours a hazy golden yellow with thick head.  Aroma of fruit, spice and malt.  Flavor of bananas, grains and citrus.  Good hefe.

had this on draft last week at the suppenkuche, a definite if in the sf area.  poured beautifl grainy yellow with a spongy huge head.  nice nose of bananas and spice.  smoothness hits the palate and more banana bread wormth kicks. no lemons please.  an excellent hefe though a bit thin at times.
Murky gold with a thick gold tinged head. Wheaty aroma with a little banana thrown in. The wheaty-banana carries through to the flavor with a finish that tingles your tongue.

(bottle - 12 oz) Hazy orange color with a mountain of foamy white head and lacing that goes all the way down. Light aroma that’s full of citrus hints and some wheat and grains underneath that. Flavor isn’t as wheaty as I expected. The beginning is a light mix of grains, wheat and citrus flavors with a nice undertone of bananas, some light orange and a nice apple skin finish. A tad watery.

On tap at the Red Star Tavern in Virginia Beach. Hazy yellow with a fluffy white head. Nose is yeasty, wheaty (of course) with banana and light citrus notes. Nice, crisp, light citrus (lemon and tangerine?) slightly spicy in the finish. Good for the style!

Bottle. Pours clear gold with a reasonably sized white head; pour the last inch or so of the bottle for some cloudiness. The aroma is yeast, nectarine, and a touch of spruce. The flavor is almost identical to the aroma, but with more spruce. Toward the bottom of the glass it gets zestier. Predictable, but okay.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy gold with a fluffy white head.  Aroma mostly of wheat with some banana.  The taste is not as sweet as other German Hefes, more wheaty and yeasty.  Good, but not great.  Go for a Hofbrau or Franziskaner at the same price.
bottled. Very, very great flavour, and aroma. Full bodied, harmonic, and everything you like from a great wheatbeer. my best wheatbeer ever. :-):-)

Bottle.  This beer has a fruity yeast aroma to it and pours (like any good hef) a nice cloudy orange-yellow color. Slightly more bitter than most hefs with emphasis with a distinct banana-like of flavor.  Not my favorite hef, but decent.
Pours hazy gold-orange with a large white head. Banana and lemon dominate the yeasty aroma. Fruity, citrusy, flavor with a light hop bitterness. Prickly, thin mouthfeel.

500ml bottle. Poured murky tan into a footed pilsner glass with a huge white head. Not pretty by any stretch.. looks a bit like very stale urine. Yeasty nose with light banana, not unpleasant but rather underwhelming. Strong banana flavor up-front, fading into alcohol and astringency reminiscent of cheap pale lager. Flat, bitter finish. Palate is thin and watery, highly drinkable but feels very flat in the mouth. About the highest compliment I can pay this beer is that it’s a small step up from plain water as a cold refresher. I paid $2.50 for the bottle and would definitely not buy this again at that price.

Bottle 0,5l. Bright golden. Cloudy. Typical wheat beer behaviour: Large head. Disappointing aroma: Watery. Some fruity and spicy hints. No distinct aftertaste either. Too carbonated. Some sedimentation.

Light on the palate, w/ slight medicinal properties. Left me hangin’ and searching for more flavor. "It’s got to be here somewhere". NOT! Overall it’s good but  light on all components and uninteresting.

On draft at Morgan’s Chicago.  Cloudy orange/yellow body with a decent white head.  Aroma of lemons and oranges.  Flavor of lemons and oranges with some wheat.  Nice carbonated, refreshing palate.  Among the best hefeweizens I’ve had.

Produced on date 08-05.

Pours a pale orange/straw color with a creamy two finger head that settles to a thin cap, and leaves behins a really nice webbing of lace.

Smell; oranges and lemons, ripe bananas and bubblegum. There’s a nice bready/yeasty aroma, with a bit af a grassy/hay quality to it. The smell is really inviting, I have to make myself take a sip.

Taste; nice hints of oranges and lemons without being overly powerful. Ripe bananas stand out, as well as bread dough. I like how the wheat comes out without being heavy, as well as a nice spiciness with cloves in the finish. Mouthfeel is medium bodied, with a nice carbonation that makes this vary easy to drink.

I cna’t believe that I avoided this style so much until recently. Between this and the Weihenstephaner, I am definitley becoming a fan of this style of beer.

As far as ol Hefezien(sp?) go, this is about as good as it gets. Pretty much only drink this at the Gaus Haus in Minneapolis, usually during Oktoberfest. It certainly is good, but my dicering toungue cannot detect the Lemon nutty aroma, gold orange with thing white tight head. Big banana flavor, citrus banana, as soon have indicated. Im an ape.

Tap at Pinhead susans.  Lemon nutty aroma, gold orange with thing white tight head.  Big banana flavor, citrus banana.  Smooth palate.  Nice stuff.  A little euro sourness in the back of it in a nice way, acidic tartness.    Has some nostalgic value, too, as one of my first beers off the beaten path of foul tasting lager, many moons ago.
Very nice hefeweizen, good balance, not too sweet and overwhelming banana. Bit clove. Moderately bitter. Still sticky palate.
This beer pours a cloudy golden yellow color with a BIG white head! It ha s a big fruity smell.  taste is hops infused fruitiness with a great lingering taste!  Cheers!
what really got me interested in beer, fruity and sexy never lets me down. I shall never forget about it. some enjoy with lemon,
Bottle.  Poured an orange color, with a long lasting head.  Hoppy aroma.  Slight citrusy taste.  Very refreshing.  I enjoyed this.
Cloudy golden color with a foamy head. Fruity aroma with a banana & clove flavor.  Leaves a clean palate as it goes away.

Bubblegum, hay, grass, clove, yeast, and banana...typical flavors of the hefe...and this one has them all in abundance.   I usuually refrain from these in the winter, but i had one in the cellar from last year, thought I’d better drink it before it gets any older...and I’m glad I did...it, and the fact that it’s 55 degrees in Chicago on January 29th,  convinced me that summer is just around the corner.
Bottle.  High creamy white lasting head. Golden unclear body. Banana yeast aroma. Sweet banana lemon flavor with just a bit of carbonation.

Beer. Its what’s for breakfast. At least it is in Munich, Germany. If you ever venture to Munich, you will find hefeweizen, an unfiltered wheat beer, served in the Munich beer halls with a mid morning snack of weisswurst sauages. There are many outstanding examples of this style to be found in Munich, and one of my favorite examples is Paulaner Hefeweizen from the Paulaner Brauerei of Munich, Germany. I enjoyed this beer at the Paulaner Im Platz in Munich, and it is a classic example of what a Southern Bavarian hefeweizen should taste like. 

While most of the beers I drank in Germany were vom fass, this is a style that is actually intended to be bottled, as it is sedimented with yeast, where the beer continues to condition and develop. It is really something to watch a waiter or bartender in Munich pour one for you in the proper weissbier glass. Hefeweizen is a tart and thirst quenching beer, and has aromas and flavors of clove, banana, pear, and even bubble gum, from the use of a very distinctive ale yeast strain. Paulaner Hefeweizen is a very popular beer both in Germany and in the United States. It can be found in markets outside of Munich, as I enjoyed this beer in other parts of Germany, and I’m happy to say I enjoy it here in the US quite often as well. 

Paulaner Hefeweizen pours to a beautiful, hazy and opaque pale golden color with a thick, tall, rocky head, and a very lively carbonation. It is important to rouse the ring of yeast that clings to the bottom of the bottle as yeast is a major aroma and flavor component in this beer. Just leave an ounce before you empty the bottle, swirl it, and let the yeast pour into your glass. The nose on this beer is wonderful with lots of aromas of clove and banana. The palate is firm with good tart wheat malt flavor paired with estery fruity flavors of banana and pear, and perhaps even apple. Paulaner Hefeweizen finishes with more wheat and estery fruit flavors, then finishes with a spicy clove finish that lingers. 

A really impressive example of hefeweizen from one of Munich’s best brewers. Paulaner has made a real push into other markets in Germany, and their beers and restaurant/brewpubs can be found all over Germany. Their beers are popular here in the US, and can be found in a number of markets here. If you see this beer in your market, it is well worth giving a try. It works well with lots of dishes, and is a great beer to drink with in the warm weather, and yes, a great beer to have for breakfast!

12 oz. bottle from Beers Around the World kit.

Poured a medium dark amber with a huge head that took over 2 minutes to subside to 2 fingers. Some nice lacing formed after the dense foam waned. Smell is mostly of yeast, with a slight fruitiness. Taste was just like the smell with a banana / cloves / lemon flavor blending well with the yeast  and wheat taste. Smoother than I anticipated. Very slight carbonated banana aftertaste. My wife said she tasted spearmint, though I did not. Like the commercial description says, it is indeed a very crisp, refreshing beer. I am limited in my wheat beer experiences, but I like it a lot, prefering it to the Hackor Pshoor hefe. So far, my favorite hefe.

Draught at Ship & Mitre, Liverpool. Cloudy orange/gold with thick tight white head. Banana/lemon/touch of bubblegum. Refreshing, very good hefeweiss. Finish has lemon and banana, but it feels light and fluffy. Quite a nice dry feel

Cloudy yeasty pour with a beautiful rocky white head that does diminish over time, but continues to coat the glass.  Aroma of citrus and wet sourdough bread.  Citrus, cloves and wheat maltiness in the taste.  A very good example of the style.

Bottled.  Cloudy golden pour with huge frothy head.  Typical strong wheat beer aroma.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Sweet and lacking any bitterness.  Simple, laid-back and containing a touch more yeast than most.  I’ll take a Maisel’s or a Franziskaner over this, but still, a top-notch Hefe.[3.6]
Update: This one was a bit oily, a bit slick.  I really wasn’t having a good time by the bottom, very boring.[3.3]
Poured a cloudy orange with a good sized white head that went away quickly.  Nice banana smell. Taste had a slight banana flavor and was quite refreshing.
"MMMM very nice. Poured a nice golden brown with an average puffy head. Smell was nice and fresh of bananas. The first sipe was a typical hefe, with a little cloves added to it. What a beer."

01.17.06  500ml bottle.  Typical German hefe pour is clouded orange-golden with light and lingering tan head of loose froth.  Aroma is inviting with mildly spicy clove and citrus hints mingling with an esthery sweetness and yummy yeast.  The flavor is laid back moreso than expected but nonetheless very quenching with mild acidity (citrus, tart) and some bananas in breakfast cereal.  Slick, yet tingly in its eff.  I like that it’s mouthfeel is more asertive than many hefeweizens.  How I’ve never had this beer until today is a mystery.

Poured from the bottle at The Light Bar in Shoreditch (London), a bright cloudy orange with a large frothy head. A strong wheat aroma of citrus and banana, with hints of pepper. Smooth to taste and a good tanginess.
Good wheat beer, something that can be found almost anywhere. if your looking for a wheat beer to try for the first time or just have an urge for one its a good choice
Doughy, wheaty, sweet aroma. Cloudy amber, some head. Tingly carbonation, tasty yeasty fruity flavor, banana aftertaste.
Pretty consistent year to year.  Certainly better on tap, but still quite good in a bottle.  Strong hefe flavors of banana and clove.  The warmer the better on this one. Love the end of the glass.
Unclear yellow colour, orange haze. average white head. Malty aroma, some yeast. Herby flavour, finish is dry and herby.

Light gold in color with a chunk head.  Cloudy like a Texas lake.  Aromatics included bananas, citrus, and possibly clove.  Fairly full on hte palate.  A good example of a traditional bavarian Hefeweizen.

Bananas and citrus in the amroa. Pours an eggshell head, which swirls into the beautiful orange yeast. Cloudy, but not as much as most weizen. I break from the pack in that the taste is too thin. Almost watery, with no bitterness and a flat-cola aftertaste. I’ll drink a free one, but honestly, cheaper hefeweizen is usually better to me. Dont’ kill me :)
Pours a hazy orange/brown. Sweet with the typical banana & yeasty hefeweizen aromas. Very nice, could be a bit more full though.

Can/Tap/bottle, whatever. For me this is the perfect weizen and one of the few beers that I actually prefer served from a can. Amazing rocky head on a dark golden hazy body. Aroma is full of banana, fresh bread and fruit (melon) leading to a lively palate showcasing sweet malt with clean, nutty wheat flavor. Phenolic but not over the top. Mouth feel is full, but carbonation is a bit unpleasant as with most weizenbiers - but nonetheless suitable for style. A beautiful brunch-companion.

Thanks to the in-laws for getting this one for me!  Surprised I’d never rated this.  Medium orange and gold, medium, lasting head, slight haze.  Aroma lightly grainy, with a touch of clove and lemon.  Flavor is wheat grain with a lovely touch of balanced esters, bubblegum on the front with equal parts clove and lemon on the finish.  A delicate, tasty beer.

Tap.  Nice full head in a chilled pint glass. A golden hue with nice wheat notes.  Nice lemon and banana, but could be more spice.  Great session beer especially in the summer when you need a thirst quencher.

My favorite Hefe and I’ve tried all of them that I can but keep going back.  Golden pour..Head doesn’t stay too long.  Smells of citrus and honey maybe some banana in there too.. Very refreshing after being outside all day.  Excellent flavor that doesn’t stay too  long.Makes you want another drink.  I could drink this until I pass out which I do sometimes..

One with les soure,..good! nice bisquit banana sweet with a slice of bitternes.
One of the betters
Honey.  Wheat.  Banana.  Tastes a lot like other Hefe’s.  Pretty good overall. Would be very refreshing on a warm summer day.
Cloudy orange color with a small dimishing head. Light sweet aroma with flavors of honey and wheat.

The head was spare and diminishing.  It had an orange color.  I do not like the taste of these wheat ales.  It tastes OK at first, but there is a nasty aftertaste that comes around a few seconds later.

Beautiful appearance features a sunburst of orange, yellow and scarlet. Spicy nose is dominated by nutmeg and cloves with some citrus peel lingering in the distance. While refreshing, the palate is pretty thin, as is the flavour. Some spiciness and lemon but not much going on overall. A little disappointing.
An excellent example of a good weisse beer.  Cloudy orange yellow color with creamy head, good aroma, flavor is excellent.

50 cl
Orange/yellow Color
Withe creamy head
Good fresh aroma, banana
Good beer
Deep golden, unclear. Off white head. Fresh aroma, yeast, hops? Mild flavour. Wheat, yeast, bread. A little banana? Sugar sticky palate. Nice, very mild.
Cloudy orange colour. Thick white, rocky head. Clove, spice, banana aroma. Flavour is pretty much the same. A nice fruity and lemon-ish finish.

341ml bottle.  Cloudy beer.  Smells a bit like bananas.  It reminded me some citrus tastes.  Apparently it’s recommended to serve it with a bit of lemon.  I’ve tried it plain.  I got 2 other bottles to try it.  Really nice.  Good carbonation.  I would buy it again.

Pours a light cloudy orangish, with long lasting head.  Aroma is of easy bananna, light spice, lemon.  Flavor doesnt pack as much punch as I was hoping for, more bananna and  spice, with a splash of tang, maybe more lemon.  Mediocre.

Bottled at a Thai Restaurant in Cologne, 500ml. Opaquly orange is a good descriptor with big head. Plenty going on with this, a rich wheaty base with fruity orange notes and a touch of clove with I think, just a little nutmeg. Then a sweet almost manufactured strawberry like flavour that dominates the rest of the beer. Quickly finishes, refreshing with a modicum of interest.

Not the biggest fan of the Paulaner brewery simply from the disappointing beers from their range that I have tried, so I didn’t expect too much of this one. Poured an opaque, orange gold with a huge, quickly formed, dense and fluffy white crown that rose a good half inch from the stein. The head remained for the length and left glugs of drying froth down the glass as I sipped (It did look good!!). A little burnt toffee and gritty haystack grain came through in the aroma, as did softer notes of bubblegum, banana and lemon concentrate, making for a pleasant start to the tasting. Quite soft in carbonation, medium-light in body and initially creamy in mouthfeel. Subtle mix of toasted malts, sweet banana and pear, and tangy lemons and grapefruit. Finish is a little short, but it remained fresh and crisp for the length. Served chilled this proved a decent German wheat beer, and the first Paulaner beer to ignite my senses. Quite nice!!! (33cL, 5.5% ABV, BBE 04/06)
pretty decent stuff.  really smooth.  Not a whole lot of taste or aroma.  bit of spice/clove towards the end.
As far as brand name beers go from Germany this is one of my favorite as well as one of the best.
Generally too light and spicey for me; however, it frequently can be the best beer available.

500 mL bottle poured into my Hofbrauhaus weizen glas.  Poured a deep golden color with a big head that sticks around.  Strong banana/bubblegum aroma with some spiciness as well.  Strong taste of yeast and wheat with a tangy edge to it in the finish.  This is one of the beers that I came back from Germany raving about and while I have found some better hefes since, this is still a good one and worth drinking.

From the bottle: Pours a cloudy deep gold with a thin white head.
Typical Hefe aroma of clove and banana.
Zippy mouthfeel, deep banana taste. Pretty average overall I thought.

Yellow-orange in colour. Thick white long lasting head. Has a wheat aroma with some hints of clove and bananas. Taste of banana, yeast and some citrus flavours. Bananas in the aftertaste. A good weiss bier.
Bottle. I like that one. My first Hefeweizen I think. Cloudy, yellow/golden color, light but tasty: banana, clove and some spices. Gimme another one anytime!
On tap (Scruffy Murphey’s, downtown Columbus, GA):  Cloudy, yellow-orange body with nice head.  Light flavor with a refreshing hint of banana in the background.  Overall very good.

12 oz bottle: For some reason i always thought i had already picked this up before and thought it was alright. Aroma is a moderate but refreshing smell of the classic examples of a true German hefeweizen.  Chewed bubblegum, an old banana peel, and hints of clove and yeast sit right behind the two inseparable staples.  The flavor isn’t as promising as the aroma had tricked me into believing, but it’s still a worhty hef to be drank.  A decent amount of bubblegum and yeast found in the flavor while a satisfying amount of wheat outweigh everything else.  Maintains a sturdy covering of foam until the the very end as the clear golden liquid disappears.
Bottle. Hazy amber color with a huge frothy white head that diminished slowly. Good sweet wheat aroma. Light to medium texture. Good refreshing wheat and fruit flavor wih a moderate sweet finish.

Pour is a hazy yellow with a huge white head.  Aroma is my is hard to detect but you do get some spices and cloves.  Flavor is a bit weak in mine.  In fact i have to really almost try to detect what was used.  I get some banana and vanilla but again its very weak.  Maybe an old bottle since i bought this at a place you would not go to get good craft beer.  Franziskaner is still the best.

After a long search, I’ve finally found this..... in a bar near my uni. Great. 0.33l bottle, drank from a Paulaner weissbier glass. Said 5.5%, but same thing probably. It poured an enormous, thick white head, gold/orange colour. Not as misty as some, but who cares. Well carbonated. The nose was spicy, with hints of bananas maybe, not as assertive as in, say, Franziskaner, but nice enough.  The taste was....well.... good. Typical weissbier taste, only better. Banana, lemon, yeast. Pleasant stuff. Faint banana aftertaste. Doesn’t beat Franziskaner in my opinion, but that one’s a sentimental favorite, and that probably has something to do with it.

Not one of my favorite styles, but starting to become a believer. He has a nice cloudy amber color with a lasting thick and creamy head. Has a smooth banana aftertaste that makes the beer even more enjoyable. Still like them with out lemon, but learning more and more each time I try a Hefeweizen.
Very pleasant cloudy look but no significant head.  Very crisp and refreshing with a bit of lemon taste.  Smooth texture but nothing incredible.  Very good appearance.

Exceptional hefeweizen. One of my favourite styles, and this version just proves why. It pours a lovely, consistent cloudy orange marmalade colour with a thick, creamy and lasting head. Dusty banana and cloves aroma with a hint of tutti frutti. A great balanced flavour, with the sweetness counteracted with some sour and bitter. It’s very fresh in the mouth with a medium body and a satisfying aftertaste. I’ll be definitely going back for more of this.

US 12oz Bottle pour - Don’t have any of my weizen glasses with me. Thus, not quite as large a head as I’m used to. Light, cloudy Amber body. Aroma was very nice - banana, clove, cinnamon, fruity. Flavor was excellent - much richer banana flavor with less spice than I prefer. Full, creamy texture with a long, slightly sweet finish. Very nice, indeed. Cheers!

This was my first weissbier - almost 2o years ago - and therefore pure nostalgia. Still tastes great. Cloudy golden colour with a huge lasting head. Aroma and taste of fruit and spices. Full body. This is the original. Every other weissbier is just a copy.

Appears a hazy cloud of gold with a 2 finger white head that slowly fades. Streaky & spotty lacing.
Smell is of banana, clove, along with wheat and a touch of creamy vanilla.
Taste is of zesty wheat with a clean banana and clove freshness.
Mouthfeel is slightly peppery and fizzy with a medium body and some banana sweetness coming through.
Drinkability...this is the one that sets the bar for me for the style. Appearance is much better on draft but this is still a great beer out of the bottle.

I may have gotten a lackluster bottle, because this beer comes across as lackluster even if otherwise meeting minimal standards of decency.  Very cloudy orange color, quality head retention, lackluster though decent aroma, lackluster flavor with mild wheat crispness and a lackluster soft smooth finish.  Reasonably good but uninteresting.

This beer had some flaws.  The light aroma was a good start but the over powering sour nose did not help.  A good golden copper color helped.  A good amoutn of haze.  This had a great wheat flavor but was over powered with eh clove like flavor which should not be in this beer.  It was ok but it could have been better.  I am hoping it was an old bottle.

Hazy orange-honeyish hue, with abig frothy white head, with, yeasty, bready dough, banana, even hint of fruity peach aromas follow through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, fruity, wheaty character, leading towards a mellow mouthfelling yeasty finish.

Draught. Hazy, golden straw, nice aroma, served with lemon wedge, great taste, citrus, clove, vanilla and slight yeast taste, esters, hint of root beer in finish. Just an excellent beer. Classic example of good hefeweizen. Incredible on tap and just as good in bottles fresh in Germany.

Bottle (330ml).  Poured murky orange with a huge slightly off-white creamy-rocky head.  Aroma strong with banana esters, tobacco ash, sweet malt, spices (coriander, pepper), a bit of hops and wheat.  Taste is a bit tart, very citrusy (lemon/orange), with some hop bitterness and sweet malt, spices and the ash bitterness overall - very mild flavour, really, light asgtringent mouthfeel.  Quite pleasant, not overly memorable, but one of the nicer Hefeweiss beers I’ve tried.

(500 ml bottle: $1.99 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA) So, perhaps the defacto standard for German Hefeweizens.  It pours with a big, tall, bubbly head, just slightly off-white in color, and it sure is taking its sweet time dropping down to a size where I can actually take a sip of beer.  So while I’m waiting for that, the color is a beautiful bright orange-golden, and of course is fully cloudy, and that’s without disturbing any of the abundant sediment on the bottom of the bottle.  I’ll attempt to disturb that in subsequent pours, however.  The nose is packed with fairly strong banana-like esters and a moderate phenolic aroma.  Not getting too much of the typical clove smell, and the wheat aroma seems to be overrun by the banana, but the nose is still very inviting.  Well, what do you know, the head has finally died down a bit.  With as much banana as there is in the nose, I expected the flavor would share the same characteristic, but the banana is more restrained here.  I also expected it to taste sweeter, but the sweetness is pretty mild as well.  This balance allows the wheat flavor to really stand out more than in most Hefeweizens.  Bitterness is very mild.  And finally, there’s a touch of clove in the finish, putting a nice cap on this baby.  Body is medium, with gentle carbonation for a smooth mouthfeel.  I think I can see why this is often considered the standard for the style.  Well-balanced, well-crafted and thoroughly enjoyable.  But I never could break up that yeast pack lining the bottom of the bottle.
Wonderfull appearence, exellent head, fully lasting, cloudy as it should be, yeasty aroma, quite bitter finish, average duration. A good beer.
Very thick, yellowy colour; big lasting thick head. Mild aroma, great taste - smooth, fruity (banana like notes), full. Creamy, spicey, very satisfying. Awesome

Pours a cloudy honey colour with a thin head. Typical banana/clove aromas, touch of yeast. The taste was bananas and some black pepper with a slightly tart edge to it, lively carbonation. Very drinkable. Didn’t last long.

Pours white-yellow with a meringue head that dissipates fairly quickly.  Aroma is quite complex: Spices, butterscotch, orange and yeast.  Orange, banana and malt flavours with a creamy mouthfeel and a pretty clean finish (Slightly bitter and notes of yeast).
Hazy orange, white head. Banana, hops and melon in the nose. Refreshing taste, some sourness and a bit grainy at the end. Just a bit different..

My favorite beer to date.  Had this one from the tap while on vacation in Chautaqua County, NY.  Excellent all around.  I shared it with some non-beer drinkers and every one said they could drink this one.  Pleasant beyond words. Arrived with a small head. Aroma with pleasant  with a touch of citrus, banana and cloves.  Tasted like the aroma with a pleasant aftertaste.  By the time my friends gave me it back, I had to order a second as the first was largely gone. Now I just need to find out where I can get this one in Alaska.
Has that good wheat beer apperance and aroma but that crisp refreshing taste on a hot summer day is just not there.  Beer has no complexity.

Golden orange appearance.  Mild aroma of wheat, cinnammon, and citrus.  Medium bodied bier w/ pleasant taste of cloves wheat, and citrus.  Not a strong taste compared 2 other weisbiers.  This is my "budweiser", a reliable b33r after a long day of werk.
It was a very fine Hef.  I perfer cinnamon-less Hefs like Widmer but it is still a good beer.

50 cl. Bottle. Yeast in bottom. Very cloudy yellow coloured wiessbier, with a rich creamy head. A lot of aroma of wheat and yeast and some citrus. Good comlex taste for a wiessbier, fruity of banana and hints of wheat. A really good refreshing beer.

Pours hazy golden orange with a nice white fluffy head. Aroma was wheat and yeast. Flavor was a little weak compared to some other Hefes I have enjoyed this summer. A little watery. Not bad but I prefer Franziskaner or Weihenstephaner for a reasonably priced, easy to find wheat.
Really good beer. Who knew a widely-distributed Hefe-Wisen could be this good. Probably the best beer available in my current location in Albania.

Not my favorite hefeweizen, but a very solid representation of the style. Has the expected banana and clove notes, but actually less so than I look for in a Hefe. Still, a nice friend to have on a hot day.
Bold aroma that is mostly spice, with underlying notes of vanilla, banana and cloves.  The body is medium to light, with added fruity yeastiness.  Great drinkability and an all around solid hefe.

Simply the best Hefe beer in the world. Drink it and you will never get enough. 
Sweet and mild, each zip is pure love.. 

Here in Norway our local monpoly has been out of stock since may 2005, the fools. But though it gives me little comfort, I am saving some bucks because of the outrages prices on import beer here in Norway.
on tap-pours a thick creamy white head, color is a cloudy gold.  Aroma is cloves, citrus.  Taste is mild cloves and citrus.  A nice beer.

Paualner Hefe is very difficult to obtain in Vancouver BC.  I used to have it custom ordered in via the BC Liquor Board custom order program,  but now I finally convinced them to begin stocking it.  Unfortunately we can only get the .33l bottles instead of the .51 (hey it’s better then nothing).  

I find this hefe to be the perfect blend with just enough yeast to give it a smooth sweet flavor (just a bit less then Hacker Pschorr which I also love).

I’ve found the date and storage of this beer to be very important.  As this beer gets older the flavor changes and the yeast become harder and harder to whip up from the bottom.

In short - drink it fresh!

Bottled. Hazy orange colour, nice white foamy head. Sweet fruity aroma with hints of yeast. Fruit, yeast and some spices in flavour. Also hints of sweet malts and gets a bit caramellish in fnish. Creamy mouthfeel while drinking. Citrus in aftertaste. Pleasant one.

Draft, Baja Bean, Staunton VA. Served with lemon wedge. Lots of citrus on the nose, mostly lemon and orange, with a nice light grainy aroma as well as some spice. Very light body, fizzy but not in a distracting way. The fruit and spice balance out well with a slight malt sweetness and overall general crispness. This is a fantastic beer, like sippin’ lemonade; perfect for a balmy southern summer evening.
Copper. Big, bubbly, white head. Big malt nose with subtelties of alcohol and sweetness. Same flavor with a bit of lactic character. Creamy smooth body, nice level of carbonation. Very good.

After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity wall adhesive white foam collar which was fine and even of structure. The beer also contained much carbonic acid in the glass. The beer has a thick dark blond color and a sweet honey taste. The after tast of the beer is hoppy bitter with a banana touch. This beer smells fruity.

Bottle.  One: I have limited experience and knowledge of Hefs. Two: I still find ales and dark lagers most refreshing, typically.  Maybe that’s why I preferred Saranac’s hef to this.  Maybe this is exactly as a good hef should be, but, personally, I found it too highly carbonated, a bit heavy of palate, and overpowering of flavor with foods.  Too good for me ?  Maybe.  BUY AGAIN? Probably not.  
 HEY, I"VE STILL GOT 6 OF THESE.  WANNA TRADE?  TURN ME ON TO SOMETHING NEW AND GET A PAULANER HEF IN EXCHANGE.

Bottle: Very cloudy orange-flecked gold (apricot perhaps) with a thick creamy white head. Thick banana and subtle clove and nutmeg aromas dominate. Sweet wheat malts and floral lemon overtones. Lots of full bodied wheat malt flavours with cloves and a hint of corn (which works for some reason). Some gentle woody and lemony, floral juicyness at the end. Very nice!

Draught, in Germany.
Golden with large white head, mostly lasting, unfiltered. Aroma of malt (fruit, citrus) and yeast. Flavor light sweet, moderate acidic. Light to medium body, oily, lively carbonated.
Pours a cloudy light amber with a lasting white head. Aroma of yeast, malt, some citrus and banana. Clean and refreshing flavour of malt, yeast, citrus, banana and spice (clove). A very good hefe.

I have had this several times on the tap and 12 oz. bottle and both serve extremely well accompanying most meals.  It is clean and light, with enough flavor to keep up with light or heavy dishes.  The banana finish is noticeable but not intrusive.  One of the most drinkable good beers I’ve had.  Definitely one to pick up for entertaining  - a great crowd pleaser.
Pours a  light amber body with an off-white head.  Spicy banana aroma.  Thick mouthfeel with a kick of spices and a smooth banana finish.  Really nice Hefe.
Yeasty banana aroma, lovely golden color. PERFECT hefeweizen flavor. My new favorite hefeweizen. Expensive and tough to find in CT, though. I will relish this 6 pack.
Bottled.  A very picturesque beer with hazy gold color with a pillowy lingering head.  This beer offers a fresh and clean taste. A solid summer beer.

Golden yellow color with nice white head.  Aroma is better than the taste, very citrusy smell.  Tastes fruity, citrus and banana, with a very sublte earthy notes a bit of nutmeg.  I prefer Scneider and Sohn Edel Weisse.

Excellent, full tasting bottled Weizen. Classic banana/clove flavors integrate well with slight lemony acidity. Satisfies my palate as well as any micro beer could. No bitter yeastiness, great example of style, don’t miss it if you haven’t yet tried a German HW you like.

Bottle.  This should be the benchmark by which to judge other weizens.  While most are similar in style and character, few make my mouth water when looking back on them.  This beer however sets that tone, and not bad for a mass produced beer easily available.
Very nice hazy golden color. Nice appearance. Citric and fruity taste. It is one of my favourite Hefeweizen beers)
From keg. Hazy/cloudy  gold color.  Aromas of yeast and fruit. Flavor is spicey, with banan and clove. Not bad at all, just not my favorite style.
Munich - Gold hazy pour with wheaty nose which is also present in the flavor but there is also fruit there.  Making this a very nice smooth weissbeer.
Not a hefe fan, but when I hit them this is what I grab. Reminds me of a thick banana champagne.
On tap at Just Sports. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, fruit, and wheat. Flavor is fruit, wheat, sweet. Loads of bananas flavor, good body, good brew.
this beer is great.  sweet citrus taste that stays with you till the next sip.  great full aroma.

Draft at Naja’s.  My favorite hefe to date.  Nice golden orange color with a nice fluffy white head, not as cloudy as other hefes I’ve tried.  Definite fruity flavor with a tinge of clove.  I will certainly be drinking more of these as the summer goes along.
A well put together hefeweizen. Not my favorite, but certainly a great example of the style. Cloudy golden body, big puffy white head, aroma is citrus and banana. Good stuff.

Very solid, a absolute classic.  Perhaps a bit more dry than other hefes, and certainly a bit more yeasty.  Carbonation tingles your tounge.  The flavor of clove doesn’t overwhelm; its more subdued.  A classy hefe.
Can 50 cl. Brown hazy colour and large medium lasting head. Lemon + standard hefe aroma. Very smooth and good carbonation. I’ll get some more of these.

A standard hefe. less sweet than some wheat beers like Penn wheat, also less banana and clove than Penn wheat. I suppose the yeast is different than in other brews. Paulaner has been brewing since 1634 so who’s to say which is better?

Good beer, standard hefe. Refreshing on a hot day. Appearance was golden orange and cloudy.  The flavor was citrusy with hints of banana and nutmeg. Tasty creamy texture. I will definitly have another.

on tap served with lemon, i really need to start asking for my hefes without the lemon since this guy just droped it in after the pour before he handed it to me.  this was a good hefe, banana was present.  nice and refreshing on a hot summer night.
a sim rate: (on tap) Sweet aroma - particularly lemony. Wheaty. Nice orange colour. It seems a little darker than most whites (weisses). Fruity finish with LOTS of banana. Very smooooth.
Grain, Hay, Straw, Cereal, white, amazing, .5 liter bottle, realy like Paulaner brewery beers

Draft.  Creamy and yellow-orange in the glass with a nice haze and a full two inches of snow-white head.  Aromas of bananas and apricot, and the yeast shows up nicely.  Palate is smooth, medium-bodied, and round, my only complaint being that it is a little gritty.  Flavors emphasize the yeast and wheat.  A soft, somewhat light hefe.

500 ml can.  Cloudy yellow beer with fluffy white head.  Nice heavy banana and clove spiciness, with a bit of apricot and apple fruit as well.  Flavour is a bit thin, light bodied with some wheatiness.  Dry beer with a nice sour finish.

(Bottle 50 cl) Hazy, yellowish golden with a surprisingly small head. Lacks the yeasty, fruity nose normal for the style. Some yeast in the flavour, but not very pronounced. Rather dry with only hints of sweetness and an absent bitterness. Surprisingly bland for Paulaner that usually guarantees higher quality. 191099
Bottle. Nice, refreshing mouthfeel without being too light. Light fruit, cloves, and a little hop finish all add upto a serviceable everyday-kind of hefe.
Smells like a hefe, looks like a hefe.  Smooth going down.  Doesn’t have a good bite to it.  This will do if you want to have a great standby beer.  Liked it a little to mellow for my hefe taste

(bottle) Hazy yellow-orange colour with a thick foamy white head. Yeasty nose of banana and clove. Soft carbonated, light to medium bodied. Malty taste with a fruity and spicy note. The finish is refreshing and has a spicy clove note but is a bit bland and thin.

Draught

Hazy orange color, small off-white head. Lemony nose. Light to medium-bodied, refreshing. Crisp, orange-lemonade and wheat flavor. Easy to drink hefeweizen, lacks depth - quite standard.

Clougy yellow-amber in color,with a big white head.Aromas of ripe banana, spices, and a little yeast. Crisp refreshing palate. Flavors of ripe banana and wheat up front , with a spicy finish. Avery refreshing summer beer.

Bouteille de 330 ml achetée à la SAQ du Marché 440. Arôme: Odeur d’agrûmes, d’épices et de bananes. Apparence: Couleur blonde orangée voilée. Col moyen mousseux blanc. Densité moyenne des bulles. Large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de banane et d’épices. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Corps mince avec une texture huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère amertume en arrière goût. Une des rares bonnes bières disponible à la SAQ. (Rating #149)

Pours a hazy gold with a big lacy ivory head. Smells of spicy cloves and light banana aroma.

Tastes of wheat malt and spices. Cloves and light pepper. Ripe banana and sweet flavors. Lightly fruity and lightly sour. A nice lightly spicy aftertaste. Really tasty. And smooth. And creamy. Very good beer. Maybe the best Hefe I’ve had.

Pours light golden and hazy with a white frothy head.  Aroma is banana, bubble gum, cotton candy and toasted malts. Taste is bready with a spicy yeast character that has trouble living up to the aroma. Notes of toasted malt, wheat, and cookie are also present. Tart and lightly acidic finish. Body is thin and highly carbonated.  Quite enjoyable.  Despite having tried hundreds of beers, this is still one of my favorites.

Perfect cloudy light orange/yellow. The aroma could be stronger, but has the right banana yeast. Interesting flavour with some acidity and sweetness fighting for dominance. Some spice (clove, cinnamon) in the aftertaste.

Light bodied, not quite as cloudy as I would have expected. Creamy looking head with orange, malty and sweet notes. Clover honey and roasted, somewhat smokey flavors. Foam had something of a coppery taste.

A hazy golden appearance with a tall thin white head.  Minimal aroma - wheat.  Light bitterness, and smooth flavor.  Very easy to drink.  A light refreshing beer.  Good with lunch, or a light meal perhaps.
On tap.  Poured a dark and cloudy yellow with a little of a brown tint to it.  Small white head which faded.  Good flavors of earthy banana and clove spices.  Dry finish. Yummy.

Hazy orange colour with a creamy white head.
Fruity aroma of bananas, spices and yeast.
Fruity flvour of bananas, spices and yeast.

The bottle poured a golden hazy liquid topped with an ample creamy white head that lasted very nicely with beautiful lacing. The primary aromas were of banana and clove with a slight earthy note in the background. The flavors were straightforward consisting of malt sweetness accompanied by notes of banana. This was balanced nicely by a slight hop bitterness that lingered through the finish which left a nice alcohol warmth on the back of the throat.

Bottle. The colour is yellow with a tint of gold. The head is two fingers high, white and compact. 

The smell is sour, sweet fruit drink, lime, yeast, herbs, apricot jam, and earthy notes. 

The carbonation is strong and refreshing with medium sized bubbles that tickle the tongue. 

The smell is soft, sourish with an earthy flavour of yeast, apricots, and hazelnuts. The body is surprisingly strong for a Weiss bier. The aftertaste is a bit perfumed with some sweet-sour notes.

A well crafted classic German Weiss bier. I liked it!
i am new to really going out and trying new beers, but this is the best yet
Draft. Pours hazy, dark yellow with a small white head. Clove aroma with a light clove taste.  Light and crisp, fruity as well. Good stuff.

Great fruity beer, nice cloudy apperance though the aroma could be better. Alot of spices such as cardamon, corriander and even pepper come though. Aftertaste a bit dry, alround good stuff that i’ll be having again.
Cloudy Brownish gold, witha thin but sturdy white head. Spicy, yeasty aroma. Fluffly palate. Some fruity flavors, banana maybe, and pleasent mellow "wheat" finish.

Red Star Tavern - Spanish Fort, AL
Very nice apperance with a full head and a cloudy unfiltered golden color.  Nice malty and smooth flavor with medium mouthfeel.  One of the better wheats i’ve had.

8/06 hazy goldl under a medium sized white creamy head.  very little lacing.  banana, grains, and sour citrus aroma.  and fruity hefe.  not so much spiced and banana-ish as others.  smooth and light.     

8/05 grainy malt banana aroma. hazy yellow color.  tastes grainy and malted. tastes like candy banana.  pretty good but nothing special.  5/3/7/3/14
Tap at Maspn Jar in NJ.  This is presently one of my favorites.  This beer is flavorful, with citrus hints and touches of spice.  One of the best hefeweizens available.

Tap at JpDipsos house,  (Thanks John!) Pours a hazy yellow, small white head. Aroma of bananas and cloves, pepper and other spices. Flavor is crisp smooth and wheaty. More bananas and spices come out, with a little lemon flavor.
Cloudly light brown, nice head. Light citrus aroma. Taste is citrus, bubblegum. Sweet finish. Light malty mouthfeel.
a very good hefeweizen with strong tastes of wheat, yeast and citrus.  a good beer.
This is an amazing hefeweizen...most likely my favorite.  A strong taste of wheat and lemons.  Smelled dusty and hoppy.  A great beer overall.
One of my favorite wheat beers. I’ve heard alot of bad things about it, but in comparing it with others it looks good and tastes edven better. try it if you likr a good hefeweissbier.

I was never a big fan of wheat beers like Haacker Pschorr but this beer is damn tasty.  As everyone stated it has a banana after taste but it’s spice and smooth enough that I could easily drink a 6 pack.  Nicely carbonated it’s a great wheat beer!
Light amber in colour with an off white head, spicy aroma. Feels thick in the mouth with an initial spicy kick and a lasting aftertaste of banana. Not a bad brew, would like to taste it on tap.
This was pretty tasty, i really think it has a banana aftertaste to it that is so good, way better on draft though than botlle, but still a tasty treat.
Dull muddy brown colour with a pleasant malty aroma.Nice citrus taste,good mouthfeel.I like this beer a proper German Hefeweissbier.
A very good hefeweizen. What it should taste like. Cloudy-golden in appearance, fruity aroma and flavor.
Awesome murky, yellow / brown color.  Had an herbacious citrucy taste.   Not much carbonation.  It was very refreshing and flavorful.  Would definitely buy this again.

Summery, flavoursome German hefeweizen. Poured a bottle-conditioned hazy orange-amber colour, with a thick, lasting head. Herbal character to the sourish aroma - cloves - plus bananas and bubble gum. Sweet, thin-bodied and malty with a light, dry finish. Spices, bananas and honey are the dominant flavours. Wonderfully gentle but bursting with flavour. An exceptional hefeweizen. (Bottle)
Very drinkable and attractive beer.  Not a lot of substance to it.  More sweetness than anything.  Considerable head that departed eventually.  Really no negatives to it.  Nice beer.

Bottle. Hazy but not cloudy in pour. Dense  meringue looking white head. Slightly sharp and minerally with banana and a hint of clove with a little cardboard. Thin and watery in body. Fast finish with a bit of lingering banana flavor. Not my favorite hefe. That said, the draught version is worlds better. Look at the extreme difference in ratings. Even with German engineering,  Paulaner can’t give us the Hefe that we would like to have. Try Live Oak.
