nice floral nose, lime and banana maybe also. Really refreshing, nice body considering the style, nice moutfeel with the taste buds having a little bit of a fiesta
Initial strong banana smell.  Has a nice finish more floral than banana.  little lacing

i could have sworn i had rated this. one of my standard goto hefe’s when i need a hefe. this one is bottle. pours cloudy orange tinted tan with a towering white foamy head. aroma of sweet banana bread and pepper.  taste is sweet pear and banana tangy yeast flavor that mixes with the clove/pepper in the finish. very thick mouthfeel that leaves a a lot to chew on when it is gone. a good beer all the way around

330ml brown bottle. Poured light amber/orange with expected yeast haze. Abundant white head, large soapy bubbles, foamy and rocky. Slowly settled into a smooth creamy cap. Fruity nose - banana, light pears (?). Also yeast spiciness. Sweetish, notes of apple, banana, lemon and clove-like spice. Pleasant mouthfeel, light carbonation. A pleasure.
Tap.  Cloudy yellerish pour, medium white head.  Bland nose.  Bland flavor.  Wheaty but bland. Drinkable? Yes.  Memorable?  Hardly.  I

Love it!  Cloudy, thin foam on top (From the tap) Smells and tastes a bit of citrus, lemon mostly, a bit of orange, slight grapefruit?  Goes down rather well, little to no aftertaste.  I can drink these all night.
Cloudy amber with a big creamy head and lace.  Nice fruity, hoppy aroma.  Very Tasty!  Excellent flavor, and everything perfectly balanced.  Very enjoyable.

Great German hefe.  One of the standards when it comes to the style.  Looks beautiful - a hazy, orangish/bronze that’s cloudy and balanced.   Small, off-white head as expected.  I can smell it from about 18" away as I’m writing this review.  Smells spicy, and of orange zest, bananas, hints of lemons and sweet vanilla.  Tastes wonderfully smooth and balanced.  Yeasty, like sourdough bread.  Trademark characteristics - such as spice, vanilla and banana - are well done.  Mouth watering.  A great example of a perfectly carbonated hefe.  Paulaner always manages to brew a fantastic beer.

Like drinking liquid bread. Very tasty. Pour carefully as a thick creamy head developes easily. Cloudy in appearance but just screams drink me. Very smooth and enjoyable. I purchase this beer regularly.

If God himself drank beer, this would be his choice! This is the nectar of the God’s  !Its sweet and creamy with a honey like taste. It has the wonderful smell of fruit. The malt is perfectly balanced with the hop. Outstanding!
Very nice Hefe.  Much better without the lemon in it.  Smells and tastes very mild and pleasant. Nice yeasty taste. Will drink again.

Bottle - this beer is exactly what I think of when I think of German Hefe’s.  Big banana nose.  Cloudy gold body with a head of tiny white bubbes.  Soft on the palate, slightly fizzy.  Yeasty, grainy flavor.  This is a terrific beer!
Bottle  Hazy, orange body.  Off-white rocky head, which diminishes fully.  Lightly earthy aroma.  Lightly bitter flavour.   Some acidity in the end.
blonde body with substantial head that doesn’t disappear quickly.  Nice even lacing.  Very very slight hop bitterness, and a sweet honeyish flavor.  Typical of a hefe.

This beer is near the top of my list of favorite Hefes. Its sweet and banana like with honey and cloves. It looks milky in the light and has the wonderful smell of fruit. The malt is perfect to me. Outstanding!

I simply don’t enjoy German wheat beers.  This one had nice color though- very creamy looking orange, but the carbonation was really prickly.  The Trifecta just  isn’t for me.  (The Trifecta consists of a Paulaner Hefe, a Cuban cigar, and a properly performed "beej").
An initial rush of fruit finished off with a bit of honey makes this brew one of my all-time favorites.

(vom Faß)
Tastes of honey and fruit. Sweet, but well-made and balanced. Excellent weißbier.
Not my favorite weiss, but pretty good.  A little darker in color than most and a bit fruity, but not too sweet.  Some citrus flavor, but not overpowering.  A bit better than average.

[Bottle from Le Petit Moulinsart]  Hazy peach colour with thick foamy head that didn’t last.  Fruity but subdued banana and peach aroma.  Sweet tasting with some clove and banana but really weak.  Light to medium body.  Really too restrained across the board.  I wonder if something was wrong with that bottle; I’ve had this beer before on tap and remember enjoying it a lot more.
On tap: poured a dark yellow with a small head.  Had a nice finish but a fruity/citrus flavor.  Nice blend, tastes very light.

How in the hell did this liquified shit in a bottle make the 85th percentile?  I love wheat beers and I like unfiltered ones especially but this crap sucks.  I also don’t understand why people assume that German beers are the best beers when they taste worse than a sack of assholes.
Bottle, It was good but i paid 10 buck for a six pack and was not reallly worht the much in my opinion. but a good beer  none the less.
A perfect wheat beer!  Cloves and various spices detected right away, follow through in the first pull.  Strong mouthfeel.  Sweet, almost fruity, malts.  Prost!
Adherent and compact foam, optimal persistence. Aspect veiled and loaded with a good aroma of wine cellar and mildew. Optimal representative of its style. One excellent Weisse.
Nice Hefeweizen, just not the best ever in my opinion.  It is very easy to drink.  It starts off bitter but becomes less bitter as you drink it.  Very pleasant aftertaste as well.

It’s hard to believe I am finally just rating this beer.  It’s really one of the top Hefe’s coming out of germany.  Good clove/banana aroma, It’s always so damn consistent.  That’s perhaps what I like most about it.

nice bitter taste dark in colour my opinion the best german beer i everhad to date out of st pauly girl,becks,warsteiner,hacksfar.little expensive paid 8.99 six pack down here in florida if it was 5.99 six pack ill buy it everyday thats what i pay for warsteiner.. dont know the alcohol content but the six beers gave me a greet buzz
nez:Odeur d’epice et de levure.Gout:fruite,epice et levure.Bonne astringence.Bonne petite weisbier.

Hazy gold, tending to very light brown - ver vibrant.  Nose shows mild bubblegum and banana notes but nowhere near the weight of previous tastings. Palate is quite subdued and doesn’t extend beyond pedestrian. Bad bottle perhaps? Nowhere near the class that the ratings average would suggest. (Tesco 150 baht).

Pours turnid amber/dark straw with big creamy head.  Nice aroma of hopcit, yeast, banana, spice.  Tastes fruity, with some finishing yeast, cloves, and hopcit.  As with all the Paulaner beers I’ve had, this one is well balanced and complex.  Paulaner is the beer equivalent of JVC electronics.......maybe not the best in any style, but you know it’s going to be reliably great.

NIce malty moderate with some citrus to the nose. Huge head of frothy white micro bubbles. Amber in color. Very lacey legs on the side of a dimpled mug. Cloves and bananas nicely spiced hint of cinnamon and lemons. Medium body weight in the mouth. Watery and very welcomly refreshing. Very good wheat beer.
beautiful hazy golden color.   nice white head. some citrus taste...great beer.

Recently drank one of these and a Spaten Franziskaner, comparing two Bavarian Hefe-Weiss beers. My wife preferred the Spaten, but I give the Paulaner a very slight edge -- it has a bit more "presence" in flavor and aroma.
 I think I’ll have to test the pair all over again! [;-)

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Hazy  orange with nice bubbly white head. Aroma is cloves, bubblegum, yeast and banana. Taste is true to the aroma, quite sweet, some malts, dry, smooth with a sort of spicey finish. Moderately carbonated. Very good hefeweissbier.
Lightly cloudy pale yellow poured with a promising head but it faded.  Some sweet banana flavor with a tiny bit of herbal stuff. Decent finish.

Hazy orange with a good, light yellow head. Nice lacework. Wheat, malt and citrus in the aroma. Rather dry. If you drink it a bit warm, hionts of cloves and banana becomes more evident. A good Hefeweizen.
First tried it in San Francisco and loved it. I live in Baldwin Park (Los Angeles are) and cant find it anywhere. Help!!!
Too carbonated. But very enjoyable to drink, a quality hefe for the price, comparable to franziskaner.
It’s good, a little "light" for my taste if talking about weize Beers. But while eating a pretzel isn’t any bad.
Wonderful and complex barage of flavor, lost of citrus and spice. if you let it warm a golden honey flavor starts to come through. nice beer.

(on bottle) Small banana and vanilla nose, not too much. A creamy mouth, but, and good for me, not much of that whiped-cream-feel, some hefe has. Small , more appel-ish tastes too. Soft and nice carbonation, dosen´t make me wanna fart after two sips. I´ll even have a second next time up.

Appearance is a very hazy, creamy looking light orange color. Aroma is sweet and fruity.  
A little apple and banana aroma. Flavor is a little sweet. Some nice fruity flavors. Kind of a creamy mouthfeel. Finish seems dry and spicy. Nice well balanced brew.

On tap at The Ruck in Troy.  Poured golden yellow with a white head that dissipated completely.  The aroma was not as prevalent as I would like, but smelled of some fruit and spice.  Taste was pretty standard for a hefe, but nothing too special.  Tasted of a little banana with some aromatic spice; not as strong as Ayinger Brau Weisse.  Was better with a twist of lemon.

Bottle - Nice banana and clove aroma - spicier than most.  Cloudy orange/tan color - very pretty.  Spicy flavor with subtler banana and citrus.  This is one of the more consistent Weizens that tastes as good in the states as it does in Germany.  The one I’m drinking now doesn’t seem as strong tasting as it usually does.

An extremely good wheat beer, very balanced flavor with a smooth and satisfying aftertaste.  Nice pint sized bottle makes it that much better, subtle notes throughout.  Rather standard aroma and apperance for a weizen.  Overall it definitely is a great buy, and recommended.

Normal Whitbeir look, hazy orange, with a huge off-white head and a good bit of carbonation.  Aroma was of the usual hoppiness and fruity character.  The flavor was sweet, citrusy, and mildly hoppy.  The overall effect was pretty good at the start, but by the end the beer was a little tiresome.  All in all the best Hefeweizen I have had.

A cloudy orange in color, maybe slightly darker than the other hefeweiss beers I’ve had.  The aroma is strong in yeast and citric characteristics.  The taste is slightly sweet,  but more complex than many varieties. Overall, this was a great pick.

Cloudy orange in color with a frothy white head that is lacing pretty damn well. 

Awesome banana and clove aroma. 

Slightly acidic with wheat and malt characteristics. Flavor was mainly the banana and clove. Very distinctive and perfect for the style. Some citrus and peach notes as well. Very tasty!

On tap in a .5L Paulaner hefe glass (Got to love the Brickstore pub in Atl. and only $4.25)  Pours a cloudy straw color with a big rocky white head.  Big bananna aroma with some spice.  This carried over to the flavor as well as some yeast flavors.  As it warmed there were more lemon flavors noticable.  Light to medium body with a fruity finish
Pours cloudy yellow with a smallish white head.  Nose is citrus and apricot.  Has classic hefe flavors, medium body, sweet and yeasty.  There is some banana especially at the end.
Bottled.  Has a cloudy orange color with little head and some carbonation.  Smell is of spice/citrus.  Taste is medium bodied of yeast/citrus and finishes somewhat dry.  Overall a pretty good wheat.
Cloudy orange colour. Medium white,lacey head. Strong aroma, consisting of banana, peach, apricot. Taste citric, strong banana, yeasty, some peach.

Appearance: perfectly cloudy straw yellow, with a majestic white head atop.
Aroma: everything you want in a hefe weizen, fresh, citric, fruity, but still somehow dry, straw-like, so very lemony, and that element of yeast fills the nostrils as well.
Excellent texture, great play on the tongue, spicy, but smooth. Fresh, fruity, delicious. Medium bodied, tasty, longish finish, very memorable flavor. The yeast and citrusy taste dominate and create a most adequate beverage for any occasion. 
Drinkability? I could toss down a million of them!
I still rank Schneider and Weihenstephaner up above, just slightly, but there’s not a thing wrong with Paulaner’s offering, not a thing at all!
Bottle.  Poured with a large fluffy head.  Great lacing.  Aroma is typical hefeweizen.  Cloudy orangish color.  Mouthfeel is smooth.  Taste is crisp.  Malt, some spice in taste.
La mejor cerveza de este tipo que he probado, y ultimamente he probado muchas cervezas alemanas, parece que esten de moda ;)

Krauts make the best hefe-weizens.  (Don’t hit me with the PC crap... I’m an American of Kraut heritage.)  This is a prime example.  Certainly not the best, but very tasty.  It pours a solidly hazy near amber color with a thin white head.  Nice fruity, slightly grassy aroma.  Mildly sweet with a winey fruit finish.  And I picked it up at a local grocery store.  Progress.

Bottle @ home
Slightly less head than generic hefeweissen. Fruity, fresh aroma. Body slightly thinner than expected. Touch of boiled veggies. Vanilla notes and a bit sweeter than the average hefeweissen.

Draught:  This one pours a cloudy darker golden color.  Slight hints of orange to the color.  There was a small white head.  The aroma was quite nice.  It was yeasty, wheaty, and spicy, also with notes of banana.  The flavors mirrored the aromas.  A very nice beer.
Hazy golden color, fruity aroma and taste just like a hefe should be, not the best hefe but good, medium body, refresshing finish. good on a summer day.

Not the best hefe I’ve had but certainly not the worst. Not as dry like other German beers I’ve tasted. Definitely easy to drink and a complex balance to boot. Bubblegum flavor is missing but plenty of banana is present. Somewhat spicy too.
Paulaner...very good.  Not my favorite hefe by a long shot, but it holds its own regardless

Very good beer. I really liked this one. I am by no means a professional, but this was good, albeit more expensive than I am used to, but since this is my first stab at "good" beers, I was willing to sacrifice.

This is a very honorable hefe-weizen. The head is strong and maintains a good retention. The lace is full creamy and slippery. It is hazy with a golden color (hints of red). A well-balanced effervescent and smooth mouth feel. Smell is of bananas and lemon and malt with a hint of clove. The taste is citrus, spicy and sweet with a slightly dry finish. A very well balanced beer. The best hefe-weizen for me to date.

Browny colour with a malty aftertaste.
Quite fruity and easy to drink.I am gradually finding out why wheat beers make for a good drink.

17 July 2004 - Pear like Duvel sweet hoppy aroma.  Good retention, white head, suds lacing and cloudy yellow brown colour.  Smooth fruity, slight pleasant sweetness with complex balance and not over the top hops.  Thickish palate with bubbly medium mouthfeel.
Fruity citrus sweet malt aroma. Cloudy thick yellow brown clour. Thick malt spice fruit flavour. Smooth Palate.

Bottle pours a hazy light golden, large fluffy white head, sticky lacing, with light carbonation. &nbsp Classic clove and banana aroma. &nbsp Flavor is forwardly bananaesque, with light spices. &nbsp Wheaty mouthfeel, decent body, albeit one of the lighter German Hefes that I have had. &nbsp Finishes ever so slightly bitter, slightly yeastie. &nbsp A good example of the style, but I still prefer Weihenstephaner.

Very good Hefe-weizen. Not quite as good as Weihenstephaner, but very close. Hazy golden, orange appearance with a thick white head. Nice tangy, slight fruity aroma. Kinda bland. Flavor is the ultimate thirst quencher. Great citrus, clove, very yeasty. I really enjoyed this beer.
hazy gold in color, full yet quicky dissipating head... sweet armoa of banana and yeast.  Taste is smooth and slightly bitter with very sweet tones.  Very lasting.  Very good on a nice summer day.

Hazy golden light amber with a huge slowly diminishing frothy white head.  Musty aroma of banana, bubblegum, clove, and light bread.  Medium watery body with lively carbonation.  Flavor of banana, clove, bubbglegum, bread, and wheat with a hint of citrus.  Very drinkable. Good.
Draught.  Orange, cloudy, with a white, creamy head.  Aroma is yeasty and spicy--clove.  Flavor same as aroma.  Soft finish with little bitterness.  Pleasant.
Aroma: pear, citrus and wheat. Appearance: great fluffy head. Cloudy yellow brown. Flavour: bready, tangy, tiny bit of metal but sweet. Palate: bubbly and medium mouthfeel.
Cloudy yellow/ornage color. Clove, sweet malt, wheat and citrus aroma. Malty and sharp taste. O.K. standard wheat, but for me it’s quite overrated.

Hazy, cloudy appearance with a good thick head. Taste is light without much bite. Fairly carbonated with a citrus flavor. Yeast is predominate in the taste. Not my favorite style, but a solid hefeweizen.

This is a regular offering at Pappys here in Panama City.  Hazy orange color with a very odd layering effect with the yeast. Huge white head and extraordinary lacing. Superb appearance. Citrus yeast aroma with banana and clove esters, slightly musky. Light flavor without too much carbonation, this and Franziskaner (probably my favorite hefe)  are excellent representations of this style.
Not much to say...the most generic wheat beer around...the Budweiser of wheats...
I’m not a big wheat beer fan, but I’ll rate this anyway. Cloudy orange with a nice, spicy aroma and definitely a yeasty taste. Better than I was expecting.

(Bottled, 0.33l) Hazy, dark orange color - quite dark for a weizen - and a medium, vanishing head. Dry, strong and wheaty banana aroma. Quite bitter, crisp and dry flavor for a German hefeweizen. The banana is certainly there, though. Medium-bodied, oily, smooth but quite carbonated palate. Another very nice and tasty hefeweizen you could drink every day.
B E A utiful beer! Hope I never run out of these. Sunny day and a cold case of these babies and your set. One thing that keeps it from the top of its class, is the not-so-natural flavor.

One of the weiss that that all others have to be measured against. really nice. The aroma reminds me a bit of walking into a cows barn when the farmer just has been milking. The flavor has got some banana notes

A really nice beer.  Cloudy with a good head.  Spiced with a hint of fruits.  Good fresh and refreshing flavour that lingered nicely without brutalizing the palate.  Will definitely be buying this again.
Golden, hazy, with an ok white head. Aroma from almond, grass and some toffee. Grassy flavor with a sweet finish.
Bottle.  A cloudy orange yellow color with a white head.  Corriander, orange, and spices in the aroma and flavor.  A nice treat.
Hazy yellow, white head. Aroma is yeasty, a little smoky, and with some fruit. Flavor is yeasty and fruity. Quite refreshning but not the best of beers.

Very nice hefe, but not the best I have ever tried.  This hefe had a very nice color, that sort of cloudy yellow that you find with hefeweizens.  The taste was ok, but left a little to be desired.  Poured very nice, with a very nice head that lasted.

Bottle.  An excellent hefeweizen.  Large, persistent, fluffy white head.  Very cloudy, yellow with a bit of brown in the color.  Aromas of lemon, lime, orange, clove.  Generous body and mouthfeel with a touch of sweetness.

I’m getting ready to brew a hefe today so I want to get some insperation.

Pale cloudy yellow with a fluffy white head. Clove spicyness with some citrus in the nose. Soft wheat flavor with some yeast. Again clove spice that lingers a bit. Medium soft bodied. 

Nice beer. I’d hope so since these guys have been dong it for hundreds of years. Lets go see if I can do better.
decent hefe, very spicy, somewhat cloudy with a light butter aftertaste, not bad on a hot day

Cloudy yellow with a monster white foamy head if poured right. I drink this every time I get the chance, and have mastered giving it a giant head as seen in the pictures. Not many beers look better than this when you got a 7" head off the glass.  Aroma is of bread, cloves, and banana.  This brew has a great banana taste that is complimented by cloves, and possibly some other spices as well as bread. To me this is the defining beer of this style. This beer is the reason I can’t resist trying others of this style.

A somewhat cloudy, golden color with a nice head.  Aroma is sweet with a slight banana/clove/citrus smell that is typical of hefes.  A sweet and light flavor with spices and citrus.  Well-carbonated.  Overall, a good german hefe.

On draught at the Wenlock Arms. A classic spicy, upfront, zingy wheat beer. However, there is very little subtlety to this beer. It has all the elements you expect to find in a cloudy wheat, but times ten. Brash, brassy and so exaggerated it all gets a bit extreme. Especially the juicy sweetness, which becomes a tad wearing and cloying. Certainly an intense experience but towards the end of the pint I began to feel I'd had enough.

Bottle. Tons of carbonation, but a cool cloudiness with it too.  Smell was sweet and spicy, like a holiday grog. There was several flavors that are noteable: banana, lemon, clove.  Even the belch it gave me was tasty.  This was my first, and it won’t be my last.

pretty good heffe. nothing to write home about but good, cloudy, orange with a frothy head, some nice clove/bannana/fruity esters goin on, had a bit of a sour funky finish though. Maybe was a bad tap. I liked it overall
For an easy to obtain beer, this one has its merits...cloudy orange coloring...wheat, fruity taste..very good.

Looks just like I want my Hefe-Weizens. Cloudy orange with a rich firm white head. Weak aroma of young bananas adn yeast. Round wheaty flavour of banana, spices and wheat. Smooth finish of vanilla and wheat and banana.

Sorry wasnt a fan of this one...It had great clour and aroma.  Nice looking head......but the flavour to me was a bit much...too much "citrusy" after taste and it was generally a bit much on the flavour....not one to drink down on an empty stomach.  I have had a lot of different hefe weiss beers in the past but to me this one was not that enjoyable.  Don’t know how it is out of the bottle as this was on tap, but it wasnt my cup of tea.

Ahhh, the german wheats.  Maybe its the water, but very few American brewers have captured this style to my complete satisfaction. This one is cloudy and dark yellow with with bananna esters in the aroma and again in the flavor where it is well balanced with spice.  Adding a lemon wedge to this brew would be overkill as it is laced with ample citrusy goodness. The head is white and thick and the sweetness is just smooth enough to complement the palate and mellow the spices.  A very nice example of the style.

Paulaner’s Hefeweizen... a classic. I’ve also always had a soft spot for this one. Sweet malty complex flavors with hints of fruits and spices that create a very pleasant experience. Nice fruity aroma. Great beer to always have around at all times.

Ah Paulaner my old friend. I discovered you at age 22. 10 full years before my rate beer obsession. For most of those years you were my only thought when wheat beers came to mind. Sure now and then I would cheat. Would see some other wheaty behind your back. But baby, I always came back, and you have always been there for me. Rarely has a month gone by when you were not there by my side, though I must confess that months would sometimes pass between the times I would grab you and take you for my own. Sigh. I guess the glitter comes off all relationships at some point. I even remember 1995 when Jurgen the German exchange student came to live with us. He was so thrilled the first time he opened the fridge and saw you there. He claimed that he had you all the time when he was in Germany. I felt proud. I felt the love. And I knew you were my baby. And I trusted you baby - you never failed me. Now I know I have not been as attentive as I should be. And I have been indiscreet in leaving a cyber trail of wheaty romances on my Ratebeer stats list. Now baby, don’t be mad. Don’t go. Yeah sure I’ve been with Weihenstephaner, and ok yeah Ayinger too, but baby you still matter to me.Let me hold your 16.9 oz brown bottle once again. Enjoy the cloudy orange color as you slip into something more quaffable. The large orange head still brings a smile to my face. I can still smell your strong orange and wheat scent. It made my taste buds come alive with desire. Your taste, so full of orange and wheat. True, I am a dog. Yes I have other wheaties on my mind. But baby, what we have will always be special.

Pours with a thick, white, fugaceous head and a cloudy golden color. Low carbonation. Very appealing aroma of citrus and spices. Nice flavors, very spicy, fruity and sweet. It has the palate of a wheat beer (of course), light and smooth. All in all, it’s a nice, enjoyable beer.

Very nice orange-gold cloudy body with a dense bulky head. Wonderful fruity (orange, banana) and lightly spiced aroma with some pleasant bubblegum notes. Taste is sweet, refreshing and well balanced. It ends with a fair bittersweet yeasty final. Good example of Bavarian Hefeweizen.
Bottle from The Wine Company, Slough. Wheat, bannana, spice, clove, slight sweetness. Run of the mill hefeweizen which just gets a little too much towards the end!

Re-rate  The second time aroud leads to a higher rating, with the sheer refreshment, and the texture adding points.  Served in an authentic glass can surely add a point for appearance.
This densely carbonated, spiceless sweet wheat is all about the bubblegum.  There is gum in the aroma, in the flavor and in the finish.  Clean and drinkable by the gallon.

Surprised I haven’t rated this before. Pours from the bottle with a cloudy gold color and a large white head. Aroma is bananas, bubblegum and tangerines. The taste is sweet with tomatoes, bananas and some honey. A solid hefe.

english pint: lemon, banana, clove, wheat, yeasty, smooth (a little cremey), and easy to drink. this is a good brew. it’s satisfying. sweet (slightly banana) aftertaste. the end of the bottle becomes stale, however, and so it's good off the top with the big and lovely head. still, i like it.

smells of citrus, lemons, and a nice hint of spice.  taste is fruity and lemony. a very pleasent hefe to drink, as this is becoming a more and more ordered/bought style for me.  yellow colored pour with a white head.  smooth, easy drinking, good beer.

Cloudy golden with a fluffly white head.  The aroma is lovely.  Nice fruity and sweet.  There is a hint of banana and very sweet wheat in the flavor.  The palate had a watery finish for me, but smooth and effervescent at the begining.  I think this is a good summertime beer.  It’s light yet kind of sweet and I think a lot of my girlfriends would probally like this one.  Nothing fantastic, but a good one to keep a six pack of when you just want to relax and enjoy a descent beer.

Bottle:  Aroma is a little on the weak side for a hefeweizen.  Basic aroma of citus, cloves, and wheat.  Pours a very cloudy orange.  Small, large bubbled head that dies quickly. Not much lacing. Malty flavor starts but finishes citrusy and slightly sour.  Very carbonated.  I never really understood the bubble gum flavor people describe in beer, but after this one I do.

12 oz. brown, long-necked bottle. Freshness date of 02/05 seen in lower right corner of front label.Still fairly fresh then. Poured out a cloudy orange-yellow color, with a bulky head. It left a more than decent head and lacing along the sides of the glass. Aromas are of banana, cloves, and yeast. Malts make a brief, but strong appearance in the aromas as well. No hops aromas evident.Thick mouthfeel. Not thin or cloying. Slight phenolic character to it, not offensive in any manner. Finishes tart, and clean. A top notch wheat beer.

ok.  not bad for a beer that they advertise for on the radio...  not bad for being on tap at a big corporate sports bar chain.  more on the spicy end of hefe weizens...  not too much fruitiness.  watery.  lacking impact, but not bad.

It has a hint of bubblegum and strong banana flavours, quite bubbly with decent lacing, smells nice and a good head. Nice, but it doesn’t really kick ass; the flavours aren’t as strong or complex as they could be, plus the aftertaste isn’t that great. Passable but inessential.

Not too tooty-fruity as others of this type, rather more balanced. Decent aroma. Light yellow cloudy colour. Tasty citrus is drinkable. Malt nice with food. Not crazy on some of the spices as pepper. In your face carbinations means an uneasy mouthfeel for some.
Cloudy golden yellow with a white head.  Typical wheat nose on it.  German wheat yeast dominates the beer.  Nothing special.
A very refreshing, flavorful beer for a hot afternoon. Cloudy with a great head.

Big frothy head out of bottle. Eggshell white. Nice wheat flavor. Not too bitter. Color and particulates make it look to me very much like Bell's Oberon does. Definitely a better tasting beer in my opinion. Good but not exceptional.

A cloudy orange colour with a huge white head. Nose is citrus and wheat with some malty sweetness. Flavour starts malty and finishes light citrusy and acidic. A very clean drinking beer for a hot day with a nice hop bite in the finish.

I really enjoy the massive nicely retained heads on these German wheats.  Color is cloudy, light brown.  Aroma is rather tilted toward bananas, but there is a bit of clove/spice.  Flavor is also heavy banana with a some nice spiciness and a dry finish.  Yum.

Straw golden hazy body, with a nice fluffy white head on top. The aroma is sweet banana, yeast and some hoppy hints. It kind of prickles on your tongue, and then a very sweet flavor of banana and clove. Very good thirst quencher!
Hazy golden color, fluffy white head.  Sweet banana aroma.  Sickly sweet banana clove taste.  Very full bodied.
Great beer.  Good aroma with mild banana/bubble gum smell to it.  The color was perfect.  Nice cloudy golden color with creamy white head.  This one went down easy.

On draft at N. Third.  Extra appearance point if served in a true weizen glass.  Cumulus cloudy muddy orange appearance.  Great summer drinking beer - I feel like I'm doing something good for my self by drinking this one.
On tap at the Crescent Moon. Deep golden to orange cloudy appearance. Yeasty esterified aroma. A solid flavor of malt/yeast balance. This is drinkable in mass quantities if you are not careful.
Not the best wheat i've had but it was decent.  It was medium.  A good beer for the price though.

A pretty nice hefeweizen. Huge foamy head. Not that much banana flavor, but the aromas and flavors of spices are definitely present. Has some malty sweetness and notes of lemon and orange too. Nice light-moderate tartness in the finish as well. Add the yeast sediment, as it really helps the apperance/cloudiness factor and makes the beer more flavorful too.

A turbid greyish orange beer with nice fluffy white lace, slight wet dog aromatics with a hint of tangerine and lime(sorta like mountain dew but less flowery). Not a lot of flavor at first but eventually a cracker and bisquity taste builds up chased down with some lactic like you'd expect...for such a readily available beer it's usually pretty good, not the most drop dead hefe weiss you'll ever try but it fills the bill when you're in the mood.

Poured as a cloudy orange haze with a rather large coarse white head and streams of carbonation, an appearance that is simply unattractive to me.  Aroma was hoppy and quite fruity.  I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor however, as my tastebuds were assaulted by a crisp, tart, sweet, and fruity swirl of effervescent flavors.  These flavors proved delicious at first, but overpowering towards the bottom of the glass.  It had a great thick mouthfeel, however, that helped make this an enjoyable drink.  Not one of my favorite styles OR beers, but quite enjoyable nonetheless.
Hazy golden orange color with a large white head. Sweet banana wheat aroma. Crisp clean taste with hints of clove. Not breathtaking but a solid hefe.

Christ, I always wondered what would happen if someone was able to mix the flavors of banana, cardboard, and yeast, and I have found it. BEAUTIFUL pour, AWFUL taste. Head is gorgeous and thick with medium lacing. First sip made me wince (seriously). There is an aftertaste I cannot put my finger on...blood?...a handful of coins?...ball bearings? Seriously, it tastes like bannana bread and auto bumper combined dusted with yeast. Highly over-rated beer.

Pours a huge head that laces a little as it falls into a solid creamy mass. Cloudy orange. Banana, cloves, vanilla and yeast aroma. Flavour is nicely balanced with no overriding dominance. Has all the aroma flavours with some citrus in the finish. Palate is very smooth for a hefe, doesn't have that grainy aspect. Nice.

Pous a cloudy, hazy, dirty/rusty water yellow/orange. 

When I was younger I lived in a 4plex where the water came out of the tap that same color the first 3-4 minutes... ewww. Not so good when it's your water, but kind of interesting when it's your beer. The light sort of hits the middle and reflects back out.


Tall fluffy cream colored head, minimal lacing. 


Aroma is bannana bread, and not much else.
flavor is sourdough bread & bannanas, with some clove spicyness in the background, and a lemony citrus finish.
Some bannana also noted in the finish.
crisp and refreshing.

Classic hefeweizen look: pale yellow color, impressively tall head, cloudy translucent body with an inner glow.   Aroma has the banana nut muffin quality with the yeasty and bready notes predominant. It is typical of the style, but is not as strong as most others.  Taste is again dominated by the yeast with sour dough, clove, citrus fruits, and bananas shining through.  Typical German hefeweizen mouthfeel, but is a bit more yeasty.

Comes in the long neck brown 330ml Euro crown top bottle. Had freshness date.

The pour was a delightful cloudy orange-amber with plenty of effervescence and a great puffy white Meringue of a head that pushed out of the glass then settled down to a clinging lace after a few quaffs. 

Odors of citrus peel clove and nutty yeast undertones.

Starts with a blast of prickly carbonated citrus hop tastes then smoothes back on the palate with a creamy balance of nutty yeasts sweet malt and tart hop...then the finish is tart citrus with a wonderful subtle banana-bread aftertaste punctuated with a lingering metallic hop effect

Very light and refreshing with a bright citrusy mouth feel...a wonderful summer beer....probably one of the better commercially avalable import hefeweizens.

Rerated 6/2/04...After sampling a number of german Hefeweizens I return to Paulaner for a session....it is probably the smoothest and mellow-bodied of the imports available widely in Canada.
Overall I liked this beer, rich banana aroma capped by a dynamite taste; what more could you want? Only drawback is the color which seemed to be a little odd for a hefeweizen.
A pretty standard German weisse. A bit yeasty and fruity. Well balanced.....
Banana is the one word which comes to mind. This is a most excellent Hefeweizen

aromas of clove, bananaand yasty bread aromas. hazy golden color with a substantial head. sour orange and creamy wheat flavors a slight nuttiness perhaps apples like fujis. dryish finish. quite refreshing. doesnt have a tremendous complexity, but is easy to drink without to much thought.

Looks, smells, and tastes like a hefeweizen.  Banana and clove aromas.  Cloudy golden color, big frothy head.  Fruity, slightly tart flavor.  A little more wheat flavor and a little more bitterness than other German examples.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Good example of the style.
Bottle. Dusty, clovy aroma. Hazy golden colour, big creamy white head. Nice soft mouthfeel. Flavour has a hint of clove, slightly watery. Aftertaste is very mild.

Cloudy yellow, white head. Tall weizen glaas, tap. Banana phenolic typical aroma. But I am not a big banana fan. Malty beer with a nice lingering malt profile. Banana and clove flavors mixed in nicely. Quaffable.

Nice wheat beer! Poured a blanchy white head, with a cloudy gold body. Aromas of clove and banana are present, but I am also getting another fruit in here....apples or plums???  Tastes similar to other beers of the same style, only I find there to be less alcohol present in this one. Doug Shoemaker hooked me up with this, and I am glad he did. Thanks Doug!

smells and tastes like bubblegum.  Also a little spice flavor.  good with a bratwurst. RERATE. on tap this is just phenomenal.  doesn’t have the extra effervescence from the bottle conditioning so it’s really smooth, and was an awesome refreshment on a hot summer day.

The banana palate rings of fizz, and is aluminumy with the alcohol showing its presence. the Flavor is smooth with hints of grapefruit thus citrusy. I had this after a lenten meal of tuna and it was a nice dessert beer. The flavor never lets up and lace stays with the glass till the inevitable end. ENJOY!
One memory of this beer stands out, and that is the taste of banana. This leaves the beer a bit on the sweet side.

My staple drinking beer.  For the price this beer is a steal!  I get a 12 pack for about $12.  It is standard hefeweizen with lots of banana and clove.  Very refreshing and tasty.  A great year around beer.
Cloudy golden-yellow with nice white head. Lots of banana, honeyish sweetness, vinous notes? Right on Franziskaners heels.
Cloudy yellow-tan with little white head.  Classidc wheat aroma.  Sweet start with a sour, yeasty finish.  Medium body with a fizzy and metallic palate.
Perfect with something known as "the trifecta" which consists of a Monte Christo, a Paulaner and a well performed beej. Great wheaty German summer beer.
Hefe-What?  I  just had it after a Sammy winter and it was like a fresh mountain spring. I would recommend it to my friends.
A beautiful golden color. A taste of wheat and hardly any bite at all. A malty flavor with a lemon zing. A refreshing beer. A good beer to have towards the end of the night.

Murky, deep golden lager with a large, frothy, white head which diminishes to a small, creamy, white head. Thick, creamy lacing.
The nose is spicy and malty. Soap, clove, honey and lemon. The flavor mirrors the spicy, malty aroma and then delivers a big blast of lemon zest. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Short, semi-dry, tart finish.

poured cloudy yellow/amber with frothy, thin bubbly head.  tasted wheaty, malty with  flowery/citrusy overtones.  finished somewhat crisp but seemed to be lacking.  i didn't use lemon or lime with this beer.  i would probably appreciate this one more if weizen was my favorite style of beer, but it isn't!
Cloudy yellow, white head.  Fruit and floral aroma.  Citrus and spice to the taste.
Banana, cloves, fresh baked bread, slight smoke- all these are in there from start to finish. No need to cover this up with a lemon, the flavors are all as they should be. Delicious.

Light bread tasting nose with banana/clove yeasty overtones.  Large fully lasting head with copious fine belgian lace.  Hazy, medium yellow hue.  Medium body.  Dry finishing beer.  Lively carbonation.  This is the way a hefeweizen should be.

This was probably a tad past it's peak. Hefeweizens don't have a long shelf life. Characteristic hazy yellow color and rich thick head. Hints of fruit and yeast in the aroma. Good yeasty flavor but a lot seems missing in both the aroma and flavor from what should be there. Worth trying.

Bottled.
Orange golden with a fine head.
Sweetish aroma.
Rather thin and tasteless, with some sourish bitterness.

Bottled. 
Dark yellow, steady cottony head. Semi-big banana/clove aroma, with refreshing maltiness. Soft malty with notes of light clove, banana and bubblegum and juicy maltiness. Great beer!
Fluffy lacey head. Nice nose of wheat, citrus and yeast. Nice glass of beer. Cloudy,amber orange. Creamy, fresh bread. Hints of honey. Dry. Good beer.

Lovely aroma of banana and clove. The appearance is a nice balance of light and dark yellow/gold. I feel that it disappoints a bit on the finish, as the flavor doesn't really carry through on the aftertaste. However, this is a very good example of the German hefeweizen style.

Outstanding Hefe, i put it in the same class as konig ludwig, the taste between the two is very similar. A strong flavor of banana in the finish not a lot of aftertaste. If your looking for something better try Weihenstephaner
Cloudy golden color, creamy head, nice lace. Big aroma of wheat, yeast, and especially banana. Flavor is somewhat citrusy up front with plenty of banana on the backside. Medium body. A nice weizen.
Poured a medium golden color.  Aroma was of fruits and spices.  A very apple-dominated flavor.  Pretty spicy as well.  Tasty for a wheat beer.
This beer has a cinnamon spiciness with an apple like taste.  It almost taste like a cider, but is still a very good hefe.

Pours a cloudy orange, with a thin white head that doesn't last. Aroma is malty and slightly sweet. Citrus fruits and spices on the tongue, along with banana. Finish is smooth and refreshing. This is a decent beer, but it has a saltiness that I don't care for.
A very solid wheat beer, perhaps not too distinguishable from a number of others -- but there is nothing at all wrong with it.
The classic hefeweizen appearance ... hazy yellow-orange with a massive foamy head.  Citric nose. Smooth banana flavors with the yeasty character.
this is a great wheat beer there is no harsh after taste goes down smooth there aint much of a head when poured and its semi dark colored..verdict try it

Nice pour... cloudy light shade of orange with a long lasting creamy white head.  Stong banana notes with a slightly spicy finish.  Smooth, creamy mouthfeel.  Not as complex as the Weihenstephaner I tried a couple days ago, but still a very good hefe.

It's easy to take this for granted, being one of the more widespread hefeweizen brands available outside of Germany.  However it never hurts to take a swig and remember just how good this is... Beautifully sweet, crisp and refreshing. Creamy yeasty flavour, with a rich orange colour, and big frothy white head.  Nice on tap or out of a bottle, this is one of my favourites.
I love Hefe's! Nice sweet malt aroma with bananas and some clove in the back of the mouth. Great with a lemon in the hot summer.
Great head, typical wheat aromas and flavors.  I was disappointed though and find a number of American products that are I'll drink it but not buy a case.
0.5 l bottled. Dark, deep orange, hazy colour. The sweetness was to dominant in the flavour to make this hefeweizen a much above average experience.
(Bottle)  Pours a cloudy maze color with an impressive, long lasting, thick white head.  Known as one of the most common Hefeweizens in the world.  Has banana and clove flavor and a smooth finish.

very nice aroma with a hint of ripe bananas; cloudy, medium amber with a medium white head; very smooth with a nice refreshing taste, which also has just a bit of ripe banana; one of the best Hefeweizens I've tried
Yeah-hazy,orange-yellow, banana-clove thing, frothy head, sour and refreshing, yada yada.... I know it is very good for its style, just ain't my thang.

Pours hazy apricot color with a generous white head. Nose is first banana then spice. Flavor starts lightly sweet with a hint of fruit followed some light belgium yeast and spice and finishing kinda dry with a light hop bite. This just became my favorite hefe.
Yellow cloudy beer with a nice size head. Subtle aroma of fruits: fresh peaches maybe. Flavours of banana, fresh wheat. Was refreshing, enjoyed this beer. Bottle.

I got this one in the 1 pint 9 oz brown Euro style bottle with a lovelly landscape label.
Appearance: Nice sunshine orange witha very good haziness.A good sized solid creamy white head that lingers long. Good looking strings of carbonation rise to the top..nice looker.
Wow what an aroma, strong banana scents linger with fresh bread wondeful , makes the American Hefes smell like wimps!!
I can tatse immediatlly bananas, apples and even a touch of cherry in this.Also can taste some hop bitterness at the end. This beer is fairly crisp with a dry finish.
Pretty crisp , well carbonated..good but have had better mouthfeel from other kinds of beer.
Like most Hefe-Weizens, I found this beer very drinkable..a nice ale!
CLoudy yellowish brew with a reasonable head. Very complex mix of spice with a fresh taste of wheat. Overall a good example of the style without being the best of the category.

Nice aroma and color, fruity nose and a nice hazy golden color.  Tasted very spicy, heavy clove high note with a fruity/cinnamon base note.  I couldn't force myself to finish it.  It may be a good example of hefeweizen, but I just didn't like it.  Will definitely retaste this beer if I can find it on tap.

Poured with a massive good tasting head. The appearance was cloudy yellow, some orange tint, tiny little bubbles; very attractive. The aroma was warm and fuzzy with some fruit: apricot palette. The flavor was very unique, yeasty in body. Much better than the Pyramid and Widmer Hefes I've had.

Cloudy is right; this beer pours thick and hoppy.  The head lingered longer than what others have reported here for me.  This is one of the better hefe's that I've had.  Better than the last one I had (Pyramid).
Cloudy small head, citrousy hoppy carmel aroma, leaves a coating on the tongue, not at the top of my list.

Definitley one of the better beers of this my favcorite style. I had it on tap and was knocked out by its cloudy color and great fgresh smell. A lot of sweetness mixed with just the right amount of sour with no after taste. Maybe not as good as Hacker but what is?

On Draught, Cloudy yellow colored with giant head which took some time to settle. Fresh wheat aroma with subtle notes of clove and yeast. Not as pungent as some other weizens, yet more of a clean taste.  Bottle rated 9/12/04. Beautiful dark gold color that is clouded with yeast. Perfect looking snow white head that lasts.  Pungent aromas of wheat, clove, yeast and banana. Full bodied and a filling brew. Great wheat flavors with a slight acidity. Peppery, spicy, clove and good yeast flavors. Overall one of the best German Hefes. Prost!

Nice pale orange but not as cloudy as other hefeweizens that I have had before. Nice frothy white head. Smells like a wheat beer but a little bitter. Smells of citrus, coriander. Different than Hacker Pschorr Weiss but quite nice. Crisp clean flavor. Slight citrus flavor. Little bubble gum, banana flavor. Tiny bit tinny. Very nice beer. I like it.

Hazy orange golden color with a massive puffy head, and a pleasant lemon banana aroma. Medium bodied with a silky mouthfeel, breadlike with apple, banana and pear flavors. Modestly sweet with a mild finish and very little aftertaste. A wonderful Hefeweizen.
This was an okay Hefe.  It had good head with a hazy yellow and gold color to the beer.  Flavors of bananas and spices.  A little too strong on the banana side.

Wonderful hefe aroma of banana fruit and spice. Hazy deep golden color with a fluffy white head that stayed around for awhile. Mildly sweet. Touch of orange citrus, slightly sour, lots of banana and spice. Creamy, buttery texture. Very drinkable. One of my favorite Hefes.
i drank this beer off the tap and the flavour didnt impress me too much. it was good, but a little on the plain side for my taste.

Aroma smells like soapy beers like Franziskaner. Appearance is a golden sun-like colour. Flavour thankfully is fine and not too soapy. The palate is pretty decent. My overall impression is pretty favourable, but I just don't think Hefeweizen is my type of beer.

Pours with a classic huge white head atop a cloudy copper beer with amber-tinged edges. Head shows good retention and leaves a nice lacing. Aromas of clove, yeast, and lemon burst forth, with a touch of grainy malt. A hint of pepper shows through as well. The taste is very full of the typical wheat crispness with hints of sweetness, and finishes slightly tart. The mouthfeel seems a bit thin, but it is very refreshing.

Draught, at The Well, London. 
 Murky blond with all the trimmings. The satin feel to this beer is amazing encompassing all aspects of the beer. From start-to-finish and top-to-bottom. Smooth citrus and banana bread flavours.

Pours a nice cloudy gold, with foamy head and lace.  Aroma entices you with citrus and wheat, perhaps some yeast. Very smooth flavors consisting of more citrus, some yeasts and malt, slightly sweet. Almost a bit doughy. A very nice German hef.

Had this on tap at the local pub.  Pours a very cloudy light orange color with a thick head and minimal lacing on the glass.  The aroma was grainy and citrusy with hints of sweetness.  The flavor was very smooth.  Very crisp and refreshing - great representation of the style.  I'll have this one again sometime soon.

A great by-the-book German Wheat! Pours golden and fizzy with a thick head; great in a tall glass. It has a tart taste with pronounced wheat and yeast tones. Very drinkable and inoffensive though the taste is moderately strong. A lemon would make this a near-perfect afternoon beer.

If ever there was a beer that I could write a 3-word review for, this one would be it. And here's how it would go:
"It's really good."
Alternately, a one-word review would consist of: "ahhh."
The Paulaner Hefe-weizen is the epitomy of refreshing and a great beer for the thirsty drinker. Actually, if I was going out, I don't know if this would be my first choice but if I'm coming in from a day of yard work, I know it would be.
It pours a cloudy light orange with a head that stays for weeks. It just looks good, which in this case means we can judge a beer by its color.
The aroma is quite complex with fruity, spicy tones (cloves, perhaps?). The smell is great but it's the taste we should get to...and quickly! On first taste, I tried to find the banana that I read so much about in other reviews but I couldn't. I did taste a very pronounced citrus and the spiciness that I detected on smelling was hard to detect on taste.
The strongest characteristic of this beer is its drinkability. I have never had a beer that packs such a punch in the taste department that is so drinkable. This is great for those hot days when you need a thrst quiencher but it can be so very dangerous on thos nights out when you shouldn't drink too much.
All-in-all a wonderful beer.

Hazy, honey-lemon body with lazy jets of carbonation and a thick frothy white head. Aroma of fresh biscuits, some orange citrus, hop fragrance, and a pinch of pepper. Tart fruit flavor and light wheaty body. A crisp thirst quencher that is well-crafted like all Paulaner beers.
Although hefeweizens are not my favorite by a long shot, Paulaner makes a very good example of the genre. Dark yellow, cloudy, nice aroma, wheaty & yeasty as far as flavor goes. A good beer.

Probably THE textbook version.  Hazy dark yellow with a big vanilla colored head.  Estery nose of banana and ajust a hint of clove.  Smooth, medium body offers rushes of sweet malt and yeasty tones throughout.  Somewhat carbonated and spritzy.

A good Hefeweizen. Not as offensive as others in this catagorie. Pronounced yeast profile but it is well behaved and belongs in the flavor. Medium-lite mouth feel, Great aroma again with a yeasty profile. I would buy this again!
Cheers
Currntly my favorite wheat. Cloudy orange color and big heads. All the complexities of flavor blend well.

Very little citrusy aroma. Beautiful cloudy dark golden colour. Very mild flavour with little banana or clove. Generally citrusy. Perhaps meant to be a hefe-weissbier for the non-wheat beer drinker - though very drinkable, it seems like a subdued example of the style. There's nothing wrong with this beer and I would certainly drink it again - it's just not what a German wheat should be. Bottle.

Hazy golden colour with a great thick white head. Smells of lemon, yeast, coriander seed and curacao (orange peel) all are elements of the smell. The taste is very mild, a bit of the freshness (curacao & coriander) is noticeable along with some yeastie & wheatieness. Aftertaste subtle as well showcasing a bit of the better flavours roaming around with this beer. Overall, a better than average German Wheat, and even though I had this just after turning 21, I hadn't had it since...so at a bar with about 125 taps, I picked this piece of crap...and it turned out to be alright! Try this if you like wheats, as it is most likely available and very pleasing! I got a 23 ounce glass of this on tap at MacGregor's in Rochester, New York.

A nice compliment to my meal.  Lemony and mild, with somewhat of a dull palate--a little flat--and it is more brown and hazy in appearance than other hefeweizens, yet it has a better combination of flavors, judged side-by-side with the things my friends were drinking.  (on tap, Ludwig's Garten, Philadelphia)

Nov 2019. 

August 2010 Can. Pleasant drink with refreshing acidity and some mild bubblegum notes. Drinkable. [2.7]

July 2003 Bottle. Refreshing, spicy and interesting. As one who is not a fan of wheat beers I found this surprisingly enjoyable - indeed, very surprisingly enjoyable! I’m ordering my Paulaner sunglasses and bikini. [3.0]

Has that classic German spicyness to it. Thick white head out of the bottle that reminds me of the merangue on top of a pie! Hangs around for a while too. Not as pungent as other German Hefe's. Perhaps more enjoyable too. Still, I am up for a bit more...

An excellent beer to enjoy outside on a hot summer night. Crisp, refreshing, with a nice citrus aroma. My advice, chuck that Corona w/ Lemon crap, and plunk down for this beauty. If you've got the ching ching that is.

I had this on draught at Stone's 7th anniversary party. 
Appearance: To the surprise of no one, the hefeweizen goose-stepped into the glass as a cloudy yellow pour
Aroma: The nose has banana and citrus notes.
Taste: The flavor of this hefe is the typical crisp and refreshing found in a hefeweizen; it's just done better than most
Though this is not a style of beer I usually enjoy, this was fairly pleasant; apricot-colored with a light banana/citrus taste.
Orangish appearance. Smells of wheat, oranges, and pears. Flavor is fairly light with a hint of banana. More of an apricot citrus fruit taste. A rather light palate. An enjoyable wheat beer.
Citrus nose with a cool, nice colour. Smoothe and refreshing with a wheaty finish. In fact, it is kind of sour at times. Not bad overall.

Very decent germean wheat. Good strong nose of wheat and some fruits. Cloudy orange coloured; lasting head. Taste is decent too perhaps a bit watery, consists of wheat and fruit notes, some spices. Smooth, refreshing palate. I like this one.

Cloudy golden yellow appearance. Small, fluffy head, with good lacing. Aroma of yeast and fruit, banana. Fruit notes in the taste, smooth on the palate. Has the usual wheat beer notes, but a bit muted.  A very nice beer, but not in the top ranks of wheats.
Large frothy head with thick lacing.Colour was almost amber to me,taste of lemon and wheat also bubblegum.Another good wheatbeer!

On Draught) Paulaner Hefe is a great German wheat, but it is so damn critic! I really enjoyed the oily palate, and the fruity orange zest nose, but it becomes over powering if you really become attuned to it. This beer poured a large frothy head and held out a nice constant lacing thorough out. A good German Hefe, but I wish the pub would stop giving me that damn orange slice, which I end up eating and never put in my beer.
Yeasty, sweet aroma on a cloudy amber beer.  Nice wheat flavor, with a mild yeastiness.  One of my favorite wheat beers.
Draught. Light and cloudy. Wheaty and yeasty flavour. Not very good at all.

7/24/03:  bottle.  
 wheatie with a bread-yeastyness to the nose.  burnt-orange body and somewhat cloudy.  lots of wheat taste with some minute hints of floral.  nice for sipping on a summer day.

A cloudy, murky yellow body bordering on opaque. Thick white head.

Smells like lemons and wheat. Reminds me of incense!

Very light... Some wheat and some yeast. Some lemon on the back of the tongue. Very light on flavor.

Very spritzy on the tongue indeed!

Yes, this was indeed an intersting beer.  I was mystified by watching the yeast mix with this layering affect with the temperature changes.  Crazy...Very creamy head, great lacing great appearance.  Musky aroma, that reeked of cloves and pears and citrus.  Very light, another great summer time session beer.
Cloudy orange body, thin white head.  Aroma has a wheaty tang.  Flavor is wheat, with light citrus.  Not as yeasty (banana, clove) as Franziskaner, my current favorite.

Hazy orange color with a very odd layering effect with the yeast. Huge white head and extraordinary lacing. Superb appearance. Citrus yeast aroma with banana and clove esters, slightly musky. Light flavor without too much carbonation, this and franziskaner are excellent representations of this style.

This brew poured alarge head of fine to medium sized off-white bubbles and a hazy light orange brwon colored body.  It had a wheat aroma with some banana notes and a fruity banana wheat flavor.  Its mouthfeel was initially smooth and finished with a slight tingling.

Smells like a wheat beet...looks like a wheat beer.  Large white head with a cloudy orange color.  Lots of citrus in the aroma and taste.  Very smooth and slightly watery, although I think its a good balance.  Good amount of carbonation.  This is the most drinkable wheat beer I've had to date.
Large white creamy head. Cloudy orange color. Aroma is fruity with banana and citrus notes. Flavor is fruity too with vanilla tones, ending in a moderately malty finish. Medium bodied.

This beer poured a large off-white very creamy head with small-medium bubbles that was long lasting. The body was cloudy with carbonation observed. The hue of this beer was golden and there was good lacing on the sides of my glass. The nose was that of banana and clove and the flavor was fruity. The mouthfeel was very smooth, thin and watery. I was not extremely impressed with the taste of this beer as it lacks some character in my opinion as German Wheats are one of my favorite styles of beer.

This is the Hefe-Weizen that all should be compared to. Its a perfect blend of fruityness and malty sweetness thats extremely easy to drink.

On tap at McGoverns: Color is golden dark yellow and very cloudy, with lots of those wheat and yeast chunks flying around. Head was off-white and frothy with some divets and was about two fingers high from the tap. Impressively fresh looking.

Smells just as fresh, lots of fruityness and very sweet and tangy. Aroma is mostly lemony, and hints at banana, honey, clove, peach and orange. Super clean and fresh....oh boy, oh, boy, oh boy, I couldn't wait to drink it.

Ahh...thats better. This tastes amazingly fresh and fruity with just the right amount of malt balanced in so nothing is really overwhelming. But the taste is pretty fruity, kinda lemony/orangey with some vanilla and a nice robust malt backing. Man is it smooth with just the right amount of fruity tang hold. The feel is a lighter medium body with a slight pulpy thickness and has a very light lemony spiced dry finish. I could drink this anytime but it suits warmer weather
On tap, murky orange with medium white head. A bit of citrus aroma and flavor, solid wheat body. Fruity; good refreshing summer beer.
If only the flavour was a bit more upfront. Other than that it was delightful. Seemed to improve the more I had.

Huge banana flavor!  This is a top notch german wheat that is similar, but not quite as good as, Ayinger Brau-Weisse (my standard thusfar).  Very resfreshing due to light body and heavy carbonation.  Good for sore throats.

From "Bistro des Bières Belges" in Montreal's South Shore. Pale gold color, limpid, generous white head. Wheat is obvious in mouth, refreshing fruit taste with an unfortunately short malty orange and lemon aftertaste

Very,cloudy,oarnge.Big,dense,white,head. Excellent lacework,very clingy.Very fresh nose. Heavy,clove,bread(toast),fruit(yeast),and grassy aromas. Mouthfeel is well carbonated,with nice staying flavors. The most flavor from any "summer"beer I have had.Sweet,fruity,yeasty flavors are balanced perfectly.Finish is smooth,grassy,fruity. Lingering malt,yummy. Excellent summer beer.  I don't pay much attention to this style,but this has to be one of the best.Excellent!
Non-transparent golden color with a nice white thick foam on top. Has a nice fruity taste of bananas? A nice beer on a hot day, especially on tap.

Cloudy yellow.  Well carbonated, with light stable white head.  Aroma is faint, slight banana, slight grass.  Flavour is banana with malt like finish.  Slightly sweet but very muted. Grainy or yeasty hints.
Aromas of citrus fruit, banana and spices. Taste is toasted wheat bread and bananas with just a hint of lemon and spices. Smooth and great with a lemon.

Great big frothy head from the pour.  Decent carbonation.  Aroma of wheat and decaying grass.  Color is a murky golden orange.  Flavor is nice and crisp with notes of wheat, lemon and yeast.  Finish is clean with very little aftertaste.  A good quality wheat beer.
Cloudy orangish color. Fluffy head.  Good yeasty, wheat flavor. Finishes with a candy-like flavor and a slight bitterness. Gives a citrus aftertase. Enjoyable. Especially on a warm summer day.

This is an upper-level quality hefeweizen. Above average looks with nice lacing and certainly in the top tier of flavor for its style. Lots of wheat, lemon-cream,banana and clove spice presnted to the tongue. Pleasant, short-lived aftertaste.
Had on tap at Fred,s Alehouse. Good brew. Nice head, left lacing up & down my glass. Tones of banana/clove. Tall .5L glass was pretty cool too.

Murky, orange apearance.  Nice, fluffy head with good lacing.  Yeasty, malty aroma.  Lots of flavor from the fruit and spices with the malt in the taste.  Touch of hops for good balance.  Smooth, refreshing finish.  I'm ready for another.
A bit more fruity than other German Wheats, not that it matters, it only makes it more fresh

yeast, spice, fruits in the aroma. Pours a cloudy yellow, carbonation high, head is thick. Very similar the other German Wheats; sweet flavour and mild acids. Body is light. I like wheat beers so it's tough not to make me happy...
Cloudy orange/yellow w/ off-white head. Mild aroma of banana & cloves. Light, slightly creamy feel. Typical german wheat w/ light banana flavour & moderately hoppy finish. Also, mildly astringent.

Drank from the bottle. Wonderful aromas of citrus fruit, banana and spices. Taste is toasted wheat bread and bananas with just a hint of lemon and spices. A little thin but smooth and very drinkable, this would be a great hot weather thirst quencher.
The color is a golden orange-brown... quite cloudy.  The aroma is fruity and nutty... perhaps pears?  Flavor is smooth and frothy... consistent finish.  Overall, very good hefeweissen.

Cloudy yellow with huge head, little lacing however, medium-bodied. Dough, lemon, banana, and spices detected in the aroma. Chewy wheat feel in the mouth despite the fizzyness. Sweet with less fruitiness bite than other hefeweizens from Germany. Dry, earthy aftertaste. After drinking some American wheats, this one stands out, a good hefe, but not my favorite.
Good head, sweet wheat aroma. really sweet wheat yeast taste. lot a carbonation that bits at the end.

Light yellow. Seemed a bit too light for me, hoping for a bit more sediment.  Was ok.  Not the best hef out there, not the worst.  Was a little bit sweeter than I care for in a hefe and I had to drink this cooler than I would have liked as it was a bit too carbonated, but to be expected from an import bottle, I guess.

nice pale yellow color. definately bottle conditioned- not at allclear.  first pass minimal clove/banana scent, just kind of flat smell. Second pass, cloves coming on but still small. third pass, there it is--good clove smell contained in a slightly sour environment. Refreshingly sour on entry very slight hop presence coming on late. Taste grows as it sits-drink this one slowly andenjoy it - don't gulp or you will miss it all. Overall, very refreshing. Very good beer.
not just my favorite Hefe, but my favorite beer overall.  There's nothing better to enjoy on a sunny summer day!
Nice wheaty aroma. Frothy mouthfeel. I expected more of a clove, banana, bubblegum taste. On the palate, crisp,light, semi-watery. Very nice, it does the job.

Zesty spicy aroma with a hint of orange? Lovely dark straw appearance.  Medium body is approriately clove & banana estery with a musty, earthy undertone in the finish.  Finish is slightly sweet, nice & light despite typical high carbonation.  High quality beer!
In my opinion this ranks best for Hefe's, thick white head, light golden color, & clean aroma.  This paulaner is very light on your palate & does just what u ask a hefe to do...  Refresh!

Thin White lacey head, the appearance is a dark milky orange hue. Roasted aroma of citrus and wheat. The flavor is quite bananacal and malty, the finish is dry with nearly no bitterness. It's highly carbonated ,I can feel the bubbles tingling on my tounge when it enters my mouth. A pretty good beer, even though I would prefer something darker.

(draft):  Murky cider-colored body with small white head.  Aroma is very strong, banana and wheat, yeasty -- missing clove but otherwise great.  Taste is lemon up front, some banana, wheat.  The moderately sweet banana is complemented nicely by the lemon.  Finishes banana.  Very carbonated.
This is one of my favorite beers of all time. The taste was simply amazing. A relatively sweet taste. Will have to try more to better describe it...
Nice cloudy golden yellow. Smells banana and wheat. Strong rotton wheat flavor. Nasty.

Wonderful German Weisse. Beautiful cloudy orange colour with a huge, white, and lasting head. Great banana aroma and a very nice fruity flavour. Quite sweet as the style prescribes, but hop presence is more pronounced here than in e.g. Erdinger or Franziskaner.

Good light yellow / straw colored clooudy wheat beer with a huge frothy white head.  Nose of sweet fruit and malt.  Taste is wheaty and yeasty, a little clovely, but not the sweet banana style.  Not bad but smaller and less pronounced flavor, less interesting than either the Weihenstephaner or the Schneider hefes. // Rerate 3 July 2003 after having a couple on draft.  Color is a beautiful orange amber.  Might increase appearance slightly to 4.  Taste is still clove, then banana without sweetness, then wheat and yeast.

A cloudy straw color with a lacing white head. The nose is floral with spices, citrus and banana. Flavor of banana and cloves with citrus hints. Decent carbonation. I am digging these German Weiss beers lately. I have had so much better than this particular beer, but it was totally satisfying.

Starts with a frothy, pillowy white head.  Scent of bananas and bubblegum. Excellent, cloudy, light orange appearance. Flavor has a hint of cloves and bananas.  Overall, an excellent wheat. Kept passing this up because I always thought I had rated it - then I saw it missing on my "most accessible list" - only 3 to go and I will have all 50.
This had some seriously strong wheat taste.  In fact, I compared it to a bowl of Wheaties.
Nothing special - lightly cloudy pale yellow; poured with a promising head - empty promise.  Some sweet banana flavor with a tiny bit of herbal stuff.  not exciting.
Not a bad Hefeweizen, overall a good summer brew with mild complexity.  That has a good crisp flavor.
Good cloudy beer with a nice head.  Good carbonation.  Nice malty head with fruit tones.  Sweet but refreshing with a good tang of hops.  Nice refreshing mouthfeel.

Cloudy appereance, yellow colour, huge head. The aroma is malty and yeasty (usual banana hints). This is one of the sweetest wheat beers I've ever drunk, with a slightly bitter and spicy finish. Pleasant!

Bottle
Cloudy golden color. The classic weißbier aroma range, dry, quite light. Some characteristic flavors, but too weak; just a bit spicy. Simple palate, as well.

God, what a comfort beer!  Not the best, but an everyday drinker that pleases without overwhelming.  The typical aromas and flavors.  More citrusy than some; a chewy yeasty aftertaste.  Excels at drinkability (well, at least if you like the style).  Ahhhh, weissbier....I shall end this, I am falling into my glass from sniffing, and feel the need for another.  Been a rough day, you know?
Smells of citrus and malt.  Poured golden and cloudy and mildly carbonated.  Taste was slightly sour (citric acid?).  Overall not too bad but I've had better hefeweizens.

Explosive head of soapy bubble rises and retreats with the complexity of Irish lace.  Hazy orange color. Nose is of light oranges, banana, spices.  Good solid mouth feel with a slow start big middle and quick finish.  Citric taste, lemon peels and pepper.

Pour a cloudy, yellow hue with a frothy white head. Some level of carbonation present. Aroma of clove and maybe a hint of banana.  Very drinkable Weiss.  The finish is what sells me on this beer.  Excellent example of the style.  Highly recommended.
Looks good in the glass, very cloudy and hazy gold.  Taste leaves something to be desired; some lemon and citrus flavor, but nothing really stands out.

Strange Brew. Maybe I just don't like wheats; too early to tell since this is only like the 2nd I've Tried. It pourd a cloudy orange color with a great head that lasted throughout. Aroma was so so, but I thought the flavor was a bit weak with a sweet and sour note. I couldn't figure out just what the flavor was. Not unpleasant, but just different. I got this in a beer trade with a friend at work, who didn't like it either. Though I'd maybe drink it for free if nothing else was available, I wouldn't buy this again myself.
Yeasty aroma, cloudy brown appearance with a large off white head.  Sweet yeasty taste with wheaty finish.  A tad watery though.
Sweet clove,yeasty aroma.Cloudy golden brown appearance.Flavors of cloves and bananas.Is this really low in calories?Crisp sweet finish.

Rocky, tight-packed, white head.  Somewhat typical bitter, slightly skunky aroma.  Apparent, but not too much carbonation.  Hazy, honey-golden color.  Nothing jumps out at you from this.  Altogether, not bad, but I've had better wheats.
One of the best wheat beers I have tasted. Nice and thick with prodominant clove/lemony taste. It is #3 on my German wheat list. Definately a must try beer.
It was creamy and the fruit essence was very noticeable.  A little on the bitter side.  This is one to add to the shopping list.

This one poured a cloudy orangey yellowish color with a quickly dissipating whitish head. Heavy with the aroma of grains, wheat and i swear, oranges! The flavor is pretty watery to be honest...faint wheat and grains, some definite malt and citrusy orange feelings going on here. Very very low carbonation, mildly dry aftertaste. Not a whole bunch going on here in terms of surprises. Very easily drinkable..smooth and clean.

Orange in color.  Cloudly.  White head that lasted awhile.  Scent of hops and citrus.  Some citrus flavors and other I couldn’t nail down.  Sweet and refreshing.  Very good.  Flowery, has a very soft feeling in the mouth.
Orangey amber, big white head.  Banana aroma, yeast, citrusy.  The wheat acidity could be a little bigger, spicy banana.  Honest beer.

Really a lovely wheat, with a nice cloudy orange color, fluffy white head.  Very nice nose as well.  Definitely some banana notes, in addition to the wheat, in the flavor of this one.  Some noticable yeast in the finish as well.  A pretty good wheat!
Begins with a creamy and lasting head, and an inviting aroma. Continues with a rich and balanced taste. The finish is slightly acidic. A pretty good weissen, indeed. Made me wish for more.

Golden orange. So cloudy it's completely opaque. A quarter inch ring of foam evolves from an initially thick foamy head. Mildly spicy wheat aroma. Full, round mouthfeel. Somewhat sour with hints of cloves and banana. Clean finish with some lingering spice.
Love the smell. I get caramel, citrus, honey, ginger, and butter. Medium brown cloudy appearance with off white head. Lightly sweet and acidic. Very nice.

Pale gold color, very hazy. Medium head. Aroma is banana and yeasty. A mild flavored hefe-weizen. Mild malts, some banana and clove flavor. Smooth taste. A touch citrusy. Lively carbonation. Well balanced. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Wow, this is what a hefe. should taste like.  It is clean and a rich golden color.  It has a nice white frothy head.  I had stored this one for a while for no particular reason and the flavor is still impecable.  The initial flavor is hoppy with a sweet malty finish.  Good beer.
From the bottle. Now this is what wheat beer should taste like. Nothing wrong with this Hefe

I haven't seen a quality wheat for so damn long.  I'm salivating!!!  A sawdusty orangish body & an everlasting thin white head.  Hints of corn-flakey, yeasty aroma.  Creamy and smooth, but a pleasant citrucy tang near the end.  I miss good Germans!!!
continues to be the classic.  The banana, cloves and spice notes are a thrill for the geek.  One of the best dessert beers of all time.
awesome banana yeast aroma, cloudy pale orange, dry wheat with creamy yeasty finish

Strong, but pleasant, bannana, yeast and clove aromas. Pours a slightly cloudy golden color with a thick white head that diminishes quickly. Nice small bubles of carbonation coming up from the bottom. Yeasty up front, bannana and cloves on the slightly spicy finish.   Medium-light to the palate.  Very drinkable, but a bit too much on the yeasty (or could this be hops) side for me.

This one pours a cloudy, deep golden color with a medium sized white head that lingers. It has a nice yeasty, bubblegum-like aroma with a hint of banana and cloves. The flavor is fruity, with a crisp finish and slight lingering sweetness with yeasty tones. After the disappointing Sierra Nevada wheat, this one has lifted my spirits back up and reaffirmed my belief that the meaning of life is to drink good beer.
Yellow in color cloudy, as it should be. Nice clove flavor, rich enough body to balance out all the spice and sour notes but still very refreshing. A top Hefeweizen
This is my favorite beer. Give the Germans a hobby or they'll take over the world.
Strong flavor with heavy yeast taste.  Can be overpowering out of the bottle
Yeasty, bready beer.  Aroma  is strong, with a distinct yeast odor.  Thick for a hefeweizen, with a rich and full-bodied flavor.  Slightly sour, just about right.
Nice foamy head. A very tasty beer! Yeast flavor is definitely there........
Good hefe.  Gold cloudy appearance with white mostly diminishing head.  Medium bodied with a wonderful mouthfeel.
A good clean Hefe, with cloves predominating the aroma and flavour profile (rather than the more common banana). Crisp for a hefe, good head retention and good overall balance.

This is a great tasting beer I didn't know what I was getting into when I got it and I'm nicely surprised! Cloudy yellow gold. Didn't have a huge head but it did have a wonderful aroma and flavor. Sweet and yeasty nice and smooth.

Excellent German wheat beer, hazy & cloudy appearance, straw dark gold in color, poured out to a huge white head, when the head finally disappated a bit, it laced around the glass the whole way down, flavors of banana, a little bit on the tart side, a little bit of a spicy yeasty flavor as well, very smooth & very drinkable, I certainly wasn't disappointed in this beer
Nice, wheaty, yeasty aroma. Excellent lace. White head, cloudy orange body. A very good weissbier.
[rerate needed] A nice wheat, very smooth but very mild.  Not many things stand out in taste.  I’m partial to a different type of hefeweizen, so I wasn’t impressed.

pretty typical german wheat for all the crap i know with customary hints of bananas and a little wheaty tartness went down smooth with some original sixties ska props to ecz who was fresh back from camperdown cellars

(3Jan2003--12oz. bottle)
Compared to most other variants of this style,
this beer is not as frothy.  The banana/coriander trademark aroma and flavor
are more pronounced, almost embarrassingly so.
Yes, this is a hefe-weiss!  screams the beer.
Pleasant malty flavors and finish.
Amber colour with a beautiful foam. Aroma of sulphur, flowers and banana. Well-balanced flavour. Persistence of the sulphur in the aftertaste. A good, well-made beer.
Loved the carbonation and lemony flavor. Reminded me of a shandy. Cloudy yeasty appearance, decent head. If I'm ever searching for a German Wheat (probably during the summer), I'll get this one.
Very similar to the Hacker-Pschorr my brother likes that we also drank at Christmas. A little less memorable, but still very clear and refreshing.
Great color and great head.  Not as dry as Franziskaner, a great beer from such a large brewery
Lemony, yeasty, slightly chalky, and with a little hint of rubber. Very fruity, and a little acidic spice is here. Not my favorite style, but one of the better ones I've had of the style.
Lots of fruit, not much carbonation. Still an excellent beer! Schneider Weisse is still my fav, but Paulaner Hefe is wonderful and true to style!
Good & Fruity. Kind of a toasty fruit basket witha nice head and bling bling.

Bottled(330ml). -for many beer fans this is very good beer but I don’t like it at all.

Draught at 20.Karlovački Dani Piva, Karlovac, Croatia. Beautiful hazy orange coloured. wheaty and fruity (banana, lemon) aroma with notes of sweet corn. Slight acidic finish. Very nice brew.

Well this is an old favorite that I never really got around to reviewing. It is usually always on tap at the bar I usually hang out at, this brew has a very rich creamy orange/brown cloudy color with a fluffy orangish head. In it''s smell there are hints or bananas, oranges, and peaches. The taste of the brew is very well suited for a hot summer day it’s refreshing characteristic. The hints of bananas and oranges are not to over powering but still present. Overall this beer is probably best enjoyed on a hot day but I will drink it when ever.

Cloudy, and lemony. I am not really a fan of these types of beer. The head was tiny, and it looked liked Thermaflu. I did not try it with a lemon, but it had a heavy citrus kick on its own. I did not really like it.

Very cloudy, lots of aroma. Solid wheaty & yeasty taste, almost meaty in a good way. Thick as well. I''ve had so many bad or average beers lately, this comes as a tonic so I may have overrated it. But it is good beer.
Well carbonated with a big head and typical cloudy body. The usual bananas and cloves in the nose, quite refreshing and drinkable. While there are probably better this stuff ain''t bad.
a great session wheat beer that i can drink all the time-just plain smooth-nice semi-sweet malt with full grain finish
Beautiful cloudy orange-yellow color.  Very light taste.....................
