Excellent light tasting beer with playful flavour of banana et al. Are we sure that we''re not getting our daily dose of Vitamine C with this beer?

on tap-Comments
Cloudy tangerine with huge, lasting white head.Yeasty fatty clove nose and flavor. Cloying for a wheat beer

Rerate: Very light, even for a wheat beer.  Hardly any flavor.  The distinct aroma is--of all things--cornmeal.  I am appreciating wheat beers more and more lately, but there's little to enjoy about this one.

Milky honey gold under a huge long lasting fine bubbled pale yellow white head. Faint graint sour citrus aroma when cold becoming hoppier and celery like when warmer. Medium body with ordinary low zing flatish type palate. Medium light bitter sweet and sour grainy start. Sweeter grainy banana flavoured middle and  thereafter. Pleasant enough but lack real definition and there are many other better hefes out there.
I like white beers, especially in the summer.  Dark beer in the winter white in the summer.  Nice beer.
No real distinct flavors - a sad muddle of typical weisse esters and citric action.  Slightly bettere than average.

This is definitely one of the all-time best beers in the world! It is soooo much better than the other hefeweizens to be had.  This is definitely my favorite hefeweizen, and a strong contender for my favorite beer.

Smells like it tastes, which is a good thing.  Big lasting foamy head.  Dark yellow with slight murkiness depending on how much of the last ounce you pour in.  A nice mix of spiciness, sourness and hops.   A certain effervescence on the tongue.  A weekend afternoon beer with enough character to make it interesting.

Has a citrus smell, and is very cloudy with visible yeast sediment floating around.  This beer doesn''t have much bite, thought.  Cloves, banana, and the occasional hint of grass.  Oh, and yeast.  Not too bad for an every-day drink if one can find it on sale.
Goes down smooth. Nice aroma. A lot of citus (lemon?) taste. ...............
Decent.  The Ayinger wheat beer is superior to this brew.  However, I can't complain since I can get it for 2.50/pint on draft...
A good wheat.  Reminds me of New Belgium''s Sunshine Wheat.................
Pale yellow, hazy;  moderate character for the style - all the elements are there, not very assertive though.  Finishes hoppier and yeastier than some.
Awesome orange cloudy colour. Has a nice wheat, citrus and malt aroma. Has a more dry taste than other wheats i''ve tried. Banana and cloves notes is present. Very dry finish.
An absolute gem in the arena of German Wheat beers. It is slightly better than Franziskaner's Hefe-weisse (also from Munich) and just as good as as Sprecher's Hefe-weiss (Milwaukee micro-brew).
Hello thick head!  I poured this one like any other and got mostly head.  Not that much aroma.  Was not expecting the banana flavors...kinda strange.  Hazy appearance.
Good overall, but beyond the initial nice impression it doesn''t have much to hide.
A pleasant wheat beer.  Soft citrus and banana are complimented by a light clove presence and a touch of yeast.  Very bubbly and crisp.  All in all, a very drinkable beer.  Quite nice.

Hazy orange colour, with a beautfully white head, with clingy lace. Banana and clove in the aroma. Slightly tart and tangy, wheat, banana etc  flavoours, with a yeasty finish, and also a bit hoppy, quite refreshing, fairly standard German wheat, but that not a bad thing.
cloudy yellow goodd white head.  lots of carbonation.  banana and clove flavors are well balanced but not quite complex and intrigueing.
MWBF 2002: Spritzy clove and banana aroma.  Banana and citrus flavor.  Refreshing and characterful, though not as complex as better hefeweizens.  Cloudy yellow with firm head.
Very light and crisp, but a nice flavor too.................................

Just a damn good wheat beer packed with flavour. In fact if someone told me it was a weak, smooth Belgian tripel I might have believed them. Great deep orange colour, and as smooth as you would want for a beer of this type. Very good.
A good wheat beer.  A slight lemony taste but not too fruity.  .............

A dark yellow beer with a beutiful head. It has a typical wheatbeer aroma of yeast and fruit. The taste is slightly sour caracteristic of beers brewed on malted wheat. The flavor also contains yeast and a bit citrus - but almost non bitterness. A good wheat beer.
Dark blond, milky with a medium head. Hoppy sour aroma. Fresh, sour, yeasty, slightly lemony taste. Fairly short taste. Refreshing.

Great bottled, even better on draft.  Strikes the perfect balance between sweet, malty, and spicy.  It wavers somewhere between a traditional wheat and a Belgian white, but the resulting "identity crisis" is sublime.  Drinks smooth, lingers deliciously, complex yet relatively undemanding.  One of the few beers I truly love.

Sampled toward the end of its shelf life.  Cloudy gold with fluffy but quickly subsiding head.  Strong clove and wheat flavors with hints of lemon and other citrus.  Not one of the fruitier, yeasty hefes.  Of course, wife's party foul kept me from getting to the bottom of this one.

Re-rate: 9-28-02.
Great beer. A lot better
than the first bottle I tried. Slightly better than Franziskaner but not quite as satisfying as Weihnenstephaner.

Twangy, yeasty aroma of banana and pine intimates this beers complex character. This  hazy orange-yellow hefe with a bubble-bath-like head was quite easy on the palate.  A quite drinkable beer that was much better the after a 2nd and third tasting. Prickly pine and banana on the palate--a great german wheat.

Extremely ripe boastful nose of lemon, vanilla, clove, phenol, and sweet corn.  The foam appears whipped and frothy.  Aggressive pour yields a two finger foam and releases perfect level of carbonation to provide the most addictive creamy feel.  Beautiful balance here: touch of clove, honey, and long lemon zest finish with toasted malt depth.  Decent stuff.
Very very weaty, nice carbonation, pours very nicely into a swirl of blonde and light orange.  Hefeweizens aren't totally my style but this one was very enjoyable and I'll order it again.
A nice drinkable HW.  Generally available, and worth a try for first timers.
Cloudy yellowish - orange appearance. Huge head typical for it's style. Very nice banana, citrus and clove aroma.  It's a very good hefe.
wheat beer tasting '02:  big banana and yeast aroma.  slightly fruity flavour sweeter than most.
I'm normally not a big fan of wheat beers, but I'll make an exception for this one.  Slightly cidery and enjoyable.

Great hefeweizen! Highly recommended. Perfect example of this style of beer. Classic cloudy blond when the yeast is mixed in. Some fruit notes and spice notes throughout the taste. Very refreshing, as a hefeweizen should. Pick one up today and enjoy.
One of the best Hefeweizens I've had.  Gorgeous cloudy golden color with lots of head.  Doesn't have as strong a banana flavor as many other wheats, but very clean tasting.

Spank my parrot gently and call me a sour puss, this is easily one of the best beers of its style.
I didnt sense as much fruitiness as many of you fruits have, but I certainly tasted the wheat. Crisp, refreshing.. almost reminicent of a high quality pils.
I felt like a tawdry black woman after a few sips of this beer. Is that a good thing? WHO KNOWS. This beer is quality.
Cloudy orange color, banana in the aroma with traces in the aftertaste.  And spank my giraff and call me whiskers, it tastes a little like WHEAT.  This is a wheat that's hard to beat.

Excellent Hefeweizen!

Paulaner has a very complex taste of wheat, apple, banannas, citrus, and bread.   It is thick and yeasty, but crisp.  This is one of my favorites of the style.  I’ve had other wheats, but I always come back to Paulaner.  This one just mellows me out, with the right amount of alcohol.  I could drink this one daily.
Spectacularly cloudy - the ideal color of a wheat beer.  Initially bitter flavor with a late onset of multiple fruit flavors.  Grape was the most dominant tone.
Somewhat sour in the aftertaste.  I found it to be not quite as refreshing as a wheat beer should be.
Peararoma. Bit dusty. Pear and banana in the flavor. Yeasty, bit herbal with some fruity sweetness.
Nice wheat beer goes down well.  Subtle fruit and vanilla taste.............

A good wheat aroma fruity,also comes back in taste  a little spicey,But a little Thin
Although a great weissbier
Thick, dripping banana juice over firm, doughy, wheaty yeast…Phenolic bubblegum with a drop of vanilla…One of the heartiest weizens…

Pours with a deep hazy Golden body topped by a huge foamy lasting head with some lace left behind. Slightly sweet flowery wheat and malt aroma with yeasty notes.
Slightly sweet and fruity flavor with yeasty notes, however, the fruitiness tastes slightly over ripe or rotten.  Light bodied and smooth.
The perfect balance of banana and clove!! While in Germany, my everyday beer!!

German-American Cuisine perfection tonight in my household! Steak and Corn-on-the-cob on the grill with this brew. An excellent hefe, nearly the equal in banana to the Denison's in Toronto, and nearly the equal to the crisp smack throughout the entire Hitachino Weizen. Overall a great beer. Oh, and the total cloudy unfiltered nature of this one wins big points in my mind. I will return to this (was that Douglas MacArthur?).
Rerate from tap at Nockherberg. A lot drier and less fruity than I remembered 7 4 7 4 12 hazy straw looks, good banana aroma, fullbodied yet fresh, wellbalanced taste - uneventfull
A bit lighter bodied, with a very nice aroma. A not so subtle fruity taste overpowers the beer and leaves a little more to be desired.
A nicely prepared Hefeweizen, easy to go down with an easy, wheaty flavor...
The benchmark for Hefe's as far asI'm concerned.  Excellent wheat and fruit flavor, please don't disgrace it with a lemon.

Faint clove aroma. Cloudy orange color with large bubbles. A citrusy, wheaty flavor is well balanced and highlighted with vanilla tones. Paper-like finish. Medium bodied, but a little too weak overall.
Huge head, nice lace, typical wheat cloudiness.  Nice refreshing taste, good for the summer heat, works well with fish.

mmmhhhh, citrus, yeasty aroma with hints of cloves and dough. Nice Cloudy orange color. Taste vanilla, banana and yeast. Creamy with a lively carbonation. Wonderful wheat, unbeatable on hot days outside in a beergarden!
not impressed no body not worth drinkin again...............................

I am re-rating this beer as I recently tried it head to head with Hacker-schorr Weisse.  I have always like the "Natural Wheat" style best, when you get free wheat with the beer, but I think I actually liked the taste of Hacker-Schorr better because it had lest of a boozy aftertaste.  This is one case where my sensibilities and my senses just didn't meet up.  But, it's still a great wheat and one that I'll continue to drink.
Wasn't quite as good as I was expecting. A little weak in taste and not quite as strong an aroma as I was hoping.  Still not too bad though.
Citrus/banana/doughy smell and flavor.  Cloudy appearance and easy drinking.  Wheat beers just are not my favorites, but this does seem to be a classic.

Pours a dark golden- yellow hazy color, has a creamy white head and leaves a nice lace in my glass, spicy yeasty aroma. Banana yeasty wheat flavor, some sourness, light-medium body, nice creamy and soft palate. has a very sweet finish. I think I had a bad bottle the first time I tried it, this one must be fresh.
Looks, smells, and tastes just like an German wheat. No surprises...........
airy, flowery beer thats very tasty. better when not so cold, and in smaller quantities(1/2 bottle perfect)

This beer pour a cloudy, yellow color with a nice white head that left some lace. Some level of carbonation present. Some aroma of clove and maybe a hint of banana. The tast has some hops and clove aspects. The finish is what sells me on this beer. I am not a big fan of this style, but look for these styles for the warmer months. This is what this type of beer should be like. Definiately worth checking out.
Great wheat beer , fruity aroma with hint of berry (strawberry?) , creamy impresions . Highly recomended !
Es muy bueno.  This is one of the very best hefe's out there so go buy a bottle today!  Extremely wheaty and flavorful. Beats every hefe except Ayinger UrWeisse and Hacker Pschorr Hefe.
Fluffy head. C&B nose. Very creamy and refereshing. A very solid weizen.....
Definite banana aroma. Appearance and head are wonderful. Nice..............

I tasted this beer in the states and in England.  Thought it was much better in England. The initial taste was sour in the states, but the aftertaste (the best quality of this particular beer in my opinion) was about the same in the states as it was in Europe. Very expensive too over here, so I'd only buy it again if I were in Europe.
The taste is a little sweet and sour.  Could stand to have a bit more head.  Definately not my favorite wheat.
Very average hefe....can get better here in the states......................

orange colour, banana aroma, floral, long dry crony and banana finish
.....

tasting this beside a franziskaner hefe, letting the monks slug it out in a gastronomic sense: the spaten guy on the label seems more affable-- the paulaner monk looks like he could use a rolaids or something. anyway, this one is more clear than the franz, with just  a squeeze more orange in color. fluffy head. more clarity means (evidently) less yeast floating around, so the paulaner retains more of a malt presence, and therefore i like it better. has a green apple aroma and a distant, sweet sauerkraut aroma (tho to admit that i can hear an ompah band in there too will likely demolish my remaining credibility). a balanced flavor, some clove; it wins the taste test over the sharper more lemony spaten. those kooky germans drink this for breakfast, i'll have to try that sometime...

A truly great hefeweissen. A near perfect appearance with a soft, well-balanced head and a nice golden body. Tastes like a hefeweissen should which on the other hand amounts to a not so distinguished characted. All in all, Paulaner sets the standard for Hefes..
I found this to be an average Hefe.  I seem to prefer the American HEfe's, but this on was not bad.  It think I may try again later due to all the remarks about bad bottles...
cloudy orange colour, fine head with a nice lace, banana aroma, floral, very sweet, creamy, heavy, long dry crony and banana finish - bit disgusting at the end

En dejlig øl. Dejlig frisk. Men prøv også Paulaner Märzen.
A fresh and good beer. One of the best Weissbier.
It has a nice foam and a beautiful golden-orange colour. It is fresh and pleasant.
Clean taste. Slightly dry.. Overall, not bad, but not impressive either.  Probably better with a lemon.

The gold standard for Hefeweizen, when fresh. A word to the wise, age is not kind to this beer.  I've had several bottles with a nasty aroma and a harsh straw tasting finish that had sat around too long.

The original rate was based on a perfect pour one that has eluded me for at least a year and a half. So I feel it is now to rate the present. Not the freshes bottle with a brew date of 12/06, but that seems typical to as of late. Still a wonderful looking pour, but this one is a bit darker, which I like as much or better than the lighter version. Sweet wheat with just a touch of banana, I’m not catching the full malt and light spice of the past. Light sweet wheat flavors with a stronger phenol presence, more resin than banana and spice. Again the base malt is not fully apparent. Still a nice hefe, just doesn’t seem to have the depth and complexity I used to find in one out of ever three to four barrels. Maybe my memory is slipping, but I don’t think so.  Straw color with a head that doesn’t end.  When fresh, I consider this the one to compare to others in the "light" (as opposed to the Ur Style) hefe style.  Clove and banana phenols dance across the tongue in balance with the wheat and malt sweetness.  This beer does seem to be very susceptible to heat light and other factors which can bring the rating down.

Great hefeweizen. Tends to form an excessive head sometimes(slightly irritating). But no real flaws as far as I'm concerned. I like to drink this with simple foods like a red apple, or perhaps just some bread and cheese(butterkaise). Very yeasty, as hefeweizen should be. Re-rate: I don't enjoy this as much as I used to. I think it's the weak finish. Still a good beer, but could be better. I am back-and-forth on this beer. I swear I must have had a bad bottle last time because now it seems great again. Maybe Paulaner has consistency problems?

This one changed my attitude about wheats a while back. I've grown to love that strange sweet corn mash aroma and flavor, and bubble gum aftertaste that only wheats deliver. If "In Heat Wheat" wants to get near German heffes, they better start swapping out thier labels on some Paulaner bottles. Not that pretty to look at, unless you know what it is. I often trade off between this and Franziskaner, and will need to rerate sometime. Good head stas around, neat tiny bubbles, and not too heavy on the ABV, its got that over Franz any way. Man, nothing beats this on a hot Saturday afternoon in the sweltering heat of Florida, amazing it isn't a bar standard in this state.
Quite a citric beer with peppery overtones.  Not as impressive as, say, the recommendations to the right of this webpage.

This is one of the first spicy beers I have had. The color and smell are distinct, like nothing I have ever had, but I don't think this one is for me. Initially it smelled like pineapple juice, but I'm not sure anymore. Interesting.

6/10/01: One of my top 10 beers for sure, and certainly the best weiss-beer type; got turned onto this by a beer novice, actually, at a Bennigans of all places (great with a Monte Cristo, mmmm); I think he's less of a novice now.  One of the best-smelling beers, too.

4/18/02:  beautiful cloudy amber, with huge lasting head; awesome nose of banana/chocolate, citrus, apples, and yeast.  Flavor almost as wonderful, ultra-malty for a wheat; but perhaps doesn't have enough 'edge' to it -- could use a bit more carbonation, a bit more oomph in the finish.  I've been slowly going through a lot of my pre-Ratebeer faves lately; this one holds up quite well, though probably not a top-ten all-time anymore.  Best German wheat, still a possibility.

4/15/03:  still loving it, love the sweetness on this one, and it does have a powerful nose, but gotta knock a couple of points, I've just had so many better beers and German Wheats are not at the top for me any more.  This is, however, one of the best.  A rare beer that is worth savoring but also very easy to pound in large quantities.

Sweet,crisp,and refreshing! 
this wheat brew is good all the way through! cold or room temperature.. this gets the best of the best for me, has a hint of clove..this is a GREAT German Wheat Brew!!!!

Sweeter than I expected, this is still an attractive and refreshing Hefe-Weissbier. Started drinking it with a warm meal, not a good idea - much better on its own or with a light snack. Enormous long-lasting head, pleasant but not very strong aroma. Flavour has all the good elements a beer of this style should have, a bit too sweet though. Rerate: Sweetness does not come through quite as much this time. Lovely aroma. A good hefe!

Wonderful aroma. Banana is particularly strong, some cloves, and a bit of citrus. Light hops and wheat. Cloudy (unfilt.) golden dark amber with creamy, off-white lacing head. Palate is ligh-medium watery with gentle carbonation. Starts sweet with wheat and banana, citrus. Light acidity kicks in for a weaker sweet finish. After is bready and a bit sweet, with a pleasant level of acidity and low bitterness. Fruity.
A very quaffable beer. Pours out to a slightly dark, golden color with the usual cloudiness from this style. Light clove taste is nice and not overdone. No banana ester taste, which I appreciated.

Body is less than desirable, I appreciate a more pungent flavor.  Smooth and refreshing, will probably start drinking lots of wheats again as the weather improves.  I was not partaking in wheats during the winter and fall months, so hopefully the brands I have forgotten about will present more punch than this particular brew.  I seem to remember the Franziskaner having a heavier feel, but the cold months have forced me to dabble with a lot of brews made from roasted grains.  Will definitely re-evaluate as the summer develops.

A soft mouthfeel allows you to experience classic sharp weisse flavours unimpeded, but it would be nice to find a fuller body - the thinness makes it all go brackish after a bit.  Maybe it suffers in comparison to the strong bodied Oberon I had jsut before sampling it.  In any event, I'm not much of a wheat man, but this is decent.
Spicy clove start and creamy banana finish. Delicious.......................

I am spoiled because this is the first bier I ever drank.  This also has made me rather preferential to it.  Milky, thick appearance, light pleasant aroma.  Delicious nutty flavor which tells of the glory of wheat and the earth that gives it.  I think this should always be the standard in wheat biers and I also think Franziskaner's wheat bier is a diluted version of this.  Rock On, Paulaner!

Smell reminded me of a wheat or bran breakfast cereal I used to eat, which I can't remember the name of.  Nice ambery-orangey, murky, color.  Good balance of wheat and sweet (is it honey?) flavorings.  Carbonation was noticeable but not offensive.  A great wheat beer that puts a few american wheats to shame.
This is a very good beer crisp and refreshing has a smokey type flavor to it and i agree it does have a sticky after taste but all in all a good beer

Dense milky, pale orangey amber look. Yeasty honey malt aroma is certainly noticeable on the first sip. Finishes slightly crisp but just seems to remain a little too sweet and sticky in the aftertaste.

This is one of the beers that got me over my dislike of beer and I thank Paulaner for that. Light flavor and less bitterness than most beers. I haven't had enough German Wheats to be able to judge it against it's style, though. Good beer.

My first wheat beer. Cloudy orange color, not much head (I was either too careful pouring or the bottle was a little too aged), but the aftertaste was something I've never tasted. Could be bananas, I'm not sure. I'll have to try this one again. All things considered, a pretty decent brew.

I can get this on tap at a local pizza joint.  Lucky for me!  This is good stuff, nice and cloudy in appearance, and fresh tasting.  A classic wheat beer for sure. If you have a chance to try this on tap, you won't regret it.

Not being my favorite style, I loved this; it was amazingly refreshing. Poured beautifully with a thick foam head and a very cloudy body. Citrus and a wonderful malt, hop balance make this a must have during the summer.
Wonderful smell of wheat. Translucent gold colour, fluffy big head. Well balanced, smooth. Nice session beer.
If this were cheaper, I'd drink a lot more of it. Very refreshing, nice combination of fruit and sour. A little spice/herbal flavor, but not excessively so as I find many Belgian wheats to be.

Bottle (12/06 production). Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy dark yellow, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain, husks), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with a note of banana, light note of clove. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Pretty ordinary example, with a slightly odd tartness character (a bit like fruit juice). Bit weak in the mouthfeel department, but overall it’s ok.

You've got to get around the bad smell, because everything else about this beer is wonderful!  This and Pyramid are the best hefeweizens available in America, without a doubt.  Sharp, wheat/fruity taste that is very refreshing.
A decent wheat bear.  Nice head and body.  I'm glad I had it with a lemon wedge.  It's no Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier.
When I had it it was a bit cloudy, but that must be cause its wheat beer. I was satisfied though. Good flavor and left a nice taste in my mouth.
Great taste, good smell, cool cloudy wheat appearance.  Surprisingly refreshing.
good tasting, good smell, but the appearance aint great looking.  the cloudy light beer isn't very appealing
I think it is a fine german wheat beer. But their are better out there......

After much searching, I finally obtained a bottle that wasn’t bad. My first hefe ..was it ever worth the wait. Copper-brown with nice hite frothy head. The banana aroma i was expecting, with a hint of citrus as well. Some spice as well.
Love this on tap! Very fruity esters , nice cloudy, golden hue. Smooth mouthfeel with the taste of bananas and clove.
Wow, was ein Bier, neben Erdinger das beste wo gibt!........................
Very good.  Although some will disagree with me not the best Hefeweizen out there, but it is very very good.
Liquid bread....with the classical doughy aroma and flavor of a German Wheat.  Flavor is consistent front to back, with a strong yeast influence.  A solid hefe.

A nice hefe-weizen, and true to style to boot.  Bananas and citrus are pleasant.  Almost tastes like a Belgian Ale yeast was used for this brew.

Cheers!

Rerate: Draft-poured cloudy yellow with a huge white head. Light banana aroma. Yeasty and full bodied flavor. Not as frutiy as other hefe’s but still a good beer.

I’m on my 3rd as I write this. Pretty tasty stuff. First time I have had a hefe-weizen. I will buy it again.

I really liked this beer. I could kind of smell Bannana aroma which was very nice. My friends have tryed it and have not liked it due to a skunky taste but that was not the case with the bottle that I had. I would try this one again!
This is a really good beer before you eat.  Not a beer to be drunk with a big meal.  Overall a very tasty beer

Bottled (thanks again mom). Cloudy golden/orange coloured, huge lasting white head. Strong aroma of banana and wheat, nice. Sweet flavour, wheat, fruity notes. Thick mouthfeel. Certainly good, but in the style i think Weihenstephaner and Franziskaner are superior.

Although hefeweizen isn't my favorite style, I liked this one when I thought I wouldn't. I'm generally not a big fan of Paulaner beers. I think they're quite ordinary for the most part but I enjoyed this hefeweizen better than most I've tried. Maybe their is hope for the larger brewers like Paulaner.

i will not buy this again.the aroma and appearance were nice, however the taste was terrible. i can understand brewmaster's comparision to peroxide, however i liken it to the water left over after boiling potpourri.

Well, before beginning this review I have to admit that  I generally dislike weiss bier, which gives my weiss bier-loving friend no end of fits. That said, the flavor here is quite superb. The "fruitiness" doesn't overwhelm my poor, misguided dark beer-loving palate the way other weiss beers do. It hits the tongue (as does the fruity bite of the aroma) and lingers without making me miss the taste of hops, dark roast, bitter etc.    A gateway beer for non-weiss fans? I'd say so. I just hope that doesn't damn it to those who like weiss beers. I first drank it in mini-kegs at an Oktoberfest event, and I wanted to make sure that the quantity imbibed (all you can drink) didn't affect my enjoyment of this beer. But upon "sober" reflection with a single bottle, I do admit that this is a damn good beer.

I dont see myself buying this stuff again.  There sure is heck aint any "refreshing fruity flavor".  I agree with brewmaster on the peroxide.  You must have to be a huge fan of german wheats to drink this stuff.  Paulaner is a good brewer...but this does not appeal

I dont see myself buying this again anytime soon, if ever. But decent if consumed ice cold. At avg. temp - i cant help to compare the taste as gargling with peroxide for some reason (If you have ever done that - you know what i mean). Maybe its just me.

Re-Rate 01/18/02: While I no longer feel Paulaner is worth a "Perfect 5", I still rank it in the top 5 on my master list of Hefe's.
Pours a cloudy orange color, nice white head and generous lace. Nose is malt, wheat, citrus, clean and fresh. Front is malt sweet, the middle light, fresh, the finish dry, acidic, moderate carbonation and a bit dry with a nice hop presence to finish it off.
A good Hefe weizen traditionlly brewed with five ingredients. I like it.....
As with most hefe-weizen's, drink with food.  It brings out the flavor in the beer as well as the food.  Very good, by the way.

My first experience with a hefe, and it was a good one.  I tried it first a few months ago, and then again recently.  I agree that it does not need lemon, and it has a nice fruity tartness all its own.  I don't sense banana in this one as much as some others, and maybe that is why I find it even more refreshing.  I love German weiss beer, and this one is no exception.
Best hefe Ive ever had!  No lemon or lime required.  Nice fruit-wheat flavor.  This beer stands alone as far as wheats go.  Great head retention.
Pleasant clove/banana flavor, but somewhat marred by a lingering cloying sweetness.

This could be my favorite hefeweizen that I can consistently find. Mmm. Classic aroma, lovely to look at in a glass - surefire conversation starter at the very least. I could probably drink this all day. If some schlep bartender gives you a lemon with this, throw it on the floor and enjoy a fine wheat beer sans trendy bullcrap accessory.
It's got that bananayeast smell.  Real good looking Weiss beer with nice label and tall head.  It's dryer and less tart than it smells.  Pretty good mouth for wheat.
Damn I like this beer.  Good rich flavor and very refreshing.  I highly recomend this one, or any Paulaner for that matter
for one that's produced in that large amounts it's a really good one in the more citric category
lovely orange-gold colour, bit thin and dry. I like my weissbier with a little more flavour than this.
Great version of this style.  I love the color of hefweizens................
excellent head and nice aroma of cloves...toss up between this beer and Franziskaner
One of my favorite beers.  This is my favorite hefe-weizen..................

Sweet yeasty malty aroma with a cloudy golden color and white creamy head.  It has a tangy citrus/sweet flavor with overtones of yeast and a good carbonation.  The aftertaste is of lightly hopped oranges and yeast.  I definitely enjoyed this beer.
Awesome!  This in my opinion is the standard bearer for the Hefe-Weizen.  The folks that made this are true artist.

Goods but not outstanding -- I was introduced to Hefeweiss on Franziskaner's version, so FH tends to hold the standard for me -- Paulaner was just as good, although where they made up in citrus notes they reduced the yeasty wheat taste the FH has -- very good and a must try for all -- Cheers!
If German wheat is what  you seek this is certainly it. As for me I will pass on the style
Tested from can..Weissbier on cans are no good..............................
A very good German beer.  The only German beer I'll drink, although I hear Julius Echter is good.
My second favorite wheat beer, behind Fanziskaner...........................

Somewhat of a disappointment. I expected more of Paulaner. However, a decent summer brew. Bitter start, smooths out quickly to a weak bodied clove and non descprit finish. Lovely cloudy honey color. Probably much tastier if really fresh.
I great German wheat beer.  The brewery statement describes it fine.  ......
Great banana aroma. Nice sweetness. Great weizen!...........................
Definitely suffers in the carbonation department, seems flat and lifeless in multiple tastings.  Doesn't have the fruity zip it should.  Much better hefes are out there.
Pretty average in my book. Not as spritzy as some others, and no fruitiness really pokes its head out either. A good intro to the style, but it doesn't define it.
A very smooth brew...nothing harsh or weak with a nice sweet aroma.  Even though I had gas from hell after drinking this one, I enjoyed.
One of the best weiss beers out there, okay, maybe top fifteen..............
Maybe it's just me, but this kind of tasted like sausage.  I am going to buy another 6 pack and try it again.
A great Weissbier from Munich. Rich taste, nice foam. Always a good choice!

not as exciting as i once thought it was. fruity, fairly citric and salty. goes down nicely but it"s all a bit homogeneous - adjectives don"t leap out at me. maybe i"m a bit bored of hefeweizens. rer8: maltier this time round, with nice aroma of appleskins, black banana, munich malt, vanilla, bread. bit sweet and stodgy, not zingy or fluffy enough.
This is a great wheat beer.  The last sip was as good as the first..........
Excellent refreshing example of a German weisse with a hint of banana and definite yeasty character. Similar to Hacker-Schorr Wiesse but possibly a notch above.

Edges out both Weihenstephaner and Schneider-Weisse as the best hefeweizen. Reason: just a bit more flavorful.  Tons of banana-clove, bread, yeastiness and fruit.  There is no better summer beer.  Puts the embarassment that is American-style wheat beer to shame.

RE Rate - 4/2010.  Aroma of malt, vanilla and a touch of banana.  Cloudy gold/amber with persistent white head.  Flavor - malt, cake, yeast and orange.  Watery feel, but still quite drinkable.  Very good, but not as great as it once was.

A very nice hefeweizen.
refreshing citrus taste............................
Hazy yellow, big hefe head, high carbonation. Aroma-cloves big time! Big clove taste,very crisp, pretty bold. I liked it alot.
Slightly underwhelming as Bavarian Weissen go. A bit spicier than average, but whatever flavor it had was severely dulled by massive carbonation.

I may grow to like this style of beer more in the future, but for now I will just say that it is way too bitter and that there is no hop balance. It's a shame too, because I like the flavor, but it seems to linger around with this fruity aftertaste that could be balanced out with some stronger hops. UPDATE: Much better without that stupid lemon.
A nice filling Hefe.  More clovey/yeasty than Erdinger, but perhaps, not as well balanced.  A cloudy brew, even for the style.  Beautiful fluffy head.

Incredible. Smooth and tasty, this beer has perfected the balance of sweet and bitter.  I stared at this for a moment after pouring it in the glass because it just looks so damn impressive; nice thick head and cloudy brown, translucent color (think apple cider with a golden hue).  Apple-Banana pervades the flavor, yet the beer is not overly sweet.  I always wondered how someone could become an alcoholic...well, now I know.  I could drink this all day long, summer or winter.
i really loved it, especially the color, and the different taste. ..........
Quite possibly my favorite beer. I went on a Weisse beer binge about six months ago, and this was one of the better ones I found, try it, you'll like it.
A fairly good wheat beer.  Nice and flavorful.  Lousy nose I thought, could smell the alcohol more than could taste it.
Yes, a lemon was added and it improved the taste. ..........................
Draft: Cloudy yellow with a big white head, nose of clove, yeast, citrus, flavors are smooth citrus and banana, nice.
Archtypical German Hefe.  Great crisp taste, fruity overtones.  Great color and head.  Not a great Hefe fan, but I'd much rather have this that a Bud on a nice hot summer day!
I'm not a huge fan of Wheat beer, but this one is as nice as they get.  Very refreshing.  Makes you feel like you just had breakfast.  I wonder if it's good on cereal?

The archetypal German hefe-weizen for me.  It's really everything a wheat should be.  It's not as exotic or as expensive as some, it makes a great consistent hefe-weizen, though.  Banana and clove, good old German yeast.
